author: {'steamid': '76561198036319900', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 8075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8075, 'last_played': 1465232357}
review:
I have played this game maybe four-five times more in offline mode than online so make of those numbers what you will.

A great rougelike with a ton of different skills and abilities that make every run unique and interesting. One run you might pick every crafting skill and simply brute-force your way through problems with your amazing equipment but lack of stats, inate combat capability or abilities. The next you pick shields, heavy armour and dual weilding, find two of the biggest shields you can and slowly waddle your way to victory in your equipment that more resembles a slightly portable bunker than actual armour. The third run you pick vampiracy, bloodmancy and viking wizardry and become the doom marine, ripping and tearing through everything.

That is another strong suite of this game, the comedic edge. While you have your bog standard skills like swords and axe that make you better with guess what? Swords and axes, you also have fun and weird choices like Communist that while not giving bonuses to not eating gives you cold resistance and buff-debuff abilities and passives themed around communism, like real-socialism that drains gold every turn. Some other interesting examples are: Emomancy where you deal but also become more vunerable to existential dammage. Archaeology that is more or less just an Indiana Jones refference with a bunch of skills to muck around with artifact items and Killer Vegan that has huge stat buffs but penalises attacking animals and eating meat. While it isn't the height of comedy, it isn't in your face all the time and there is a good game to fall back on when the skills lose their luster.

The modding community is quite good as well, I haven't taken part in it for several years now but when I left there was plenty of new stuff to mess around with so even if everything ended the day I stopped playing and modding you would have a pretty big backlog.

There are some problems with the game, some skills are definetly worse choices than others and due to the game being decently hard you will gravitate towards the better options and ignoring some of the dead-ends. The studio also is no more so if you have a technical problem don't expect it to be fixed... ever. But assuming that you don't have any problem of that nature the list of negatives becomes quite short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043519584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1634979365}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963047901', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 7090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6879, 'last_played': 1614708591}
review:
A hilarious but surprisingly deep turn-based grid-set roguelike that you can play at your own pace. Having first played most of a decade ago and replaying recently, most of the humour stands the test of time.

The game features a boatload of skill trees, which alongside items, enemies, optional extra dimensions and dungeon sizes have been increased further by three expansions. And then on top of that an expansive set of Steam Workshop mods have added even more of all of those.

In short highly replayable, and with many of the skill trees being both useful and interesting there's a lot of incentive to replay it too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087799559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1469, 'last_played': 1699499142}

author: {'steamid': '76561198204702387', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1588355266}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is a very interesting dungeon-crawler roguelike game. I have to admit, it feels rather cheesy for the Hard difficulty with all other options enabled, but Permadeath is the way to go here. The DLC is worth it. Really worth it. The free DLC? EVEN BETTER. Gameplay and music is always fresh and you'll end up putting yourself in predicaments where you could die or just survive. This game is well worth the price, and can be a collector's gem.

Overall Rating: 9.7/10

Audio/Soundtrack: 10/10
Gameplay: 9.5/10 (Can get stale after a while, but you'll get the drive to pick it right back up.)
Replay Value: 10/10
Mod Support: Great. Wish there was more mods.

Hardware Notes: You may need to have a decent GPU to run this. Some framedrops can occur on loading.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994683300', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1674526856}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993023804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 524, 'playtime_forever': 1712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1712, 'last_played': 1585062855}
review:
In my ongoing and likely futile effort to write a Steam review for every game in my library (#424 out of 612)... it's time for Dungeons of Dredmor.

One of the better roguelikes out there, Dungeons of Dredmor is a dungeon-crawler with a lot of mechanical freedom and depth. It's one of those precious few roguelikes that really seems to embody all the best aspects of the genre—it's a deep, engaging game that never fails to be engaging, all the while maintaining a healthy challenge for players of all skill levels. If you're looking for a good "starter roguelike" to introduce yourself to the genre... well, I'd probably recommend Sword of the Stars: The Pit first, but after that? Dredmor all the way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063797852', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 6181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1688998499}
review:
This game is by-and-large really well balanced. There is enough complexity to make it fun and interesting, but not so much as to cause you to waste countless hours trying to learn the game mechanics. You will die. You cannot respawn. You create a new character and apply what you learned. It is from the perspective of the Major Naughty Haha (my eldest daughter's endearing term for a villain), so in a way you're the hero, but in that dungeon, you're a vandal and mass-murderer. Love it!!

I found in one play-through that the second level was hard so as to make it very challenging. In this one, it's going well, so far. Large pink blocks marked on your map help you remember where the merchants were. You can make the map slightly larger using the icon at the top right of the map. You will find many items during your foray into the depths. It can be hard to choose what to keep and what to get rid of. 

Check everything, even the bookshelves. Do the side quests. They sound confusing and like nonsense, but they're real! The rewards are nice. 

Run away to heal, if needs be. You will face decisions over and over again in this game. Choose wisely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007660744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 3628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2832, 'last_played': 1605994269}
review:
Pretty good roguelike. Easier than most, but I see that as a good thing.

At the start you get to choose 7 different skill paths (from 36 - 60, depending on dlcs), and this will constitute your character. This gives each playthrough some variety, since they really change how the game plays. However, the dungeons themselves, as well as the monsters, get old after a while.

The game does a good job of teaching how to play and presenting information, at least compared to most other roguelikes. There is no identify mechanic; the game outright tells you what each item does, for the most part (potions, mushrooms and skills have some effects only show up when you use them, but that is easily done). This makes it easier to pick up and play without having to do a ton of research.

The graphics are ok, and the music is good, but very repetitive.

Overall I'm glad that I bought and played this game, and can recommend it if you are looking for a roguelike that is easier to play but still has some depth.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994723528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4717, 'last_played': 1667645486}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is a very versatile roguelike dungeon crawler. The core mechanics and gameplay are solid and easy to pick up, but with a variety of difficulty options and massive array of skill combinations you can make the game as accessible or unforgiving as you want. Top that with loads of items and your classic procedural roguelike dungeons and you get basically endless replay value.

The workshop also has loads of extra content to play, if you ever get tired of the base game options.

Audiovisually the game nails it for me. Compared to classic roguelikes, there is a lot of detail - however not everything that happens is visually represented, giving your imagination an opportunity to immerse yourself in the world. That being said, the world is not - and isn't meant to be - very immersive. Everything about the world is built with a tongue-in-cheek attitude. You will find (now dated) memes and references to all kinds of pop culture. This works for me, and I find the game to be a perfect mix of light-hearted fun and hardcore roguelike action.

My favourite roguelike!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056040262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3831, 'last_played': 1584616118}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029543784', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1583494540}
review:
I really like this game a lot.  But for some reason I'm a bit more hesitant to just start right over after dying in this Roguelike unlike so many others I've played.  Maybe I just need to give it some more time and try out some more traits.  I just don't feel any connection to this game for some reason even though a lot of people really like it.

This is more of a 'first impression' as opposed to a review.  I haven't played very much at all.  I'll try to update as I continue to play.

review: Fantastic and highly addictive game! It definitely deserves to be better known. I especially enjoy how the 1:1 turn based element affords a relaxed and contemplative experience. Using the wiki to understand all of the game elements (particularly item properties and skill synergy) is a MUST though. This game definitely requires homework to properly enjoy, but if you learn as you play you will become proficient in no time (again, there's no rush). 10/10 would preorder Dungeons of Dredmor 2 in a heartbeat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198839728910', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1703082044}
review:
🏆 NOTA: 10 🥇

⚠️NUNCA ENCRUST 2X ⚠️
Não Encrust o mesmo equipamento duas vezes, isso acabará com seu personagem. Você será amaldiçoado pela Haematic Drain, perderá HP total, HP regen, etc. Ou seja, vai fodar-se seu jogo e terá que começar novamente! É neste jogo você aprende errando! 
⚠️ NUNCA ENCRUST 2X⚠️

O melhor Roguelike que já joguei desde 2014 ♥ Fiz questão de compra-lo em 2020 e prestigiar os criadores. Parabéns Gaslamp ♥

Storage: 
- Encontre um lugar de fácil acesso ida/volta e deixe seus itens lá, salve o jogo e saía dele tranquilamente. Quando você continuar, eles estarão lá! Os itens da loja não resetam. Sugestão é usar a Portal Dimension room, por que lá você poderá ir/voltar para qualquer Floor.

Prós:
- OST do jogo incrível, tenho salva em minha playlist de ost.
- Diversão e desafio garantidos com Sistema de Criação de Mapas aleatório.
- Gráficos 2D lindos.
- Build Skill incríveis e divertidas.
- Dificuldade desafiadora.
- Farm de Craft é difícil. O sistema de craft exige mais do que um casual player.

Contras:
- Nenhum! Nenhum mesmo! Vale cada $ gasto!

Gaslamp
- Função de Print Screen pela Steam não funciona.
- Função de Painel pela Steam não funciona.

Sugestão de melhorias:
- É possível multiplayer?
- Melhorar a navegação pelo teclado na Aba de Craft. É chato clicar no mouse.
- Um Baú ajudaria bastante ao guardar itens, com filtro de itens e talz.
- Pesquisar itens na Aba de Craft ajudaria demais.

review:
Мне показался скучноватым. Большую часть времени лупишь монстров без какой-либо угрозы для своей жизни, а потом умираешь по невнимательности от яда/незаметного моба (сессии 3 - одинаковый сценарий). На Pixel Dungeon похоже - но тот мне намного больше зашел
1) Интерфейсом. Наиграл часов 5, все еще страдаю. Например, проходы находящиеся за стеной ничерта не видно
2) Балансом. Ну скучно лупить 50 мобов без риска, а потом совершенно внезапно огрести

За иронию - плюс. Вроде как контента много - юнитов, абилок, предметов. Но не зашло

author: {'steamid': '76561197997998444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2557, 'last_played': 1579390565}
review:
Extremely unbalanced game.
At the beginning, you need to pick 7 skill trees that you will be able to progress in throughout the game, stuff like "dodge" or "axes" or "pyromancy", which allows for a lot of potential combos. It can be expected that some builds are stronger than others, and you can get to the final boss with practically any build if you don't do obviously stupid things like jumping in the middle of monster zoo.
However, to actually kill Dredmor, you simply must use one of the few exploits - and they must be planned for from the beginning of the game.

So if you made an all-melee build, for example - you're dead. There's no chance for victory, because Dredmor has absurdly high defenses, thousands of HP and every turn will blast you with spells for 50+ dmg. You will have about 150-200 HP at this point, so you might die before you even get close to him. 
Don't rely on healing potions, either - you need to have picked "alchemist" as one of your starting skills to see more than two of them during your run. Not that they will help - they heal for 30 and take up turn to drink, Dredmor blasts for 50. Oh, and he also automatically "corrodes" your melee weapons, making them less and less damaging.
It doesn't even matter what difficulty you play, on Easy Dredomr is as much a monster as he is on Hard. 

But if you use Pyromancer? Well, it will be a walk in the park, because you have a cheap tough summon and firewall spell that will eventually burn him to a crisp. 

Don't buy it, don't waste your time as I have wasted mine.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994597419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1580520785}
review: Fun in theory. But, the skills system, stats system, and general inventory management is incredibly unintuitive for anyone who hasn't already spent 10 hours on the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054886186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 8089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7853, 'last_played': 1640969142}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989253670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4436, 'last_played': 1709084770}
review:
What can you say about Dungeons of Dredmor...

It's a game, a damn good one. It has an art style that's personal, it's combat/spell mechanics are mind boggling and complex, the feel of the game is unique. 73 hours as of review time and I can say that I have never beaten this game. I don't even think I've come close. S**t, there's mechanics in here I STILL havn't figured out. 

If you like remorseless rogue-like dungeon crawlers with humor, Dredmor is for you. Some might find the sheer amount of references off-putting or even cringy, but being a lover of easter eggs in all forms, I can't help but smile whenever I figure a reference out.

review:
This is just a quick review to add some thought to anyone contemplating buying this.

If you have played rogue or any of the thousand rogue-likes after it, this game is for you.  It takes all the gameplay you are familiar with and makes it...silly.  Yep, this game is rogue with laughs.  Does it have some shortcomings?  Sure, but what game doesn't.  The sheer joy of opening a Monster Zoo outweighs the moment of realizing you have just accidentally attacked the store owner.

Play it.  Have fun.  Die well.

Though, as I said, this is a game better tinkered with than played vanilla.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008969290', 'num_games_owned': 2068, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 6318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3653, 'last_played': 1703782045}
review:
So I started playing DoD around when it came out. I initially bought it because I liked the idea of rogue-likes, but didn't really expect to sink nearly as many hours into this as I have. For the cost to fun ratio, this is seriously a great bargain, and the devs seem to be actually really great. 

Buying this game has provided hours upon hours of fun. It's the kind of game where you can come back after a while and just sink some time in here or there. My cousins and I actually turned this into a yearly competition at Christmas time where we watch each other play and take turns trying to get the most points/get further down the dungeon (none of us have reached Dredmor yet), and it's really great game. 

Seriously, you can't go wrong for the price point, and the dev is a great example of how to provide excellent content while being reasonable (and honestly, maybe even selling the game a little too low in my opinion) about the pricing of their titles and expansions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985208702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4256, 'last_played': 1687513349}

review:
It's a lot of fun, endlessly dungeoneering, trying out different weapons and skills. It's starting to show its age after 9 years however, would love to see an updated version with more polish though.

But for a fiver, you can definitely get your money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058684290', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 6028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4894, 'last_played': 1666804468}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033923433', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 7919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7919, 'last_played': 1409078792}
review:
A great - if a tiny tad grindy - introduction to traditional roguelikes. Oh, it has its flaws, like:
[list]
[*] Inventory management is a nightmare, [b]especially[/b] if you try to play a crafter, because of how freaking many near-identical types of items there are. There are [i]like[/i] 7 different types of cheese, 4 types of steak, 22 functionally-same types no-effect of alcohol, and about 34.35 bajillion types of crossbow bolts. Oh, and every single one of several disciplines of crafting requires at least a single inventory item to use. Oh, and you have a stash space, but [b]there is no stash management[/b], so have fun picking up 10+ items to get to the one at the bottom.
[*] Permament corruption mechanic - where melee attacks of some monsters add random permament stat maluses to your magic items - makes playing pure melee characters impossible. Unless you are insane enough to craft every single item you own, or buy the DLC where one of the skill trees has [i][b]the one and only[/b][/i] method of removing corruption.
[*] Summoning a single ally turns every single combat turn to a slog. Summoning several is even worse.
[*] Abrupt music cuts when jumping back and forth between your stash space, dungeon, and shop, can really sour you on a catchy soundtrack. And the game practically drowns you on loot.
[/list]
...but its good qualities are numerous, especially for new players.

Shame that the developers dissolved without a word of warning, shortly after publishing their promising second game, [i]Clockwork Empires[/i], in a definitely unfinished state. That means, if you'd grow to love the game, you'd be heartbroken to find out there will never be any compatiblity patches, any anniversary patches, any new DLC, any sequels, and that at least one achievement (that required you to meet the developers in person) is forever unclaimable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015455491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3030, 'last_played': 1583229646}
review:
ものすごくキャラクターの顔（の特に一部）が特徴的なローグライクゲーム
DLCを抜きにしても40近くのスキルがあり、それらを自由に6つ組み合わせて、ゲームを進めることになります
ポリコレのため（かどうかはわかりませんが）きちんとキャラクターを男性か女性か選択できるようになっております

システムとしては基本的には、各階層をくまなく探索してアイテムや素材、お金を集め、ショップ（装備のみ販売）で必要ないものを売り
各所で設置されている、自販機等でほしいものがあれば買い、また敵を倒してレベルアップで自身のスキルを強化していくことになります
クラフト要素としては武器や防具、消費アイテムを作成するためのいろいろな道具やスキルがあります
もしさっさと先に進みたいのであれば、各階層をくまなく探索する必要はなく、どんどん下へ下へと潜っていくこともできます
（当たり前ですが下へ行けば行くほど、強い敵が出てくるので準備なしに下へ行くと簡単に死にます）
自身の強化としては、レベルアップごとにスキルを１つあげることができ、武器と防具といった各部装備アイテムによるステータス強化
Life回復・Mana回復・各種耐性ポーション等の消費アイテムがあります

またこういったゲームの醍醐味である、キャラクターのプレイスタイルも、完全なフィジカルモンスターや
紙耐久の魔術師といった典型的なものだけでなく
格闘メインの魔術師、状態異常やバフを使いこなす格闘家といったキャラクターでも楽しめます

プレイして感じたことは、まず1つのフロアがかなり大きく、1回のプレイで結構な時間を使います
あとは特定の武器やスキル、アイテムの組み合わせがかなり強力で
また最終ボスがそれまでの道中の敵とは、けた違いに強いことが大きく印象に残りました
一部のワンドや矢、またテレポート等のスキルが最終ボスを倒すために実質的に必須になっています
（一応耐性ポーション等を使ってもできなくはなさそうですが・・・）
最終ボス以外のバランスはそこまで悪くはないと思うので、そこだけはどうにか調整してほしいですね

author: {'steamid': '76561197995353119', 'num_games_owned': 2111, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 4773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4773, 'last_played': 1432437907}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030327694', 'num_games_owned': 574, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 16333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9691, 'last_played': 1700220224}
review: DoD is a classic rogue-like that feels very much like a re-imagined Nethack, with new jokes and several systems tacked on. This game is heavy with micromanagement and RNG-determined runs. The addition of crafting mechanics to a true rogue-like game increases the knowledge & experience levels required to have consistently satisfying runs, as you won't begin knowing what tools & supplies are worthwhile, or what much of anything does. It isn't a very friendly game to newcomers! That being said, if you're looking for a complicated, cerebral, tactical game, this one's stellar. Great time sink.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976137727', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1574907878}
review:
Yet another janky rpg-maker-esque game trying to emulate nethack.

I understand wanting to bring real rogue-like games to a casual audience, but this makes the same mistake all the other attempts make. Bad UI, depth focused in the wrong areas, too many rewards, too easy, poor controls. I don't really understand what niche it was trying to hit - between accessibility, depth, casual.

I don't _hate_ this game, but it's hitting middle grounds in all the wrong places for me, so I couldn't keep playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169974514', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1967, 'last_played': 1700618027}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025121822', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 4387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3807, 'last_played': 1674150439}
review:
This graphical roguelike is possibly the best way to experience many of the aspects the genre has to offer, but is flexible enough to accomodate more 'casual' players.

Roguelikes aren't for everyone, but this game truly is, with its colorful and funny graphics, the witty writing, the complex yet entertaining build system, the optional perma-death; this is the perfect way to experience the funny random nature so intrinsic to the genre with much less of the frustrations that are inherent to it.
The engine is a bit dated and janky, but the game is extensible and customizable which is a big plus in its favor, making an inherently replayable game even more replayable!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970716650', 'num_games_owned': 1831, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2772, 'last_played': 1577990580}
review:
Fun game with tons of replay value, if you  like rogue lite/like games, this is a good one. Lots of character build opportunities, and a bunch of community content to add to it all.
Runs great on Windows and Linux.
The whole experience has a light humorous feel to it, but the game itself has good mechanics, and fun strategies to try unique skill combinations, and randomly generated levels that are interesting enough to keep you exploring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027094516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 17465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16860, 'last_played': 1574772672}
review:
게임에서 병맛남.

스킬 조합해가면서 어떤 조합이 제일 던전 제패하기 쉬운지(그리고 던전 보스인 Dredmor 앞으로 유저를 안전배달해서 삼턴컷 당할 수 있는지) 테스트하는 게 주요 묘미. 보스 너프좀요.
잡다구리한(그리고 대체로 무쓸모한) 아이템들의 툴팁 읽는 재미가 쏠쏠하다. 
스킬 설명이나 아이템 설명이 패러디인 게 많아서 배경 지식이 많다면 좀 더 즐길 수 있을 것.

로그라이크 중에선 쉬운 난이도. 허기가 없어서 문닫고 스페이스 눌러서 몇 턴 넘기면 체력, 마나 풀로 채울 수 있다.
꼼수로 저장파일을 딴 데 백업해두었다 죽거나 뭐 안좋은거 당했을때 백업해둔 거 불러와서 다시 할 수 있음.

한국어 OS 일 경우, 난이도 선택이 안 되어서 강제로 중간 난이도로(그리고 강제 영구적 죽음 옵션 선택으로) 진행해야 했던 버그가 있었다. 지금은 고쳐짐.
그 외 가끔 게임이 강종되는 버그 있음. 그러면 지난 저장 포인트부터 다시 해나가야 하니까 사이사이에 저장해주는 게 좋다.

현재 DLC는 3개 나와있음.
Conquest of the Wizardlands는 포켓 디멘젼이 추가됨. 몹도 안나오는 공간이고 유저가 어느 층에 있든 포켓 디멘젼으로 순간이동 가능하므로 거기 바닥에 아이템 떨어뜨려서 일종의 창고로 쓰는 게 좋다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035512685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8995, 'last_played': 1600367411}
review:
Mit das  einzige Spiel, das einen Spieler beglückwünscht, gestorben zu sein.
Sie nehmen sich wohl nicht so ernst:
In diesem Spiel ist der Weg das Ziel und vor dem "gar pöhsen" Lord Dredmor zu sterben ist keine Schande...es ist sogar gewollt.
Okay...die "zufälligen" Dungeons kommen einem nach zehn Durchläufen ein wenig bekannt vor; nur : man hat bis dahin zehn Durchläufe mit einem guten Spielgefühl hingelegt...und ist mit seiner Skillung halt gescheitert...der Tourist mit Diebstahl und Feuermagie macht sich halt nicht so lange ;) 
Talentbaummöglichkeiten und Kombinationen: UNENDLICH!
Und der Dungeon wird dir zeigen ob dein spezieller Liebling durchkommt...wenn nicht....GLÜCKWUNSCH!!! Sie sind gestorben!!
Leider begreift man den ganzen Witz nur, wenn man recht gut Englisch kann...einziger Wehrmutstropfen...ansonsten ein sehr guter Dungeon Crawler der alten Schule den man durchrushen kann...oder bis in Kleinigkeiten plant "Nkay, wenn mir DER Gegener jetzt mit Feuer kommt und ich eh grad die Eiswaffe überhabe, warum versuche ich nicht mal..."
Und von seinem Witz, und dem "Versuch und Irrtum (SEHR HÄUFIG Irrtum)" lebt dies Spiel...und hat mich bisher begeistert...und wird es auch weiterhin, denn immer wenn es mir genug wurde kommt der Moment, wo plötzlich so ein Diggle vor seinem geistigen Auge auftaucht und raunt :" Du hast dem Übermeister noch nicht besiegt...oder hast du?!"
Und man versenkt erneut Stunde um Stunde in...."Herzlichen GLÜCKWUNSCH!!! Sie sing gestorben"
Definitiv eine Kaufemfehlung!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018133485', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 14950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12482, 'last_played': 1693298381}
review:
I love roguelikes and I have this game to thank for it. In this day and age, many games claim to have 'roguelike' elements, which usually just amounts to having permanent death and maybe procedurally generated levels; this game however is far closer to the original definition. 

Its a refinement of the games that the genre is named after, but don't let that fool you into thinking its easy. It can, will, and repeatedly kick your ass - most of the time its fair, sometimes its just brutally unfair. Its certainly a learning experience, but thankfully the cheerful, chunky presentation and dry wit alleviates the process.

The base game isn't lacking on content, and yet there's three expansions (one of which is pro bono) and a small but well stocked Workshop to offer even more options to personalise your dungeoneering experience. If you want to experience a proper roguelike without having to go back to the stone ages, then this should be your first stop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166221497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1697122778}
review: Love the game 100% fun, difficult, and addicting. You don't get any penalties for choosing who or what class line you choose to play and once you level up enough its great! Different classes offer varying benefits, for example eating any mushroom with out fungal arts class would poison you, but with it you can eat all mushrooms and gain vast temporary abilities. The list goes on and on! I don't like the idea of permadeath but its somewhat forgiving of your character letting you pick the previous skill and class trees from your last playthrough. Every playthrough offers something new and random all the dungeons are randomly generated making it super fun! Recomended to anyone who love difficult rpgs or new rpg players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030123832', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 345, 'playtime_forever': 3271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1570121809}
review:
The company went belly-up before listing the expansions of this game with an AUD price on Steam, so I cannot buy the expansions at all. As an achievement hunter, this renders the game impossible to 100%. Cheers, I hate it.

EDIT: If you have an American friend, they can gift you the DLCs. This got me around the region lock.

DoD is ridiculous. The sheer amount of customization deserves a mention, even if some of the trees are of limited applicability. The enemies are adorable, the soundtrack is wonderful, the game-play is easy to learn but very difficult to master the ins and outs of. I only have 20 achievements left and I've been playing the same build the whole time. I'm pretty sure it'll beat Lord Dredmor with only a minor change or two.

The game is obviously a little bit unfinished. Crashes are a consistent irritant, teleportation potions can soft-lock you from progressing, and the character sprites could have used some serious work (you're always the exact same looking!? Bad RPG. Bad.) I don't imagine it'd hold the attention of anybody except the die-hard rogue-like fan base. As I fall into that fan base, I did enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003099588', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1522, 'last_played': 1567659078}
review:
This game is full of bugs. And some are so obvious that it looks like developers don't care at all.

Like when you are moving by pressing a key, sometime you'll get XP, raise a level, and gain a skill. When you have chosen that skill, and get back to game, the key you were pressing still acts as if pressed. That happened to me a lot and just ruined a run...
This is a bug so obvious and stupid I can't understand how it isn't fixed almost 10 years later ...

There are a lot of other stupid things, like if you want not to waste your lockpicks on stupid doors, (because there are no advantages at all to lockpick doors, since you can break them), you must drop your lockpicks for every single fucking locked door.
How can there not be a tickbox -  [x] don't use lockpicks for doors  - ?

Did I mention that there is no shortcut to select the skills / spells ? you never stop clicking...

Worst game interface ever even though it's a decent game I can't recommend it to someone that wants to PLAY.

review: its hard to put how good this game is in to words , its like a tactical D&D with comedy , you can build your character in so many different ways. Theres easter eggs galore , comedy galore , adult references , ect. .I have put so many more hours than Steam has logged in to this game , probably around 100 - 200hrs. originally i got the game for free and i liked it so much i've bought multiple copies for friends and family. i highly suggest this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025257406', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4463, 'last_played': 1585082683}
review:
This is the first roguelike game I played, it was difficult for me when it first launched due to my mindset of saving everything for that moment when it's most needed.

Now it's much easier to play random skillsets and make it deeper into the game and I love it.

That being said, what stands out to me the most right now, and the reason I'm launching the game while at work is for the music. I don't get tired of it. Just enough to notice it's there, without being so overwhelming that I can't focus on other tasks. There's tracks to think, there's tracks to feel pressure rising and there's tracks to calm.

Everything I need in a day.

For the gameplay, it's solid. Even after all these years its unique humor and interesting skill passives make it great to play around with. Go for something balanced, or go all in with a certain gimmick, either way, if you don't plan well you're likely to die.

I definitely like the fact that there's the option for permadeath on or off. I now play with it always on because it's not as rough to start out as it used to. That being said, being able to reload a save and correct a mistake or misstep is always welcome when learning the game.

If you're looking for a decent roguelike that doesn't take itself too seriously you can't beat this one, at this price-point. Buy it for yourself or your friend and share the hilarious ways you die, the close encounters, the cheating monsters, and of course the lutefisk.

Edit: I have noticed it runs the CPU high on Windows 10 I'll need to test in compatibility modes to see if that's an issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041178432', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1563642869}
review:
It's weird to think about the history of things, and where roguelikes have gotten to. 
This is probably one of the most traditionally roguelike-roguelikes on steam, and it doesn't even force permadeath. (honestly permadeath now just feels like a tool for lazy developers, but I digress)

What IS important is this game is a step in video game history, a minor one, but albeit an important one, this was probably one of the first commercial, accessible roguelikes to ever get any kind of attention. Nowadays with way too many of these out there, and none of them traditional or fun, it may be hard to see the appeal or understand how anyone thought the "lolrandom" skill system and humor was endearing, 
But this was 2011. Back then, mouse usage and such a slick and user friendly interface was incredibly rare for games like this, let alone anything resembling sprites or an appealing artstyle. 

Back then, Brogue had just started development 2 years earlier and hadn't caught on, Tales of Maj'Eyal wouldn't get released until the following year, and on that, this game ran on netbooks and drove itself under the same impulses as Diablo, a game everyone was familiar with. 

This game was HOW a lot of the ideas of roguelikes spread, no it wasn't particularly amazing at anything, but it was fun and it was satisfying, and it was definitely cheap. It's a great, content rich little game, back from when people thought "emomancy", and a class that was pretty clearly a harry potter rip off was clever. 

It's not a 10/10, but it's somewhere between a 7/10 and a 9/10, and it's *important* gabe-darnit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025490203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1562071657}
review:
Good turn base rough game, but the number of objects is too high, which end up filling your backpack with garbage.

the crafting system is too clunky - way too many ingredients mean that it is very unlikely that you will manage to collect the right stuff of you 

no starve mechanism makes it much easier than the classic rough games (hm NetHack, etc)

final verdict - has all the right components, but couldnt get me in for more then couple of hours
7/10

review: Pretty fun roguelike dungeon-crawler with heaps of silly humour and playstyle variations. Loot and equipment are downright weird. I mean there's a dagger that slices cheap meat-slabs off your enemies that you can eat. Or turn into lutefisk to sacrifice to the lutefisk god. Basically, this is madness - the game. Does get repetitive after a while and the end boss is a cheap bastard. All in all, can't go wrong with that price.

review: Dungeons of Dredmor is a goofy Rouge-like indie darling from 2011, chock full of memes and humor from those times. Its features all sorts of skills ranging from magic, combat, and crafting. A shame Gaslamp Games is now defunct, at least were pretty sure it is. If you liked/miss the humor of the early 2010's you'll really enjoy this Rouge-like gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202107617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1563021260}
review:
First and foremost, buy this game. (Y)

So this is first impressions from someone who enjoys rogue like games to a masochistic level. It is very very good. Don't let it lull you into a false sense of safety though. I am currently writing this review salty from suddenly dying to a level 10 boss after thinking "Wow floor 9 is p*ss." So don't count your laurels. I'm learning something new each round and so far only tried a handful of things. Completely 100% worth the £1.74 i spent. 

Not much of a tutorial around the crafting system, but i guess it adds to the "learn as you go" style which i personally like instead of being spoon-fed the game. There is a simple tutorial that covers the basics. 

And oh yeah, it's f***ing hilarious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968808203', 'num_games_owned': 1889, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4570, 'last_played': 1640311118}
review:
This has to be one of my favorite games of all time. It's a good dungeon crawl with a lot of wit, rogue-like game play, and a real depth that makes each game somewhat fresh. There are amusing skill sets, and the way you mix them with each new character provides lots of variety in how you play. The monsters frequently speak, and I still chuckle thinking about the first time I saw a low level monster say "Fus Ro Dah" at me (Skyrim reference).

Edit: Revisiting this review a couple of years later, and it's still high on my all time favorite list.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013131394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3176, 'last_played': 1570605963}
review:
A game i first purchased on a whim so many years ago.
I find myself playing it a few times per year when i get that Rogue-like itch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080781507', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1099, 'last_played': 1664386678}

author: {'steamid': '76561198835629932', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1619, 'last_played': 1701114923}
review:
really fun and hard game with a really good sense of humor, the jokes are really funny and smart mix that with the really fun gameplay to make a really nice and unique game, and the difficulty is no joke sometimes you will just be walking around steamrolling all enemies then suddenly uou get dick flattened by a random enemy with an aura or just falling into a trap multiple times but even when you die it still makes you want to play it again because of the different skills and their abillities which make the game fresh every time you play it again BUT dont forget that the devs have gone bankrupt so dont expect any new content for the game (but there are a lot of mods for the game which increase the content by a ton but they arent a lot being made due to not many people knowing this game or people wanting to mod it)

i give it a deep omelette out of ten

author: {'steamid': '76561198012279782', 'num_games_owned': 1512, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1619, 'last_played': 1509322939}
review:
I'm not by any means a roguelike connoisseur/specialist but I had a lot of fun with this game. I've been through the greats such as ADOM and even an obscure one called Incursion - apart from the famous new ones such as ToME - and I can say that this one has what makes a true roguelike fun plus added goodies such as nice sprites, music, humor and skillsets.
Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198261889289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 5309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4382, 'last_played': 1675007992}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028739006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1570867632}
review:
Es un roguelike clásico por turnos con algunas mejoras y actualizaciones.

Tiene un sistema bastante completo de estadísticas, variedad de botín, y un sistema de creación de personajes muy abierto, El interfaz es gráfico y manejable con ratón. Tienes ayuda en pantalla, tutoriales ... lo habitual en el siglo XXI. Además, la dificultad es configurable, lo que convierte a este juego en un roguelike perfecto para novatos en el género.

En definitiva, un juego entretenido, fácil de empezar a jugar y difícil de dominar. Si vas a comprarlo, recomiendo coger el pack completo de juego + DLCs por 6€

author: {'steamid': '76561198058420171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 4710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4620, 'last_played': 1657285886}
review: This was the first game I bought on steam.  I spent a lot of hours playing this game.  It was fun and light humored and is still one of my favorite rouge-likes.  Playing the game doesn't begin to feel old over time between well crafted enemies and character classes.  This is a well made game.  It's very niche so easy to overlook but it's a class above most other rouges.  You made it to this store page.  Maybe you've already heard of the game from elsewhere and are just verifying what you've heard.  I'll verify for you that this game is very much worth your time.  Maybe you're just browsing Steam's catalog looking for something cheap and are worried about purchasing another shitty title that will just end up cluttering your library.  This isn't that game.  This is a little jewel that you will remember and think fondly of for years to come.   It's hard to say why the game works so well but it does.  It captures the spirit of rouge games in all of their glory and gives it to you.  It's a game that deserves it's cult following.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045295321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14635, 'last_played': 1708784701}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is one of my all time favorite games. It is a game that has evolved with me as I grow into a different gaming style and have different needs. Being a Salaried employ with a family leaves much less time for me to jump in and immerse myself in a game. But DOD lets me pick-up, play, and drop as needed, and if I want and have the time, I can delve for hours too.

There are few cons to the game, I think a game of this style could due to implement a Dungeon, class, and item builder. I know there are mods that take care of some aspects of this, but it would be nice for those that like to create. I think innately it should have much more variety in building a class, but what it has is stellar! 

10/10 across the board with room to expand the board.   
ALso it is the type of game I would love to see additional content added to it, but not a DOD 2, if you get my drift.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058271003', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1781, 'last_played': 1553795411}
review:
I don't love this game. It's very similar to Diablo 1. You just grind monsters for experience/loot. There are very few important decisions to make. I can't tell much of a difference between monsters. The majority of them have the same dumb AI. They're mostly hit point bags with sticks. Some make ranged attacks sometimes.

I decided to beat it anyway on the "fast" mode. After the second level, I couldn't tell a difference between the "fast" mode and the normal mode. It just has floors of monsters, and the boss rooms are always a hoard of mobs, which takes forever to kill but still isn't challenging. I eventually got so bored I started skipping floors. I ended up skipping 3/10 floors, wrecked the zoo room on floor 10, and then got literally one hit by lich Dredmor, when he was supposed to be feared and running away. I don't feel like grinding for another 12 hours to have another shot at Dredmor, so I guess I'll never beat this game. *shrug*

The game would also benefit from more polish. It's hard to tell what areas of the map are unexplored. You can't use mouse movement to walk through pets. If you mouse click a doorway, you will attempt to close the door instead of walk through it (which has gotten me killed). The food/drink mechanic is pretty annoying. If you build your character right, you don't need either, so there doesn't need to be 30 types of both constantly clogging your inventory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007568587', 'num_games_owned': 854, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1507, 'last_played': 1550248307}
review:
[b]«Рогалик», который заставляет к себе возвращаться.[/b] Одна из самых годных инди для меня.  Несмотря на первоначальное скептическое отношение (особенно из-за графики), я полностью изменил к ней своё отношение, но на это потребовалось практически 8 лет. Казалось бы, нужно забыть то, что она есть в библиотеке, но нет. 2011, 2012, 2016, 2019 год… многочисленные попытки понять и полюбить проект наконец-то увенчались успехом.  
И помогли в этом:
1.	Музыка, которая оказалась пусть простой, но очень душевной. Пара треков так вообще, идеально бы подошли не рогалику или приключенческой бродилке, а например, «Космическим Рейнджерам». Музыка разная, что-то обязательно понравится.
2.	Множественные отсылки к культурным феноменам, знаменитым играм и просто каким-то глупостям. Сначала я не особо обращал на это внимание, но, когда игра навалилась на меня всем гигантским кол-вом контента, я сдался. Разработчики вложили очень много именно в этот пласт игры.

[i]…начал играть вечером, и потерял счет времени. Когда такое происходит, значит игра свою задачу выполнила.[/i]

Что же меня отпугивало от погружения и может также напугать новичка?
1.	Нельзя лениться всё читать. Игра на английском и если играть только интуитивно, то можно не разобраться в механике. Особенно это касается крафта, улучшений и т.п.
2.	Игра сложная и становится легче в процессе прохождения, только если благоволит рандом… ну или если игрок заранее посмотрел билд, который способен выжить в подземелье. Я лично билдами не пользовался… и пожалел на более поздних уровнях.
3.	Очень специфический интерфейс, который просто не доработан. Есть отличная возможность для масштабирования его элементов, но отсутствует привязка к местоположению на экране.

Советовать её сложно, так как она может затянуть не сразу. В ней есть проблемы, как плохая оптимизация, бесполезная система квестов и перегруженный интерфейс крафта. Но даже, если игру не удастся пройти, она все равно подарит удовольствие. За такую цену очень трудно найти что-то похожее и приятное.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990913342', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 8715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8503, 'last_played': 1512706113}
review:
Dredmor is my favorite casual rogue-like of all time. It hits a perfect balance between a tricky dungeon with loads of dangers to learn to adapt to with a wide variety of builds and randomized drops... and learning the archaic practices needed to ascend in a tougher rogue-like like NetHack or ADOM. I was originally able to clear Going Rogue/Perma Death within ten tries just off familiarity with the genre and good practices in risk reduction. Since then I've played it on and off and eventually sat down to thoroughly clear all of the expansions, clear all of the achievements and really put the game to bed as mastered.

Dungeons of Dredmor challenges you to mix and match seven skillsets of deceptively simple complexity and to scavenge enough gear and consumables to survive the early floors. From there you polish your budding hero and carefully weather your approach through a wide variety of daunting floors, whether in a short and to the point compact mode or a full feast in the original big levels. Your best odds of success come from finding tried and true gear for various dangerous situations and to compliment your build and your many deaths will make you familiar with them all. There aren't many floors in Dredmor where you can kick your feet up and say "absolutely nothing bad spawns here!" Dredmor makes smart use of consistent dangers that run parallel to one another: traps are ever present and scale steadily, monsters develop nasty tricks that rarely venture into unfun and unfair territory, and ever-present surprises like set named mobs, monster zoos and That One Monster You Hate maintains consistent danger in every floor. The wonderfully balanced spread of loot keeps you pursuing that next +1 and the expansions add extra chances to jeopardize your smooth run with naked greed, as well as extra items and skillsets to keep your toolbox variety high! Of particular note is Wizardlands Pocket Dimension, offering packrats, craftsmen and rogue-like survivalists the perfect private space to unwind with some compulsive sorting. These are devs that know their audience!

This is a game where you can settle in and relax spending hours meticulously planning, clearing and leveling through one good run. Capping off the experience with grace is the final confrontation with Dredmor himself, or with the expansions the optional super-boss Vlad Digula. This game knows how to give you a finale and the last floor of Dredmor is often a nail-biting experience punctuated by the sight of that sneaky lich. This is it. Time to see if you kept up your defenses, picked up enough high value throwables and are ready to soak a few serious hits, maybe put your jukes to good use as they close in with their "you call that min-maxed?" game-ending melees. A perfect thrilling end to my favorite dungeon dive.

Dredmor has a sense of humor that should appeal to almost anybody, sticking to tongue-in-cheek and quirky over any chance of being in poor taste. The only legit flaw I can level against the game would be the balance of the skillsets and even then the weaker ones have a few gem skills that should have fans across the entire playerbase, and the skillset system is intelligently designed so that you can benefit from skillsets that you don't invest in! The ability to mod the game just boosts the replay value and helps patch that small hole, so what else is there to say? Dungeons of Dredmor is a fantastic casual rogue-like and the expansions are good value if you enjoy the base game. Try it today.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042342311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7863, 'last_played': 1551806788}
review: This game does not get enough love.  It is true to the Rogue-like platform, incredibly rewarding and deadly.  Top-notch humor and overall fun design.  I would like to see a new update with some additional content as some of the items have grown stale after so much play time.  However, the game itself has a ton of replayability with various combinations of power sets and a high skill gap.  It's easy to jump in to but takes a good while to master.  I encourage you to dive into the dungeon, if you dare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033554911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 6739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5102, 'last_played': 1702654337}
review: Professional nerds are still unveiling the vast multitudes of easter eggs and references that are layered within this game. They are still discovering more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041622326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 7215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7200, 'last_played': 1490135059}
review: An absolutely wild game and one of the best ways to get into proper Roguelikes. Start with this and move onto more complicated titles like Brogue into Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup and finishing with Sil for a smooth learning transition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263786925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1546251504}
review:
★★★☆☆(3/5) 

這遊戲畫面有別於一般像素的地牢遊戲，很簡單的劇情，過程也沒有突發事件，就只是打怪、撿寶、煉金、鍛造，你能想到的RPG要素這裡都有。但也因為沒有穿插劇情襯托，遊戲時間久了還是有點膩。

主角身上一堆的「屬性」 設計，其相對的作用有些不太清楚，另外「技能」 說明不是很詳細，有時候搞不清它的作用。或許我不是數據帝，也懶得仔細去研究。這遊戲可能要普通難度以上才能體會吧，因為不想受虐只選了簡單模式遊玩。

因為沒太多劇情對話，沒有中文也不是難事，只有開頭一段魔王介紹；雖然推薦給喜歡刷怪尋寶玩家，但這遊戲好像沒有儲物箱設計，只能一個異次元小房間，看著在地上堆滿物品、裝備、礦石、藥水，收集真的有點傻眼無力。

author: {'steamid': '76561198111513022', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2296, 'last_played': 1606703407}
review: Okay at first I got this during the winter sale I thought it was going to be a bust. Surprise surprise I really enjoyed the various starting traits and the crafting really made me interrested. This is definitly a rogue like I got into and I like the mods people made which makes it a  interesting. After I  got to the end I start to think can I win with different starting traits and  begin again. The flavor text for all the items is just  excellent. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198253551769', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1545148287}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is an awesome game! This is first rogue like game I have played in my entire life and I simply enjoy this game! You have a huge selection of skills to choose from in which you can create some interesting specific builds and create interesting gameplay! You will die a lot in this game as the game is simply trial and error in what skills work together and which don't. However, I feel like this is simply what makes the game really enjoyable and has replay value! 

Also, the dungeon is random each time meaning the floors and monsters and the loot on the floors is completely random always giving you a different challenge each time. 

The first attempts through the dungeon I kept dying, Though I went and kept switching out skills and finally managed to find a good build.

The build I personally use is Axe, Mace, Duel Wielding, Perception( to detect traps more easily), Werediggle Curse( to go werewolf to kill multiple enemies at once), Viking Wizardry( Wizard that does electricity kind of spells),  Psionics(Make enemies go to sleep),

My overall score for this game is 8/10. It's a solid game with tons of replay value and a good rogue game for 1st timers new to rogue genre.

I would definitely recommend you to pick this game up and try it out! It's fun to play!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998817967', 'num_games_owned': 659, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 4091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3794, 'last_played': 1545423290}
review:
An accessible roguelike that is pretty humorous and long-lasting, although it doesn't offer the incredible depth or grognardy fiddling potential many more expansive roguelikes offer. Like, there are roguelikes where you can turn self into a freakish mutant who drives a reinforced bus or uses convoluted crafting and deity worship systems to create incredible weapons, here it's pretty tame - although it's perfect if you're new to genre, or simply don't want your brains to melt trying to comprehend convoluted systems.

This thing looks nice, sounds fine, and has a setting which you can get a glimpse of in item tolltip descriptions, and it's mostly jokes and parodies, which is great - whole game doesn't take itself seriously, as a matter of fact. Anyways, it's pretty cliche in many ways, when it comes to activities - you scour dungeon floors, you fight monsters, and you level up to learn new skills and use equipment and other skills. There's a lot of options and interesting builds, and even more so if you get DLCs which get super cheap during sales and are worth it. And I mean it when I say interesting, where else do you get to be a multidexterous communist vampire who uses emo magicks? Or a kung fu were-bird alchemist steampunk knight? And the whole game is a bunch of goofyness like that. You gonna fight carrots and astronauts and loads and loads of diggle birds!

Another thing that's bit unfortunate? It's really combat-oriented. Like, there were many different roguelikes that diversified your activities over the years, but this one is mostly just combat and item management. Oh well, you still get a lot of options.

Go ahead, try it. Even if you're hesitant, this gets super cheap on sales, so why not grab it? Fantasic timekiller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025557226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1559040700}
review:
If you are left-handed, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

I've had this game for years and have patiently waited for the option to change key-bindings. I made comment of this back in 2014.

Sure, you can use the arrow keys to move about, but every other key is out of reach unless you move your hand off the mouse. Most left handed players rely on the keypad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040892359', 'num_games_owned': 3005, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1590328782}
review:
I bought this years ago as roguelikes are one of my favorite genre of games. I played it for a few hours over the years, maybe around an hour each time. I play for awhile, realize I can't get into it then think about it a few years later and try again. I really just don't like this game.

Normally on a roguelike it's either already set (or you're able to change) movement to the numpad. Not in this game. I like my movement keys, food, rest and others on the numpad. I find myself using the mouse a lot in this game, which you should never have to do in a roguelike. Hell, you can't even go diagonal... WTF is up with that? In most RLs you can pick up an item and compare it to what you have equipped. Not here. (Unless I've missed something?) It seems like I have to open at least two menus to do anything. I dunno, I just hate the systems/UI. 

I will say that it is pretty funny, which is nice. That doesn't, however, excuse how bad the game is and how poorly it was designed compared to others in the genre. It is cheap, I'll give it that, but there are so many better RL experiences that you can play for free that you should save the couple dollars this game costs. 

I'd recommend people give this one a pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019350240', 'num_games_owned': 1393, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3761, 'last_played': 1543257317}
review:
Funny writing and witty characters combined with a solid dungeon crawling RPG.
You'll easily loose a few hours booting up this lovingly crafted title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962912109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 10276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6505, 'last_played': 1702780392}
review:
The game looked pretty bad from afar so I had 0 expectation going in.
This game is surprisingly high quality, do not let the graphics fool you.
There is a learning curve but the game is interesting enough to keep you wanting to learn them.

Loots and skill trees is what makes this game a true gem.
There are many random fun items that you can use to somehow escape close calls.
Skill trees are many and its up to you to mix them up to fit your play style.

Overall, fantastic game.
I would buy a sequel from the same developer without hesitation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061172843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1586286571}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986265620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2069, 'last_played': 1668428812}
review: Sadly, I've tried and tried and just cannot get into this.  I even liked the hell out of Stone Soup, but this is just a mess.  The whole "Well we're not gonna tell you shiat!" thing gets old quickly.  Having no idea what the classes are going to get you ahead of time, having no idea wtf is going on with the crafting system, having no idea wth to do with tons of random crafting/otherwise loot... just - no.  It does lack some tradtionally irritating roguelike elements like food needs and it has sorta no permadeath options, but when paired with the purposefully obtuse actual gameplay stuff it's a drop in a very big bucket.  If you like to be punished/confused/whatever unless you've read the hell out a lot of wiki stuff, or banged your head on the wall a lot of times - well go for it.  Not my bag though.  I like the idea of roguelikes just fine.  Roguelikes without any real attempt at telling me wth is going on / how anything works combined with about 54205291023023 options for how things can get done?   Not so much really - that's not a good combination design-wise imo.  YMMV.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197972370664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1547053929}
review:
I had a weird experience in this game. I was looking forward to a fail/try/fail/try game, but my very first run [i]ever[/i] brought me to the second to last level on the hardest available difficulty.

I must have just picked the right skills. 

The problem was my first run took six hours, and when I died I was too exhausted to try it again. There'd be no fun in falling short anymore, since I almost reached the end.

That being said, it seemed like a fun zany game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123973496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1590494534}
review: Probably one of the best rogue-likes that I have played. The only problem is its glossary. I know the game tries to be satirical but it doesn't make much sense when everything on the scene tends to distract me with a weird nomenclature and tons of unuseful descriptions. If it doesn't annoy you much, then the game is a must.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026977554', 'num_games_owned': 1285, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 2379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2133, 'last_played': 1682113521}
review: Dungeons of Dreadmor is a fantastic way to kill an hour or two in between whatever you've got going on in your life. It's an extremely simple but surprisingly fun concept executed with a charming, Munchkin-like aesthetic that makes all the mundane RPG tasks much more bearable. It's also pretty damn hard, constantly throwing traps, minibosses, and random encounters such as massive screen-filling "monster zoos" at the player. However, it never feels impossible, and if you take your time, you can make your way pretty far even on your first few attempts. But dying is all part of the fun and the massive variety of skills makes the process of rolling up a new character feel refreshing every time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033340053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 3704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3704, 'last_played': 1526195965}
review:
Its games like this that make me wish for a neutral option for steam reviews as Dungeon of Dredmor is a a good game.

DoD is a rogue-like isometric dungeon crawler with a over the top sense of humor (literally everything is a joke) in which you create a hero and delve into the depths of Lord dredmors dungeon assembling a character by choosing 5 potential skills each 4 to 6 sub skill/spells from a massive collection of over 50 skills. Obviously this is alot of skills and abilites and opens up a vast number of possible combinations and with that come replay value; Not all of these are going to be viable and discovering combinations that work is a joy as you learn more about the systems in the game.

So what does the game do to earn a thumbs down from me? Well its the jokes. The game is packed with humor, every item description, monster, and plaque you find has some sort of joke on it, alot of them will make you chuckle, so whats bad? Well your stats and gear are also jokes and it just makes things a pain, rather than conveying information clearly the game is squeezing in another joke that just creates a hurdle to understanding the games systems (of which there are quite a few) and this is especially annoying as there are already so many jokes they really didn't need any more and the game would of been better for for it.

On top of that theres the horrible UI design, its tiny and difficult to read, it doesn't scale and is actually too small to fit in all the relevant information (if your character has more damage types or resistance types than can fit on the UI it literally tapes an extra box onto the side of the UI, like a loose box attached with tape, it looks bad) and on top of that all the relevant stats are represented by (tiny) icons; instead of just clearly stating on an item gives +5 fire damge +1 cold resist you instead have a square or a circle with little symbols, so instead of stats you have a set of tiny icons, (many of which look similar to each other) and need to open your character sheet to mouse over all the icons there (can't do it on the item) and match them up to know what they do (remembering that alot of them have joke descriptions that make this worse still).

I've beaten the game on the highest difficulty and it was a even after the time I spent with DoD I still couldn't remember what those symbols meant, it was a constant pain in the a*** as I tried to get seriously into the higher tier content the game has to offer and is a prime example of bad UI design. Its not game breaking, you can still play at a high level despite this, but the game is much more enjoyable played casually and you'll probably enjoy it if you just jump in for occasional quick dungeon crawl.

TLDR, if you want something to just jump into between other game DoD will provide you with many hours of good times and maybe the occassional chuckle, but the design seems to fight against you diving deeper into depths that are totally there with jokes taking precedence over cleary conveying information to player, meaning its a pain to get deep into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198416422296', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3404, 'last_played': 1637065237}
review:
大概是steam上我最喜欢的roguelike，几十种职业任意组合探索地下城，（共产主义者打爆一切。）
药水效果全靠喝，技能效果全靠用。别说英文就是中文你也弄不明白那一堆梗下面隐藏的真实效果到底是个啥。（我至今不知道地质学家技能里那个artifact到底是个啥）
墙上的彩字输入进口袋位面的机器里可以进入一个小楼层，怪挺菜的，低级注意陷阱能秒大概40滴血。
普通楼层里的蓝色传送阵不要随便进去，里面怪的难度不和你当前级别挂钩，但是里面有好装备。（管他呢，共产主义者打爆一切（我错了不要反击digger大哥
锻造系统啥的我不是很了解，可能需要平时多积攒一些加锻造能力的装备，要不然那么高的属性要求根本达不到啊喂。

在三层看到一把10w的剑，存了好几层买下来，然后把所有铁砧附魔都给它，神器诞生了哇咔咔。
就这样，随意抒发一下这个游戏的感想

author: {'steamid': '76561198010672112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 5675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5322, 'last_played': 1553579738}
review:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33289799-LetsTalkGames/] You can check out my Curator review page for more reviews, [u]LetsTalkGames[/u]	[/url]

A simple but highly addictive Rogue-Like. 
Over 50 different class choices with each class containing a sub set of four to six skills.
At the start of the character creation screen you are asked to choose five out of fifty one classes to mold the character that you will be dungeon crawling with. Awesome idea.

Sadly you can not change the looks of your character in anyway shape or form. 
And the characters appearance leaves little to be desired.
Gear that you pick up such as swords, shields, armor, etc... 
Do not show up visually either, which really sucks. 
I'm not really fond of the art style either. 

That being be said something about this game keeps me coming back for more.
Maybe because it has great difficulty options and I always crank those up to the hardest setting so the game
Play is consistently challenging / entertaining.
Or maybe it is the HUGE amount of choices you have for creating your character.

Some absurd choices
And 
Some very unique choices.

The amount of class options alone makes it well worth the price, you throw mods into the mix and there are no limits to class options. With the right skill set / research you could even create your own class mod.
If creating mods is not your thing, no worries. There is massive list of downloadable characters.
One of the benefits of older games.

Alright 
lets get to it.


[h1] Pros [/h1]

[*] Huge list of class / ability options. Including Magic and Melee of course.
[*] Humorous description text.
[*] Storage isn't a issue thanks to the alternate dimension storage room.
[*] Has crafting Classes, Blacksmith, Alchemy, etc.
[*] Can be rather challenging with settings cranked up.
[*] Turn based combat.
[*] Loot / loot chests.
[*] Mini quests.
[*] Alternate realms AKA the Diggle realm. You'll want to be extremely careful in this realm.
[*] Perma Death option (my favorite)
[*] A Score system to determine how well you did.
[*] Decent variety of items that have + X bonus to stats.
[*] Character stats: Str, Dex, Mana, etc.
[*] Mini bosses RNG can really F*** you here if you are not careful.
[*] Mods of all kinds: Character, item, New rooms, Classes / abilities.
[*] Random spawning shop keeper.
[*] Replay Value



[h1] Cons [/h1]
[*] Straight forward A.I.
[*] Can get repetitive.
[*] Arts not that great.
[*] Can't change character looks.
[*] Gear doesn't show up when you wear it.
[*] Shop having nothing but trash too often.
[*] No story


[b] The Verdict [/b]

There is nothing mind blowing about Dungeons of Dredmor but it has enough going for it to still be pretty fun to play. 
So many class options make for some truly unique play styles. And just messing around with those options could add
a great deal of re-play value.

I recommend buying the game on sale. 
Lots of new Rogue Likes coming out that are putting far more overall effort into their title which really begins to show Dungeon of Dredmors age. 
On sale though, totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 295, 'playtime_forever': 10064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10064, 'last_played': 1476314961}
review:
This is a pretty good RPG with lots to like, though it isn't perfect. It's a roguelike, but it allows you to cheat permadeath if you want. As roguelikes go it is relatively easy anyways.

Pros:
* Genuinely good humor nearly everywhere.
* Lots of classes that play differently. Since you mix-and-match several classes each run that means a lot of combinations.
* Fairly deep crafting system, if you take a crafting class.
* Good modding community with even more unique, funny classes to play as. Mods are well-integrated.

Cons:
* Very little variety in threats. Almost all enemies just charge into melee with the occasional one that shoots ranged magic while approaching. All have the same AI. You can usually ignore elemental weaknesses/resistances if you want. The only time you'll be engaging more than a couple foes at a time is one room per level which is huge and stuffed with monsters (which you can clear with area spells or run away).
* If you actually use the crafting system, you'll quickly run out of inventory space and it will become a drag. (This is mitigated by a pocket dimension that got added by the expansion, but I'm not sure if you get that in the base game and it might have been a mod).

author: {'steamid': '76561197969323825', 'num_games_owned': 1777, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2295, 'last_played': 1530736881}
review: A decent beginner roguelike with zero respect for the player or their time. Tooltips for skills are next to useless, and don't give you a meaningful description of what they do. You can rest to regain health and mp, but you can only rest for one turn per button press; every other roguelike in existance let's you rest until full or an enemy walks into your line of sight. Give it a wide berth and give your money to Caves of Qud instead, or play Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035677446', 'num_games_owned': 2876, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 12621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8356, 'last_played': 1651989519}
review:
[h1]Geneal Experience[/h1]
Your time really disappears playing this game since it is very hard to put down. It feels like one of the best RPGs out there, especially for the price. The customization is insane and you can find synergies that can give you dozens of unique runs. Most of the skills are useful and it's easy to see which ones would be a compliment to your build. You are not intended to win and you get a great challenge as you try to make your way down the dungeon. The humor and easter eggs are really top notch, be sure to read all the tooltips for anything you can hover your mouse over. 

[h1]Complaints[/h1]
Depending on your playstyle, a full Dredmor run can take a very long time to complete. There is an option to reduce the amount of floors, but it can come at a cost of more loot, but the full version of the dungeons can take three times longer to complete. This might be more of a "me" issue, but I like to explore every corner for items. The length isn't a bad thing, but it does suck when you spend hours on a run to die accidentally and lose your progress, whether it be a long time since you last saved or losing a whole permadeath run. 

[h1]Replayability[/h1]
Dredmor has many ways to play and your starting skills are always chosen by you. Because of this, Dredmor offers unlimited playability by simply being able to change your build each time. Even if you repeat a build you used previously, you will find that the dungeons are randomly generated and you may find different loot as you dive deeper. 

[h1]Extra Content[/h1]
There are currently three expansions for Dredmor, one that comes for free and the other two are bought normally. They add more skills to chose from (most of them are quite powerful additions), more items to craft and loot, more floors to go down and an addition of the pocket portal which adds more mini dungeons and a place to store your items in a pinch. They are very much worth it if you enjoyed the base game. 

[h1]Achievements[/h1]
There are a couple of broken achievements that require either SAM or a Workshop mod to fix. The Devs are no longer in business and the game has stopped getting updates for some time. I believe the only mod that is currently broken is the "Craft 500 wands" achievement. I used the Workshop mod for this. Getting the full 100% does require playing a Permadeath run with the hardest difficulty, and this proved to be a very hard achievement to acquire due to the damage of traps and enemies. If you don't have the stomach to grind it out, Dredmor can be a rough game to 100%.

[h1]Technical Issues[/h1]
The game does not feature many technical options and has not been adapted for higher resolutions. It's not uncommon to have a super tiny UI when playing on 1080p or higher. If you play on a high resolution, the best you can do is click the tiny box on the corner of a UI element to increase it's size. This can be done for the skill bar, inventory and map. 

[h1]Value[/h1]
While the base game is $5, for $2 more you can get the full edition which is very worth it. Dredmor is a very deep game mechanically and it comes with a couple hundred hours of playtime. It's very much worth the price if you like classic rougelikes. I can't recommend it enough!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010560368', 'num_games_owned': 1183, 'num_reviews': 703, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1406152310}
review:
Классический рогалик (процедурно генерируемый!!1111) с юмором в каждом кусочке описания вещи, способности, врага аля настольная игра "Манчкин". Тем не менее, игра зайдет не всем, разбираться в ней долго, во многом - из-за неудобного интерфейса, да и просто времени на хорошее прохождение требуется много. Очень большая вариативность (десятки перков и классов) тоже идет в зачет Dungeons of Dredmor. 
В целом, советую поиграть в данный рогалик, однако, не факт, что она Вам зайдет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259339095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1642988261}

review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is a solid rogue-like RPG with good sense of humor: all the flavor text is done in a style of Munchkin card game. It's is really fun to explore first time around. 
Gameplay itself consists mostly of combat and it is quite repetitive and gets a bit boring during full playthrough on last dungeon floors. It is actually more interesting to do short session, try some crazy builds and die during first 5 levels)
