author: {'steamid': '76561198059953862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1434825144}
review:
So... I am writing this review, because the game pushed me towards the edge of negative emotions. Which is quite sad, because the game itself and idea are really good and addictive, sadly not enough to forgive all the non-stop, gamebreaking issues.

The mains reasons why I cannot, by any stretch of imagination recommend this game.
1. Game crashes. Crashes sometimes are game-breaking, as the game sometimes just does not save at all. A crash couple times after 1-2 hours of playtime led to completely losing the whole progress until that point and resetting everything including game settings, which is impossible to accept,

2. Game does not autosave for no apparent reason. It shows during gameplay that game has been saved, yet when starting the game the day after I'm still starting not from what I have left, but from the very previous save, which feels like even bigger waste of time - there is no way I am going to go through same thing I have passed already and got the good stuff and upgraded my character. It's just not fun at all and misses the purpose, because it's far from similar to replaying the game after death. It makes me not want to play it anymore because I don't know when save will work from the proper place and when it won't.

3. Numerous glitches, including popping through doors, attacks that were impossible to hit they still do, I believe it's some sort of trying to give an advantage to silly AI which sucks terribly.

4. Game performance is just plain awful. It has not been optimized for anything, and as far as the retro visual estetics go, clunkiness and non responsivness to keyboard is one more thing that CAN NOT BE ACCEPTED in game that has been out there for so long.

I swear, don't buy it. It's more frustrating than anything you've met and after reading revious others left you can see these are not an uncommon problems. It will make you love the game, and few momens later you will hate it dearly and want your money back so you can get go get a burger instead of buggy, unplayble game. Shame on you, lazy ass developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058571308', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 5325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4303, 'last_played': 1492168552}
review:
A lot of us define a good game by one we can sink a "£1 an hour of good gameplay", and in that sense, Dungeons of Dredmor is one of the best investments possible - you can get it, with all the DLC, for only £5. I've currently got 51 hours in it, so it's been more than a good investment, in that sense.

The gameplay is... Solid. It's turn based, so  you're hardly on the edge of your seat, but the enemies are unique and the taunts are funny. Lots of references. There's even a fantastic mod, "Death by One Thousand Taunts", which adds even more. It's great.

Because there's a surprising amount of workshop content for a near-six year old game, some mods add new skill trees, etc., so even if you do a playthrough of every skill type, there'll be new ones to try.

I never thought I could play rogue-likes. I'm not that great at Binding of Isaac, though that might be because you cannot save and exit it, however with Dredmor, you can save and exit, so you can come back and replay whenever you want.

You can run this in a potato. And get more than enough hours into it to make it more than worth the while. 

9/10 a fantastic investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004456693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1532611580}
review: At first I fell in love with this game. It has a really nice humour, offers a lot of classes and has a good, nostalgic atmosphere. Yet after some hours I got really bored... the game just can't offer anything new to you, no matter what kind of character you have. I would give a 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046490097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1430054134}
review:
Ce jeu n'est pas si mal, mais il y a quelques points qui m'agacent. J'y rejouerai probablement et je pense qu'en rabais, il peut en valoir le coût. Cependant, les jeux de ce type sont légions et je pense qu'il y en a de meilleurs.

Ce que je reproche :
Principalement la lenteur. Le personnage se déplace lentement, les étages sont longs à explorer, les combats prennent beaucoup de temps... tomber sur un zoo et vous en avez pour 30 minutes à tuer tous les monstres que vous y trouverez!

Lors du choix des compétences en début de partie, les effets de chacune ne sont pas clairs. En gros, pour les premières parties, il faut tester pour voir, avec le risque d'avoir une combinaison vraiment pas optimale.

Ensuite, quelques détails au niveau de l'interface : difficulté de voir certains objets lorsqu'ils sont sur le bord du mur inférieur (pareil pour les ennemis d'ailleurs) ou derrière une étagère/caisse/élément de décor; impossibilité de comparer les caractéristiques des équipements lorsque l'on tient l'un d'entre eux (si l'inventaire est plein, oblige à prendre un objet, le poser, prendre l'équipement dans l'inventaire pour voir ses caractéristiques); impossible de ramasser un objet sur une case adjacente s'il y a un allié sur cette case (créature invoquée), cliquer sur la case nous fait attaquer notre allié; option disponible pour ramasser les objets au sol automatiquement, mais ne fonctionne que sur la case sur laquelle on est (exception de l'argent, qui est ramassé sur les 9 cases) alors qu'il est possible manuellement de ramasser les objets sur les 8 cases autour; impossibilité d'avoir la carte autrement qu'en minimap et il n'est pas clair à la base de savoir quelles icônes représentent quoi (on voit facilement les escaliers, les marchands et les zoos, mais d'autres éléments seraient intéressants à voir, tels que les structures utiles aux quêtes secondaires, les statues, etc... qui sont en fait peut-être visible, mais vu la taille de la carte, c'est difficile à identifier); difficulté de savoir les dégâts que nous feront les ennemis; menus de "crafts" pouvant être fastidieux à naviguer (et je n'ai pas encore trouvé comment notre habileté dans les différents artisanats augmente), ce qui va avec une gestion complexe de l'inventaire (emplacements limités et nécessité de plusieurs objets spécifiques pour certains crafts, ce qui oblige à fouiller dans les crafts pour voir les objets que l'on peut créer, les composantes nécessaires, etc, etc, pour ne pas jeter ou vendre les composantes dont nous avons besoin); impossibilité de racheter aux marchands les objets vendus : un missclick et c'est tant pis pour toi!; voix énervante nous annonçant "your inventory is full", "your health is low", etc (je ne sais pas comment appeler cette voix).

Également, plusieurs objets n'ont pas leurs effets décrits. C'est volontaire et cela peut représenter un certain intérêt, mais je trouverais intéressant d'avoir ces effets affichés une fois que l'objet a été consommé une fois. J'ai personnellement du mal à tout retenir et je trouve énervant d'avoir à me servir d'une aide externe (notes personnelles ou site internet) à laquelle me référer constamment. (Cet élément est mineur et influe peu sur mon appréciation générale)



Côté positif, le jeu a une très grande rejouabilité, plusieurs "achievements" à compléter et certains représentants un gros défi, possibilités de modifier plusieurs options de jeu (pas de mort définitive, 3 niveaux de difficulté, choix aléatoire des compétences pour plus de défi, et quelques autres options).

author: {'steamid': '76561198025833979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1569, 'last_played': 1679638443}
review: Normalmente este tipo de juegos del genero Rogue-like tienen un publico muy reducido y solamente en paises como en Japon y de Europa estos juegos generan interes. Pero este juego tiene una jugabilidad casi ilimitada, ya que puedes expander el juego con mas mods que hacen que el juego se alargue todavia mas, asi que se los recomiendo este juego aquellos que desean un juego que les dure mucho, no se van a arrepentir.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971536555', 'num_games_owned': 1666, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 14520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13304, 'last_played': 1638293066}
review: One of the games I return to quite often. A simple to play, complex to master dungeon crawler with so much vairation. The most important thing is that the player can custom-create the character's class, which is one of the most important things in creating variance between play-throughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968329361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1594713473}
review:
The short version: It's fun.  Build character, collect loot, be a god on one floor and die to a piece of vegetable on the next.


The long version:

This game is a turn-based, dungeon crawling, rogue-like-power-fantasy.

That last bit may sound contradictory but in the same game I slaughtered an entire room of 50 something+ monsters without batting an eye and ran like a baby carrot panda from a stupid corn thing.

The character building is fantastic as the player can choose a handful of skill trees which creates a lot of different character builds. Progressing down different trees in different order can create a new experience for the playthrough.

The rogue-like aspects are tweakable so the player can choose how difficult or easy a playthrough will be. They can even turn off perma-death and load a save when a character dies. Along with the built in options, this game is moddable with Steam Workshop support for easy browsing/installation.

Combat is turn-based and depending on how you setup your character it can range from flinging fireballs and running away until things are recharged to teleporting into the thick of things and slowly laying the smack down on every living thing in the area.

Crafting is a little clunky. It has a lot of depth and that can be a blessing and a curse. The player has a limited inventory space but the amount of crafting materials is a little overwhelming at first. In general, there is a crafting material for each craft (smithing, tinkering, etc) and for each crafting material there are multiple levels (copper, silver, brass, etc). Inventory can become cluttered unless the player is not a hoarder (what's wrong with you?) and they know exactly what they want to make and how much of a certain material is required.

On the other hand, the depth allows for a lot of customization and there are even recipes to be found on bookshelves to create even more things.

The humor and flavor text in the game is a bit of hit or miss. While it can be funny, at times it gets in the way of figuring out what exactly a skill does. This can also be half the fun for some.

As for the story, something something evil something something you are the one panda to save them all. Yeah, game's about loot and poking things till they're puddles of goo.

It's a great game for people who like to experiment with builds and go dungeon crawling/loot collecting through randomized levels. If you don't like the rogue-like element, you can turn it into a rogue-lite. Mods extend the fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019673114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1429995617}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065964036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 18218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1497239621}
review: If you like games the Sword & Stars: The Pit, and other rouge-likes with crafting and lots of skills then this is a game for you. I also bever see my death coming, and the humor is pretty darn good. The workshop content is pretty awesome too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045765418', 'num_games_owned': 2111, 'num_reviews': 775, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1427919463}
review: Amazing game, a some you must have it. Plenty hours of gameplay, really.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029808025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 20161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13043, 'last_played': 1633835515}
review: Incredible game with an amazing sense of humor, more games should aspire to be like Dungeons of Dredmor. The fun never ends thanks to the games difficult design and many mods from the workshop, Gaslamp games deserves way more than what it has gotten from this game. Considered a casual rouge-like, is probably the toughest on the steam market. I have only beaten the default game twice in all my hours playing, and have yet to defeat the final boss on the Diggle realms DLC (All the DLC is worth buying since its dirt cheap and adds a lot to the game).  You can sit down and play this game or go on and off on a run, personally I like to play this while I listen to a podcast. BUY THIS GAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025423596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1578243435}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005733306', 'num_games_owned': 468, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 13638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13638, 'last_played': 1429414547}
review:
This game has been netted as one of my personal favorite roguelikes. A big fan of Gaslamp and their crew - I'm stoked to have been part of a lot of beta testing for the content of this game and even to where an achievement that I suggested on the forums has been added in! :D

Now. This game sets up the limits of...weird. And the DLC has only improved it. The crafting system is large and well varied, the Wizard Keys and finding graffitti scrawled on the walls with codes to new levels, all the loot you can shake a stick at, in-game vending machines selling you everything from baseballs to ground meat and nukes and Root Of T'char. 

The greatest thing about this game is how varied the outcomes can be. You have the choices of 6 different talent trees out of 15+ ones and none are "right" OR "wrong." The game gives you the freedom to play as you please and the Save-Exit function is a godsend when you start delving and you feel tired. Levelling up and playing is turn based and the enemies move as you move.

Overall: I have so much fun with this game that I've yet to finish ONE game. 70+ hours on and offline with this game and every time there's that itch to re-roll a character and try a new combination JUST BECAUSE the skill trees augment and vary your gameplay so much!

GOOD:
-Fair play RPG.
-Lots of contents, weapons, combinations, skill trees, items.
-So MANY bad/good puns and references to other bits of culture.
-Game never really feels 'unfair' or 'hard' as some other roguelikes. There's mostly always a way to live...mostly. Or run away.
-Diggles.
-Heroic Vandalism!
-Do you like eggs? WELL WE GOT A LOT OF 'EM!
-SO MANY community mods and addons for this game made by dedicated players. Hate the current skill trees/items? Well replace them!
-The monsters yell and insult you whilst you bash their heads in!
-Wands, nukes, steampunk, veganism, were-diggle skills, get Wizard-krunked, Astronomy, blacksmithing...gosh!

BAD:
-The game does have a tendency to be unbalanced at times when it is you happen to delve too quickly and the enemy levels outpace yours and you find yourself getting smacked upside the head.
-The same way you can combine types of damages on weapons and armor...remember that the enemy can do it too. Don't be shocked when you get slapped to all hell when you get hit by 4-8 different types at once and get instagibbed with Boss monsters.
-The game is rather lengthy and for some players it's a lot to sit through in one sitting. Breaks are nearly mandatory sometimes. Set your number of levels and difficulty in advance.
-Do not turn on permaDETH if you're not a fan of dying. Flushing away a couple hours/days work because you got teleported over a body of water and can't swim is enough to make you cry.
-Butcher Rooms. Nuff said.
-The stability of the game is still questionable at times and prone to some far-spaced but non-lethal bugs. It's a lot to deal with but the game is still stable.

PLEASE NOTE that this game is NO LONGER BEING WORKED ON. This is a CLOSED project. Gaslamp has given up nearly all the resources to create the game back to the community to continue making content and debugging and in general have been very, very good to their players. 

From allowing us to name the expansions, to adding our own achievements, to allowing bug reports in beta they have done so much for this game and honestly...it's a project made with a lot of love.

I may be selling you this game wistfully but I guarantee anyone who buys and plays this wonderful project WILL enjoy themselves immensely. I do recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042272222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1635, 'last_played': 1698815129}

review:
J'ai acheté Dungeons of Dredmor en sachant uniquement qu'il est un rogue-like. Un rogue-like à l'ancienne.
Quand j'ai ouvert ma première partie, je me suis dit "Ouais ok, vite fait." 
Et au fur et à mesure de mes "runs", j'ai commencé à voir le potentiel du jeu.

C'est un jeu pour les zizous du rogue-like : un jeu de technicien !

author: {'steamid': '76561198098136718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5066, 'last_played': 1521674255}
review:
Dungeons of dredmor allows you to make a version of iron man.As in, Mr tony stark..If you get pretty damn good.
-Unarmed
-Tinkering
-Blacksmith
-Clockwork Knight
-Perception(Optional, But useful)
-Master of Arms/Shield Skill
-Etc.
(Note:This setup does require the full DLC set, But its worth a look)

Roguelikes are at once brutal, Entertaining, And very often a timesink once you work out the patterns.They are the games where you quite casually toss characters into a meat grinder to see what comes out.Roguelikes are glorious, And this, While easier than the usual genre fare..Is a good option.

You begin by selecting a hero/heroine with no random name selector, Forcing some creative juices to flow.The next screen is somewhat more imposing, Especially the first time.Seven skill groups are picked that define what your character can do in the game context, And then you are let loose with a short blurb that basically says the hero meant to head down was on his lunchbreak, So you go down instead.

The above build i mentioned is based around a style of play, Namely that of the sturdy and/or drunken warrior.It is very possible to be a sneaky fellow lobbing crossbow bolts, A drunken mad scientist with helper fungus..Or a vegan emo-pirate, Because why not.The drops are random, Creatures silly and endearing, and victory is never a sure thing.

If worth nothing else, The game is good for a brief look to dip your toes into the roguelike genre.Skol!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048750494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1660, 'last_played': 1503472989}
review:
I would recommend dungeons of dredmor, it's a classic feeling RPG with alot of challange, ( i always play on hardest difficulty settings). it's RNG mechanics offer every experience to be different from the last and the modding community has offer signifigent replayablity even if you've beaten the final boss. the crafting system is intuitive and easy to understand, the wide range of classes and builds allow you to play each game different from the last, or find a style that suits you. 
however, if you aren't into rouge-like RPGs, do not enjoy challanging moments, and RNG mechanics then i wouldn't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004028499', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 4876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3284, 'last_played': 1481139212}
review:
Highly addictive... fun as well, but this game can eat up hours just because you want to progress further each time you die. A rogue-like-light in all respects, but that does not mean it is a bad game. 

It can get repetitive, but limit your playing sessions to one or two hours and that won't be a problem. The difficulty is quite extreme, but that's not really a negative point in these kinds of games, it seldom feels too unfair or random, most problems can be remedied with good strategy.

 A good game, though not the greatest rogue-like out there (that would be Adom).

review: I read about this game from different sources like TV Tropes and the game's wikia page and thought that this game would be fun.  Two hours in, lame.  The lowerest resolution is still bigger than my laptop screen force to play in fullscreen.  The game is boring when the plot is "Hero goes to dungeon and faces Villain."  Those are the negatives.  The positives are you can choose what main skillsets to have on the trek.  A choice of different difficulty levels and permadeath.  I cannot say I recommend this game nor say I don't recommend.  The reason for and against are slightly balanced out, but I am sad to say that I do not recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117594867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1632923248}
review:
Kill them from afar with your Bolts of Mass Distruction or bash them in the head with your shiled. Or maybe you want the Diggle experience. Anything you expect from a cRPG, this game delivers. Including humorous item/skill descriptions and comments from your foes. 

Not to mention that you can make this game run even on your toaster if it has a display.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062259956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4886, 'last_played': 1470797976}
review:
Fun, funny, and quirky, DoD can be played either as a roguelike or as a classic, turn-based dungeon crawl/RPG with a nice crafting and skill tree system. Permadeath is an option you can disable at character creation if you want to get a feel for the game before diving into the pitiless world of the roguelike. Variable difficulty settings also help with this.

The main downside to the game is that, although there is plenty of variety in terms of items and skills, not so much in terms of gameplay. The game is an unbroken progression through floors of the dungeon that are virtually identical except for different tilesets, and enemies are regularly recolored and recycled. There is no "town" or "overworld" to speak of, although there are shops. 

Still, the game is absolutely worth it, especially at the bargain price. Why are you still reading -- just buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158353086', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1575704317}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997753928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 5820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2617, 'last_played': 1524213185}
review:
If there was a heavy blizzard and a man was trapped in his home with rations, toilet water, and Dungeons of Dredmore on a lappie with batteries. I believe when he was found by rescuers 5 days later he be like "Oh, hey guys!" And not mentally shaken in the least. After all, in the world of Dredmore time passes swiftly, yet so sweet.

It is true that I would have never scooped this game up had I not been gifted it. Was I wrong to overlook one of thousands of inexpensive Indies? Maybe not. Afterall I like to keep my Library uncluttered and the cost of collecting every popular title adds up.

However, I would have BOUGHT this engrossing character building game earlier had I known first hand that it was so pleasing. It a good example of a game thats not epic, but has a formidable polish pushing it past most indie peers as far as replayability and reward factor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020874000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1355, 'last_played': 1427864340}
review:
I don't understand why this game is so popular.  Sure, it's cheap and is good-humored, but it just didn't do it for me.  If I had to put my finger on it, I think it's that it relies too heavily on the random number generator.

You have no control over what items vendors are selling or what quest rewards you'll get or what crafting materials or recipes are available in any particular run.  You just repetitively kill enemies and get strung along for the ride hoping that the random number generator is kind to you.  Not my idea of a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064790122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 6402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3599, 'last_played': 1679033930}
review:
Having played a couple of days and reaching Lord Dredmor, i must conclude that the game:

- has a fun set of monsters
- invites you to try out new skill combinations, thus has replay value
- has a _great_ music
- includes lutefisk

but looking back, there are some negative points too:

- bugs roughly every 10 minutes (at least on the linux version), ranging from misplaced items (cant reach) or monsters (4 stacked upon), crashes every 30 minutes (after some in-game time / progress)
- the crafting system is dysfunctional (getting a lvl1 recipie in the last lvl of the dungeon - too random, too many "silly"/useless crafts, 3 ingots for a simple item without stats - ingots too rare)
- fun for 99.9% of the game, then Lord Dredmor kills you with 2 strikes
- nonexistent help/tips: "what does potion/mushroom xxx do?" is part of most roguelites, but a simple tooltip how to use knightly leap or what some stat-gain gets you would be very pleasant.
- lutefisk cube: The idea is that you can transform every non-food item to lutefisk and then donate it to the fish-god who gives you a random item. But to have a good chance you need about 200 pieces. But trading a 13k gold item for 1 piece of lutefisk?? Would just need some price/lutefisk scaling. 




This game is in such a nice and interesting state, but lets call it beta quality and finish up those loose ends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027771321', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1388641201}
review:
Pros: 
+ Good randomization
+ Variety of items
+ Variety of skills
+ Cool roguelike concept

Cons:
- Awful graphics (and I've played ascii roguelikes, this is worse)
- Framerate has no effect except how annoyingly long the animations are
- Requires mouse AND keyboard to operate game, no mouse only operation and no keyboard only. Some commands are limited to one or the other
- Levels look exactly the same

author: {'steamid': '76561198035351059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6892, 'last_played': 1686695377}
review:
It says a lot about Dungeons of Dredmor that I've clocked up more hours on this than Skyrim and I'm still playing it over 2 years later, long after I completed Skyrim.
It's funny and easy to get into but with enough depth to keep you coming back. Steam achievements help as I've found myself playing to get achievements as well. 
As with many games these days you'll probably want to find a wiki online to get all the information that we used to rely on manuals for but that's only a minor niggle.
If you've ever enjoyed an RPG, you'll enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972654162', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1433, 'last_played': 1633801524}
review:
Pros:
  - It's a good intro to Rogelikes
  - It's polished, the theme is consistent and I experienced no bugs

Cons:
  - Repetitive, each level has the same mobs, just a different color
  - There is little to no strategy in combat.
  - While I thought the crafting was going to be promising, by the time you get enough materials, you'll have found half a dozen of the item you want to craft
  - The only challenge in this game is [spoiler] the final boss, which after such cake-walk of a game will likely cause you to rage-quit after two-shotting you[/spoiler]

I played through this game with very minimal difficulty and I can say that if you're a Rogelike fan who hasn't played this, skip it. It you haven't played a Rogelike before and want to take baby steps into the genre, this game might be for you. Word of warning, it's very repetitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050789718', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2624, 'last_played': 1601062041}
review:
This game is fun for those who enjoy dungeon crawlers with a random gentrated items and weapons and with reffrence and quotes to a lot of pop culture and old video games the humor is Off that as well however this game is not for the faint of heart this game is deffinly diffcult you will die a lot but if you think you can handle it and your not being a wimp You will put it on to the diffculty of going rouge diffculty where ethrething just got crazy hard  but the game is always fun and something to do if you feel like playing a rouge like  you will enjoy this game. 

I suggest this game for people who enjoy roleplaying game and hard games

author: {'steamid': '76561198107882088', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1512961065}
review:
What a game!!!! Im not usually a fan of Turn-Based RPGs but this one just got me hooked instantly!!! I thought to give it a try and what a game!! Its original price is so worth the game, 4 euros is litterally a bargin for such a game. 

In a game like this expect to die...........a lot. Its a Rogue-like, Turn-based, RPG, Permadeath game, meaning litterally if u die, well ur dead. The execution of all them put together waas done so well in this game. You start the game with your choice of sex and then 7 different "talents" you could say, from around 40 different ones!!! You basically mix and match what u want to be and then are put in a randomised dungeon, to survive. I have died 10 times four with the same talents and then just tried something else. Im now playing, still alive lvl 10 with the talents i originally wanted, but with more understanding of the game im now not fouled. 

Its a hillerious game with great amounts of time and depth put into it. I am having a lot of fun and now cause of this game i might look into more turn-based games. Its a game that i would most definatly recoment to others as its a huge amount of fun. 

A game well worth 10/10 ^^ :crafting:

author: {'steamid': '76561198043806044', 'num_games_owned': 692, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1657277184}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor.

Сегодня речь пойдет об игре под названием Dungeons of Dredmor.

DoD - это пошаговая RPG игра поджанра roguelike, созданая Канадской компанией Gaslamp Studios и полностью выполненная в пиксельной графике. Сюжет в игре прост и скучно банален - есть злодей, когда то заточенный в подземелье и готовый вырваться наружу,но наш герой не прост и собирается отправиться в самый низ подземелий, дабы сразить врага, вот и весь сюжет.

Геймплэй-же отнюдь, интересен и затягивает игрока целиком с самого момента запуска. В самом начале игры вам дается выбор пола, имени и способностей вашего персонажа, этих самых способностей целых 34 штуки, хотя выбрать вам можно будет только 7, которые по ходу повышения уровня будут улучшаться вами. Сами способности представляют собой сплав фэнтэзи, паровой механики и юмора, а так-же всяких разных ремесел, которые позволят в будущем создавать и улучшать экипировку главного героя. Далее ваш персонаж появляется на 1ом этаже подземелья, где его дружелюбно или не очень встречают двери за которыми таится ваша смерть, или же нет ? В этой игре все основано на удаче, на каждом этаже есть тонны ловушек, сундуков и дверей которые так и жаждят чтобы их открыли, сломали или разбили, все зависит от вашей удачи, ну и от отмычек конечно, куда-же без них ? По мере прохождения вы будете спускаться все ниже и ниже, тем самым увеличивая уровень сложности, попутно уничтожая полчища монстров с отличными друг от друга характеристиками и слабостями, собирая разнообразную экипировку, материалы и зелья. У главного героя есть 6 основных характеристик и 18 дополнительных которые будут расти в зависимости от вашего уровня и снаряжения одетого на героя. Ах да, чуть не забыл, в игре имеется разнообразнейшие волшебные палочки, растения, метательное оружие и сыры. Нет, серьезно, просто море сыра, а так-же есть разные квесты которые дает статуя богини, наковальна бога Кронга позволяющая улучшать или ухудшать снаряжение в зависимости от желания самого бога и много, очень много другого.

Хардкорна ли эта игра ? Да, конечно-же, начнем с того что в игре есть функция Permadeath, удаляющая вашего персонажа после его смерти, я уже не говорю о том, что игра иногда делает вам сюрпризы ввиде толпы ядовитых или огненных гадов, окружающих вас со всех сторон.

Но есть и минусы, такие как например бессменный костюм главного героя, редкие магазины, а так же неимение мультиплеера, все это на самом деле не значительно по сравнению с количеством плюсов.

У этой игры есть 3 DLC, каждое из которых дополняет игру довольно сильно, а так-же доступен workshop, позволяющий изменять игру под вас и ваши желания.

Я часто спрашиваю себя, почему эта игра так популярна ? Из-за схожести с великолепным Dungeons and Dragons ? Из-за отличного, подбадривающего саундтрека ? Или может быть из-за толики юмора, столь саркастичного по отношению к самой игре ? Мне никогда этого не понять, но я все-равно запускаю игру, ставлю галочку перед надписью Permadeath и создаю персонажа. Снова и снова.

review:
I regret that I did not get this game quite some time ago. It's an addictive fun roguelike that's the fantasy counterpark to The Pit. It's got a wider variety of options though and the RPG elements add a very distinctive feel to the game. The sound track is very good. The game is easy to get the basics of and learning what each options in character selection can do has been a blast. 

A good pickup for anyone's library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006646114', 'num_games_owned': 1230, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 6471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6462, 'last_played': 1628371887}
review:
I can't remember when I bought this, but I got the Diggle Nog cheevo for the 2011 Winter Sale event, so that could say something.  It took about three years of hiatus and 107 hours to finally kill Dredmor...[i]once[/i].  On Easy (and Permadeath)...

Dredmor is a roguelike, and I think it's a pretty good introduction to the genre since I've not really played many of them.  You start out by picking from three difficulties, if you want your character to be permanently deleted when he/she dies or not, and if you bought the Realm of the Diggle Gods expansion, if you want to have 10 or 15 floors.  From there, you're given a page full of skills and you're to pick seven to make your character build, as opposed to having set classes like Warrior or Battlemage or whatnot--or you can just pick Random and see how that does.  And then you're given your choice of cosmetic gender, you name your character, and you're sent on your merry way.

Everything is laid out on a grid and every time you move or attack uses up a turn, where everything else is allowed to move or attack.  You can quite literally stand with enemies surrounding you and nothing will happen until you do something.  You level up with enough EXP by killing enemies, destroying Dredmor statues, or unlocking doors/chests with lockpicks.  When you level up, you recover all HP/MP, and you're given your choice of your seven skills to raise which will influence how your stats increase.  Skills work on a linear tree system, but you're allowed to raise your skills in any order, between raising them all up evenly or maxing one as soon as possible.  Every skill in every tree does [i]something[/i], be it simply raising your stats by a set amount or giving you interesting new spells or moves or powers.

Combat is pretty much "hit it until it dies" if you're going melee, but every character can use crossbows provided they have ammo and wands as long as they have charges, no matter what build you went with.  Some enemies use long-ranged spells too, so it's a matter of using what you have to counter their threat.  Monsters typically don't show up en masse during the game except in Monster Zoos, big rooms where mooks and minibosses pretty much Zerg Rush you.  You don't necessarily [i]have[/i] to clear them out, but you get a free item for wiping everything out, and it's a lot of EXP, too.  You also get free items for doing sidequests gained by praying at the Inconsequentia statues scattered through the dungeons.  They're pretty basic quests--kill this enemy/group, retrieve an item, use this item on a special statue, etc.  

I think Dredmor is a pretty fair game in terms of difficulty.  If you die, it's almost always your fault.  Died to a trap?  You carelessly marched forward without enough Trap Sight Radius.  Fight an enemy to where the point both of you are near-death and you miss, dying to its attack?  You didn't heal yourself, retreat, try to lead it into traps, etc.  Of course, this game is randomly-generated so you can quite easily end up with a bad draw on items and stuff, but one draw of roguelikes isn't the game giving you the tools needed to win, but winning with the tools you're given.  No one game is unwinnable if you keep your wits about you and don't get complacent.  

The expansions...well, expand.  RotDG adds monsters, skills, items, five more floors; YHTNTEP adds more monsters, items, skills; CotW adds even more monsters and skills and items, but also adds new floors apart from the main dungeon on top of a customizable safe zone (though the base game has a basic version of this place).  There are also quite a few mods on Steam and not on Steam that add more of the above and with things like additional room layouts and so on, but some may require some or all of the expansions, so watch for that.  

So yeah, TL;DR I would really recommend this game.  If you're new to roguelikes, this is a pretty good place to start.  Easy mode is pretty easy, hard is pretty damned hard, but that all depends on how the RNG treats you and how you build your characters.  There are a lot of achievements here...though a lot of them require you to die to various critters.  But you know what they say:  Dying is fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014324398', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 8469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3038, 'last_played': 1525709799}
review: I remember looking at Dungeons of Dredmor and rolling my eyes - mostly because the visuals. Don't let the cartoon-y style fool you though; Dungeons of Dredmor is a tough sunvabitch. If you want a rouge-like dungeon crawler, you've come to the right place. Offsetting the grim nature of your quest, Dungeons of Dredmor provides a unique sense of humor. Recommended 100%

author: {'steamid': '76561198004524283', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1829, 'last_played': 1612010578}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yG_Sbada8BQ

Dungeons of Dredmor: An old schoolish, dungeon crawling, loot grabbing, Diggle killing, grid based, rogue-like indie game from Gaslamp Games. 

Dungeons of Dredmor is a really simple and challenging game, when starting a new game you are first asked to choose between difficulties, permanent death or not and smaller dungeons with the same number of enemies and, if you have the DLC an additional 15 levels to go through. You will not be hurting for things to see and do in Dungeons of Dredmor also, if anyone has gotten 100% on it you are truly one of a kind. Next you are greeted with picking skills, you can choose up to 7 skills from a list of 50 different skills, all offering unique abilities and play styles, and once you've chosen between such skills as Emomancy, Killer Vegan and Bankster you choose male or female and enter the dungeons! 

The story behind this game is that the evil lich Dredmor was imprisoned beneath the world for being a meanie but, has slowly eroded away his bonds and you are asked to enter into his prison (or dungeon) and stop him!...again! Its dirt simple but, hey it works well and the dungeons are no joke. 

The game is grid based and combat is turned based, you can click or use the keyboard to move, upon entering combat you trade shots with your foe, (or take turns), the challenge of Dredmor is in how you build your character and, a little bit of luck with finding powerful items and shrines but, mostly in how you build your character. Although there are many skills to pick from some are better suited for dungeoneering than others, some only work better with other skills and there are some that are must haves, make no mistake there are ideal builds for this game. 

Items come in to play a little bit, especially food and healing items but, the crafting system in Dredmor is deep, there is a lot to craft and I haven't personally seen it but, what I have seen is almost every item in the game being craft-able. There are also skills associated with crafting, so you can build your character around any of the crafts if you so choose (such as being a clockwork, steam-punk knight) and, crafting things is as simple as having the crafting kit and using it with the correct items and there are a TON of items to craft. 

The graphics are also nice with this mix of hand painted/ comic look style, the game also runs as smooth as butter and, looks so simple you should be able to run it on just about anything so it's a great game for laptops. My only complaint about the graphics is more of a personal desire, the game shows you all these really neat hand-drawn items that look totally badass however, it never shows on your character; your character always will have the same frilly Guybrush Threepwood outfit regardless of the badass armor and traffic cone you have equipped, that kind of detail would have been greatly appreciated. 

Music in the game is excellent, with lots of organ, piano and strings, giving a sort of melancholy tune alongside some quirky upbeat tunes. The tracks tend to repeat if you linger on a floor too long so that may be a downside depending on how much you like it and, the music is what you'll listen to the majority of the games (in fact it often overpowers the other sounds of the game) so it’s a good thing it’s an awesome soundtrack.

Dungeons of Dredmor is funny and challenging, a great game to play anywhere and caters to a lot of playstyles, it’s a solid experience and gives you a huge amount of content to enjoy for a cheap price of $4.99 USD. For $6.99 USD you can get the complete set which I honestly suggest because it’s a great deal for the amount of added content you get even if you don’t end up seeing all of it. If you want a challenge, or a never ending rogue-like game, enter the Dungeons of Dredmor!

TL/DR; Dungeons of Dredmor is a rogue-like dungeon crawler with a HUGE amount of content for $4.99 USD, it’s got humor, charm and challenge, with plenty to do and replay ability to the Nth degree. It’s really cheap for what you get, Gaslamp Games certainly is giving you bang for your buck, honestly, if you don’t own the game, consider getting the full package for $6.99 USD, it’s just a few extra bucks and well worth it, plus the DLC by itself is $5.98 USD on its own so don’t waste your money unnecessarily! Check it out and support these guys so we can get more greatness in the future! 

-Double Thumbs up from Royial

Video Reviews: youtube.com/RoyialNetwork

review:
很容易沉迷，系统很丰富，除了RPG养成和探索，还有制造，搜集要素。
难度不算高，技能玩法比较丰富，但是好像在战斗上前期的权重不算很高。
由于采用这种2D视角，玩家上面的敌人会被被玩家身体挡住，有些角落看不出来有没有路。寻路比较诡异，而且永远保持玩家在中心，鼠标也会跟着动……

author: {'steamid': '76561197988649454', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 2892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2589, 'last_played': 1659447056}
review: A nice roguelike with fun attributes and skills. Animations make this one play a little slow from time to time (especially with a lot of diggles on the screen one turn can take ages when they start burrowing and unburrowing). Don't underestimate crafting and beware of boss monsters that share their appearances with normal creeps and you should do fine. Lord Dredmor himself is a tough ass bastard though. Recommend playing on rogue and small floors if you value your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018512090', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 33362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20308, 'last_played': 1702540623}
review:
This is the quintiessential modern rogue game.  You have all the essentials:  procedural levels, turn-based combat, deep customization, perma-death, punishing but fair gameplay.  What really sets this apart for me from a lot of faithful rogue games is that unlike most rogue games that have tiny tiny sprites or ASCII graphics, Dredmor has big, beautiful sprites.  I cut my rogue teeth on Azure Dreams so I just got used to the idea of having a normal sized character on screen.  When I started getting into rogue games on PC, I was really disappointed to find so many had teeny tiny little sprites for graphics.  It made me feel more like I was looking down on an overhead map, it made it hard for me to get immersed in the game.  Dredmor solves that problem, has a normal sized character and enemies but in my opinion sacrifices nothing.  The UI is a little weird but not bad and you get used to it quickly.  My one complaint is that after dozens of runs, you do start to get tired of seeing the same enemies, but the expansions are cheap and great and I highly recommend buying all of them right off the bat.  It also adds more classes to the game, making the character customization possiblities go from large to astronomical.  Permadeath is optional but as far as I'm concerned, the only way to play.  The risk of death keeps you always on your toes.  

TL;DL:  If you like Rogue, Azure Dreams, any Mystery Dungeon game, buy this, you will love it.

Suck an egg.
Have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048368692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1962, 'last_played': 1584713210}
review: Ridiculosy fun Dungeon Crawler with insane replayability and witty writing. Strongly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042616288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1704985022}
review: Don't want a clever plot and a dozen mind bending tasks to complete right now?  Then buy Dungeons of Dredmor.  Its light dungeon crawling at it's awesome best.  It's engaging, it's funny and it's utterly compelling.  Also, if you have an old computer it has a very low requirement.  SCORE!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035937021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1516515799}
review:
This game has the best and most creative class creation system I've ever seen.

You mix and match your skills, all skills being available to any character, and, because no classes, no class restrictions.

You can run, for instance, a heavy-armor mace-spec necromancer vampire mage.  Or a berserker who deals elemental damage and huge crits and can craft his own gear.  Or a stealthy archaeologist banker.

For that alone, and the new-piece-of-gum delight of running into the dungeons again with a new skill group, this game is worth the $5 it costs to pick it up.

2600+ Steam players couldn't be wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992760170', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1205, 'last_played': 1424338185}
review:
I think the Music is fantastic, but I generally just find myself bored playing this for a bit. I've tried over and over to get into it but I always start to nod off. I also like the humor in the item descriptions and elsewhere but, it doesn't keep me from wanting to just go play something else.

The Dungeon/Item/GUI Art I think is great pixel stuff, but the Characters/NPC's look like they have a HEAVY Super 2xSai/HQx3/Whatever filter like what you'd find in an emulator and I think it looks terrible.

Not enough enemy variation imo. Also, the filtered look I mentioned makes them look so washed out.

Would help if gear showed up on your character as well.

Seems too easy on max difficulty. I get bored before going to far but I rarely die. I generally just stop playing and start fresh on the next run. It -might- get harder, I don't know.

I can't hate, it seems like a legit game, I'm just not feeling it. I'd personally rather play DCSS or Nethack. If I really wanted to play a more modernized RL I think "Dungeonmans" is better than this, and a bit closer to the classics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003950141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 9518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9407, 'last_played': 1601003509}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995001401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1459056528}
review:
로그라이크 던전게임의 왕도라고 볼 수 있다..

의외로 크래프팅 시스템이 딥다크해서 그쪽 게열 퍽을 찍고 시작하려면 약간 숙달되어야할거같고

간편하게 그냥 무기 및 근접박치기 위주 퍽으로 스타트하고 그냥 우적우적 몹들을 청소해나갈 수 있다

군데군데 보이는 유머 센스도 마음에 들고..

그냥 뭐 평범하게 좋은 게임이다

'평범하게' 란 의미가 좀 애매하긴한데 쉽게말해 평범한 로그라이크 게임이지만 
그 재미는 평범한 수준은 아니다 매우 좋은 게임이다

특이한 로그라이크 형식이 게임을 통째로 말아먹는 경우도 많지 않은가..

author: {'steamid': '76561197970396550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 972, 'last_played': 1450889347}

author: {'steamid': '76561198139720322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 4682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1689852192}
review:
This game is pretty cool. Over the past day or so I've had this game, I haven't put it down for very long.
I've been playing a couple roguelikes for a while, but none of them have quite the sense of humour that this one does -- for instance, the "Plumber's Agaric", plainly inspired by Mario, and any number of other clever references. I enjoyed the art, which is a bit reminiscent of Tony Mosley of Zogonia fame (readers of the late, lamented Dragon and/or Dungeon Magazines may remember this gem), and the skill trees are a good way of improving and customizing one's character.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986021621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 10752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2950, 'last_played': 1675451389}
review:
A fun dungeon crawler. Combat can be a little slow, and the graphics could use some improvement, but the well-implemented RNG elements, item drops, and crafting mechanics make up for this. Difficulty settings range from easy to imbalanced with the option of making playing in roguelike mode, which is a nice touch if you're looking for a challenge.

9/10 Recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198043100942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2948, 'last_played': 1424962789}
review:
Start the game up, throw on some music or a podcast, and subconsciously steer your way through this funny, quirky game..... Until you stumble upon a monster zoo.  Then you should really pay attention.

This game has a surprising amount of depth for something so lighthearted.  Completely worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974630913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1453064338}
review: More fun than I would have thought for such a low price tag! A really good rogue-like with tons of skill variety/combinations that give it even more replayability than just randomized levels/loot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972122047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1710, 'last_played': 1519800176}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001478731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1363, 'last_played': 1431881023}
review: When you die, it is nearly always your fault. A quality rogue-like with goofy humor. It also includes an option to turn off permadeath when you become tired of failing and just want a relaxed experience. My only real problem with the game is that the inventory and crafting can be a pain to organize. But then, I'm a packrat so it may be my fault.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022034430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2401, 'last_played': 1636418993}
review: there aren't any lutes or fisk in the game but there's lots of loot and lutefisk so that's good

author: {'steamid': '76561198085149627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2347, 'last_played': 1388623636}
review:
[u]Pros:[/u]
+ The flavor text for the monsters, items, everything is whimsical and packed with witty refrences and quips.
+ The classes are tonnes of fun, as their names suggest.
+Lots and lots of items, crafting and customisation.
+ Monster Zoos are always appreciated- unless you're not prepared for them, of course.
+ It features a benevolent lutefisk god.

[u]Meh:[/u]
= The art style isn't everyone's cup of tea.
= It's a straight up dungeon crawl without much of a story/backstory.

[u]Cons:[/u]
- Without spoiling the ending, the skills you chose at character creation have a greater impact on whether you can defeat the game than they really ought to. Your first run you either get lucky by picking the right skills or you metagame to be sure you can counter the boss mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990062563', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1421258712}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010060335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1488485356}
review: Missing alot of strategy elements and decisions. Very simplified. If feels like the Munchkin version  of what was supposed to be a roguelike. There is a difference between random for the sake of random and an engine designed to be random but with plenty of modifiers and things that affect outcomes and many solutions for every problem. When you die rarely is it because of an element of the game that you didnt understand properly or something that could have been stopped or modified if you had taken the proper steps to prevent it. If you want a good true roguelike from the steam store buy Tales of Maj'eyal or Vulture for nethack(nethack is free so are most of the tile sets, but vulture has a GUI and mouse controls so its easier to play without having to remember the 40-60 commands for nethack). The Nethack engine is by far the most in depth classic roguelike engine on steam even though its over 20 years old. Or get Wazhack for a different style of rogue

author: {'steamid': '76561198020831196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5477, 'last_played': 1641262278}
review: This was the first rogue-like game I ever played, and at the time I didn't even know what rogue-like meant. I just saw this game as a dungeon crawler where the dungeon changes every time you play. Endless replayability, heck yeah! This game was easy to learn how to play, but my goodness is it hard to master. I've spent many an hour on this game and so far, I haven't beaten it once. came close once, but otherwise I'm lucky if I make it past the 5th floor. I keep coming back to it again and again, with the hopes of someday beating it at least once. Also, there's lot's of quirky and hilarious dialogue which makes the game even more fun to play. I'd recommend this to any fan of rogue-like games, especially for the very low price tag, and I also recommend it for those who are new to the genre or who like dungeon crawling/hack-and-slash games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041979655', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1339311600}
review: This game gets boring just at about 11.2 hours in

author: {'steamid': '76561198028048505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1489, 'last_played': 1537843119}
review:
A very user-friendly and moddable roguelike with a lot of character. The gameplay is much like other roguelikes, with huge replay value, but it's simplified and streamlined for those new to the genre (like myself). This is the first roguelike that I really enjoyed playing, thanks to its gameplay, humor, and general accessibility.

And finally, and I can't really believe I have to mention this, but this game can be played offline. This is a huge boon to people who don't always have an Internet connection. I am almost always connected to the Internet, but many games right now simpy cannot be played if you aren't online.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975079031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1565, 'last_played': 1418596948}
review:
This game is very monotonous and not very challenging for the majority of the game. You shouldn't be able to reach the endgame of any roguelike on your fourth try, which is what I did on normal difficulty. I didn't even come close to dying until the final floor. Several hours of easy grinding and then a hard final floor.

Its a shame because the character/attribute system is one of the most thought out/fleshed out of any roguelike.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990627522', 'num_games_owned': 11339, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1390143616}
review:
This is typical old-school roguelike. That means you will enter the dungeon many times with different characters and this time they will have really crazy sets of skills. It's worth to try how is to play as vegan, tourist or geologist. This is definitely something that other games don't allow.
If you still not convinced, maybe powerful crafting system will convince you. You will create hundreds of different items, starting on potions, ending on Chainaxe or the Historically Inaccurate Viking Helm.

VERDICT:
If you're a roguelike fan, this it's must have for you.
If you have never tried any roguelikes, this is a good game to convince you to that genre.
If you like only modern shooters, you will never have opportunity to wear the Communist Power Ushanka.

Like this review? Consider to join [url=steamcommunity.com/groups/GoodGamesGR#]Good Games Giveaways & Reviews[/url] group and maybe press big sexy "Follow this curator" button on our [url=steamcommunity.com/groups/GoodGamesGR#curation]curation page[/url] to read more reviews and win free games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041429551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1341, 'last_played': 1423427427}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor è uno dei più famosi "rogue-like" in circolazione su steam. E devo dire che merita il suo successo. In pratica, per chi non sa cosa sia un gioco "rogue-like", si tratta di esplorare dungeon su dungeon, affrontando mostri su mostri e raccogliendo centinaia di oggetti. la visuale, dall'alto, gode di una grafica grande e dettagliata e lo stile è colorato e scanzonato. Potremo scegliere a inizio gioco un avventuriero o un'avventuriera dalle ENORMI sopraciglia (e dico ENORMI!!!) e scegliere le abilità che useremo durante tutto il gioco. In questo modo potremo avere un classico guerriero, un ladro, un mago o qualcosa di originale mischiando le carie abilità. La componente gdr è piuttosto sviluppata, con molte statistiche da tenere a bada e le skill sono varie e piacevoli. I dungeon sono molto vasti, con teletrasporti e centinaia di accessi ai piani superiori o inferiori. I nemici sono moltissimi (a volte entrerete in camere chiamate "monsters zoo"!) e tutti ben disegnati, spesso molto spiritosi e il loot vario e abbondante. Avrete anche accesso ad una vostra camera personale (in qualunque momento, essendo interdimensionale) dove lasciare gli oggetti in più, visto che l'inventario non è proprio capiente... Il gioco non è in tempo reale, ma a turni che lo imitano. Ogni vostro passo, attacco o semplice attesa (premendo la barra spaziatrice) fa avanzare il tempo, facendo muovere i nemici sullo schermo o facendoli attaccare. Ci sono poi statue da distruggere e altre che danno side-quest (molto semplici a dire il vero), divinità da nutrire con strani prodotti finlandesi e incudini per migliorare l'equipaggiamento. C'è anche un sistema di crafting (che però ho usato pochissimo, in giro si trovano oggetti molto migliori, almeno per i guerrieri puri). Come dicevo il gioco ha molto humor, centinaia di citazioni e idee divertenti... però è tutto in inglese, non difficile da tradurre per carità, ma magari questo potrebbe fermare qualcuno di voi. Non so se in giro per internet esiste una traduzione. Ultimo appunto, esiste un esteso workshop, pieno soprattutto di nuove skill. Elementi negativi non ne ho trovati, però è ovvio che il gioco è abbastanza ripetitivo come meccanica, essendo un esplora-ammazza-raccogli. Se però questi giochi vi piacciono, gdr con tanta "azione", allora Dungeons of Dredmor fa per voi!!!! Ah, la morte definitiva è opzionale, un'ottima cosa per chi, come me, detesta questo aspetto dei giochi simil Rogue!.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008048819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 15104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7787, 'last_played': 1695473550}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 8221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8221, 'last_played': 1489704858}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a turn based rogue-like game.



[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

Good main menu music.
There are some different resolution sizes available.
You can play the game fullscreen or windowed mode.
There is colorblind mode.
There is a music volume slidebar available.
There is a sound volume slidebar available.
You can use mods.
There are alot of tutorials available.
There is perma-death available. You can Toggle this.
You are able to toggle small floors instead on playing on a big floor.
There is a difficulty settings available.
You are able to do a random role on the perk selection.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

The game is pretty easy to understand. You get thrown into a dungeon in order to defeat the evil final boss. But before you are able to reach him, You will have to face plenty ammounts of floor with alot of different monsters. Monsters will get stronger on each floor and will be different too. You will encounter random events, quests, challenges, vending machines and alot of other things. Monsters are always able to spawn, even from behind in the fog. You are able to level up, getting new items and you are able to safe the game at all time.


Could crash at times.
Gameplay could be repetitive and is not having alot of variety.
Music is pretty bad.
Graphics is okay.
It has a perk and level system.
Each floor and run is randomized.
It has events, quests and mini-bosses.
You are able to change the controls on the keyboard.
It has some jokes.
You can mix a variety of different skills together at your own choice

[h1]Other things.[/h1]


ONLY THE MUSIC AT THE MAIN MENU IS GOOD.

-------------------

I Give this game a 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198039337300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1477584942}
review:
Warning, if you've never played this game, minor spoilers ahead. (Like, really minor, but spoilers nonetheless.)

This game is a unique combination of simple, easy, difficult, relaxing, laid-back, humorous, and just general old-fashioned fun. Holy crap it's fun. Basically you crawl your way through levels of the dungeon to get to the main bad-guy, accumulating a number of unique and silly items, skills, and badassery. Levelling up always feels good, and gaining a skill almost always has a noticeable affect on your combat.

Fair warning, you will die a lot. And if you're like me and love pain, you'll play on perma-death (which is optional). On about my fifth character, I was really getting into the swing of things. I had tons of items. I had a pocket dimension I could go to to dump unwanted detritus that might be useful in the future, and I'd just made it through the second floor (still haven't seen the third; the floors are fairly big and ooze with content and monsters). I was fairly powerful at this point, at least for the floor I was on, and easily laid waste to waves of monsters with the help of my zombies and clouds of poison that I conjured. So, feeling like a badass, I hopped over to my pocket dimension to drop off some loot, when I noticed that from said dimension I could also leap to other dimensions! "Okay, cool," so I did. Plowed through one small dimension, no sweat. So I go to another, run into two monsters, kill myself with my own poison cloud. It was my fault for not paying attention, but alllll the hard work, the several hours I'd put into his skills, levels, items. Gone!

At that point I said to myself, "Okay, this is probably the point where going back to the first dungeon just becomes a tedious grind, and I won't want to play anymore." Well tonight I felt like trying again, trying some new skills. Frankly, it's no less fun than when I played for the first time. The floors are all randomly generated, so it's never the same run between characters.

My current character has kicks that literally explode into fire, tearing through enemies like nothing, and I'm only on the first floor.

It's not just the content, it's the little quirks. You can tell the developers had a blast making this game. Everything shines with creativity and humour, and it's just a lovely little game gah I love it.

10/10, recommended a thousand times yes. It's cheap, you should buy it with the expansions. Get ready to lose at least a few hours a day.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977133422', 'num_games_owned': 2188, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1696117841}
review:
Melhor Rogue-Like de todos ! 
Como todo roguelike, esse jogo recria a dungeon a cada jogada. A personalização do personagem através de skills e itens é infinita. Tem muita skill e item mesmo ! 
A escolha de dificuldade no começo do jogo é um ponto forte. Além dos básicos easy/normal/hard, dá pra ser tanto hardcore como a maioria dos roguelike onde vc morreu já era, e dá pra escolher ter a opção de dar reload no ultimo save pra assim conseguir chegar no "chefão" final.
Altamente recomendado. Jogão !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995528737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1423, 'last_played': 1453051529}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047134587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 4819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4657, 'last_played': 1439679119}
review: I hope you like creating new characters in RPG games as that is what I spend a lot time in DoD. Death is waiting for your adventurer behind every door and it is fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005894566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1552571363}
review:
I love it. If you need a roguelike rpg fix, this is it straight up. If you prefer your roguelike a bit on the "lite" side you can turn off save deletion after death (thus no permadeath). There's so many elements that you get to chose when it comes to creating your character. Want a sword weilding mage that can smith and knows some alchemy and goes berserk often? Sure! Want a martial arts healing necromancer that can lob some fire around? Done.

  I give this game a perfect score but also would reccomend some minor tweaks, they don't detract from the game in my opinion but would be nice. First off I would like more character graphics options. Hairstyles, colors, outfits etc. And perhaps a music filter so we can make sure our favorite of the game's clever soundtracks play. Best 6$ I've spent on here otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972303784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 3693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2814, 'last_played': 1428112781}
review:
Character building is one of the biggest draws to a game like Skyrim and you'll find it here.
One caveat is that the last boss exists and will be difficult for a poorly synergized build.
There's hardecore mode for people who like that sort of crap too, but it's completely optional.  You can copy saves out of the save folder and manually manage a group of saves if you want to further strip the rogue-like elements out and just play for fun.
A fun game overall.  Goofin around with builds is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982731681', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1521859468}
review:
While being a very compelling roguelike, Dungeons of Dredmor still offers a good dose of humor.  The art style is well done and there is a WEALTHY amount of playability coming out of the DLC packs and the workshop.  The game can be hard to grasp at times, but it is definitely worth a few solid playthroughs.

Buy it if it is $10 or less

author: {'steamid': '76561198002007500', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5301, 'last_played': 1668321793}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028253012', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 16791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14025, 'last_played': 1641837402}
review:
This is my favorite dungeon crawling game. It has a humorous fantasy theme that I find endearing. The best part is that going deeper into the game lets you see more items and skills and each one has a joke attached. There are 50+ skill trees and you can pick 7 when you start your character.

If you're easily frustrated, this is not a game for you. You will be dying constantly and that's how the game teaches you.  That's really not a problem though because the entire dungeon is randomly generated, so you'll get a different experience each time.

There is so much game here for the price that I think you're actually kind of stupid if you don't pick this up. If it looks good to you, don't hesitate. I spent over 300 hours playing and it was worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961763044', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 6837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4348, 'last_played': 1468186502}
review: i fucking lost

author: {'steamid': '76561198007585893', 'num_games_owned': 1941, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 10208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10208, 'last_played': 1388996029}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor holds a central place in the vanguard of modern roguelikes.  It does an excellent job of showing how an essentially traditional roguelike can be presented for a more modern eye, making the classic dungeon hacking fun newly accessible to a wider audience.

It's far from a perfect game, however.  The enemies are mostly all the same, inventory is annoying to manage, and different damage types are little more than labels for different categories of damage.  This isn't the game you play when you want to explore the height of roguelike design, though; it's for quick, accessible fun and an entry (or re-entry) into the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030419257', 'num_games_owned': 1093, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 9615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7474, 'last_played': 1668538559}
review:
Отменный рогалик с любопытным стилем, тонной отсылок, занимательным геймплеем и приятной музыкой.

В свое время запустив игру ради получения достижения на зимней распродаже в Стиме, я влюбился в эту игру.

Если вы когда-либо хотели найти рогалик попроще, встречающий игрока различными уровнями сложности и хардкорности, интерфейс которого не вызывает никаких дополнительных вопросов, без потери интересных механик, логичности и логично разгоняющийся по мере продвижения по подземелью и знакомства с игрой - Dungeon of Dredmor игра для вас. К слову, игра легко модифицируется и имеет встроенный Steam Workshop, так что мододелы выпустили множество интересных исправлений и дополнений.

Управляя вашим персонажем, вам предстоит опуститься на самый нижний этаж подземелья и убить его злобного владельца-некроманта - Дредмора. На вашем пути встанут тысячи монстров, ловушек, неудачных стечений обстоятельств и ваши собственные ошибки. Сможете ли вы выполнить ваше поручение или оставите очередной хладный труп на одном из уровней подземелья? Все в ваших руках!

А если вас смущает потеря персонажей при смерти, то вы можете отключить перманентную смерть персонажей и играть с сейв-лоадом, что заметно упростит, но и укоротит игру. Однако данная игра не уступает ни в одном из аспектов своего геймплея и стиля, а лично я называю эту игру одной из лучших рогаликов и инди игр за всю мою геймерскую карьеру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030798798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 4532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2663, 'last_played': 1579397218}
