author: {'steamid': '76561198025700866', 'num_games_owned': 952, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1422060179}
review:
I started my first dungeon as a communistic, vegan Emo-Pirate who was heavily into Mathemagic, tipping my fedora to the ladies, punching my way barehanded through the dungeon. In the second room I stumbled upon a device which let me enter a pocket dimension, where I punched a machine to open up the gates to hell. Naturally I entered and tipped my fedora again. I was then embraced and slaughtered by giant demons and died. 

10/10 would tip my fedora again to die.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123412640', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1110, 'last_played': 1420291157}
review:
Dungeons of Dreamor is a dungeon crawling RPG with an interesting take on the turn based approach. By that, I mean that your actions count as turns. You don't go into a battle mode, the entire game works on turns. If you take a step, pick up an item, use an item, use a spell, use an attack, defend... all of these things count as a turn. So whenever you do something, every enemy gets to as well. This is also used in coodowns on abilities and regeneration of health and magic. Insead of waiting on a timer, you do actions to keep the game moving. It's great for pacing. Before you even start playing, you have some options you can set, and then you get to pick from a number of different abilities. So you're not restricted to a class, as in some other games like this. Instead, you just pick whatever abilities you want, which is fun for customization and replayability. As you level up, you can chose to level up those abilities as you see fit, but only one per level. The gameplay, aside from the turn system, is pretty standard. You walk around a huge dungeon, fighting enemies and looting the place. You can also craft a great number of things along the way, provided you have the materials, the tool used to craft it, and enough points in the required skill to make the item. This is where I start to have some issues.

See, you can pick your own skills. You can also level your own skills as you please. But sometimes you'll pick skills that don't cover the areas you need in order to make certain items. If you don't have that to level up, you simply cannot make those types of items. That can be annoying. It can also be annoying to have all the materials, the skills, and not the tool required to make the item. Although that can be remedied by finding one somewhere in the dungeon. My biggest complaint is that the inventory you have is a tad small. It makes you have to manage your items well, constantly craft items to use up materials (but that's not always so easy to do), or constantly backtrack to the shops to sell things. I guess you could leave stuff laying around but then it'd go to waste. Having a few more slots would help a lot. I guess it comes with the territory of looting. And with the skill complain, I suppose you just have to plan ahead and know what you can and can't do, which in turn will help you identify which items you do and do not need. Some of the skills in the begining don't explain what they do, choosing to have a joke description instead. This can be annoying to deal with and try to remember what they actually do later. Some of the drinkable and edible items you get aren't specific about what they do either. You might drink something or eat something that puts a debuff on you, hurts you, or even kills you! And the game is littered with traps. Some you can see, some you can't. Sometimes you can go around them, sometimes you need to walk over them to get to another spot. Sometimes you can disable them, sometimes that'll fail and they'll go off anyways. Imagine hitting a random trap that you couldn't even see, only to have THAT be the end of all your hard work. With permadeath on (as the default), it's quite maddening. 

Still, this game is massive and... very difficult. I've sunk almost 20 hours into it as of right now and and never made it past the second floor. Am I bad? Maybe. But it's pretty easy to die from random stuff. I may have misread this but I think there's something like ten floors normally and fifteen with the expansions. So there's tons of stuff to do in this game. There's even tons of things I haven't even figured out yet! It's an amazing amount of content and playtime for what only costs you 5 bucks. Heck, toss in the extra buck for the DLC and get even more out of it like I did. It's very well worth the price tag and I'm really surprised it isn't going for more than that. It could definitely be a 10 or even 15 dollar game. 

Dungeons of Dreadmor gets an 8/10 for being an immense dungeon crawler with an interesting take at a great price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993562656', 'num_games_owned': 837, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 32733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15375, 'last_played': 1677567566}
review:
Unique and challenging at times, it's a joy to play. The humour and various references are great. There are numerous skills that you can mix and match to become whoever you. An axe weilding communist vampire? An archealogist dual sheild weilding vegan? The choices are endless and the mods from the Workshop can add countless more.

I've only beaten the game twice but its still fun to try new combinations and see what works and what doesn't.  I usually come back to this game every few months spend hours playing it.  Its a unique game( at least for me, i had never played  a roguelike before) and i just enjoy the humour. For the price, you can't really go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006535739', 'num_games_owned': 834, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1640615832}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is a pretty fun look at the old roguelike genre, and was a great romp down memory lane. While the graphics are simple, as is the gameplay, a simple interface masks a surprisingly deep customization and talent system. The synergy between different skills will have you experimenting with builds for DAYS. The addition and seamless integration of Steam Workshop was nothing short of brilliant, and when you feel like you've seen everything in Dungeons of Dredmor, provides HOURS of extra enjoyment.

Good: Solid gameplay, fun visual aesthetic, good music. Deep and complex customization presented in a brilliantly accesible way.

Bad: Some skills are just too good. Whenever there's a skill that me and ALL my friends separately came to the conclusion that it MUST be in your build, things need a little tinkering. 

Ugly: Not much.

Possibly the worst thing I can say about DoD is that the era of the traditional rogue formula is definitely showing its age. The procedure of "I move, then all enemies move, then I move" is showing its age as a design process. Dungeons of Dredmor could be that last, best look at a wonderful genre, and I enjoyed the hell out of it, but I think it will be the last true rogue I play. It's time to see what the words "rogue like" can do attached to other formats of gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010421653', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1440461772}
review: что 1 уровень, что 5 одинаковы, игра однообразна до жути.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985549739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1470796947}
review:
Rating: 8/10

Dungeons of Dredmor is a mix between the ASCII game Nethack and the card game Muchkin. It's a really fun rogue-like and offers hours of entertainment. If you like roguelikes, then the $5 price is a steal. There really isn't a class sytem - you can choose whichever skills you want to start off with. This means that you can have entirely different combat experiences depending on which skills you choose.

For it's cheap cost, hours of fun, and being true to roguelikes, I rate this game a solid 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107473372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1683350506}
review: Like FTL meets Terraria. A fun casual blast, even for someone who ordinarily hates roguelikes. I think this is the closest thing to D&D that I've played, definately worth 5.00, and if its on sale you can't afford not to get it. The game's turn based: you walk one step then an enemy walks one step. You hit the enemy hits. The items are numerous and intersting. I have nothing but good things to say. Will update if anything changes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982493025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 1861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1766, 'last_played': 1479951147}
review:
I keep coming back again and again over time. One of the greatest turn-based rogue-likes out there, if not the greatest. 

Wonderful crafting system. 
Whimsical art and locations.
Funny, but engaging and challenging.
Just the right amount of every variable that makes this genre great. 

Edit: I forgot to mention the BRILLIANTLY well done steam workshop support, and the DLCs are a great value as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025625270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1546880160}
review:
I played this game a lot on my old 2008 year old low budget laptop on Linux. I like it when you don't need a beefy computer in order to play some good game.

At first I was confused by the interface: lots of different items, not very convenient crafting interface, lots of numbers and secondary stats on character screen scared me. But with little time and patience I figured all that out. So I definitely recommend this game. It has good sense of humor and provides certain challenge. Just try not to get discouraged if you die a few times. :-)

The only minor drawback is that it gets repetitive after some time, especially if you chose big rooms and if you are playing with mods, which provide more levels. But I guess you can say that for any game. :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994429794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5174, 'last_played': 1569808477}
review:
Really fun replayable game.
It was really hard my first time, but not knowing what to do was part of the fun.
If it's too overwhelming then maybe check out an episode of some experienced player and how they start off the game.
My favorite skills are Astrology, Tinkering, Necronomiconomics, Demonology, Killer Vegan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046952965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1589, 'last_played': 1641558949}
review: The absolute best in rogue-like gaming.  Dungeons uses an excellent skill selection, character customization (not appearance), and many random elements to provide for a hundred different ways to play.  You can become a warrior with high damage and defense, a rogue with high counter-chance and dodging, or a mage with magical abilities.  Actually, if you wanted, you could become a combination of any of them, or even all three.  And the loot is plain awesome.  I normally pick up everything - be it an aged-steak or a magical robe - and take them to the wizard's pocket dimension to be sorted.  It's kind of a organized mess, with piles all along the walls and floor.  There are piles of mushrooms, gems, food, armor to be used in smithing/tinkering, tinkering parts, ingots for smithing, and stuff waiting to be sold.  And anything that isn't worth selling or keeping gets turned into lutifisk.  Yep, lutifisk.  You might be asking yourself "Why I would be turning random junk into lutifisk?", and if not, you might be asking youself "What the heck is a lutifisk?" but all well be explained in due time.  Furthermore, you lutifisk haters, it is not rotten fish but just fish that.....well it kind of is rotten fish but it tastes good with butter.  So there.  Anyways, I would highly recommend Dungeons of Dredmor to just about anyone who likes games with random elements.  And even to most people who don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014374374', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1419695457}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044039388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4246, 'last_played': 1654868856}
review:
Someone please take this game away from me so I can do something else with my time.........

The uniqueness of each skill (and, subsequently, each character) keeps me coming back day after day. The gameplay is simple and easy to grasp after you get over the initial shock (if you're not familiar with roguelikes). 

Because of this game, I have bought two more roguelikes. I don't know when I'll play them, though, since this game is so amazing that I don't really want to play much else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025091679', 'num_games_owned': 2324, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 1866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1512, 'last_played': 1420761029}
review:
This is the best roguelike: it's amusing, satisfying and hard to beat. Replayability is amazing, and you can create vastly different characters, which completely changes the gameplay. There are also settings for the size of the dungeon, it's possible make a small instance for a quick run, e.g. to test a new build.

10/10 very good game.

Be sure to check out the Steam Workshop, there are pretty amazing new skills there, such as my personal favorite, LASERS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044564941', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1719, 'last_played': 1595988894}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is the Roguelike that comes closest to the original Rogue game from the early days of computer games. Looting in Dungeons of Dredmor is satisfying to the very last Zorkamid (the currency you accumulation on each runthrough), the RNG is fantastic! If you get a rough start, just start breaking Dredmor statues and smashing Diggle Beaks til your fists start bleeding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011339022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2599, 'last_played': 1400068058}
review:
Rogue-like dungeon crawler with great humour.  The character class system and crafting aspect makes the game very replayable.  This game does suck you in.    The game itself is simple in graphics and gameplay, but it's still a pretty solid game.  It'll take you a while to explore every character class combo, and each one gives you different strengths and angles to go through the game.

I loved this game.   it's worth a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056811737', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 2372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1655, 'last_played': 1502751550}
review:
A fantastic roguelike (yes, an actual turn-based roguelike), with a great sense of humor. In DoD, you'll fight everything from zombies to giant vegetables, while using equipment that references everything from Mario to Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy. There's a huge number of different weapons and armor to find, and plenty of different skills to choose between, from vampirism to burglary to becoming a vegan, and a crafting system to let you create and upgrade all kinds of new equipment. Also, you can kill the shopkeeper and take his stuff, so there's that.

8/10 Terrified of Monster Zoos

author: {'steamid': '76561198018810888', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1540523300}
review: A true dungeon crawling experience, with lovely music and a wonderful sense of humor it will have you hooked for hours on end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992263754', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 15392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14387, 'last_played': 1610044658}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is a simple but challenging rouglike that can be heavily altered for better or worse with mods. The game has a quirky sense of humor, but since it makes no claims of being anything more than a goofy nonsense rougelike it gets away with it. Some of the best times I had with this game was just rolling new skill sets and playing the first 3 floors to see what happened. If you plan to beat the game get ready for a long haul and a tough time once you get to later floors.
The game's couple DLCs add new floors or useful new features and loads more weird goofy skills.
I reccomend you get this game on a sale since it usually drops to about $3 with the DLCs included.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968334951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6898, 'last_played': 1487964013}
review: The large replayability combined with character custimization make this a great game for the price.  Plus you can play it on just about anything. Good difficulty scaling and goals.  If you love min/maxing DnD style this might be worth looking into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094376730', 'num_games_owned': 4865, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 13589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11665, 'last_played': 1550621487}
review: IMHO, this is one of the best - if not the best - roguelike game that you can find here on Steam. It has a lot of good points, but maybe the best of all is the wonderful character customization - the real gem of this game: at the beginning of the game you don't have to choose a class, with a set of fixed abilites or skill trees to develop your character, but 7 skill trees from a big pool of available skill trees. So many skill trees means that the customization are nearly infinite - every game is different, every character is different, every time you press "New Game" is a new experiment. IMHO the only negative thing is the last boss itself: if with a mix of careful actions, knowledge of the game and a little help from the blind goddess you can often survive long enough to reach the final boss, with nearly every playstyle, killing him is another story - he is really powerful, a lot more than the normal enemies, and with some builds is practically impossibile to beat (especially if you are a melee fighter). It's also a positive point - this is a roguelike game, so it's a good thing that it's not too easy - but often to beat him you must change drastically your playstyle, put away many of your abilities and use one of the possible specific strategies. But this is only a small negative thing, surrounded by a sea of positive qualities.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995427553', 'num_games_owned': 656, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1289, 'last_played': 1485203543}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055165385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8479, 'last_played': 1581657746}
review: Good Shit

author: {'steamid': '76561197996915263', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 38635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37354, 'last_played': 1582507538}
review:
I've logged over 600 hours on Dredmor. I may log 600 more. The level of character customization (especially with the expansions) is incredible. The game is tough, and nearly every death leaves me thinking "DAMN! That was MY fault. Okay, time to start again and THIS time I won't get careless and screw it up!" followed by my screwing it up again.

It's a game I've played in 10 minute intervals and in 8-hour sessions. And the game is genuinely funny (which is rare in my world). I've been playing video games since the Atari 5200, and Dungeons of Dredmor is Top 5 material for me. The game + expansions can be had for just over $10 - an absolute steal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014887704', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2064, 'last_played': 1564096279}
review: Great value for money

author: {'steamid': '76561198165540971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1477800642}
review:
Наткнулась на игру случайно, трафика было мало, а сыграть во что-то новенькое хотелось. Вот и подвернулись Подземелья под горячую руку.
Итак, мои первые впечатления. 
Игра забавная и весёлая, не надоедает. Кажется, что разработчики как минимум вдохновлялись Нетхаком, потому что и сюжет, и сам игровой процесс очень схож. Ну и куча шуточек-отсылочек. Поэтому данная игра заслуживает высокой оценки.
Но есть пара минусов и плюсоминусов: она не очень сложная (ну по крайней мере, на лёгком уровне сложности), музыка приятная, но со временем немного приедается, приходится отключать. Ну и у меня иногда подвисает, но возможно, что это проблемы моего пека. 
Конечно, это не Скурим или Морровинд и не NWN. Но лично я думаю, что покупать и играть в неё стоит, особенно, когда она продаётся со скидкой.
8 Нетхаков из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976231507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1430945190}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965953724', 'num_games_owned': 1245, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 6155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4216, 'last_played': 1669364598}
review:
This is one of my favorite roguelikes, along with SOTS: The Pit and ToME. It's procedurally generated greatness with an absolutely fantastic sense of humor.

What the hell are you waiting for? I have 69 hours in this game without ever having beaten it. Just buy it already. Play it. Love it. Get all the expansion packs.

Pros:
- excellent systems for crafting, damage/resistances, and character stats
- a myriad of skill trees, of which each character can choose 7 (can you say synergy?)
- completely irreverent pop culture references, quotes, and tropes, all with great dry wit
- simplistic control scheme for entry level players (but still as satisfying for veteran rogues, IMO) 
- huge selection of items, randomized weapons, potions, and unlockable crafting blueprints

Cons:
- can't see armor on your character
- very easy to get lulled into a false sense of security and then get merked
- diggles

10/10
Would die by stepping on plastic caltrops again

author: {'steamid': '76561198003188225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 9158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5504, 'last_played': 1641200655}
review:
So I sat down one day and thought to myself "I need to poop"
So I bought this game.
About 10 hours after I realised I still needed to poop.
Another 10 hours after I was constipated.
A week later I needed some laxitives.
In short, if you play this game you forget to poop. This is normaly my way of telling its a good game. So this must be a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027724317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 7895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3187, 'last_played': 1690851597}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023089072', 'num_games_owned': 859, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2632, 'last_played': 1527396513}
review:
Warning: This game is incredibly difficult.

So far I've spent 30 hours on this game and the furthest I've gotten is approximately 60% through the base game on easy difficulty (I play with permadeath - there is an option to play without permadeath). That being said, it's definitely one of my favorite games of all time. This game manages to blend originality and humorous references in just the right amount. It's a blast to fail every time I play. I'm not the best at writing elaborate reviews, so this is mostly just to contribute to the positive review percentage. 

tl;dr
At $5 this game is a steal. It's loads of fun, and even the most hardcore gamers will struggle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063455203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1560730088}
review:
Simple enough to get into and yet deep enough to keep your attention.  Easily one of the best values on Steam.  Great humor, active modding community, GIANT amount of content, I cannot say enough good things about this game.

Makes for an excellent starting point for those interested in exploring the roguelike genre.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198004851213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4369, 'last_played': 1473981948}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991901694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1462255844}
review:
Bardzo fajna gierka. 

 Na plus:
+bogate drzewko rozwoju bohatera(-ki)
+losowość rozmieszczenia komnat (rozgrywka nigdy nie wygląda tak samo)
+humor
+różnorodność przeszkadzajek
+stopniowany poziom trudności (im głębiej tym trudniej)
+zbalansowana rozgrywka (śmierć bohatera/-ki nie jest tak losowa jak np. w popularnym ostatnio   NEO scavengerze)
+bogaty crafting
+uzależnia ;)

Na minus:
--(duży minus)lakoniczne opisy w drzewku umiejętności (bez studiowania wiki dobrej postaci nie stworzysz)
-postacie walczące na odległość będą miały kłopoty z miejscem w ekwipunku
-uzależnia ;)
P.S.
Grę przeszedłem na najniższym poziomie trudności ze zmniejszoną liczbą poziomów, jednak grałem nie przez steam i dlatego mam tak mało na liczniku czasu rozgrywki. Tak naprawdę to pochłonęła mi kilkadziesiąt godzin. Naprawdę polecam! Pamiętajcie o przeglądaniu stron wiki podczas planowania swojego bohatera(-ki).

author: {'steamid': '76561198041910476', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 19974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7202, 'last_played': 1700586135}
review:
This game is a fantastic, and cheap, buy for anyone in the market for a good dungeon crawler. The author has obviously spent many meticulous hours creating and refining the many monsters, items, and skill trees available in this game, as well as keeping the overhanging satyrical theme that is so very present in every aspect in this game. I completely recommend this game for anyone - it appeals to players whether they are in for a hardcore dungeon crawl or simply playing to enjoy themselves and have a good laugh at the cleverly sarcastic item descriptions.

8.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093844768', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4625, 'last_played': 1678348499}
review: At the first glance I was honestly sceptical about this game but I needed only a while to get addicted. Probably the best rouge-like game, full of humor, fun, makes you wanna play more and more and more to upgrade your character to the maximum. Did I mention awesome classes skills? Well, here you go. Are you a fan of X-files? Vampires? Harry Potter? Well, here you go. And have even some more. Definitely awesome and worth its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097569582', 'num_games_owned': 2505, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 3578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3287, 'last_played': 1418019936}
review:
THE GOOD:

This game is incredible. It's similar to Pixel Dungeon, but deeper and more difficult (as there are many paths to ultimate victory). I've been playing it on easy and medium levels and the difficulty ramps up in jumps, but each time I experiment with builds I get closer to success.

I've still not completed the game, but, with 45 hours on record, I'm still up for the challenge, and always happy to thrash on monsters.

Finally, I must say: the support at Gaslight Games has been INCREDIBLE. I've yet to close the loop with them and report my experience, but they helped get me up and running with the game on Steam.

THE NOT-ALL-GOOD: 
Your character's art doesn't change to reflect your items. BUT, this chews through art budgets very quickly. So, frankly, it's really a non-issue. I'm pleased the development and art efforts went where they did.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964641301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2318, 'last_played': 1384905764}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is a turn-based/action RPG with some interesting features, such as:

- Subtle sense of humor
- Good soundtrack
- Freedom to choose and mount your own skill tree
- Lots of items to find along the way

In the beggining it surely won't take long for you to become addicted to it. Then after you've been to like 10 floors and Monster Zoos, you simply can't wait to finish it so you may try something different. After all, this is Steam and another sale is coming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064278553', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1832, 'last_played': 1416851743}
review:
>Скучно, неинтересно, однообразно и очень медленно (с большой и долгой "О"): это те эпитеты, которые приходят на ум после 30 часов игры. 
>Она непродуманна, багованна и вообще выглядит вырвиглазно. "Оптимизация? Не не слышали." Загрузка минута с лишним на компьютере прошлогодней сборки. 
Ачива, получаемая за вылет игры как бы говорит нам...
>Множество навыков, которые нам наобещали, на деле оборачивается 10-12 стоящими ветками, а это чуть меньше, чем четверть, и парой-тройкой работоспособных связок.
Вегант, например, очень полезное умение, которое сразу же исключает возможность пройти большинство портальных данжей и зоопарки. И кап умение по очищению штрафов тут не поможет.
Приготовление жратвы/зелок/брони и вообще все ветки крафта так-же полезны, как дырка в потнике потому, что гораздо быстрее находишь эпичную пуху, чем появляется возможность скрафтить наполовину слабее этой оружки. Зелки, при грамотном билде, являются чисто занятыми слотами инвентара.
Бесполезные чуть менее, чем полностью: кулачный бой, магия сна, магия провидца, да и вообще вся магия... тысячи их.
Фул маг сам по себе уныл и беспомощен на нижних уровнях. Маны не хватает, а противники становятся довольно жирными и резистными. В СверхАду он валится с пол пинка накаченного дигла и может сделать ничего резистны противникам, в то время как обычный воин может посоперничать с ними.
>Множество ненужных предметов и глупые одинаковые квесты удручают чуть более, чем полностью. 
>Невероятно, но всего 2 типа квестов приносят такое разнообразие в игру. Ведь нет ничего веселее, чем носить от белой статуи тряпку/овощ, чтобы кинуть в фантан (убийство появившегося недруга опционально) или обычного заказа на убийство 1 или нескольких мобов ради непонятной фигни, статы которой ты перегнал еще два этажа назад. 
Если вас раздражают скриншоты, будьте уверены - это именнно то, что вы покупаете. Ничего оригинального и нового не будет.
И в заключение:
Рогалик не должен вызывать чувства скуки и однообразия, хотя они все именно так и выглядят со сторооны (это я говорю как ценитель рогаликов). Этот же делает все наоборот. 
Половинка дигла из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052610539', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1415745551}
review:
I am utterly baffled how this is better reviewed than other retro games like Legend of Dungeon and Hammerwatch that are in the same price category. Because this is really, really worse than either of those games.

No, I didn't play this for long. Because the experience was so completely grating, I needed to stop. The controls suck, the music is absolutely horrible, the graphics have the look of an RPG Maker construct, and the entire experience was totally clunky and unfun. There is a huge difference between a game that feels "retro" and a game that feels "cheap". This feels cheap.

I'd seen enough and really didn't want or need to see any more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967419832', 'num_games_owned': 1360, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 1966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1941, 'last_played': 1641977802}
review: An amazing roguelike that I believe brought the Roguelike Genre to the mainstreams attention, with the equal if not greater help from FTL: Faster Than Light an the Binding of Isaac. There's a lot fo content in the main game, and the DLC's add even more. There is much humor to be found in this game, along with a large amount of skill/spell/passive trees, a deep crafting system where most items in the game can be crafted if you have the materials and recipes. Along with having a large amount of items and item types(all randomly generated), along with many unique items, gives the player a lot to search for. There's also many options to change the difficulty an length of the game to suit anybody's preference for length.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001960104', 'num_games_owned': 1833, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 7017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6978, 'last_played': 1459699455}
review:
How could I not recommend a game in which you can play a communist necroeconomist bankster pirate?

DoD is a wonderfully well-made Nethack-/Rogue-Like dungeon crawler featuring a refreshing amount of nerdy humour all over the place, from character classes like Emos and Mushroom Farmers over monsters like Fish Paladins and the omnipresent Diggles to legendary equipment pieces like The Legendary Pork Sword.
The game mechanisms are straightforward: Kill monsters, collect loot, improve your class-specific skills and delve deeper until you face Lord Dredmor himself and slay him for great glory.
There are, of course, some sidequests (issued by the godess Inconsequentia herself) that are equally procedurally generated as the dungeon itself, as well as Monster Zoos or other opportunities to obtain some especially fat loot.

What I especially like about DoD is its humor, especially when it comes down to achievement hunting, for which you mostly need to die for the most diverse reasons, and generally recognising all the pop (and nerd) culture references.
A big plus is that this game is also easily moddable via Steam Workshop, even though lately the number of good mods is mostly stagnating.

Long story short, DoD does everything right that a rogue-like needs to get right and some things are even done much better. Therefore, I can only highly recommend it.

Also, Lutefisk.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994708210', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 3554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3399, 'last_played': 1694232751}
review:
-TL;DR at Bottom-

Dungeons of Dredmor is simultaneously an addictively expansive roguelike with heaps of replay value and a disappointingly, shallow experience, and in this way, it is the World of Warcraft of it's genre. For it's price it absolutely is worth it, but at the end of the day you are left wishing the devs would have put a bit more thought into the game to create a solid experience.

At it's base, DoD is a turn-based dungeon crawler with painfully basic combat. You walk around rooms, meet monsters, left click them until they're dead. Occasionally you'll meet a situation where the enemies are statistically and/or numerically superior to you, at which case you must randomly spam offensive/defensive items and abilities at the issue until it's solved, and you really don't even have to pay much attention to exactly what it is you're using. It's just too inconsequential, regardless of the vast amount of options available to you. Increasing the difficulty or enabling perma-death somehow manages not to address this issue, it simply requires for you to pay more attention to the handful of mechanics that really matter. It might seem better for the first few floors of each playthrough, but regardless of settings and skillbuilds, the experience will degrade into the above mentioned simplicity by floor 5 no matter what it is you do, which is primarily due to XP and high level items being too abundant, leading to overleveling reducing the difficulty. Again, this stems from a lack of critical thinking employed in the basic game design, and while it'd be unfeasible to change anything at this stage of the game, it should have been taken much more seriously back in it's development infancy. The importance of a balanced experience distribution in an RPG game is one of the first things any old scrub with a couple hours of dabbling in RPG Maker learns, so it's downright embarrassing that Gaslamp Games took it so lightly.

So that's the core of the game. Why is this a good purchase then? Well the game has three factors that save it from itself; Humor, Content and Steam Workshop.

Humor, I would say, is DoD's greatest asset. Without it's presence, it would crumble and fall into the realms of indie shovelware, and it combines together with a feature that you can never go wrong with; content. So there's a lot of humor is what I'm trying to say. So the way this game works is, after presumably completing the short tutorial course, you start a new game and enter character creation. This process is unlike anything you've experienced before. You right off the bat get to chose a number of skill trees (1-8) for your Adventurer and decide your playstyle on the spot. The fun factor in this is all the various combinations made possible by this formula. Simply put, you can be a regular Melee user, a wizard or a mix of both, and if you'd like you can take the Warlock tree to help with that. Or not. It's very freeform, although hard to explain. Right off the bat you'll notice via the Skill Trees' descriptions that the game's funny. You have skill trees like "Battle Geology: Like all geologists, you can create earthquakes, armor yourself in stone, and petrify enemies. " and "Warlockery: Warlocks are wizards that really wish they were warriors. Or Rogues. Or cheesemongers. Anything but wizards, really. Their "spells" (as they are) serve to make them less wizard-like in a variety of ways.". If these two make you chuckle, or at least make you go "heh" internally, then you'll have an absolute blast once you actually plunge into the game. Every item name, item description, skill, spell, room, monster, monster description - really everything that's anything with words on it will have humorous dialogue that simply never gets goddamn old. Even monsters often make snarky comments from a list of a thousand or more phonemes. It ranges from low to high brow humor, references and even some memes here and there and it never feels distasteful or tired. If you're imaginative and weird, like me, you could also give a voice to all the text in your head, so that the Narrator from Trine 2, or hell, Jef Goldbloom says all the stuff, and it'll be all the more hilarious. And there's tons of this content, just tons and tons and tons. Rightfully so, because the game consists of 10-15 dungeons per run with each floor taking at LEAST an hour to complete unless you're leaving stuff unexplored.

This is where the Steam Workshop comes in. I personally don't recommend playing the game without all 3 DLC's installed AND the majority of the workshop content subscribed to and loaded up. The almost inexhaustible supply of content is the single one thing that can and will distract you from how shallow a game Dungeons of Dredmor actually is. When you're pretending to be a Vegan Necromantic Steampunk Knight and reading funny bits all the time, you don't care about gameplay. You'll be immersed into the whackiest, stupidest scenarios you've ever seen and you'll make it work. It's all novelty, but when there's this much of it, it works better than a real freaking game.

I should fleetingly mention that crafting and inventory management is a huge hit and miss. During some runs, I'll have patience and indulge in the hassle that comes with dealing with it. Other times I'll simply ignore 90% of the loot that spawns all over the floor and wish they put more effort into it. Ironically, while I'd say it's bad in this game, DoD's crafting is exactly what today's MMOs could use in order to make crafting actually freaking interesting. Because MMO's are MEANT to be timesinks, and items there would be worth the literal hours it takes to get specific equipment with noticable and snazzy uses like in DoD. As opposed to stupid junk you will NEVER pawn off on marketplaces, nor even think about using yourself. Oh and the music is loud and obnoxious but it grows on you.

One last, last thing; The gameplay is crap, alright, fine. But I should tell you that if you're of the particularly imaginative sort, there's plenty of room to create fun, self-imposed challenges that could alleviate this issue. On a basic example, you could stylize your character to only wield clockwork/steampunk styled items, which limits your equipment and arsenal. You can take concepts like this to much deeper levels that I can't really explain without you having played the game. It's like those weird people you see on GameFAQ's making up weird challenge run guides for Final Fantasy games. You can do that if that's your sort of schtick.

-TL;DR-

Gameplay: 2/5 - Shallow. Relies on your imagination to make it fun. Not for the casuals.
Replay Value: 5/5 - There's lots of ways to play and things to try and as a Roguelike, the game does excell.
Content: 5/5 - Thousands upon thousands of hilarious descriptions, names and phonemes is the game's primary source of fun.
Music: 3/5 - It grows on you, but nothing to write home about. Title song is catchy.
Art: 3/5 - It's pixelart. It's alright. Level art styles will leave you scratching your head sometimes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993742904', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1460901866}
review: Dużo potworów do zabicia, dużo przedmiotów do zebrania, ciekawy system tworzenia postaci, permadeath (opcjonalny), losowe lochy. Krótko mówiąc - fajny, (względnie) prosty rougelike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017931211', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6150, 'last_played': 1589287133}
review:
Excellent rogue-like au tour par tour aussi bien pour découvrir le genre que pour y chercher une nouvelle expérience,le gameplay est très plaisant et,bien qu'assez classique,arrive à se renouveler à chaque partie grâce aux nombreuse classes que l'on peut mixer ensembles pour trouver le style de jeux qui nous convient le mieux;le système de craft est plutot sympa avec plusieurs domaines(alchimiste,forgeron,ingénieur ou creation de bâtons)et l'aléatoire des découverte de nouvelles recettes;en plus le système est poussé plus loin avec le dlc"conquest of the wizardlands"
Comme tout rogue-like il ne se laissera pas finir trop facilement,mais la"permadeath"(que l'on peut désactiver) ne m'a jamais gené ou énervé mais plutot pousser à tester un nouveau build ce qui rendait chaque run unique.
Même si il n'y a pas d'évolution continue(au fil des runs)et que les anglophobes devront passer leur chemin;à seulement 5€(et à peu près pareil pour les deux dlc+le gratuit) je vous le conseille grandement à toute personne ayant des bases en anglais(le principal n'est pas très dur à comprendre)

author: {'steamid': '76561198091067271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 14629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10729, 'last_played': 1635486508}
review:
Some say that a god cannot exist. Those who say that have not met our Lord and Saviour Lutefisk. The Lutefisk is a kind giver, and also a taker, for one cannot recieve what they are not willing to give away. Thus has been taught to me by the Lutefisk. As we delve deeper, we will all be taught by the Lutefisk; we will all join the Cult of the Lutefisk. However, a new Cult is not the only thing that Dungeons of Dredmor offers. 
   
   As a roguelike RPG, gameplay is simple: run around, grab loot, kill monsters, and don't die (and not just because Lutefisk does not promise an afterlife). However, there are many fun and exciting features. An advanced set of skill selection, in the form of multiple skill trees with linear paths, keeps combat unique and different. For example, I have had builds where I run around and just kick monsters to death (yes I mean kick, as in with a boot) while dual-wielding shields and builds where I teleport in, drop mines, push monsters onto said mines, and teleport out of explosion-related danger. There are several different interactions in the game that either reward or punish you. For example, Krong, the God of Anvils, leaves blessed anvils randomly on floors in the dungeon that you can enchant your gear with. It is not until you place your gear on the anvil, the point of no return, when you find out if Krong blesses or curses you. And of course, interactions involves our dear Lutefisk. Tithing Lutefisk at a Lutefisk Shrine, a food item that offers barely any health regen, may appease the Lutefisk God, and he may give you an enchanted item. DoD also offers a completely fair difficulty curve: each floor means significantly harder enemies. Therefore, as logic dictates, you should complete the entire floor you're on for as much experience and items as possible. The only exception to this rule is random minibosses and of course, Dredmor. Minibosses are literally there to make sure you're paying attention to the game. If you're punching everything, and notice this one monster is doing half your health in one hit, you should probably use a different strategy. Dredmor is a completely overpowered piece of... bologna... but I mean, to me this makes sense. It's HIS dungeon, HIS realm of power, and you're trying to stop him. If he was weak, why would a HERO (and quite the hero you are!) need to stop him? If nothing else, this hard task merely forces you to further investigate every chest, to question every move, and to work ever harder at making that perfect combination of skills. 
   
   Another good part about this game is that it's very accessible. There are three difficulty levels, permadeath is optional (so you can save your dearest characters), there is an option for smaller floors with the same experience gain, and with DLC, there is an option for 5 more floors of grinding before the boss. Speaking of DLC quickly, two DLC packs are super cheap (2.99 USD each and actually the Deluxe edition has the game and those two DLC for just 6.99 USD), and the third DLC pack is free. Cheap and easy to get into means that casual players can enjoy as well, while advanced difficulties and more options means that the hardcore Roguelike fan can cater to their style as well. 
   
   Another important thing about DoD in my opinion is the community. This is one of the most friendly, most helpful, best communities I have ever experienced on any game ever. Most questions get answered in minutes, and the number of guides for new players is seemingly limitless. These same helpful and friendly people also make amazing mods that add even more playability to a game I haven't been bored for even a second in. 
   
   TL;DR: All in all, DoD is an accessible, fun, pun-packed, Cult-creating, deceptively simple Roguelike RPG with a good community and workshop integration. I would highly recommend this game even off of a sale, and when on sale I will attest that it's literally a "can't miss". If anybody has any questions, ask in the comments section, I will do my very best to answer them in a timely manner. Similarly, I will try to continue to edit this guide at appropriate times.    
   
   The"Your TL;DR is still annoyingly long, sir."TL;DR: Very fun, creative game; amazing community; astounding Workshop content; optional Cult participation. Worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133225640', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1459453637}
review:
Excellent rogue-like rpg, loaded with humour, weird monsters and great mecahnics. Character stats can be a bit overwhelming at first, but game can be played with trial/error style for equipment - e.g. let's try if this sword does more damage to my enemies than the other one. Various skills can combine into unbelievable builds, like steampunk vegan, who protects animals(or sends them to their death) or dual axe wielding brutal hero in steel clad armor. 
Anything is possible, and don't forget that losing is !!FUN!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019267622', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1427818539}
review:
Passionant ! 
DoD est un RPG de type Dungeon-Crawler archi-complet. L'humour est omniprésent, les graphismes orientés "cartoon" le rappellent à chaque instant, sans versé dans l'infantilisme. En effet, le gameplay et l'univers du jeu reste mature, le jeu est très exigeant, il est important de rester prudent et avisé dans ses choix de rôles au départ de l'aventure. Les niveaux des donjons sont réajustés à chaque partie, les ennemis extrèmement variés, et de nombreux secrets/armes/possibilités lui offrent une rejouablitié totale !

L'IA est efficace, et on se prend facilement à cet univers original, fait de "Doodles" et autres joyeusetés. Jouer un vampire berserker végétarien qui manie des arcs est toujours un réel plaisir ! (des dizaines de possibilités offertes, mon exemple ne doit pas vous effrayer).

Bref, je recommande, en avertissant cependant sur le fait de ne pas s'attendre non plus au RPG de donjon ultime, son manque de prise de sérieux est rafraichissant, mais peut aussi être lassant à la longue.

review: Dungeons is a slow, repetitive slog through a series of large, characterless, procedurally generated maps. Character progression is severely lacking in depth. The skill system boils down to unlocking one active or passive skill per level in a sequence of linear offerings. The crafting system is unapproachable, excessively time consuming, and unnecessarily cumbersome due to the inadequate inventory management system. I regard this game as an inferior version of "Sword of the stars: the pit"

author: {'steamid': '76561197971626164', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 11807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1707717786}
review:
This game is a great roguelike, and the only one I've ever played where I don't usually get even slightly angry when I die, which is still often, though I've played it quite a bit.

Aside from the nice ancillary things, like its very low system requirements (though I have seen the game take up to 80% of a single Phenom processor core running at 3.4ghz) and complete cross-compatibility with windows/mac/linux, the game itself features colorful and endearing 2D graphics, and plenty of them. The only game with more loot that I've seen is probably Borderlands 2, and certainly its loot is less well-documented. This thing has hilarious descriptions for everything from en-meatening Pork Swords to cringe-collecting Meat Wands.

Not everything in this game is a dick joke, either. Beyond the humor, the gameplay itself is compelling, because it basically makes no attempt to balance its skills, and allows you to take something like 7 of them right off the bat, from a pool of something like 30. Then, when you advance, you choose which skill to improve, which usually boosts your base stats a little and then gives you some kind of rules-bending ability/spell/mutation/fell aspect that fundamentally changes the way you play the game after acquiring it. This makes every playthrough new, and is only helped by the semi-random dungeon, with its themed floors and heaps of treasure. Seriously, this game has so much loot they give you an interdimensional ROOM (forget bag) of holding to store all of it in. This is important, because there's also CRAFTING! Which is practically a minigame of economy in and of itself if you choose to go that route. Fortunately, since that item management shtuff is not for everyone, it is totally possible to play through the whole game without ever crafting a single thing; turning all that useless detritus into lutefisk for the lutefisk god. He is a benevolent fishy deity that you will come to worship, should you delve deeply enough into the dungeons.

Anyway, there are a LOT of quality roguelikes out there. Why pay for this one when you could enjoy a free one like Dungeon Crawler: Stone Soup? I think it's simply down to the overall quality of the game; as a whole, it makes for an attractive, entertaining, funny look at the genre that is both a sendup and an experience that stands well on its own, once you get past the laughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028071417', 'num_games_owned': 4145, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1415088648}
review:
Game #3 - Dungeons of Dredmor (PC)

November 4, 2014
Where to begin... Well, I guess let's try and figure out where and why I bought this game. That may shed a little light on how Dungeons of Dredmor (Further referred to as DoD) came to be in the 1K Game Stream Challenge.

As best I can guess, DoD came with a bundle of games. Either some HumbleBundle or one of the other "Value Bundles" being sold by one of the flavor of the month Steam Key re-sellers on the internet today. See, the Indie Developers tend to get their games lumped together, because the consumer of PC games seems to like value above quality. This is not always the case, but unless your dealing with the likes of HumbleBundle, then you're probably going to find a few games in each bundle that equate to a happy meal toy.

Let's start at the beginning. For the record, I knew nothing about DoD coming into the playthough. I literally couldn't have told you anything about the game. After playing it for 3 hours straight on cast, I can tell you it's a Rogue-like RPG Game, and that's about it. From the point I started playing, I was confused by the mass amount of loot just lying around. Some may find this interesting and want to pick up every little thing, but honestly it seemed more like a videogame about hording than adventuring. There is so much crap lying around that you spend far more time messing with the tiny inventory screen than the tool belt where you store important spells and skills. This seems boring and tedious, neither are what I consider a gaming experience. Even trying to figure out the crafting system was cumbersome and not intuitive.

Now, I am a supporter of Indie Games and when it comes to Rogue-Type games, I love them!  Spelunky, Crypt of the Necrodancer and Rogue Legacy are amazing. The difference is they are mainly platformers, and this plays well with the Rogue style of death machines. You care very little in most cases that you have to start over. In DoD this can be a nightmare if you leave the Rogue option on. Starting over each time is hell if you've just lost an hour of crafting work. One final note, that may be just a gripe,  in the game the characters always look the same no matter what armor you equip them with in the menu. Metacritic's average complete argues against my finding with a 79 for overall reviews. I would probably have put this more in the range of 40-50 based on the issues I've stated above.

The one area that DoD wins in is price. Being an Indie title, the cost of the game is going to be on the lower side of the scale. When I say the lower part of the scale, I mean less than $5 on steam everyday. The complete edition is $6.99, and has a decent offering of DLC. The other advantage to DoD is that it supports user mods from the Stream Workshop, which can really extend the life of any game. To be fair, I did not install any files from the Workshop. I can't say that I would recommend  buying the game, but if the opportunity arises that some bundle has the game, give it a try and see if you can find anything interesting from user generated mods.

 

FoG

#HistoryWillBePlayed

Reference:

http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/dungeons-of-dredmor

Gameplay Video:

http://www.twitch.tv/fansofgames/b/585136108

author: {'steamid': '76561198062163512', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1506729498}
review:
In short, great game. This is one of the most dungeon-crawlery dungeon-crawlers I've ever played and I love it. 

At this point I just roll through purely on damage and buffs (smart choices, I went nearly full rogue with a bit of warrior mixed in); I should probably learn what potions do at some point. Smithing doesn't interest me, nor does alchemy or magic, but I'm sure it's a staple for some. 

The only thing I don't like is backtracking, but, hey. It's a dungeon crawler.

All around great game. If you love RPGs with menus on menus and a decent learning curve, I'd definitely get this. It's addicting as hell and I've only scratched the surface of a much broader game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067208095', 'num_games_owned': 1472, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1504796669}
review:
Чудовий представник модернових рогаликів. Якщо ви новий у жанрі, то ця гра буде непоганим вибором для початку. До переваг можна віднести:
* Різноманітний вибір навичок під час генерації героя (чи героїні)
* Сучасний дизайн
* Зручний інтерфейс
* Багато гумору та пасхалок
До мінусів:
* Не дуже висока реіграбельність
* Маленьке різноманіття прокачування героя з підняттям рівня.
Я можу рекомендувати цей рогалик в першу чергу тим, кого відлякує ASCII графіка, та складність класичних представників жанру. Також ця гра підійте більш досвідченим гравцям, як забавка на декілька днів, максимум на тиждень, для того щоб розслабити мізки і просто відпочити.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027671296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2787, 'last_played': 1637094210}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067336828', 'num_games_owned': 732, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3047, 'last_played': 1687372691}
review:
(Великолепный рогалик, дак ещё и с графоном. Десять дигглов из десяти.)

Я пересмотрел свое мнение после того, как опробовал таких титанов жанра, как NetHack и ADOM.
Этот "рогалик" всего лишь жалкая и однообразная пародия на NetHack. Если вы не могете в классику из-за ascii - накатите тайлов(а лучше перетерпите и попросту привыкните). Но ознакомиться с Dungeons of Dredmor все-таки стоит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042555493', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 20199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9045, 'last_played': 1692350878}
review: Dungeons Of Dredmor is A very fun, but challenging, turn-based rogue like game with a bunch of items and stats, (along with being able to buff your gear with random stats.) and funny flavour-text. The game does require a lot of understanding to make it most enjoyable, because sometimes it can be confusing at times, it may not be for everyone, but i love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015101288', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1156, 'last_played': 1655967225}
review:
Joyita oculta entre una multitud de juegos.
Sin duda lo recomiendo, gran juego de mazmorreo en el que no hay 2 partidas diferentes.
Tienes que pensar bien como armarte el personaje, y tener suerte pues es facil morir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053126671', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1452844200}
review:
You sit down and play 15 minutes and when you look outside 4 hours have passed.
This game isnt a gangster ,but it kills time !

author: {'steamid': '76561198005293074', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1699400647}
review:
This is a game I've owned for quite a long time now, and before I begin I will clarify that I have way more 10 hours play time on this game, as at many times in the past I have been without internet access and this has always been my go to offline game, I'm sure the number is much more close to 50 hours or so and it still remains my go to offline game.

I've mentioned in other reviews that I don't like games with a short lifespan and little replayability, well this game then is an absolute wonder to me because not only does it provides almost an endless amount of gameplay and tons of replayability, it is incredibly addictive and fun to play.

The mechanics are very simple and there is little to no story at all, which leaves your imagination to get carried away and fill in the gaps as you crawl through the large dungeon areas slaying hoards of quirky little monsters and farming items you have no desire to eat, use or sell. This is a game where you will probably only ever be using the arrow keys and a mouse click, and the simplicity of this provides an easy gaming experience.

I will say I have never played past the medium difficulty level, and I will go further as to say that I have never even completed a single save, I don't usually play with permadeath on either, it's mainly a case of me creating various heroes and forgetting how far I got on each one and deciding to start all over again. This is not a game you could finish in one sit through, even when enabling the mode which reduces the size of the levels, this game is still massive and takes a lot of time to cover each area and collect each item.

One thing I would imagine playing this game is that the simplicity and repetitiveness of this game would get boring, but it never seems to do that, I believe it is probably the desire to push on for more loot, gold and exp to max our your skill sets, as well as find interesting new items with cool stats and comparing them with your current inventory, perhaps one of the most thrilling discoveries you can make on any level is finding the store, which always stocks a bizaare inventory.

The music is also really good, and while it may feel repetitive at some points, it still manages to sound really great and perhaps helps in setting the mood for becoming immersed in the game.

I would say the main factor for enjoying this game is that it excels in making you feel that you have achieved and made progress, there are a lot of achievements you can unlock, and two expansions which add more levels and crazy skills to master, this is definitely a great entry and perhaps a little overlooked work within the roguelike genre and I cannot recommend it enough.

That being said, this game is pretty buggy at times, the levels appear to be randomly generated and at times this can result in some items being blocked off and unattainable without the right skills, and this while slightly annoying, doesn't really take much away from enjoying the game, the game was also very buggy when I played it around it's time of release, but it does seem a lot more stable now. So I would still say it's definitely worth picking up especially given how good the price is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991124354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2533, 'last_played': 1618674455}
review: In depth rogue-like that doesn't take itself too seriously. Could do with a better UI and some statistics but otherwise can't complain since I just randomly keep coming back to this for an evening of fun even after years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048968243', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2368, 'last_played': 1538727387}
review: This game is so very addictive. You every want to kill a couple hours? Throw on a good movie and start playing a round of this game. You can take it in a million different directions depending on your playstyle and you then have to adjust it to adapt to the items you find. Not to mention it has a wonderful sense of humour. I happened to get it in a Humble Bundle and it was one of the best steals ever. Just go for it, if you're into rouge dungeons than you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028102438', 'num_games_owned': 1974, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 2877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2840, 'last_played': 1606492896}
review:
这游戏法师天赋太强,火法到3级的火龙几乎前期无敌秒过,后期没输出肉厚可以当T.反正怪优先攻击宝宝,在同距离下.
近战太渣.
游戏中还有很多BUG,例如下楼后地图一片黑,丢技能非法弹框,自动储存卡顿报错.还有极低极低几率损坏存档的现象.
总而言之,这块游戏是不错的"不可思议迷宫"系列.
区别就是欧美喜欢在"天赋"上做文章,日式系列着重在"道具"上做文章.
一路玩下来,前期节奏很不错,到了中后期就很烦了,基本不愿意清理完这层就下去了.
但是这游戏恰恰又需要刷怪,需要补充等级,"道具"效果很微妙......这点又违背了"不可思议迷宫"多样化将就"脱出"为主的宗旨.
由于不是"暗黑"那种自由行动,总归还是染上了"回合制"De关系,在面对大面积怪物的时候,频繁的施法后的多重效果严重拉低了整体游戏的流畅感.
更可惜的时候,除了没有修复的BUG,该游戏没有正式的中文版.
算是相当的遗憾了.
如果你喜欢不可思议的迷宫,可以玩一玩,但是期望不要太大.
游戏里很多设定可能会让你很欢喜,也可能让你很反感.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991196689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8035, 'last_played': 1655244641}
review: A jovial, lighthearted rougelike that's fun to play in small doses

author: {'steamid': '76561198008187229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1522787924}
review:
If you like fantasy pop-culture references, irreverent humor, and hoarding items "just in case", then this is the game for you. Didn't think I was going to enjoy this game as much as I do, but it's challenging and addicting. At a certain point, it feels a bit grindy, but there's the option to streamline dungeon size such that your spending less time on each floor but still progressing through the game. Plenty of replay value if you like exploring different play styles and challenging yourself!

And there's seriously nothing like strutting around feeling like you own the place and then feeling your stomach drop when you open a door to a monster zoo.

Buy this game, it's totally worth the price, and you'll have a blast adventuring!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012512028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1020, 'last_played': 1387926877}

author: {'steamid': '76561198142216449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1061, 'last_played': 1706320212}
review: A fun  and funny turn based dungeon crawler. The only "downside" I can think of is that it is very hard to actually beat the game and that it can be time consuming. However, both of those are also part of the game's charm. The game is not meant to be beaten on your first try, it is meant for you to make a character, see how far you can get with it and then try again with a different one, or the same one, your choice. All in all I think it is definitely worth your time, I've had it a long time and still have a lot of fun with it

author: {'steamid': '76561198142748437', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1492411208}
review: What can I say about Dungeons of Dredmor? Well, first of all, let me say that this is the first time I've played a roguelike and enjoyed it. Immensely. This is perhaps the most accessible, most enjoyable roguelike game out there, with a great artstyle, a metric butt-ton of nerdy jokes and references to things like Doctor Who, Discworld, etc, and some of the most hilarious achievement sets I've seen thus far on Steam (there is literally an achievement for kicking a door until you die from a broken foot). This game has almost infinite replayability, with dozens of skills in nearly endless combinations and enough mods out there to keep the game going long after you've played the whole shebang, Dredmor is a delightful, near-endless experience I'd recommend to anyone with a bit of extra cash on their hands.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974183287', 'num_games_owned': 929, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 19437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12037, 'last_played': 1509817101}
review:
Words fail me when I try to explain how much fun I've had with this game, and it gets worse when I try to talk about all the fun I'm still going to have. This is a great roguelike AND a great turn-based dungeon crawler. The permadeath is on by default, but you don't have to play that way, and the lower difficulty is rather forgiving.

It has some things that really annoys me, first and foremost the lack of transparency in many places. But that's nothing that a few seconds of search on the great wiki won't fix (not to mention that it's less of an issue when you aren't obsessed with min/maxing the way I am).

Overall the many qualities completely overshadow the few problems. Really good aesthetics and tone of the game make this possibly the most appealing roguelike I have ever played. The way class/skills interact makes for a a huge depth of strategy and builds to explore while being amazingly well balanced for such a complex system. The system looks weird and hapazard at first, but once you get used to it you realize that there is a framework of simple concepts underlying it all; and once you see that, it's very easy to grasp how various things interact and how new things will work. That makes for an exceptionally experience in mastering the game and getting to know how it works.

The great community and all the love the developpers poured into it (obvious from the large and completely free DLC that's available) seal the deal, making it one of the best games I have ever played.

If you like deep game that you can play easily after an hour of getting familliar with it but that's deep enough that you are still improving after a couple hundred hours into it, then look no further.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998979630', 'num_games_owned': 1068, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1607, 'last_played': 1511634852}

Such a fun dungeon crawler with so much quirky humor! It's def one of those games that you sit down and say "Ima game for an hour" then you look back at the clock, curse, and realize your late for work :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198079013804', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1593624124}
review: Buy this game! I would've never bought it and known how great it was if someone hadn't have given it to me. I saw this before. I noticed the price and the graphics and said "This is one of those cheap games that suck. Just here to trick people and get their money in return for crap." Ooooh man was I wrong. This is an addictive rogue-like game that will have you going back for more. I like this so much that this is the first game I actually collected all of the cards so I could craft a badge for it. Again, buy this. It is soooo easy to over-look this amazing game when searching for others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021405214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14827, 'last_played': 1594493700}
review: Excellent game. Highly recommend it. Has a great replayability value and a lot of funny references.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041956524', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 5775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5414, 'last_played': 1700720138}
review:
I'll say this: it is a fun roguelike, you'll have tons of fun trying to survive in it.

My gripe is that the Diggle Gods expansion makes it gamebreakingly long. It's game breaking because once you get to the final levels, your skills cannot be upgraded anymore, which means leveling up becomes essentially useless and is only a way to achieve full hp/mana. Also it makes Dredmor not twice as hard, but TEN FUCKING TIMES HARDER THAN HE SHOULD BE, and ends up dragging the game not to a crawl, but to a crippling, sliding, agonizing limb-shaking slide across the floor. It's fucking terrible. I get there are hardcore gamers out there but this is just fucking ridiculous. It's like turning your bicycle gear all the way down and then going up hill. It just gets more more time consuming and tedious than it should be.

Overall really fun and fantastic game. Loads of fun, loads of skills. The rest of the DLC is a must have, wizardlands pocket dimensions will save you LOADS of grief and makes your life easier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077927735', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1268, 'last_played': 1653852178}
review:
Sehr gutes Rouge-like, Dungeoncrawler Game was mit seiner umfangreichen Skillmöglichkeit und Anpassungsmöglichkeit besticht.

Auf dem höchsten Schweirigkeitsgrad ist es auch für Hardcore Gamer zu empfehlen. Perma-Death sei Dank :)

Das Spiel beginnt damit das man sich einen Charakter mit dazugehörigen Traits erstellt die dann ingame pro Level Aufstieg freigeschaltet werden können. Dieses System hat gerade mit den Addons unmengen an Möglichkeiten die man ausprobieren kann.
Es ist Rundenbasiert (ohne Wartezeit) und man sollte auf den späteren Leveln schon aufpassen das man nix überstürzt :P


Rundum ein gelungenes Spiel für leute die auf Rouge-like und Dungeoncrawler stehen!

9/10 - Dungeoncrawler/Rougelike

author: {'steamid': '76561197971252964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 26729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5574, 'last_played': 1706933668}
review: A fun rouge like with lots of pop culture references spread throughout the levels.  Nothing particularly special about it, other than the humorous take it gives everything.  Enemies and levels become repetative, and some of the offered classes have much less use than others.  Overall, a fun game to spend some time on when you can't think of anything better to do.  6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198038604011', 'num_games_owned': 914, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 2714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1425697515}
review:
I’m probably dating myself here, but did anyone else play Castle of the Winds? I’m glad that back in those days we didn’t have timers to keep track of hours spent in games because it would have been quite depressing to see my counter on that game.

While I’m not a huge fan of the whole rogue-like genre (I much prefer rogue-lite) Castle of the Winds holds a special place in my heart and Dungeons of Dredmor was a wonderful trip down memory lane. I don’t have tons of experience with other titles in the genre, I found DoD to have tons of content for plenty of replayability without the beginning levels getting stale. There are lots of classes and skills to mix and match, the procedural generation is logical and reliable, and the interface is easy to use and navigate. Aesthetically DoD is very charming, I don’t exactly know how you would classify the art style -it’s somewhere between hand drawn anime and south park- but it’s clear that the developers had a lot of love for the game they were making and the world they were creating. 

This game took me back to a simpler time and I love it for that; Dungeons of Dredmor is a great game to add to your collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111934344', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1412875032}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008631191', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1402324442}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987350411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1408988084}
review: It's cute and charming, but rather shallow. There are so many better quality rogue-likes out there. This one has better graphics than most, but they're not that great. The only thing it has going better than most is the crafting system. Other than that, everything seems a poor imitation of real rogue-likes. If you are new to the rogue-like genre, this could be for you. But for experience players who like a little more depth, this doesn't cut it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964866568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 3320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2722, 'last_played': 1666979759}
review:
It is my most favorite Indie game on steam.
I played so many times, using many different skill trees and I never managed to beat the damn game.
And I love it :)
It has all the things that are awesome:
-Random generated floors (and a LOT of them)
-Random drops with lots and lots and lots.... of items :P
-unique (I mean UNIQUE) skill specialisations (you can combine them at will!). Oh, and A LOT of them :P

This roguelike game is big, cheap and looks good.

what's not to like?

10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039956251', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1464353238}
review:
외국식 유우-머 요소가 많이 포함되어 있는 로그라이크 게임 던전 오브 드레드모어입니다.

추천은 하지 않습니다.

처음에 스킬을 선택해서 진행한다는 것도 개인적으론 마음에 안들었고, 무기 같은 경우 스킬이 없어 효율이 떨어질 뿐이지만 마법이나 제작 쪽은 아예 손도 못 대는지라..

모든 게임 초심자가 사용할만한 남자의 중갑전사는 보스 스킬 구성이 근접 카운터급이라 게임 클리어하기가 매우 힘들고, Monster Zoo 인카운터에서 정말 지옥을 느낄 수 있습니다.

인카운터 이름답게 몬스터가 엉청나게 많이 모여있는데 턴 진행을 몬스터 하나 하나 진행해서 정말 끔찍할 정도로 지루합니다.

초 중반에는 나름 괜찮네? - 하지만 여러 판 해가며 후반 진행할수록 재미가 없는 게임이라 생각합니다.
