author: {'steamid': '76561198011674203', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1525490683}
review:
I definitely love this game, it's usually my go-to when I'm out and about with my laptop. It's a hilarious roguelike, full of ridiculous monsters and items and such. Everything is dipped in humor and/or allusions and references (for example-- Item: [Jeans] Cutoffs. Description: "It's a medical condition!". For all of you Arrested Development fans out there) The monsters will taunt you with all kinds of funny text, and there's a mod or two that add additional lines to the game. Very much lends itself to replayability; there's a lot of skill sets you can choose for your character (7 per playthrough), anything from the generic "Sword" skill tree to "Mathemagic" and "Fleshsmithing". DLCs are lovely and adds even more skill sets like "Tourist", "Emomancy", and "Paranormal Investigator".

And you're not just buying humor, it's actually very good as an actual /game/ too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198128058125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1472005622}

review:

Un sistema di creazione degli oggetti con innumerevoli combinazioni completa il quadro.
Consigliatissimo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004874574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1519342072}
review: This game is such a addictive diamond in the rough. At first, the skills seem daunting, and the premise of dying every five seconds because you aren't exactly sure what to do seem rather annoying. BUT! If you play rogue-likes, and are familiar with the type of genre then you'll be fine! This game is so good once you get into it. You get a bit further in each play, you choose a different skill set until you're satisifed and feel unstoppable, you pick up new loot. LOOOT! So much cool loot! My only wish is that this game provided a different character appearance with the items you wear. OH MY GOD That would be the absolute icing on the cake. Overall, I love this game, and will conquer it's dungeons one day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198100477273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1693280506}

author: {'steamid': '76561197982928139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 13961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10881, 'last_played': 1508651090}
review:
Surprisingly clever and fun game.  Highly recommended.  Excellent intro to roguelikes and simply one of the better ones simply for its *excellent* setting and tone and very clever mechanics.
Doesn't try to over balance (i.e. make eveyrthing so readily comparable that they aren't really differentiated) which allows the game to be fun [less so than more complex roguelikes; but tearing a rift in spacetime to destroy a room is still fun].

Also: the game looks way better when playing than it does in stills!  (Seriously, I almost didn't get it because it looked so ugly in screenshots; but I actually really enjoy the graphics when playing the game.)

Great game to at least try.  Can't wait to see Gaslamps next game (Clockwork Empires).

author: {'steamid': '76561198103509891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1706195807}
review: dungeons of dredmor is good fun. the dungeon itself feels vast with many different levels and secrets. Loot is free flowing as it is in any rogue type game and the monsters each have their own unique sense of flair. wit over 40 starting skills to choose from you can completely specialize your character any way you want, be it as a pure fighter who walks into room and is the only one who leaves, or a rogue who kills enemys before they even know he was there or even a magical swordman if thats your thing. the game can be hardstarting off at first but permadeath can be turned off allowing you to adjust to your character. Overall very fun game would highly recommend to anyone who is a fan of the rogue or rgp genre

author: {'steamid': '76561198087252561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1571708425}
review: This game is great. For those of you that love the hack and slash, mob slaughtering, loot grabbing, pun filled dungeon crawl with tons of class customization and tweaking, this game is for you. Don't let the low amount of time Steam says I've spent on this game fool you. I spent quite a bit on it at a friends house trying it out. This game is quick to suck you in, although it's easy enough to save your progress if need be and pick it back up later. There is a bit of a learning curve when it comes to figuring out which combinations of character skills you need to actualy survive based on your play style, but with three different modes to play on, one of which being a permadeath mode, you can learn as you go. A couple of other great things I like about this game, is you can actually choose to be a female adventurer, which to me is great, as most dungeon crawlers try to put the female character as a spell slinger or an archer. I'm a girl, I prefer to be hacking off limbs in the front lines. This game lets me do just that. Replay values in this game are insane as well, since you never know what your dungeon is going to look like. Each one is randomly generated, with mobs, side quests, loot... This is just amazing to me. Heck, you can even get mods and install mods and extra content for this game that other people have created. Controls are fairly simple, and you can adjust your keybindings if need be as with most games of this genre. All in all, this game is well worth the cost, and getting it on sale is definitely a must. I recommend this game to anyone with a few bucks to spend on a game. You won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122066117', 'num_games_owned': 1179, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1456071274}

review: A fantastic game, even in 2017. I've had it since it came out, and it still holds up amazing to this day. I've never dealt with any bugs or glitches. Well worth a shot for anyone who likes permadeath rogue-like games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028297743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7956, 'last_played': 1416105878}
review: This game is an excellent Roguelike and given all the roguelike love in recent months (years) I am stunned no one on my friends list has ever played it.  Especially when I have suggested it.  Random maps with fun sets of skills and leveling, it is definitely different but once you get the hang of how skills work it is a lot of fun.  Probably my favorite game in the past few years that fits with the roguelike craze.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042216498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3128, 'last_played': 1690907449}
review:
Want to know an actual rogue-like is ? Go play this game !
In a nutshell, graphics are very well fitting the game, music is great, ALL the text is hilarious (you do have to understand english though), the gameplay is very nice, the UI is pretty clear, the tutorial explains pretty much everything, and most of the items and skills descriptions are self-sufficient, most skills are original and have their interest, several play styles are possible, and the permadeath mode is psychologically challenging.
Two true downsides though : the boss (Dredmor) is kinda disappointing and fighting him is not very fun, and the money which you don't have when you need it at the beginning and a bit later you have a ridiculously large amount of it.
But it is still a great game ! I defenitly recommend it to anyone who likes rpgs and is not afraid of reading !

review: This game is one of the most hilarious and fun games I've ever played. It's also one of the hardest games I've ever played. The mods also give it a lot of replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977786373', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1299, 'last_played': 1604797154}
review: Tihs game is an oldschool rogue-like. If you like Sword & The Starts The Pit, you will love this too ( & vice versa). The style of the game may be a bit off-putting at first, but it will grow on you. There is a ton of hilarious flavor text throughout. There is also a ton of content in the form of character customization, items, a crafting system, quests, and more. The expansions are absolutely worth picking up. The game is hard, but can be broken if you build your character right, and get lucky. On my third run through, I created a vampyric fire mage ninja viking character, and thanks to RNG for some amazing item drops, I literally could not die. I would walk into a room, auto-dodge all attacks, and counter them with fire magic and axes to the face. Every counter attack that hit & did damage would heal me. All I had to do was stand there. So, +1 for allowing me to become the Norse god of Fire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087073714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 15273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1631987711}
review:
Para quem ainda sofre por duvidas em comprar este game, eu digo: você está perdendo bastante tempo de diversão, mesmo com uma arte grafica que pode não ser agradável a muitos jogadores, é um game que garante o melhor do roguelike + dungeon crawler, liberdade para escolher a build de seu personagem, dando sempre aquela vontade de testar todas as combinações para encontrar o melhor combo desejado. Uma variedade de itens e sistema de crafting.
  O game pode parecer facil de inicio, mas conforme se atravessa os niveis igualmente cresce o desafio. Vale citar tambem a disponibilidade do workshop, o que aumenta ainda mais a "vida util" do game, trazendo a possibilidade de baixar novos mods ou ate mesmo criar seus proprios.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023502462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2319, 'last_played': 1692762063}
review:
I've also put in plenty of not steam time on Dredmor.

Am a big Roguelike fan, and besides the Diablo series, I usually have usually stuck to Angband and the like. I love the ascii look, but the tilesets and animations really add something to the turn based crawling.

Super fun dungeon crawling, tense and hilarious situations, lots of skill trees and spells and attributes to tweak, as well as the workshop for new of all of the above make the game very worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994433381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1491, 'last_played': 1494045674}
review: I still haven't beaten this game... good god does this game like to bend you over backwards and #*!@ you hard... over and over and over again... And the dumb part is that I keep coming back to it. It's frustratingly entertaining to the point that you want to finally beat it JUST so you can spit in its face and tell it "YEAH! TAKE THAT!" It's addictive in that right... oh, and the references are everywhere.

review: Prepare to Kawaii to Diggles

author: {'steamid': '76561198109544340', 'num_games_owned': 1411, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1592036167}
review:
This game is opposite from most games I played in a very nice way. 
To begin with, every time I die, and that happened frequently, I’m happy that I can start a new game. 
Because the game is fair and always when I have to start over, what is certainly a pleasure, I know it’s my own fault.

The music in this game is exactly what I want to hear in a game like this. It’s a way too much orchestra song kind of music what really give the feeling of a middle age castle period. 
Call to arms and conquer!! Tadadum tadum tadum…Very good choice!

The interface and menu is very detailed and clean. Compared to the graphics of the dungeon itself it’s modern style. 
The dungeon is old style, but with enough diversity and eye candy to not feel boring or repetitive. Even that the dungeons are randomly generated every game plays like his own story. Every random set up is like handcrafted by an experienced level designer. The placement of monsters and goodies is a surprise every time, but always very well balanced. Behind every door you open on a gigantic random map is a whole new game generated before your eyes. Within every room dozens of monsters to fight and dozens of pick-ups to find.
 
Every character you build, chosen from tons of skills yourself or totally randomly, is unique. But really unique. Not unique because the skill you are good in blocks your access to all other skills, but because the skill you develop really makes sence. Every skill point you spend for a skill is game play changing in real time.

Another very good balanced, well designed aspect of this game is that for the first time (I played hundreds of RPG’s and TBS games) you can use all your skills on many, many places of every map.
The fighting is fun, fast and rewarding and it’s even turn based, so you really have time to make every turn and every action you make count. Also it’s very easy to understand and again perfectly fair for the AI and for the player. Fast because every action is just one point, so your turn or the computer’s turn doesn’t take more than a second to make. What is also groundbreaking is that the turn based gameplay in battles and the exploring part of the map is seamlessly. So you don’t have to push the end turn button a thousand times if you are not in a fight but exploring the map.

It was running flawlessly the first few hours after installment and without any glitches, lags or crashes on a three years old laptop with a build in video adapter.

The only bad thing was that one time I had to kill my own summoned monster, a golem, myself because he was blocking my only way out. This was done in a second, but it was just horrible to kill my own loving pet with my axe.

This game is also original in many ways. The art, the item and spell description and the subtle, delicate jokes all around the game. Sometimes just written on walls or as little text balloons above NPC’s or monsters. But again it is done so balanced and it fit so naturally in the rest of the game.

The last time I walked from my PC to take a piece of paper to write a secret code on it to gain access to a secret portal was 15 years ago. Cést magnifique!
This game is just brilliant in many ways and I can only thank the developers to let me play this game for a few bucks. 
It’s really worth more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069309674', 'num_games_owned': 916, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1690916288}
review:
Очень рекомендую, ведь за смешную цену вы получаете красивый, в меру сложный рогалик, с кучей отсылок к другим играм и интернет суб-культуре. Займет вас на 50+ часов, плюс каждое прохождение будет уникальным. Единственный минус - отсутствие русского перевода, что,  в наше время, не является особой проблемой.
Как по мне, так эта единственная игра, где можно создать пирата-коммуниста, использующего матеМАГию и бегающего по замку в сланцах, тоге, цилиндре, да с серпом и молотом.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014720463', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 7086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6433, 'last_played': 1501740314}
review:
I would be lying if I didn't say this was fun at the start. 
At first the game is charming. Then the charm wears off and you're left with a randomly generated clusterfuck that makes no attempts at even being winnable.

How long this takes depends on how long it takes to roll an absurd unwinnable game, which doesn't take that long.

I don't mind roguelikes, I love the genre - but Dredmor is the perfect example of what's wrong with the whole randomly generateed nonsense everyone loves to make. From the game actively mocking your loadout by generating completely useless equipment and items, to discovering that any and all elements you can use are actively negated by just about every enemy in the game. But heaven help you if you get hit with the "Hidden Element"  , because nothing you have will -ever- defend you.

On the bright side, it's a FAR greater step up than the likes of Hack, Slash, Loot which is an even worse roguelike.

review: One of the first two games that I ever got on steam, this has to be one of my very favorites that I come back to again and again. It's funny, it's lighthearted, but it's also difficult which makes fighting for the achievements all the more fun. It's also one of the few turn by turn dungeon crawlers that I like. I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026465557', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1248, 'last_played': 1449770689}
review:
Игра от бога.

Во-первых это рогалик. Хочу сказать не самый дружелюбный к игроку рогалик, как например Rogue Legacy. В этой игре первые пару часов вы будете бесконечно умирать от ловушек, попадать в западни и, не дай бог, встретить комнату, полную монстров (Monster Zoo). Зато потом почуствуете всю ее прелесть: игра дает нам возможность самим делать персонажа. В игре предложены несколько десятков черт вашего персонажа, большая часть которых потом сможет развиваться как самостоятельная ветка скиллов. Все это дает нам возможность создать как самых стандартных персонажей, типа мага, война, рыцаря, так и совсем странных, как, например, войн-вегетарианец, по совместительству адепт огненной магии, турист и криминальный следователь. Звучит забавно, не так ли? Это не все, что заставит вас улыбнуться в этой игре. В Dungeons Of Dredmor юмор присутсвует везде: в описании предметов, врагов и умений. В этой игре время, которое проживет ваш персонаж, зависит только от игрока, от того как быстро и хорошо он умеет ориентироваться в той или иной ситуации, как он изучал умения, да и как ведет себя в бою. В игре почти нету места рандому, разве что банальная генерация локации и монстров. Не стоит забывать и про музыку! Она тут отличная. К сожалению самих композиций тут не так и много, но все они очень качественные и самое главное — приятные на слух и подходят под игровую атмосферу. Если тут есть ярые любители собирать ачивменты, то их тут предостоточно, причем как минимум 10 из них займут у Вас не меньше сотни часов. 
Могу смело посоветовать всем любителям хардкорного игростроя купить DoD, а лучше со всеми вышедшими дополнениями, как по мне, так она эта игра того стоит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098621045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3558, 'last_played': 1590585138}
review: I purchased this game along with a handful of other rogue-like games during a bundle and I was not expecting much. This game not only blew my expectations out of the water but it took the whole ocean with it! The game has a massive class system where you can mix and match more then a dozen classes together to create something truly fun and fullfilling. Want to make a dual wielding axe berserker who only eats his veggies and has a soft spot for animals? Done! Want to make a Vampire mage who sold his soul to the undead to attain Necro magic? Done! I could go on theres so much replay value this game has its insane. Theres also a crafting system aswell as you go deeper into the dungeon you pick up reagents used to make armor,weapons,potions,bombs,traps, the list goes on! I could type out a wall of text on how great this game but you have to experience it for yourself. Bottom line for 5 bucks this game is worth it and I would have gladly pay more b/c the developers deserve it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021656095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 34763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34520, 'last_played': 1709512104}
review:
I own a lot of games, but this is the one that I keep coming back to most often. 

The game is clever and funny, riffing on practically every major fantasy or sci-fi movie book or game of the past century (Dwarf Fortress, Doom, Quake, Half-Life, Elder Scrolls, Conan the Barbarian, the Cthulhu Mythos, Planet of the Apes, Harry Potter, The Wicker Man, Star Trek, Dungeons & Dragons, Diablo, Pac-Man, Warhammer, Super Mario, The Thing, The Blob, Master of Magic, the list goes on and on; There's a seventeen page long list on the developer's forum and it's still imcomplete), yet it also has more than enough depth to still remain interesting long after you've seen all of the jokes. (And if you -do- get bored with what is included in the game, one of the official expansions is free and several of the fan-made mods {specifically FAXPAX, Interior Dredmorating, Compleat Essential Skills, Roguish Renovation, ASCII Invasion, and Swashbuckling} are of a quality comparable to the core game).

One word of warning however: The game does not interact correctly with the steam's SteamCloud remote savegame system and the developers have so far been unable to figure out why, so it is recommended that you turn SteamCloud off for this game if you don't want your save files randomly erased. Erasure of save files may also occur if the game crashes while autosaving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061911641', 'num_games_owned': 956, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 158, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1709762583}
review:
What can I say about Dungeons of Dredmor? Well, for one, it's one of my favorite games on Steam. I could spend countless hours playing character after character looting and exploring dungeon after dungeon, and never have the same experuience twice. I'm not kidding. Not even once have I found a room exactly the same. Talk about Procedurally Generated. 

The joy of this game does not come in any one category. There are parts of this game that, if anywhere else, would make for a horrid experience. The combat isn't that complicated, but it can be difficult, and it's always fun. Wearing a piece of clothing or weilding a specfic weapon doesn't effect your outward appearance, only adding (or subtracting) from your stats, so for people who like to see your appearance change it's a problem. 

Dungeons of Dredmor isn't like most other games out there, as you may have already guessed, but it is ery entertaining, and hours will go by without you even knowing it. There is so much content in this game, and of all the hours I have played so far, I have not made it past the second dungeon. Is this because it is difficult? Maybe a little. But the real reason is that the game is really really big. Too many different types of monsters to count, as many weapons, more items than I've ever seen in a game, and interesting text on everything.

This game has a lot of pop culture references and stuff like that, so for people who hate that with a passion, this game probably isn't a good choice for you. But if you want a game that can make you laugh, that's really fun, and can let you waste away hours of your life, then this game is perfect for you. 

I highly reccomend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014661464', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1423487437}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987047936', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 11274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1347, 'last_played': 1613263620}
review:
As someone who thought he wasn't a fan of roguelikes, I didn't have high expectations going in, but I haven't played a game as addictive as Dungeons of Dredmor in quite a while. It's not for everyone and there's zero story, but if you're a fan of dungeon crawling and building characters, this game will have you tinkering for quite a long time, trying out new skill combinations as you try to make it to the final boss. The DLC packs add a lot and definitely make the game more interesting and replayable. If that's not enough praise, I'll add this: usually when I finish reviewing a game, I uninstall it. But I'll be keeping Dungeons of Dredmor around.

Full review here: http://postlaunch.blogspot.ca/2014/03/dungeons-of-dredmor.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198032788858', 'num_games_owned': 1105, 'num_reviews': 678, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1382086455}
review:
Эталон своего жанра.

Отличный рогалик с уникальным графическом оформлением и множественными смешными и прикольными моментами в геймплее. Сам геймплей построен на бесконечной прокачке и постоянном сборе мегатонн лута. Крафтинг представлен в игрушке в изобилии, уйма рецептов в каждом из многочисленных направлений. Отдельно скажу о ролевой системе - такого количества различных веток навыков я не встречал ни разу за свою жизнь. 

Убей Дредмора! 8 из 10 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032943425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1540884839}
review: I bought this game on HumbleBundle so it was very cheap.  On the whole, the game is very much a rogue-like game.  The dungeons are randomized as are the encounters.  The items can be tediously repetitious.  Many of them are reskinned with a different color and the stats vary based on luck rolls.  Still, in terms of replayability, the game is solid.  You get to choose a set of any skills you wish from a pool and use them to run through dungeon levels.  This means you can play over and over and have a different experience each time (while the skills don't combo, they will supplement each other better others).  If you are looking for a challenge (I have yet to reach the end), this is definitely a great game to pick up.  Perfect for a quick hop on and hop off game during your free time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045559514', 'num_games_owned': 691, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 25291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7793, 'last_played': 1617949241}
review: By far the best game I owned on Steam. It gives you a good first impression and has a great sense of humor. The only downside is that the customization you make (weapons, armour etc) isn't visible on your character.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004911402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 8598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6201, 'last_played': 1633881200}
review:
If you like TURN BASED Rogue dungeon crawlers, then you have found the best one out there.  Fast, fun, intuitive, easy to pick up but tons to learn.  If you don't want a longer game, set it to "No time to Grind".  If you want a challenge, set it to hard permadeath.  Messing about with different skill combos is a lot of fun, some very odd combinatons work out really well.  I have played Dungeons of Dreadmor a lot, and still love it every time I fire it up.

Yes it is difficult to win.  Yes 9 times out of 10 you are going to get wrecked.  Yes anyone can find fault with anything if they aer picky enough.  This game is superb.  10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198042265960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1529669571}
review:
Although I'm assuming I haven't clocked up anywhere near enough hours to provide a proper overview of all of DoD's features, I cannot recommend it enough; this charming roguelike has a fantastic sense of humour and plays with all the features you'd expevt from the genre, and the gameplay of trawling procedurally generated dungeon floors in the pursuit of murdering Lord Dredmor himself is disgustingly addictive, drawing you in to hours of starting and re-starting as you learn the mechanics from the multiples of skills you can pick from to aid your adventure. These range from simple weapon mastery trees to ludicrous skills like 'Emomancy' granting you powers to manipulate and utilise the energy of angst and deprivation, or the 'Archaeology' tree which grants a certain iconic fedora and bonuses to trap avoidance and general nimbleness.
Overall, Dungeons of Dredmor is a great whole package at £4.99 for all the DLC and the base game, and promises to draw both old-school roguelike fans and newbs to the genre alike by adding actual graphics whilst sticking to the core mechanics of loot hoarding, character progression and permadeath.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044845309', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1614497018}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043970644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1103, 'last_played': 1563620904}
review:
As far as some may believe this game is worth 5 bucks. And starting off that I am a fan of tabletop games and lore, this one is caters to those that love the traditional dungeon crawls and rouge-like combat. Just be sure not to break out the dice if you can't help it (even if its for the sake of good ol' times)

[b]Pros[/b]
+ get ready to die...a lot!
+ graphics, part of the novelty of games such as this.
+ loot
+ crafting
+ tentacle creatures

[b]Cons[/b]
- get ready to die...a lot!
- the stats are confusing
- the interface needs some work. 
- the crafting interface needs more work
- skills/abilities/perks are limited [i](but that is what the Workshop is for, so this is not necessarily a con)[/i]

[b]Overall[/b] 4.5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198066796982', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 22538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21316, 'last_played': 1654403457}
review: awesome game

author: {'steamid': '76561198051627426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3920, 'last_played': 1650322805}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is a game I have come to love in recent years. It's a rogue-like through and through. In character creation, you start off with about 25+ perks to choose from. One thing I like to see in these kinds of games is that, right there. You level up and kill enemies with melee, ranged, and spells (all kinds of spells). You only get one life and that's it, as it should be. Granted, this game is not all that difficult. However, if you get careless you will die within 2 or three turns. Getting careless happens a lot if you find one piece of gear that lets you become a complete tank or decimator or whatever. I would not say that this game is as deep as ADOM or TOME or Dungeon Crawl or Nethack. I would see this as a game to get into rouge-likes like these; a gateway game of sorts. Sword of the Stars: The Pit comes to mind when talking about this as I feel as if these games are cut from the same cloth. Dungeons of Dredmor itself is a very funny game. It has memes in it at times and various refrences to movies as well as witty humor to boot. The game is a very pretty game with colorful yet simple graphics and effects. The game has a lot of base content, even more with DLCs (one of them is free, just so you know). This game even has the Steam Workshop if you're still bored and it has mod support. This game is one of the best roguelikes on Steam. I would buy the game again with all DLCs just so they would make a second one of these; 10/10 no complaints.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006637966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1400299922}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor combines whimsical humour with hack and slash murder. It is the best time.  You will die fairly often, but you'll have a blast doing it. The DLCs are well worth their respective prices, enhancing the game by adding additional levels and skills. Some of the workshop mods are really amazing, too, and keep to the game's atmosphere rather well. Overall, it's just a great purchase and a wonderful time. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014502377', 'num_games_owned': 2868, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 3803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2231, 'last_played': 1477332997}
review:
DoD brings classic dungeon crawling, in single player D&D style into the new age. A classic formula paired with seemingly infinite wit and sarcasm make for a hilariously dry adventure into the depths of a dungeon that offers challenge for those that want it and fun for any player. 
To top it off, the game community is always active and additions such as mods and extra packs are in abundance. 
All said and done, DoD is a great game worth everything you put into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046407276', 'num_games_owned': 6089, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 5040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2586, 'last_played': 1561810180}
review:
Why do I recomend this game? Because it plays really like a rogue RPG. You don't have traditional classes, instead skill trees that add spells, skills or passive skills to your character. You'll find a lot of eastereggs (references to other games or movies in this game), some of which make you laugh. And the game is even on lowest level a tough nut. 

Furthermore it has decent retro style graphics and a good playability, it is nice to be beaten up by a Diggle.

review:
First off, the game is super cheap.  I like cheap>

On top of that, the classes and skills are beyond hilarious as they are all functional in their own quirky way.

Crafting is nothing to really  be desired.  Good.  I don't feel like wasting my time crafting.

It's challenging.  You'll think you're doing good, open a door, and BAM - you're dead meat.  

Play this game.  If you don't like it then it's your own fault because you're too stupid to know what a real game looks and feels like.  

My only dislike is that it doesn't have controller compatability.  Sure it doesn't work with the game very well but I'm just saying.... it would be nice.  (I don't like to use the keyboard and mouse)

review: Dungeons of Dredmor is a cool concept, but unlike other roguelikes, the game isn't very challenging, and even outside that, the game is extremely bloated with way too many items. I didn't get very far in the game, but my experience with it was that the early floors were very easy and didn't require much thought, and it started getting really obnoxious having to manage all the items the game throws at you. You'll probably like the game if you don't mind those flaws, however.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991013586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2943, 'last_played': 1628656918}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is the first "indie" game that I remember completely and utterly loving.  For the first month that I owned it, I spent pretty much every night until 3-4AM slowly progressing through the eponymous dungeons, listening to Rush's [i]Caress of Steel[/i] on loop (great combination, by the way).  Dredmor displays an impressive and very intelligent combination of depth and accessibility, offering a fun early game to hook you in, followed by challenging middle- and end-games to keep you coming back for just one more try.  Additionally, the game costs $5 at full price, which seems almost ridiculous when compared to the trend of steadily increasing prices for indie games of generally lower quality.  If I have one complaint about the game, it is probably that (to me, at least) weapon-based character builds seem to be much harder to use than magic based builds (especially those involving Promethean magic), though this is likely due to ignorance on my part, as I'm sure there are people out there who dominate with fighter/rogue/shooty-man builds.  However, none of this is to say that I do not have fun seeing how far I can get as a fighter-type, because I do.  9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197985833376', 'num_games_owned': 906, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 2056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1455793983}
review:
The first time I played this game I absolutely hated it. The visuals are so frustrating to navigate and having items and monsters hidden behind the scenery is possibly the worst idea for a genre where every step is critical.

BUT, there is a lot of good in here. Skills are fun and varied; the monsters are interesting and the entire world seems like it was made by someone with a concussion. (That's a good thing)

I would have preferred a top down view more like doom rl but despite its visual problems, once I sat down for a few hours with it; I didn't realise how much I was enjoying myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033467947', 'num_games_owned': 691, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2865, 'last_played': 1594563521}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030686751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1556442147}
review: A true homage to early grid-based dungeon crawlers, with an appealing humour that references the classics. Although it is an unforgiving rogue-like, Dungeons of Dredmor is a great addition to everyone's steam library and is easy to pick up with a new twist after every permadeath. With a seemingly endless supply of items and future community mods, DoD is a great indie game to pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979479197', 'num_games_owned': 1387, 'num_reviews': 416, 'playtime_forever': 4744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2442, 'last_played': 1696645029}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030169739', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 13479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6468, 'last_played': 1621563997}
review: Very humorous introduction to the Roguelike genre. You will probably spend as much time contemplating skill combinations as you will actually playing the game. And remember: Losing is fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013058748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3703, 'last_played': 1445268970}
review: Most humourous games rarely elicit a physical laugh.  Dredmor is not one of those games.  The developers are witty, creative, and effortlessly mix satire ("This enemy is trying to kill you!"), pop culture (Bea Arthur, a giant wasp), and the inane (the endless combinations of nonsensical item names).  The number of skill trees and the randomized levels will keep you hooked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058374480', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2464, 'last_played': 1682107622}
review: Das Spiel zählt zu meinen absoluten Überraschungskäufen. Ich hab es mir geholt, weil es irgendwann stark reduziert war und interessant aussah. Normalerweise erwarte ich von solchen "Blindkäufen" für nicht mal einen Euro recht wenig, bis gar nichts. Dafür hat mich Dungeons of Dredmor aber echt überrascht und ich kann es jedem Rollenspiel-Fan, der auf satirische Elemente in den Spielen steht und das ganze nicht zu ernst nimmt, wärmstens empfehlen. Dieses Rogue-like-RPG hat mich durch seinen Humor, die Komplexität (vor allem in den verschiedenen Items, dem Skilltree und dem Craftingsystem) und auch durch den sehr hohen Wiederspielfaktor in seinen Bann gerissen, so dass es wohl für alle Zeiten meine "Spielzeit pro Kaufpreis"-Liste anführen wird. Ich hab es bis jetzt noch nie durch geschafft (man kann zwar Perma-Death abschalten, aber das wär ja kindisch...) und ich bin mir noch nicht ganz sicher, was die beste Methode ist (denn dazu gibt es einfach viel zu viele Kombinationen in der Charakterauswahl, als dass ich schon die optimale gefunden hätte), aber eines war für mich seit Kauf des Spiels immer sicher: Es lohnt sich nicht, das Spiel zu deinstallieren, egal wie wenig Platz auf meinem Laptop noch ist, denn ich bekomm ja doch immer wieder Bock, auf eine Runde zwischendurch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063454559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1040, 'last_played': 1532643526}
review:
I am a 35 year old gamer.  I started off with an intellivision and got my NES when I was 8.  I was looking for a turn based strategy with RP elements Artwork and, let's be honest, story, weren't paramount.  I tried this out on faith and I am glad I did.  Some of the other reviews mention the "constant humor".  This game does not take it's story seriously.  It is made to satisfy the Turn Based RP itch and along the way, throw in humor to avoid the cliches and overdone tropes.  The graphics are retro which is good for an old man like me.  The turn base-ed-ness allows me to get up and yell at the kids without worrying about coming back to my corpse.  The game has three difficulties which do their jobs well.  By this I mean that easy is just that, good for feeling like a boss, regular was a little easy for me, though I only made it to dungeon level 3. And hard (what I'm playing on now) gives me quite the challenge without feeling unfair.

I would recommend this to anyone who wants a turn based, strategic, tactical, retro looking game to have fun in your spare time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988994736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1342940400}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996020653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1204, 'last_played': 1597364522}
review:
You know how some people say "I really want to like X, but no matter how hard I try I can't"?  Well, for me, Dungeons of Dredmor is the opposite.  I really don't want to like it.  It's a 2D rougelike, top-down, turn-based-ish dungeon crawler with an odd sense of humor (it's hit and miss) and a 90's feel to it.  While each floor is randomized, each room is a template of sorts, so after a few hours of gameplay, you'll start to see the same rooms pop up over and over (just with different loot sometimes).  It doesn't feel like there's enough content for a game like this.  And yet, I can't stop playing it.  

On normal, the game is easy enough to lure you in until you find yourself suddenly dead (health is mostly gained by eating food, but it replenishes 1 point per turn (usually for 10 or so turns, depending on the item) so you need to be careful when getting into combat.  The enemies are unusual, yet somewhat bland, but they will sometimes insult you (via text above them) that is actually pretty charming ("You smell like diggle pee" or "I hope they nerf your playstyle").  The biggest draw for me, though, is the item collecting.  There's all kinds of random loot to find, better equipment or something to sell for money so you can buy better equipment.  It's actually sort of relaxing.  All this on top of crafting (which could have been done better, to be honest), leveling and basic (go here and kill this mostly) sidequests that are there to parody the RPG genre.  Plus, you regain magic by drinking alcohol.

In the end, I suppose Dungeons of Dredmor feels like a poor man's Torchlight, but I find it to be a little more likeable than Torchlight.  The music is good, the graphics are decent and it's pretty easy to pick up and play.  I recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198105402913', 'num_games_owned': 1021, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1429809782}
review: Dungeons of dredmor is a Rouge-Like. In my opionion it is a good rouge-like too. It is a simplified and more streamlined rougelike then most, making it easier for new players to get into. Happily this does not mean that Dod is easy, far from it. Even on the easy difficulty this game is unforgiving. New players can opt out of perma death to make it abit easyer on them. I recommend this game to anyone who is intrested in trying a rougelike, but was intimidated by the unfriendly interface in games like NetHack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044999074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5607, 'last_played': 1481811254}
review: dungeons of dreadmore a rougue game that welcomes new comers. and by i mean "welcome" i mean kill a LOT and trust me there are a lot of ways to die. alot of unquie looking enemies, weapons, and armor and skills and a large learning curve this game will pretty much be a good time killer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992022758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 4550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3794, 'last_played': 1657045077}
review: Highly recommend this game. Huge replay value, with a wide variety of mods. It is funny, with great culture refences. Great crafting and skill trees, I dunno just all around great game. Great investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115461516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1431208550}
review:
Not recommending it may seem a bit harsh. The game is funny, the graphics nice for the genre, there's plenty of depth and it is original in many ways. For the price I paid (part of a Humble Bundle) and the £3.49 it is on Steam, it is very, very good value.

However it is flawed. It is so slow to play and there's so much repetition of doing the same thing i.e. fighting - which is a problem common to many turn-based roguelikes but overcome by most with instantaneous response enabling quite large battles to be resolved quickly. Sadly this is not the case with Dredmor, making the early levels quite laborious on repeat play throughs. Since it is a permadeath game, I soon tired of trudging my way through the early levels and soon put the game into my archives.

You won't be wasting your money buying Dungeons of Dredmor, but if you want a game that will draw you in and keep you coming back for more, I'd be surprised if you found it here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010173035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1183, 'last_played': 1433138139}
review: This game doesn't take itself too seriously and is good for a few hours exploration, fun and adventure. The downside was writing codes to enter secret dungeons. When I saw magical graffiti, I knew that soon I would be fumbling around the cushions looking for my pen. Then later I would forget to cross off codes and wonder if I had already explored them. Also inventory management was tedious and resulted in giant piles of stuff left in a depot. Certain skills allow items to really pile up and even after a while of playing I wasn't sure what to keep, sell, or turn into fish.

review: Rouge like dungeon crawler with rpg and skills elements...yup this is game sounds good already. Whats better is the flavor text and how funny this game can be while being a interesting game. I would recommend that you play this game on normal or rouge difficulty since the "elves want to have fun" difficulty is too easy and its better to challenge the game then breeze through it. But if u want an extra challenge theres a perma death system if u so choose to for that extra challenge. And with the workshop and mods for this game theres plenty of content for this game at a good price at that cant pass that oppurtunity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097421013', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1557, 'last_played': 1458370124}
review:
Крутой рогалик, где предстоит варить зелья, шататься по подземелью, по ошибке и самонадеянности убивать себя своим же заклинанием. 

[b]Задача:[/b] спуститься на последний уровень подземелья и пояснить Дредмору, что ему тут не место.

Большая вариативность развития персонажа. Из персонажа можно сделать мага, можно сделать воина, а можно сделать мага, с двумя топорами, классно взламывающего двери, да и прикрутить к персу способность благодаря, которой он будет уворачиваться от враждебно настроенного моба рандомной телепортацией на небольшое расстояние. Сам проходил рогой + рукопашный бой.

Много магии, много эквипа, много интересных перков (некоторые добываются путем установки DLC). Присутствует крафт (алхимия, кузнечное дело). Возможность зачаровывать эквип. Большое колличество самых разнообразных мобов + можно добавить ЕЩЁ больше за счет steam workshop. 

Очень дружелюбен к новичкам — зашел и спустя пол часа игры целиком понимаешь, что от тебя требуется. Для игры абсолютно не нужно совершенное знание языка, так что отсутствие русской локализации не помешает им насладиться. 

Зачёт.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044657862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2869, 'last_played': 1396511940}
review: Hilarious amounts of  references, One of the ultimate items is "The mace of windu" its icon is a light saber. You get several traits to pick from when starting a character, such as emomancy, Necronomiconomics, Magical law, were diggle..... each with its own tech tree. starting is a bit brutal and you will probably die copious amounts but its incredibly fun! It took me almost a week just to each level 5 at wich i promtly entered a wrong portal and had a giant muscular Diggle diablo kill me whoops! The crafting in this game is amazingly complex. I highly suggest getting the community mod that  puts all the crafting skills into one tree. THe community mods alone make for almost infinte replayabilty. this game will suck you in if your an old school gamer if your looking for gorgeous graphics you'll be disappointed however if you enjoy grammatical jabs at gaming, societey, and life in general this game will have you HOWLING with fits of laughter. Even the monsters witty taunts will have you giggling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045411242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1590380865}
review: I'm a big fan of dungeon crawlers, and this one has a LOT of options to keep a player occupied. First off, it has to be said: if for nothing else, this game is brilliant because it does not require you to die from starvation, which is nearly ubiquitous in roguelike games. There's plenty of other ways to die, but they all involve poor choices (trying to disarm a trap, deciding to fight that monster, wondering what's on the other side of a door) rather than the fickle chance of not finding randomly generated food items. As such the game feels much more fair. And it's funny, as well as fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000441565', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1397344799}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050566062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1411184522}
review:
I got this game in a Humble Bundle and wasn't really expecting much, but wow! I'm having so much fun with it. The learning curve isn't too difficult (although having the wiki open will certainly help you!), the random generation of maps and skills keeps it fun and interesting, and the art style is a pleasure. Add to that the multiple options to make it easier if you're not a great gamer (like letting you save, or making the maps smaller so that there's less grinding) and you've got a real winner!

10/10, will play again!

review: I think you definately need the patience and time to play this game or games like this. The progression throug the game is slow placed, but that is to prepare you for what lies in the floors below. Most elements of this game provid a light comedy element which in turn lightens the mood. I do like this, and would like to play other rogue-like games in future, but I would have to make sure I have time to put in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037545970', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 18579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6291, 'last_played': 1684186032}
review: Unlike Civ, with it's 'one more turn' addiction, DoD's addiction is 'one more game'.  One more game is a truism, depending on your skills and game level, you may not make it past the first few rooms, if you make it past the the first room or four.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024130503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 79966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76488, 'last_played': 1483337756}
review: Simply put, one of the best graphical rogue-likes out there, with plenty of play options available for both the casual dungeon-crawler and the hard-core Nethack/ADOM aficionado. Playing is easy, but not-dying is hard, and you'll quickly develop your own play style and determine which skills trees work best for you, and which of those should be leveled up first. I highly recommend checking out all three expansion packs (especially 'Realm of the Diggle Gods' which increases the depth of the dungeon by another 5 levels) as the additional content really helps increase replayability, and when you think you've explored those to their fullest, take a look at the Steam Workshop for some incredible mods, which can add a whole new expansion pack's worth of monsters, skills, and items to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024980050', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1702190689}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042516519', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1065, 'last_played': 1677345426}
review:
Thus far, Dungeons Of Dredmor feels like the most true-to-form Roguelike of recent years. Of course there are other games that feel more like the original genre--ASCII Graphics, mouse-less controls, ten thousand keyboard shortcuts--but that's not what makes a Roguelike good. The complexity of the genre is still there in Dredmor, but it's more accessable. 

All in all, if you need an introduction to the Roguelike genre, or simply want something you can take a bit less seriously but still enjoy as much as the Hack's and Dungeon Crawl's that are the current staple of the genre, Dungeons Of Dredmor is a good choice. 

Also, it's entirely worth the $5 pricetag. Don't bother waiting for a sale, if you think you'd enjoy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041223925', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 86317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1558660490}
review: If you like rougelike/lites than you'll probably really love this. If you don't, you'll probably still like it due to the excellent humor, great art style and suprisinly accesible gameplay. Reminds me of munchkin

review: 画面比hack，slash，loot漂亮一点的rougelike，地城探险，标准d&d规则。喜欢这类的玩家可以玩玩，虽然我只研究了个把小时，但其实大家都知道rougelike本身耐玩度就很高，主页上有几百小时的评测。这游戏难度比较低，当作rougelike入门不错。我喜欢rouge like的一点是比较缓和，你不动敌不动，可以考虑清楚下一步该干什么。这是包里的游戏，带工坊和卡牌，比较划算。推荐一个。

author: {'steamid': '76561198029151201', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1171, 'last_played': 1494538276}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor, as a rogue-like, is somewhat easier than many I've played in the past. Nethack, Crawl, and others can be trickier. But while not quite as difficult per se, it nevertheless achieves a substantial amount of challenge with its own system. Though the in-game help is somewhat useless for many skills--it takes a wiki to sort through things and understand what things actually do--the flavor text used is just one small part of the game's overall sense of charm and humor. This is not a game that takes itself seriously in any sense of the word. It happily mocks and makes fun of any and everything, with tongue-in cheek descriptions of every item and monster in the game in such a way as to make you think you've wandered into a comedian's dream by mistake. The gameplay is particularly satisfying, especially when you conquer Monster Zoos, which are giant rooms filled with anywhere from 50 to 200 monsters. The modding community is rich, with gads of useful additions and fun additions to please all kinds of fans who want to see their favorite work in video games. I highly recommend this rogue-like for many many hours of fun dungeoneering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001905321', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1667242550}
review: Great dungeon crawling roguelike. I'd like it more if it had a volume based like sword of the stars the pit, NEO scavenger, and many action RPG's. This game's sense of humor is witty and clever, funny at all turns and makes a joke of nearly everything. Good time killer that's quite challenging after the first 3 levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069401174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2141, 'last_played': 1504489156}
review: If you're interested in the world of roguelikes, this is your starting point. If you are an old hand at roguelikes, this is the culmination of all you have ever wanted. My personal favorite roguelike game of all time - and I have played many. If you want an infinitely replayable dungeon crawling experience, this is the game for you. It was the first of the now 390 games I've purchased on Steam and I still play it. I mean it - if you want to have a loot-heavy dungeon searching adventure, look NO further.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980734862', 'num_games_owned': 1869, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 4945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2547, 'last_played': 1625223176}
review: Dungeons of Dreadmore is a great little rouge-lite. It has the option to turn off perma-death, which feels counter to the spirit of a rouge-like, but does allow you to get some of the more insane acheivements without getting to Dreadmore 50 times over. If you have never played a rouge-like, this is a fun, humerous, and relativly forgiving place to start.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988885194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1395713294}
review:
This is one of the best roguelikes I have ever played, and this is coming from a guy who generally HATES roguelikes. This game is incredibly well designed.

Unlike other roguelikes I feel the game actually gives me a leg to stand on and isn't out to screw me from the start. Its fair, something you usually don't hear in the same sentence when it comes to these games. The game wants you to succeed  and it wants you to have a good time.

I also love how huge the levels are, I spent about an hour and a half on the FIRST FLOOR! Seriously, I just kept finding new doors to kick open. It also means you will be sufficiently buff for the next level. Seriously, dont blow through them.

But in conclusion. While yes this game may not look like much on the outside give it a chance. Its tons of random fun and has charm for days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106857234', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 5731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1616306985}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005857751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 3245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3245, 'last_played': 1391808032}
review:
复古风格的Roguelike游戏，画面党首先可以退散了，其实在众多核心向的Roguelike游戏中，我才不会和你们说DoD已经算是画面非常好的一作了……
说到复古风格，这就是毫无剧情的下地牢踢门砍砍砍，除了商人以外连个友善的NPC都没有，挡在面前的一切生物全部轰杀干净就对了！而且当然要选择永久死亡，不是永久死亡的Roguelike不是好的Roguelike（抖M之心）～

游戏系统的最大特色是技能搭配，没有职业，而是从一大堆奇怪的技能里面选出（或随机出）若干技能来创造角色，因为游戏走的是幽默恶搞路线，所以有很多奇怪的东西，比如有Mathemagic这种听起来就很奇葩的技能树（其实数学法术非常好用，法师类最强辅助技能树），而各种技能和物品的描述也充满了捏他（比如克苏鲁神话这种万用梗当然不能少），可以感受到作者作为死宅的很多恶趣味。
在原版里面其实主要还是正常的技能树，比如各种武器精通啊防御强化啊法术流派啊制造啊之类的常见东西，而到了DLC里面各种技能树就越来越奇葩越来越莫名其妙了，比如最新的DLC里，有银行家、游客、共产主义者、偏执狂调查者、魔法律师（逆转裁判梗）等非常奇怪的东西，如果去论坛里挖Mod的话，还能找到更加诡异的技能树……

然后是缺点，首先游戏并不稳定经常崩溃，乃至于作者都做了一个关于崩溃的Steam成就来自嘲……好在自动存档和Steam云端备份，角色彻底丢失或者坏档的情况并不多，但还是会让人感到不爽；
另外就是各种技能描述提供的信息太少，如果不去Wiki看公式的话，很多技能（尤其是被动技能）光看描述根本不清楚是怎么作用的，当然简单难度非永久死亡模式这些信息可能并不是很重要，但至少给个数字或者伤害属性什么的让大家知道技能的强力程度啊；

最后就是平衡性的问题，有些技能非常逆天，有些技能存在感稀薄，而且最终Boss的打法是有限的，某些Build应对起来会很困难，比如近战物理系Build，基本唯一的活路就是设法堆到物免魔免，不然近身Boss后逃不开死亡率极高，而法师Build如果输出过于依赖亡灵系法术的话（亡灵系法术中期出了AoE大招以后可以一路横扫），会发现Boss根本是不吃那些属性的，需要另外准备一些恶心的方法来猥琐Boss，如果没准备好就等死吧——诸如此类，很大限制了Build的空间

不过总体而言DoD依然是Steam上少有的非常优秀的Roguelike游戏，而且粘性很大，为了获得最大乐趣欢迎选择永久死亡模式（不过死太多还是很让人沮丧的，毕竟游戏不简单，比如法师什么的后期一个手抖走位失败就挂了）

author: {'steamid': '76561198013924266', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1664674856}
review:
Being a huge fan of the old school rogue-likes, a la Nethack, ADOM and Angband, I've had my eye on this game for quite some time. I finally decided to pick it up and I am so happy I did. From my short playtime of the game, I am already in love with it.

Dungeons of Dredmor contains all manner of thinly veiled pop-culture references, right down to the title screens for the game, one of which is styled after the DOOM 1 box art, and another which resembles a classic Star Wars movie poster. If you are knowledgable about these kinds of things, you'll find A LOT to appreciate.

Aesthetically speaking, the game has a boatload of charm. The visuals are crisp and vibrant. The sounds are just right. The music is superb. It has got to be one of my favorite soundtracks I've ever heard in many years of gaming.

Don't let the cartoony visuals fool you though, because under the hood lies a deep and engrossing numbers game. There are quite a bit of stats, buffs, and skills to worry about. The skills are one of my favorite things about the game, as most of them are hilarious. For example, Emomancy. There, now go buy the game.

The amount of content you get for under 10 bucks is insane. Did you buy it yet? Go. Do it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015249668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 14511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8739, 'last_played': 1604475813}
review: Fantastic Rogue-like game. You can spend hours upon hours playing this game, and can sometimes spend at least half of one not even moving as you consider what you can and can't do.(Don't worry, your character has a handheld to pass the time). With a variety of skills to choose from, and vast arrays of items to pick up(and many different cheeses to devour) this game, especially at the time of this posting, being only $5, is by far one of the most worthwhile investments you could make. If you're a fan of silliness, Roguelikes, and turnbased games with lots of humor, this game is a winner. The free expansion pack is a nice add on, and the DLC is nice and cheap as well, and adds plenty of gameplay options, should you manage to beat Dredmor

author: {'steamid': '76561198013967417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 13961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8392, 'last_played': 1649127629}
review:
Never have I seen a game combine humor, challenging gameplay, and replay value as well as Dungeons of Dredmor. It takes the deep, varied gameplay of the ASCII rougelikes before it and layers on charming, occasionally over-the-top graphics and a very usable UI; all without sacrificing gameplay. Pros and Cons:

+Excellent combat system with a plethora of melee, ranged, or magical attacks.
+Crafting galore. Want a mace that smashes atoms? A dagger that cuts your enemy through 40 dimensions? A nice, warm pair of mittens? It's all there.
+The skills are amazing. Emomancy. Necronomiconomics. Fungal Arts. Piracy. There's the typical weapon proficiencies and rogue/warrior/mage schism, but everything's got a unique touch.
+Nigh-infinite replay value. Only limited by your own attention span. Every floor is randomly generated and every treasure is unique, and the skills add a lot of variance to gameplay.
+The DLC is amazing. It's not essential, but it adds so much to the game experience. I'd recommend it, especially if it's on sale.
+Modding. Now the replay value is infinite. The community's got a lot already, and it's only getting better.

-The humor's a little excessive. Personally, I love the corniness, but that's a matter of taste.
-Compared to existing roguelikes, it's a little slow. I credit that to the "accessible for non-veterans of roguelikes" part.

Best $5 I've ever spent on a game. Looking forward to more from Gaslamp Games.

review:
This is a very good game but I must point out now that you will get pretty annoyed at the fact that the game doesn't explicitly tell you when you are on low health. Compare this to other games where there is a warning system and this is poor show. I really do love this game though and have trouble faulting it elsewhere. I really only just get the crafting system and hope that they will add a filtering system to make it simpler. I will openly admit that this review is more of a shout to the developers in the hope to get some really important features in the game but there is oodles of content and hours of gameplay.

Protip: Don't annoy Brax

Gameplay - 9
Graphics - 8
Music - 8.5
Replay Value - 9.5
Overall - 9

author: {'steamid': '76561197998241176', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6323, 'last_played': 1684245203}
review:
Gaslamp Game’s first production, Dungeons of Dredmor, has accumulated quiet a cult following since its release two years ago, combining the unpredictability of rougelikes with the slick, mobile ready interface younger gamers have come to expect. But the fundamental issue with for-profit rougelikes are two-fold: they are directly challenging some of the greatest games ever made, and two, all of their competition is free. 

I will put my cards on the table. I am a diehard Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup fan. I play it on my phone when I’m waiting in line. I squeeze a quick game in before bed most nights. The depth, years of production, and meticulous balance are difficult to find outside of the RL genre. And, it’s absolutely, positively, 100% free. So when the competitor’s game starts off costing infinitely more than nothing, it’s already at a disadvantage. 

This is compounded by DoD’s other glaring flaw which is balance, or lack thereof. It is clear that the game was built, from concept to code to graphics, as a lark. Everything is a joke. All the references make it a blast to play. There are enough jokes that it even adds to replayability. But it also killed any shred of equality the game once had. Instead of picking a class and a race, as is standard with most RPGs, you pick seven skill trees which effect both passive stats and activated abilities, and go on your merry way. But pick the wrong trees, or wrong combination of trees, and you will find progression past a certain point impossible. For example, I would love to use the pole arm class. But the scarcity of the weapon itself, along with the subpar nature of the skill tree, makes it useless when compared to the sword or mace or even unarmed skills. About a fifth of the skill trees involve crafting, which in all cases is satisfactorily powerful, but turns the game from a fast paced dungeon romp into a painfully accurate hoarding simulation. Jokes about polishing your wand are great, I just wish the wand crafting skill was as much fun to use as it was to read about.

But in light of all this. In spite of the cost, regardless of the glaring flaws in the mechanics, I have still spent time playing this game, and avidly suggest it to friends who aren’t ready for a full on ASCII rougelike experience. It’s a fantastic gateway to a genre otherwise regarded as impenetrable. My issues arise from playing games like it for years, but for someone who doesn’t enjoy their eyes bleeding, a few extra dollars and inept skill trees will not sullen the experience. The controls are straight forward and predictable. And the experience is still that of a rouge like. All the frustration and theory crafting in a nice, accessible package. You will love this game. You will hate this game. But most importantly, you will play this game. You won’t spend all your time in menus figuring out how to quaff a potion, or figuring out what a certain object is. You will spend your time dying, and that’s what rougelikes are all about.

So if you’re looking for a new experience, and have no idea what a NetHack is or think Dwarf Fortress is a chapter out of Lord of the Rings, there is no better place to start than with Dungeons of Dredmor. If, like me, you have past experience with the genre, you may find the depth a bit lacking. But overall, I applaud the developers efforts to make a deserving medium accessible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985366058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1707879193}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003422887', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 10357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4270, 'last_played': 1692216552}
review:
This is a roguelike game designed as a send-up of the genre.  The jokes are hilarious, particularly if you've put as much time as I have into classic roguelikes such as Nethack or Angband, and the gameplay is quite good on its own.  As far as I've seen, it doesn't really have the puzzle-solving aspect of those games, it's purely tactical hacking.  The skill trees are amusing (of course) and fun to play around with.  

One drawback to Dredmor is that a lot of the controls are mouse based and every action is animated, making gameplay much slower than in the roguelikes I've played before.  This can be worked around with game options, and I would recommend playing with the speed turned up (use "+" key) and autopickup enabled.

If I have a few minutes to kill and am not in the mood for twitch zombie shooting, this will be at the top of my list.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986643754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1168, 'last_played': 1631690773}
review:
There's a never ending supply of nerdy in-jokes, references, and humor. A fantastic item crafting system. Great randomly generated levels. 


The only downside about this game is just how much time it could take out of your life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044669231', 'num_games_owned': 1471, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 12679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4946, 'last_played': 1644878233}
review: Great game, 85 hours played, just beat Dredmor for the first time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080396570', 'num_games_owned': 4315, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1391791621}
review:
Oddly charming and brutally difficult in parts, Dungeons of Dredmor is nonetheless a stellar addition to the roguelike genre.

Taking the role of the standard "young man on a quest for glory", Dredmor sets itself apart from the pack through a number of interesting and oft-hilarious mechanics, including varied skill trees, monsters who insult you with lines that could have been ripped out of The Secret of Monkey Island, a wide assortment of loot and armor (the descriptions are hilarious themselves) and a well-put together crafting system that rewards exploration and experimentation.

This is the kind of game you can easily lose 50 or so hours to, and I've barely scratched the surface myself. Well worth the price, and definitely a game that will appeal to any fan of the genre.

review: An amazing little rpg rogue like dungeon crawler. Some of the traits you take in the beginning turn out to be rather annoying later on in the game...vegan anyone?  But there are so many cool traits that it more than makes up for it.  This game will get many hours of enjoyment out of you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068792745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1545, 'last_played': 1438926344}
review:
Прекрасная rogue-like RPG абсолютно во всех аспектах. 9/10. (1 балл забираю за то, что вылетела пару раз во время прохождения. Впрочем, проходил давно, полагаю уже все исправили.)

Чем доставляет:

1) Разнообразие. Нет, даже лучше сказать _РАЗНООБРАЗИЕ_. Целая куча предметов, веток скиллов (я про те, которые выбираем при создании героя), монстров, ловушек. Много видов крафта. Не хочешь крафтить - покупай в магазине. Или воруй. Или убей владельца и забери все из магазина. Или... Есть, вообщем, интересные методы.
2) Графика. Полностью аутентичная и узнаваемая. Нет лишних деталей, но и не голые пиксели. Короче говоря, есть стиль, приятный глазу.
3) Механика. Скилами можно убить как монстров вокруг, так и себя. Рекомендую читать описания и вообще думать о том, как их сочетать. Можно сделать могучего мага, ловкого вора, а так бронированного воина. А еще можно сделать steam knight (For the empire!), туриста-коммуниста, повелителя плоти, второе явление Индианы Джонса... Просто попробуйте.
4) Юмор. Разработчики не стеснялись его применять. Читать описания способностей одно удовольствие. Как вам разбивание статуй главного злодея на каждом уровне с лозунгом "heroic vandalism?" Клево же. А наличие ядерной бомбы и вообще ветки скиллов коммуниста? Есть и более тонкие шутки, предлагаю поискать их самим.

Минусы: спрайтов монстров могло бы быть и побольше. Нет, их много, но часто мы видим перекрашенные аналоги только что убитого моба. Это огорчает.
Огорчает еще жуткий рандом и проблемы с поиском редких вещей. Порой половину прохождения находишь мусор. Впрочем, хардкорность этой игре только к лицу, чего это я?

Итого: мастхэв.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065136362', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3990, 'last_played': 1473964471}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072782214', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1583884721}
review:
Geiles Spiel, die Controls sind zwar gewöhnungsbedürftig, aber bei einem turnbased dungeoncrawler hat man ja Zeit zum rumprobieren.
Die Charaktergenerierung kann einem schon schnell ein Grinsen entlocken, da hier schon schnell klar wird, dass es sich um einen satirisch gemeinten Titel handelt.
Ein Haufen an Möglichkeiten, durch die schiere Masse an Fähigkeiten. Ein Vampir-Ninja mit Wikinger-Magie? Kein Problem!
Die Gegner sind ziemlich ausgefallen. Da findet man mal amazonische Hummelmenschen und sogar Baron Samedi ist dabei.
Ich empfehle den Permadeath-Modus. Permatote Charaktere werden nach dem aktuellen Ableben nochmal angezeigt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027428838', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1442, 'last_played': 1408649881}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990695543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2003, 'last_played': 1393184676}
review:
DoD is stupidly addictive and clearly made by people who love the roguelike-turnbased-dungeoncrawler genre. Many of the enemies, items, and skills are genuinely weird, but if you read the descriptions they're often funny and clever too.

Much of the replayability comes from the 35 different skillsets (51 with all DLC) of which you pick 7 each game. These range from your standard Sword & Archery specialties, to Piracy & Archaeology, to originals like "Fleshsmithing" and "Mathemagic". I'd recommend starting with standard weapon & shield skills along with Promethian Magic and Psionics. Leave the Necronomiconomics and Killer Vegan skills for a later challenge :)

Oh and there's optional crafting (weapons, traps, potions, magic wands, etc) with pretty big loot tables too.

My only criticisms: the randomized sidequests are somewhat indecipherable and lame (but hey, treasure), and there's no way the game could be played well with a gamepad due to inventory and hotkey management.

If you're still not sold, hey, the game has at least 9 types of cheese and 13 kinds of fungus for your character to eat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000338650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1656179155}

author: {'steamid': '76561198113377380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2242, 'last_played': 1709531888}
review:
This is definitely one of my favorite games.  If you're looking for something casual and highly entertaining, this is a great choice. It's got so much replay value.

You are the next unfortunate adventurer, in a long line of unfortunate adventurers, to try and take down the evil Lord Dredmor who dwells at the lowest level of the dungeon. By selecting 7 skill trees, you can build a wide variety of character types. The fun of it is trying to find the right build, and with a little luck, you might even get to Dredmor.
I've personally only gotten to him once in at least 50 hours of play, but I usually play on permadeath because it really makes every decision count.

The game developers have a great sense of humor and the game does not take itself too seriously. Items and monsters have hilarious names and descriptions - some of which is hidden commentary on society. Everything about this game is witty and ridiculous which is what makes it so fun. And it's so affordable. If you like dungeoneering games, just get this now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041438666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 12115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6240, 'last_played': 1580423956}
