author: {'steamid': '76561197973902423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1631244515}
review: I really enjoy this game. It's one of the better Rogue-like type dungeon crawlers I've played recently. Tons of stuff to find and do. It is certainly on my recommend list!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025468901', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 531, 'playtime_forever': 6864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5699, 'last_played': 1613317420}
review:
This game is aaaawwwwwweeeeesome!

I haven't beat it yet, but the fun is in the journey, not in the winning.
And a near endless supply of communtiy mods and regularly released cheap DLC makes this a complete winner!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020672164', 'num_games_owned': 2075, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1477158463}
review: Rogue like жанр во всём своём великолепии. Dungeons of Dredmor - Это несомненно одна из лучших игр, в которые я когда-либо играл. Приятная графика, искрометный юмор, генерация рандомных данжей и куча возможностей в игре делает её одним из ваших незабываемых путешествий в потусторонний мир видеоигровых прелестей. Здесь есть всё что вам нужно, и всё, что не отпустит вас до тех пор, пока вы вдоволь не наиграетесь. Игра местами довольно сложная, имеет пермаментную смерть, а соответственно бросает вам вызов. Если честно, мне пока не удалось её пройти ни разу, но я был близок, и эта близость к финалу так и не даёт мне покоя, из-за чего я буду запускать её вновь и вновь. Также картину дополняет сообщество, которое изредка делает различные модификации игры в плане дополнительных вещей и скиллов, которых даже изначально в игре предостаточно, что не может не радовать. Вам определенно стоит в это сыграть, попробуй - ещё захочешь. C'mon dummy, try to beat this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020096947', 'num_games_owned': 1079, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1387, 'last_played': 1702427709}
review: A great into to the roguelike genere that isn't too punnishing nor takes itself too seriously. The humor alone is worth it. Great at teaching basic, nescesary roguelike concepts with plenty of room for mistakes. Add in the plethora of amazing workshop content, and you have a real winner.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994805177', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1385564872}
review:
Если вам нравятся ролевые игры, вы фанатеете от настольных игр, вам кажется что бегать и стрелять, это не для вас?
Тогда эта игра отлично подойдёт вам!
Создайте своего героя, наделите его способностями, убивайте монстров, и становитесь лучше!
Кажется просто? Тогда начните играть, и эта игра затянет вас надолго!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028292142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1491087919}
review: Great game.  I definitely recommend you try it out if you enjoy roguelikes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054393567', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 2181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2022, 'last_played': 1422122523}
review: Dungeons of dredmor is an example of "don't judge a book by its cover". Initially, it looks poorly made, but once you start playing you can find yourself immensed in the game. There are tons of items, craftables and combinations to make. Battle is fluent despite of being turn based, and there are plenty of class and spell combinations to try out. Overall it has a great variety for such a "small" game! A big plus is also the fact that there are several difficulty levels, including a "softcore" mode where dying doesn't mean game over. This makes it equally enjoyable for hardcore roguelike fans as well as more casual players who would like to give the genre a try. Strongly recommended :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197980319153', 'num_games_owned': 1434, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1373574054}

review: There's a thing called a Dwarven Ingot Press. You use it to turn ore into ingots. You can also use it to turn bread and cheese into a grilled cheese sandwich. How can you not play this game?

author: {'steamid': '76561198024520803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 26356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9295, 'last_played': 1670197360}
review: Hands down one of my favorite rouge-likes, and I've found myself diving into the Dungeons of Dredmor every so often when I need a break from other games.   The art is clean and simple, and the skillsets you can choose when creating your character make every single playthrough its own unique challenge.  Besides that, Dungeons of Dredmor provides modding support, and Gaslamp Games(Dungeons of Dredmor's creators) have a small but very passionate and dedicated group of modders. Rougish Rennovations and Fax Pax mods turn the base game into a very, very strange, and very, very fun place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012376207', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 5708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5689, 'last_played': 1469681533}
review: This is a Roguelike done right: you can play casually and die horribly in a thousand ways and that's fun. Or you can take it a bit more seriously and get really close to winning before dying horribly and that's frustrating fun. Or you can play really really seriously and actually win the thing and that is freaking awesome. But however you play there's good art, excellent music, and tons and tons and TONS of items with great descriptions for you to read through. Add on the crafting system and all the skill trees and this game is basically just built out of replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053639666', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 9542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2735, 'last_played': 1612654161}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is an excellently done Rouge-like RPG game. With the huge ammount of different skills, all of which are completely unique, all the references in the game and also all the humor that is in it, the game feels like no other one. All the expansions (DLCs) are really well done and it feels that they are actually a big part of the game. My favourite DLC (or expansion) is "Conquest of the Wizardlands", adding the ability to customize your pocket dimension, find magical graffiti in the dungeon and use the codes from the magical graffiti in your pocket dimension to open "Portals to distant lands", one of them being the "Diggle Hell". Dungeons of Dredmor is one of the best RPG games I have ever seen. It is addictive as hell, you can play it always and it never gets boring, because every time you play, the dungeon is completely different. The reason why it's not a 10/10 is that I would like to see the gear I wear on my character when it is equipped. That feature feels missing from the game. 

Final Rating: 9 / 10
MUST OWN

author: {'steamid': '76561198023913125', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 4147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3484, 'last_played': 1497031456}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067554990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2593, 'last_played': 1399793777}
review: One of the first indie dungeon crawlers, one of the fathers of its genre, excelent, well balanced with a very interesting set of skills to choose from and very funny situations that the player gets involved in. Must have for anyone who enjoys DUNGEON CRAWLING and good old school unforgiving randomicity factor of the RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991758277', 'num_games_owned': 2422, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 4836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3639, 'last_played': 1666930560}
review:
This game is the funniest game I think I've ever played.  It's hard like year-old bread, but I think the (many) deaths you'll meet are fair.  Definitely don't expect your first character to live to the bottom of the dungeon though, it has a somewhat steep learning curve.

+ Truly Hilarious
+ Challenging
+ Customizable -- thousands of skill combinations

- Takes a while (5 hours, maybe?) to really get past the learning curve.
- For everything being randomly generated, you'll sure see a lot of repetitious graphics.

Would value the game at $15 or $10 and DLC at $5 (Realm of the Diggle Gods is best, I think)

author: {'steamid': '76561198070769462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1662413802}
review:
This is a fun dungeon game that doesn't take itself seriously, and that's great. Flavor text on everything makes me smile, and often breaks the fourth wall: when you bash & destroy a statue of the bad guy, the game calls it "heroic vandalism!"
You choose several talent trees at start from a large assortment (add more via Steam Workshop!) and those determine your starting weapon/abilities. There's an option to toggle at start for Permadeath, so you can play it like a Rogue-alike or with save games as you desire.
Nothing serious, nothing complicated, just good fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975391706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 25976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9197, 'last_played': 1706683149}
review: I think my time on record should indicate that, yes, this is a very good game. A nice introduction to roguelikes, easy to pick up but deep enough to keep veterans of the genre interested. Excellent art style, impeccably funny writing, and it's cheap.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197998896192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1768, 'last_played': 1470223747}
review:
"любая достаточно продвинутая магия неотличима от технологии" - цитата из игры.
 
что-то очень странное. написать мнение будет пожалуй довольно сложно, да я пожалуй и не буду. что там есть:
 
минусы: графон, сюжет состоит из примерно 15 сточек.
 
плюсы: продолжительность, разнообразие.
 
НЕВНЯТНТНАЯ ХУЙНЯ: 15+ типов дамага(каждый из которых может быть ближним или дистанционным...). отсылки буквально на каждом шагу: шарфики повелителей времени, тардис трёх видов, грызлодёры, федерация космоволшебников, вампиры очаровывают врагов блестяшками, великий маг тесла, святая ручная граната... 

коммунистическое древо скилов. 24 характеристики персонажа. я имею в виду тех которые отображаются. секретную я заметил одну, но может быть их там больше. генерация уровней. уровней там кстати 15 штук + не меньше 50 порталов (каждый на отдельный мини-уровень. мини-уровень может быть размером с обычный). куча веток скилов - смотрите ачивки. куча ачивок. куча крафт-рецептов, куча крафт-механизмов, куча бафов и дебафов, куча, куча, куча... 
 
да, это гриндилка. да, это гриндилка с разрушаемостью. да, это гриндилка с разрушаемостью и размером больше второй диаблы, по всем параметрам.
 
и это - тот странный случай когда игра должна быть бесплатной, но любая сумма которую вы заплатите будет недостаточной.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032733066', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1580764001}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047161267', 'num_games_owned': 1150, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 18885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9493, 'last_played': 1654202929}
review:
Jeu de rôle de style rogue-like/dungeon crawler... Quelques uns le classe aussi dans le style "mais pourquoi je l'ai pas acheté plus tôt". Je crois que juste mon nombre d'heure joué témoigne d'à quel point je conseil ce jeu, mais dans le cas échéant, voici ce qui peut être trouvé dans ce jeu qui peut ou ne pas être inclus dans les jeux similaires :

1. Rejouabilité : Joueur une partie peut probablement durer jusqu'à 4-5 heures, peut-être plus dépendant de la quantité d'effort qu'on y met et du temps de réflexion utilisé. Sinon, dans la plupart des cas, vous pourrez jouer au moins 2-4 parties dans ce lapse de temps. Donc si on prends une moyenne de 1 heure et demi, j'ai environ 100 parties de jouées. Et à celà il faut ajouter le temps que j'ai joué avant d'acheter le jeu sur steam (les mise à jours automatiques c'est divin). Donc J'ai probablement au moins 2-300 parties de jouées... Et je recommence quelques heures à chaques mois, encore.

2. Personnalisation : Pour chaque partie, le joueur choisis 7 compétences différents qu'il mélangera afin de réussir à conquérir le dongeon. Je crois que je n'ai pas encore rencontré une seule personne qui n'avait pas de "build" préféré, sa stratégie infaillible avec 2-3 compétences qui sont tout simplement trop forte. Le seul hic, c'est que je n'ai jamais entendu la même combinaison une seule fois.

3. Hasard : Comme pour tout dungeon crawler, il faut un peu de hasard pour rendre les choses plaisantes. DoD se régale de hasard, mais uniquement dans les endroits intéressants. tous les dégâts sont fixes (avec exception de bloc/critiques/etc.) et dans la plupart des as, les combats sont plutôt prévisibles.

4. Difficulté : 3 niveau de difficulté. Initiation, Petite partie plaisante et Cette fois-ci c'est la bonne. En gros, comme le système est assez développé, il faudra au moins 4-5 parties avant de réelement comprendre ce que vous faites (encore plus si vous prenez les DLC dès le début). Ensuite, la difficulté Dwarven Moderation (normal) devient un peu facile pour certains, alors tu a le choix de perdre à la difficulté la plus haute. Personnellement, j'ai réussi le niveau difficile peut-être une fois seulement, et c'était avec un truc qui a été ôté la patch d'après. Sinon, si je veux simplement tuer Dredmor, j'enfile une partie à facile sans expansions et je peux la compléter en ~1 heure habituellement.

5. Humour : DoD a choisi de ne pas suivre les traces de plusieurs Roguelike avec un univers immersif. DoD a choisi plutôt d'être accessible à tous. Si vous ne comprenez pas une seul blague dans les 15 premières minutes, vous avez un problème de culture. Chaque item, la majorité des compétences/magies, et quelques monstres/salles sont des références envers d'autres jeux/évenements/personnes. En plus d etout celà, la note reste tout de même très humoristique.

6. Extensibilité : La seule raison que je pourrais ne pas conseiller les expansions, c'est qu'il est possible de jouer plusieurs milliers d'heures sans elles. La plateforme est fixe, mais son contenu modifiable, et avec la Steam Workshop, il est très facile de trouver ce que l'on veut. Par contre, avec les expansions, la plateforme est étendue, le code plus modifiable et il y a plus de mods de disponibles.


Conclusion, si je ne pouvais garder qu'un seul jeu pour le restant de ma vie, DoD pèserait lourd dans la balance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971246627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1420245989}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991310485', 'num_games_owned': 3910, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 2238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1042, 'last_played': 1611484532}
review:
Great game! love the humor, art style, ironman mode, crafting system, replayability, its a rogue game!

For the more casual player dificulty can be set and you can disable the iron man mode. However i really recomend you to keep the default settings. SInce one of the great things about the game is that you die!. Every play trough is diferent so you wont get bored soon. Later on if you are more knowledgable about the game you can customize your character to your play style. The game is Dirt cheap for what it brings! so low risk to try out even if you doubt on buying it! you wont regret :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197964229326', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1373646763}
review: I normally like roguelikes, but this one just isn't for me. I think it's the overly long combat animations that kill it for me. I like roguelikes to be playable at my own pace, and I don't like being slowed down by watching repetitive animations every time I melee a monster. I also don't like the insane number of stat and resistance icons, of which I can never remember what any of them are. Normally I'm all for complexity in games, but I think this is a bit much!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019353968', 'num_games_owned': 1091, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4780, 'last_played': 1682712546}
review:
Данженс оф Дредмор пиздатая игруха отвал башки просто. Ты прикинь ходишь по всяким ебеням собираешь шмот и гасишь мобов - ну просто пиздец! А в самом конце злоебучий босс и хрен ты его завалишь я в первый раз ваще охуел! 
   А еще там есть статуи ну типо венера мелоская или как там ее они кароч тебе квесты всякие дают типа приноси то или вальни кого прям как в фаллаче и дает тебе шмот, а шмота там просто завались там и бронька чувака из дума и штаны эмси хаммера - полный улет.
   Еще есть всякая магия - фаерболы и прочая ересь когда мобов гасишь можна поднять левал и качать умения типо призыв пиздюков или сильно ебнуть молотом. Еще можно ламать стены!
   Поц с района сказал это типо называется рагалик по басурмански так что теперь рагалики мой любимый жанр (ну естесьно после контры). Так что всем советую - просто охуеете, и графон заебись (для рагаликов). А еще забыл сказал там все пошагово так что можно под пивас спокойно шпилить. DLC тоже не хуе-моё рекомендую.
   Батя жаль не играет грит нихуя не понятно

author: {'steamid': '76561198003053704', 'num_games_owned': 4569, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 2030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2030, 'last_played': 1373941330}
review: This must be the best rogue-like game I've played so far. Full of inteligent jokes. High replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993751799', 'num_games_owned': 1019, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 8968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7249, 'last_played': 1706462740}
review:
Очень редкий представитель классического жанра rogue-like RPG, в который неискушённый человек может играть, не разбивая клавиатуру в попытках запомнить сотни комбинаций клавиш, и не ломая себе глаза, пытаяся углядеть своё альтер-эго в мешанине текстур и ASCII-символов.

В этой игре абсолютно всё создано для того, чтобы вызывать у Вас глупую улыбку каждый раз, когда вы видите очередного монстра, подбираете новую шмотку или получаете новый уровень. Только тут вы можете сражаться мечом, на который нанизаны полоски бекона с демоном, пытающимся "затверкать" вас до смерти, получить с него электрифицированный дорожный конус и счастливо отпраздновать победу кусочком изысканного норвежского сыра с бутылочкой редкой грушевой водки.

Лично я не знаю примеров других игр за 100 рублей, за которыми я бы мог провести более 100 часов реального игрового времени.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026527926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 3546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1655755244}
review:
Will be fun for some but you need to know what you are getting; this is definitley old school (game play is very similar to circa 1980's Hack and Rogue, but without the permadeath)

At the begining of the game you select a difficulty level and make your character by selecting several skill sets from a large menu, and give it a name.  You then go into the dungeon, fight monsters, gather treasure, level up (gaining new powers within those skill sets with each level).

author: {'steamid': '76561198035355869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 9545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3122, 'last_played': 1526709911}
review:
Pros: great aesthetic and tileset, great sense of humor, neat music, tons of replayability as per the genre, customizable and easily modded, fair game (includes the ability to toggle permanent death)

Cons: lacks detailed explanation of many of the abilities and items, slightly bugged interface, too many items all over the place, random generation has made certain areas of floors totally inaccessible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045798225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1373949394}
review:
For a rogue-like, it's a great starting point to start understanding the genre. As a game in it's self, it's filled to the brim with humorous writing, references, and even it's own amazing catchphrases("Lutefisk for the Lutefisk god"). The writing in total is top notch, every monster has it's own blurb of information which is usually funny and sometimes giving a game a 2nd layer above a classic rogue-like; which often had minimalistic graphics, and serious toned writing. 

If you are looking for a entry level rogue-like, Dungeons of Dredmor is for you. Heck, even if you are used to dungeon crawlers and/or rogue-likes this game can give you a challenge at the hardest difficulty, and you can make the game easy, hilarious, painstakingly frusturating based on your skill selection. For example, being a warrior class character with sword skills, perception, heavy armor, and your own choice of 2 other skills can make the game easy and basic. But if you are willing to play something a little off...

You could always be the Bishop Viking Fleshmancing Vampire Mathematician that you know you are inside.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998850076', 'num_games_owned': 2238, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 3714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3009, 'last_played': 1561567732}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is a satisfyingly deep roguelike with absolutely loads of content, humor, and fun. There are many skill trees to master, potions to brew, weapons and armor to smith, and enemies to kill. The music is wonderful, the art style is great, the writing injects humor into every item and skill.  The game can be very challenging on harder difficulty levels but if you don't feel up to the challenge, there are easier difficulties that ensure even the least experienced heroes can make it to the end. The Steam Workshop allows you to download even more skills, things to craft, enemies, and other assorted goodness, as well as share your own creations with other people. The game has three dlcs, two paid one free, all of which add a significant amount of new skills, items, gameplay mechanics and other things that extend the replay value of the game a great deal. Overall a very deep experience with loads of challenge, lots of replay value, and so many different ways to play it will keep you entertained for quite some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017112736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1407320240}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992806554', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 19030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4343, 'last_played': 1539362299}
review:
In 1980 a game called 'Rogue' was born. Since then, a genre known as Rogue-like was born.
A rogue-like game typically features a randomised dungeon, turn based movement and a plethora of skills and items at your disposal. Classic RPG weapons and armor, wizardry and sneaky rogues fighting monsters, all drably illustrated with ASCII graphics.

Dungeons of Dredmor takes all that, slaps on a easy mouse interface, some charming graphics and audio, and chucks on some good humour to boot. This is quite possibly the only game - now and forever - where I can roll a beserker viking pirate communist emo vegan. Monsters will waltz up to me moaning "I wasn't even supposed to be here today". It won't make you laugh until your face falls off, but it'll have you smirking with the occasional "hah!" throughout.


If you're just curious and never tried a rogue-like before, give it a shot. It's a fairly simple game, but with enough hardcore depth to have you reaching for the wiki once you get into it. It also has a range of addons found on the Steam workshop, so there's never an end to the strange setups you can employ and the delightful humour it prizes. It's often on a 75% off sale during holiday periods, and at that price it's well worth a dabble and beyond good value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012193199', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2677, 'last_played': 1627574079}
review:
A great rogue-like with tons of humor elements that make it a bit more entertaining. There's lots of (silly) skill trees and Steam Workshop has some great mods for skill trees and one great thing for more items. It also has graphics which is a big step forward for rogue-likes

P.S. It is a true rogue-like, okay? not a rogue-like-like but a rogue-like? it's not like a like a like a rogue-like but it's plain rogue-like with rogue-like permadeath and rogue-like turns and rogue-like random generation. Rogue-like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007646141', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2156, 'last_played': 1385203751}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025922187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 61618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19354, 'last_played': 1693770729}
review:
Do you like D&D and related fantasy RPGs? Fond of Rogue and its hoard of -like successors? Easily amused by nerdy jokes in flavour text and tool tips or by pop culture references in the names of achievements? Want to pretend you're a game developer and name an expansion pack? Then Dungeons of Dredmor is the Roguelike for you!

It's also a pretty good little time-wasting game in and of its own right, even if the things above don't apply. Even if you don't get the expansion packs, the base game will occupy plenty of your time, so long as you have a hankering for wandering dungeons, picking up loot and learning what potions do by the time honoured method of drinking them and hoping it wasn't horrible poison. DoD is a Roguelike, obviously, so anyone with a low tolerance for RNG-related failure or starting over for the 8th time this morning should either avoid it or only play on Elves Just Wanna Have Fun Difficulty with permadeath off. The pointy-eared wimps. Dredmor lacks a traditional Class system - your character has a set of Skill trees which you pick out of a pretty long list from the obvious (Shieldmaster) to the slightly more bizarre (Tourist). These make for some weird and wonderful synergies as you combine your Vampiric powers of sparkling with Necroeconomics. A large part of the fun comes from exploring these skill trees - what exactly does a Magical Lawyer Clockwork Knight with Burglary and Viking Wizardry end up like?

Like any Rogeulike, DoD can suffer from repetitive grind, but there's enough different skills to mess around with that it stands up to some pretty heavy play without becoming wearing too quickly. And any game can get dull if you spend too much time with it. There are a few issues, like the way that magic/missile builds can be the only way to win (assuming you ever actually GET to Lord Dredmor himself) and the crafting system is... well, functional. When you get to higher crafting levels, the lack of filters or a basic search option in the crafting menu is a little irksome. And, of course, the RNG plays a big factor in what ingredients and which blueprints you get to play around with. But these are minor flaws that don't detract from  Dredmor's overall experience. And since it has Steam Workshop, you can get around some of these with mods.

Fun, funny Rogue-like and arguably the one responsible for the recent run of Roguelikes with graphics or Roguelike-lites as some folks refer to them. Also, pretty darn cheap and comes with Trading Cards for those of us who like that kind of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010984097', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1500528525}
review:
Its hidden gem...for some people.
It's strange how I can see most of the things right about this game being very bad for others. It's not for everyone for sure, but it's very well with what it is trying to be, an old roguelike game.
If you give this game a chance you may find that it has a great sense of humor and great catches, it's not that complex as it looks.
If you look at it and liked what you saw, give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995886022', 'num_games_owned': 1202, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1391549451}
review: Rich RPG Roguelike experience.  Reminds me of the best parts of NetHack.  Will run on ANYTHING.  Difficulty is as high as you would expect from a Roguelike, but you can also play where there are reloadable saves, which is a lifesaver.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981717653', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1493, 'last_played': 1482339979}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmore is one of those games I just can't stay away from. It is a fun rogue-like dungeon crawler with good humor. In order to play you need to create your own character with 7 traits selected from a nice and big list. You can choose your weapon styles, magic types and crafting.

With a total of 51 traits you can create a lot of unique character to explore the dungeons of Dredmore. A few examples of the crazy traits are: Emomancy, Tourist and Clockwork Knight. All these traits come with their own ability, so you can choose your wacky Emomancy Tourist and start making all the monsters in the dungeons depressed while taking pictures of them.

There is also a crafting system in the game which you can use to create potions, weapons and armor. There are a lot of materials to create armor from. From plastic to steel, they got it all.

The dungeon intself is random generated so crawling will never be the same. Look out for the crazy Monster Zoo's though. They create madness!

If you are a fan of rogue-like dungeon crawlers or just looking for a fun and hard game to mess around with, I would highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011061469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1384054025}
review:
Some time ago, I was given a Steam gift card. I can't remember what I spent it on, but I know that I had a few dollars left and wanted to get rid of my credit. So, I see that there's this game called "Dungeons of Dredmor" on sale for about what I have left. "Hm, this game looks fun." I think to myself. "Kind of simple, maybe, but I could get my money's worth in less than an afternoon. Why not!" And so I purchased Dungeons of Dredmor. 

The fact that I remember buying Dungeons of Dredmor and not the rest of my gift card's value should speak to what I think of this game.

First and foremost, this is NOT a "simple" game. There is a vast amount of depth here, particularly when it comes to crafting. I've hardly scratched the surface of what Dungeons of Dredmor has to offer, and I can say that it's one of the best roguelike RPGs availavle today. The gameplay is far from revolutionary, but is also very effective. The graphics are charming, and the writing is at times hilarious. Additionally - for a "roguelike", it's surprisingly approachable. The inclusion of permadeath toggle and multiple difficulty settings allows Dungeons of Dredmor to function as a truly hardcore roguelike, or as a more forgiving dungeon crawler. 

I do suggest buying the expansions for this game, if you do choose to buy it. Some of the skills and features included serve to even out the experience in some much-needed ways. On that note, Dredmor certainly isn't perfect. Choosing skills always feels like a lottery, with almost no description of what they actually do. The game itself can be equally cryptic, and expect to alt-tab to your internet browser of choice more than once during your stay in the Dungeon. Of course, the game IS a roguelike, so saying that it's "difficult" or "cryptic" isn't really a detriment, but rather something to keep in mind if you have no experience with RPGs like this. However, I stand by my point that Dungeons of Dredmor serves as an appropriate "entry-roguelike", with the potential to scale alongside the player's ability.

Dungeons of Dredmor, for being equal parts deep and approachable, having solid gameplay and graphics, clever writing, and minimal complaints, gets six out of seven stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999657451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1533, 'last_played': 1385423952}
review: If you're looking for a a game to get into rougelike Rpgs then I would say this is a good place to start. With the addition of steamworkshop this game is an ever expanding title, it can also be as hard or as easy as you want. The randomly generated dungeons give this game A huge amount of replayability. Definitely A buy if you are into RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021087523', 'num_games_owned': 2915, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1790, 'last_played': 1508890467}
review:
I will never beat Dungeons of Dredmor.

Yep, I said it, never. I have countless hours logged, and I haven't seen a good 70% of this game. But I love it.

With the recent rush of Rogue-likes and Roguelikes, and RogueLITES, and Rogue-like-likes, this is a down to earth Roguelike. This is your Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup, your Nethack, your TOME, but more accessible.

For starters, there is music, and art, and a good interface. Then throw in all those potions, and spells and weapons and armor that have all those stats and may or may not screw you over, a crafting system, incredibly humorous flavor text, and a huge modding scene and you have a game that costs next to nothing ($7 for everything (not including the FREE DLC)) that will last you a life time.

I might not be able to beat it, but maybe you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011740183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1466705401}
review: This game really took the traditional roguelike and made it their own. It really feels like the old school ASCII games but with tons of comedy and great art. Very difficult as well, which is a huge plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962089970', 'num_games_owned': 903, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2686, 'last_played': 1410921857}
review:
Yesterday I picked up a copy of Dungeons of Dredmor by Gaslamp Games on Steam for a deliriously low price. I had previously seen the game-play trailer on the Steam store page but wasn't sure about picking up the title until I saw this video from The Cynical Brit. Who, by the way, is awesome, and not just because his English accent makes everything just slightly funnier.

Dungeons of Dredmor is basically an old-school roguelike game, similar to Angband. It's got all of the typical roguelike features: it's really hard, you die a lot, there's random junk everywhere, there's tons of monsters, you die a lot, etc etc. What it adds to the genre is, wait for it... graphics! Don't get me wrong, roguelikes are great, I've had a lot of fun with Angband, but monochrome text characters gets a little tiring. Also, I have a mouse; it is not a new invention; it is wonderful for controlling things. Dredmor is capable of understanding the mystical signals that emanate from mice, it's amazing!

What's especially great about the game is that it really doesn't take itself very seriously. Everything is silly and strange and ridiculous. For example, my character specializes in growing mushrooms. No, seriously, I grow mushrooms on the corpses of my slain enemies. And then I eat them (the mushrooms). You can get suits of armor made out of bright pink plastic. There's references to all sorts of pop-culture and even terribly obscure geek culture. Just before going to bed last night I found a "Horadric Lutefisk Cube". If you don't get the reference, then you are a poor and sad creature and I pity you.

Of course if you don't like roguelikes, you probably won't like this game very much. It's about as old-school as you can get and still be a new game though. Luckily, they've also implemented 3 difficulty settings, and the ability to disable permadeath, for, you know, giant pussies. Which does make the game a lot more approachable.

But where else can you throw baseballs at demons that do lightning damage?

author: {'steamid': '76561197976824494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1338706800}
review: amazingly deep roguelike deep dungeon. not for the weak of gamer

author: {'steamid': '76561198064673186', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1390696331}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor... It's a little hard to explain to people who've never played it. You design a character around specific skills and then explore the randomly generated dungeon in a turn based style. It's not quite long, but it's pretty difficult. It's pretty entertaining, and it's sense of humor is spot on. It shows that it's an indie title with a few polish issues, and unbalanced skill set. The built in tutorial get's the job done, but doesn't quite explain how to set up your characters, or show the finer points of the game. Overall, it comes recommended with a 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036763912', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 14045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11751, 'last_played': 1670162895}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is, in one word, the-seriously-best-game-ever.

No? Well, maybe I'm overstating. But it's definitely one of the best -if not THE best- Roguelike I've ever played. I will always return to this game. It will constantly captivate me in its shiny roguelike eyes. Maybe it's because every character you make can have a new and exciting build. Maybe it's because no run-through is exactly the same. Maybe it's because there's actual crafting that's better than in some big name MMO's. Maybe it's because your death is always your own damn fault. Or maybe it's because diggles are so cute (but they hate you so much). I don't know, probably all of the above (definitely). I will always love this game and this game will always show me a good time. If you know what I mean. And I think you do.

Negatives? The humor is sometimes a little too much, I think, like every-blooming-thing needed to be funny. Oh, there's funny in there, but sometimes you just want the flavor texts to give it a rest already. Furthermore, I guess the art style turns off some people, not me personally, but I've heard it as a complaint. I can understand that, but my advice would be to ignore it and just try it.

You won't be disappointed. 10/10, great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045898730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1412323256}
review: Great game to pass the time!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982557772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1416299757}
review: Wow, I bought this game on a whim because I am looking forward to their next game Clockwork Empire.  I never thought I would love this game.  I love it.  It's silly nature and entertaining gameplay make this a must have for any rogue-like fan out there.  The thing that really shines in my eyes are the skill tree's. They are fun and zaney and some of them will modify others and some work so well together.  I only wish there were a little better animations associated with the fighting. IE I have a shield but it doesnt show one.  A few little things like that, but just that little things.  This game is well worth the small sticker price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060219701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1984, 'last_played': 1463692072}
review: Despite the silly premise and the overall goofy sense of humour, DoD is a deep and challenging game. You'll die a lot before you come to grips with the mechanics, but each failed run will also teach you something and make you tackle the next dungeon with more efficiancy. If you like sinking some hours into a game that always has a new surprise waiting around the next corner, this one's well worth a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985491761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1386237151}
review:
With an interesting death mechanic that forces you to restart with a new strategy this game has kept me coming back time and again. I would say though that I switched the game to easy for a couple of deaths to learn how it works before really learning to enjoy the experience.

"Rogue-Like","Dungeon Crawler","RPG"

author: {'steamid': '76561197961093505', 'num_games_owned': 4612, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 6560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3617, 'last_played': 1693907440}
review:
You're going to play this game a lot. You're going to die a lot. Then you're going to find the right confluence of events--the right build, the right layouts, the right items--that make you feel good. Feel like you've accomplished something. Feel like this time, this could be the run, this could be your victory.

You're going to lose anyway. you're going to swear as you lose that there's someone laughing in the back of your head, a cood, mocking laughter you don't hear so much as feel.

That is Dredmor.

Welcome to Dredmor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973923018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 14875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14446, 'last_played': 1457904380}
review:
I sat down to play Dredmor one night, and then I realised 248 hours had passed and the sun had come up 10 times... or was it 11?

Dredmor is a turn-based procedurally generated dungeon crawler (with the option for permadeath) in which you clear out a dungeon level by level until you hit the bottom and kill the final boss - a pretty simple premise and no back-story to speak of; but that's okay, this game is all about the gameplay, and the loot (oh so much loot).

The crafting system is pretty well designed and there's a lot of cool stuff to make (such as chainswords!!) but it's also kind of a pain because it's hard to know what scrap metals and garbage to keep in your limited inventory as you won't have access to all the blueprints at the start of each play-through, and you rely on randomly finding the right ones.

Dredmor has all the standard RPG skill trees like swordplay and archery, but it also includes some pretty weird skill trees such as mathemagician, tourist, and communist. The best thing is that, regardless of what seven skills you pick for your character, you are not locked into using certain types of equipment. If you find it, you can use it regardless of class or level. This means you can just play the character any way you want to, which is a lot more fun than being locked into the standard warrior, mage, or thief classes like in many other RPGs.

Dredmor includes lots of references to other games and popular culture, and it kind of reminds me of older games that didn't have to be so serious. This really gives the game the extra shot of charm it needs to help you look past it's flaws (and there's a lot of flaws in Dredmor, I just choose to ignore them because it's so much fun).

9 out of 10, would grind (and there's a lot of grinding to be done, but it's a good kind of grind).

author: {'steamid': '76561198078923958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 10119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1299, 'last_played': 1551153628}
review:
Отличная игра, правда не нравится мне такого типа пошаговые бои. Возьмешь вещь когда тебя пинают, и пока не выбросишь, не ударишь.
Хм, мне так кажется, или выбор наклонности эмо дает бонус к регену здоровья этак раз в три хода, интересно. До этого выбирал другие варианты, ничего такого читерного не было.
Что могу дополнить об игре. Тут наверно наилучший юмор из всех рогаликов, да и сложность одна видимо из самых хардкорных.
Зачастую, не знаешь что ждет тебя за дверью, так как враги вполне могут рендомно меняться(несколько сейвов стер из за слишком мощных).

Игра вообще все подряд пародирует, в этом она пожалуй зашла максимально далеко. У сторонника коммунизма воруют деньги под лозунгом - Все лучшее в Кремль! - и так далее.
А ведь у меня в активе, ещё меньше половины полностью открытых веток)

ЗЫ. Не советую часто заходить в Мистические порталы, если очень хорошо не прокачаны)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999501558', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1373924437}
review: A very silly roguelike. Also incredibly unstable; you literally get an achievement the first time your game crashes. Which won't take long. At all. The game is an intentional parody, and chock full of both goofy references and genuinely neat ideas. You also unlock additional features and builds by playing. The amount of content you can mix and match for your character, as in any good roguelike, will keep you busy for a while. You may want to wait for it to go on sale, though, so you don't think back on what you paid for it every time you wait for it to start back up after crashing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006636652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1137, 'last_played': 1383870892}
review:
I never thought i'd like a Rogue game, but i do, and it's this one.

I mostly play games where i can level up and save and load when i have to, i get stressed and depressed and angry when dying hardcore-mode. But DoD is fun!
Lives can stretch for a long time and there are several skills to explore and combine and they are all cool.

Graphics and music is mediocre, but that doesn't matter. The more you play the more you learn on what to do and more importantly what NOT to do. But read a wiki after a game or two to learn more is my advice.

Sure, i can recommend this if you like RPG and a challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039774200', 'num_games_owned': 2987, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1974, 'last_played': 1411874713}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is a Roguelike RPG, tried and true to the formula the game offers permadeath, procedurely generated levels and tonnes of loot and skills to play around with whilst trying to avoid your inevitable and untimely death.

The game has fantastic humour and there is nothing better than being insulted monty pythonesque style by a diggle who you are about to murder horribly.

If you enjoy roguelikes or dungeon crawling then this game is most definitely worth a look, I have sunk many hours into this game and continue to do so. I seriously cannot recommend this game enough.

review:

Dungeons of Dredmor es mucho (mucho) más complejo de lo que aparenta pues bebe directamente del roguelike clásico y de los mejores dungeon crawlers. Engancha que da gusto si lo juegas con 'Permadeath'. Tiene un humor muy particular.

Très difficile du à son côté très bordélique; et vu à ce prix-là ce jeu vaut le coup ne serait-ce que pour bien déconner, étant donné que ça sera par exemple le rare jeu où vous allez pouvoir incarner un magicien viking bankier détective archéologue et touriste vegan dans un donjon bourré de monstres tous plus marrants les uns que les autres.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972390763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1422866558}
review:
This is a good game. It is fairly easy and accessable for a roguelike (but still much more difficult than most modern games), and the graphics are some of the best in the genre.

The trouble with it is that there are much better, free, roguelikes out there like Brogue (for novices) and Z+angband (for hardcore gamers). So if you really need the nice graphics, go ahead and buy it... but otherwise you're better off just installing Brogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988691093', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1881, 'last_played': 1639643247}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001580045', 'num_games_owned': 1705, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1442690655}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975466166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 8410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8410, 'last_played': 1333868400}
review:
This is quite easily one of the most fun roguelikes I have ever played!

There are so many mechanics in this game that it'd be tough to mention anything in a recommendation, but I think the fun of a roguelike is exploring the game for yourself and experience all the ways you can die and figure out builds that work for you.  I think everyone has their own way of playing through a game like this, but I highly recommend anyone that picks this game up to play on hardcore mode, because it will force you to learn from your mistakes and you will never forget why doing what you did was a bad idea.

This is turn-based, which means when you move, the world moves.  This can give Dungeons of Dredmor a chess-like feeling as you figure out which fights to take, and which fights to run from.  There are a pretty heft amount of classes you can pick from, which are actually limitless with the addition of steam workshop support, as well as all the extra classes from the two expansions.

The only downside that I really disliked in this game is the achievements.  If you're an achievement hunter, you will probably never 100% this game legitimately, as there are stupid secret achievements such as buying the developers a beer in person.  When I last played, there were also a ton of broken achievements which you could never get (although I'm not sure if they have ever fixed these).

If you're looking for a fun turn-based roguelike to play, then I would highly recommend you to play this, especially if it's your first roguelike (as the interface is a lot more simple to use than other games).

author: {'steamid': '76561198017912302', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1541682061}
review:
Remember when indie games had loads of content and didn't cost more than 10 bucks? Dungeons of Dredmor remembers...

Dungeons of Dredmor is one of the first indie rogue-likes to gain popularity on Steam and probably the reason why we have hundreds of rogue-like games today, but unfortunatly most of theses other games reduced the content and increased the price as they released, making Dungeons of Dredmor one of the best games of the genre despite it's age.

The game works like this: The objective is to clear as many floors as possible before eventually dying and having to start all over again. Before each run, you can pick a few perks that determine what kind of character you will be playing, what kind of weapons you will be using, etc...Then you're dropped in the first floor of the dungeon. From that moment on, you have to level up your character to improve your skills, find items that make you stronger and find the stairs that lead to the next floor. Obviously, the difficulty quickly ramps up as you advance through the dungeon's floors and you are encouraged to grind for EXP and thoroughly explore every floor to prepare your characters much as possible before advancing to the harder floors.

This  game has A LOT of content! Huge item variety, huge enemy variety, great character customization options in terms of skills and perks,  randomly generated floors with shops, quests and awesome loot. Apparently the game has 10 floors, which might not seem like much, but I never got past half of the second floor and most people have never seen floor 10. It's that hard.
If you want you can turn off hardcore mode and play with saves but hardcore mode is the best way to play Dungeons of Dredmor.

The game also as a lot of personality. The graphics aren't amazing but they have an interesting and unique style and there's a lot of humor everywhere. From the enemy design to the scribbles on the dungeon walls, there are references and jokes all over the place.

This is one of those games where you will sink hundreds of hours just trying to get past those first couple floors. It's one of the most complete rogue-likes in the market and, if you like games like Binding of Isaac, you will definitely like this one.

Beeshu - June 2014

author: {'steamid': '76561198044596720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1373504629}

review: Loving this game when I have the chance to play it. Tons of fun and humour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005103869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1540171180}
review: Klasyki takie jak NetHack oraz Dwarf Fortress stworzyły podwaliny gier RougeLike. Dungeons of Dredmor jest jednym z nowszych przedstawicieli tego gatunku. Losowo generowane lochy i masa (MASA!) przedmiotów oraz monstrów to najważniejsze cechy "Lochów lorda Dredmora". Widok rozgrywki oraz sama rozgrywka jest typowa dla gier rougelike - gracz obserwuje akcje z góry.  Walka w systemie turowym, crafting, losowo generowane questy i motto: Losing is fun! Całość otacza klimatyczna, wzorowana na klasykach muzyka oraz humor na wysokim poziomie. Szczerze polecam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986399566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1226, 'last_played': 1456189487}
review: Ludicrously fun, you will find yourself rolling and re rolling over and over again as you try to reach Dredmore. For awesome fun mode just roll random everytime you start a new game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025606678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1675739688}
review:
When I first started playing this game, I felt rather iffy about it, to say the least. Once I actually started to get into the game, I quickly found myself far more entertained than I thought I would be. The gameplay is excellent, making for a roguelike experience that remains relatively simple. The comedy is quite prevalent, and though it is often referential hmor, I manages to be good referential humor ("all craftdwarfship is pretty crummy, actually", and other things like that)

Overall a very enjoyable game, with some slight visual issues in the form of very limited character model customization.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968407942', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1378979507}
review:
Call it a player experience in extremely bad luck, but ultimately, I feel that the time I've invested into Dungeons of Dremor has been an utter waste. 

Having raised three characters, and having every single character's life end with random abrupt inescapable and arguably unfair situations has really soured me on the game. Just be aware before going in that when things go wrong in this game, it'll in all likelihood be unfair (swarmed by enemies out of thin air, overleveled enemies just randomly appearing and one shotting you, etc) and ruin any amount of fun you've had prior to that character's untimely demise. 

That said, Dredmor is an approachable roguelike that handles its systems nicely. It can seem overwhelming at first, but when boiled down, all those skills, items, and crafting come into play, there's nothing complicated about it at all. I just really can't recommend it myself given how abrupt and unfair every play through I've had has gone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024997889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 8672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4225, 'last_played': 1496481849}
review: This is an awesome RPG with hilarious skills, enemies, and items.  I really enjoy trying out every skill tree to figure out the best build - and after 70 hours of gameplay I have only once gotten to the 9th floor (there are 10 or 15, depending on whether you activate the DLC).  The game gets more and more punishing as you progress, and there is less room for mistakes (PERMADEATH ALL THE WAY!). It is very easy to die from a stupid mistake! Levels are randomly generated so each playthrough is different.   Very addicting - I haven't played so much of one game for quite a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973438797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1121, 'last_played': 1366441200}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033263509', 'num_games_owned': 2923, 'num_reviews': 569, 'playtime_forever': 1848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1761, 'last_played': 1398497537}
review:
Перед  нами  очередной  представитель  игр  отличающихся  отстойной  графикой и приятным игровым процессом. Парадокс этой игры заключается  в  том,  что  ей  одновременно  не  хватает  многообразия  в  происходящем,  но  это  без  проблем  компенсируется  обилием  наполнения. Иными  словами  процесс  прохождения  подземелья  и  убиения  монстров  достаточно  однообразен,  но  учитывая  количество  вариантов  экипировки  и  навыков  персонажа  это  не  кажется  каким-то  существенным  минусом.  Вся  игра,  по  сути,  состоит  в  спуске  по  уровням  подземелья  и  экипировке  главного  героя  ради  встречи  с  финальным  боссом,  попутно  можно  выполнить  несколько  простеньких  заданий  взятых  у  статуй,  посетить  торговца,  зачистить  зоопарк  монстров  или  усмехнуться  описанию  очередного  бредового  навыка.  Всё простенько и понятно, можно переигрывать не один раз из-за случайно создаваемых каждый раз уровней  и  множества достижений, но с другой стороны потянет ли?  Тут  уж  дело  личных  предпочтений.

Плюсы: занятные навыки.

Минусы: однообразие.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964617326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1865, 'last_played': 1569288245}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017156545', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2231, 'last_played': 1654565005}
review:
[h1]What is this game...[/h1]
Dungeons of Dredmor is a humor-filled, turn-based (in a sense) roguelike. It is reminiscent of games like Ancient domains of Mystery, POWDER, and NetHack. 

[h1]Gameplay breakdown...[/h1]
Naturally, you'll start by choosing which bushy-eyebrowed character you'd like to play as. You'll then select what abilities and traits your character will carry through the game. From here, it is all a matter of exploring each level from wall-to-wall and ransacking every room. You'll accrue experience and upgrade your chosen skills - as is standard in RPGs. This really is about as far as a gameplay summary needs to go to get the point across. There are no crazy story-lines or twists, and there aren't any genre-defining features.

[b]However[/b], there is a lot to unpack from run to run. There are whole crafting systems to take advantage of, tons of resistances and stats to manipulate, and lots of taunting dialogue tossed around by enemies.

[h1]Final Score[/h1]
[i]Value | Does the price justify the amount of 'game' presented?[/i]
[b][5/5][/b]

[i]Entertainment | Does the gameplay provide a satisfying gaming session?[/i]
[b][5/5][/b]

[i]Replayability | Does the game keep you coming back for more after baseline completion?[/i]
[b][5/5][/b]

[i]Accuracy | Does the game successfully satisfy its target genre and audience with what it offers?[/i]
[b][4/5][/b]

[i]Completion | Does the game feel complete and polished?[/i]
[b][5/5][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197993703113', 'num_games_owned': 1591, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 10761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7982, 'last_played': 1706746397}
review:
It's a pretty great roguelike.

Yes it's simplified, but that doesn't necessarily make it easy.

Play it on hardest difficulty with permadeath for the chesthair experience.

I have never finished, and probably never will.

(Don't choose crafting skills unless you like sinking hours of time into inventory management)

author: {'steamid': '76561197990513926', 'num_games_owned': 1014, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1377748396}
review: If you enjoy delving down into dark dungeons knowing well you will most likely never emerge from it's depts then this is the game for you. Based on the old Roguelike games of yore it great at giving you that feeling that the next room you step into may be your last. With everything based on numbers and radomization you always get a fun, new experience everytime you play. If you want your game to be even more hectic be sure to play with permadeath enabled and have the game randomize your skills so you have to work with your faults, or benefits, to be able to survive long in the dungeon. Also the diggles are quite adorable to kill.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996566711', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 6572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3039, 'last_played': 1667015799}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is a great little rouge like that friendly for the uninitiated, though it does do afew things even normal rougelikes wouldent do since it would be down right cruel and unusual...

the modding community is also very excellent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032273592', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 2521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1654329168}
review:
This game makes me laugh.  It's a typical hack 'n slash dungeon crawl roguelike game, but with an absurdity in the design that just makes it satisfying when you work so hard to be congratulated on your death.  And die, you will, because this game doesn't really like you and may in fact be trying to kill you.  

Get this game for the little nods to geekdom-past, stay for the caffeinated dodger and Bowiemancy mods...

author: {'steamid': '76561198043828034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1420588062}
review: This truly is the silliest, weirdest, strangest, most random and most hilarious dungeon game I've ever played, and yet it's challenging, awesome and at the same time dumb as hell. This game is especially good for training your laughing and WTF-face muscles. I definitely recommend this to simply everybody as the nonsense in this game is worth your 5-10 bucks already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076461227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1569299381}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067089803', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 7791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4317, 'last_played': 1631941482}
review: This game has a gigantic selection of skill trees to take up, depending on how you like to fight. The fact that they have a minimum of five upgrade tiers each makes each character you make have a colossal range of possibilities, ranging from magic, summoning, melee, and powerful, extremely helpful passive abilities.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044343507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 272, 'playtime_at_review': 1331, 'last_played': 1710852261}
review: Theres a real charm to a game that manages to makes you laugh every time you roll over an item description. Dungeons of Dredmor is a top down dungeon crawler that manages to set that perfect balance of gameplay. Its managed to be the best valued game I've ever bought on steam as I've managed to sink more hours into this $5 sale game than my $90 Skyrim copy. The game offers you a good chunk of fun without being so immersive that you can't step out of the game at any time. It has easily made me chuckle the most out of any game I've played since Space Quest 4, and has excellent replay value. If you think you'd enjoy a tongue-in-cheek, fun dungeon crawler, I'd recommend it once it goes on sale again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079172117', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1049, 'last_played': 1510346510}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993241182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 88732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62082, 'last_played': 1540090746}
review: A very funny roguelike that makes reference to almost anything you could imagine. Adorable monsters and booze fueled wizardry await you on an epic quest that you may undertake as an axe wielding vampric communist banker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039440936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1530909553}
review: An incredibly wacky game with dozens of options to make your characters truly unique.  From the silly enemy taunts to the God of Lutefisk, Dungeons of Dredmor manages to take itself lightheartedly while at the same time offering a surprising amount of depth.  In addition, the thriving modding community ensures that there will always be something new to explore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062106290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 866, 'last_played': 1643750862}
review:
Sort of a cross between the numerous resistances of Angband, the crafting system of Unreal World, the exploration of Nethack and the combat system of Crawl.

All in all, an awesome game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010797118', 'num_games_owned': 2567, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 15627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13253, 'last_played': 1661215311}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is one of my favorite games. It has just the right amount of enemies, skills, and humor to make you want to play again and again. Also, the developers are charging you basically nothing for this game, and for any DLC. The only negative is inventory management, but it certainly makes up for it in other categories. If you like dungeon crawlers, or even if you don't, you should check out this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056785806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5796, 'last_played': 1681299475}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026575104', 'num_games_owned': 2064, 'num_reviews': 428, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1378329572}
review:
This indie rogue-like dungeon crawling game simply sucks you in with :
- random levels
- dozens of statistics for your hero and weapons and items
- instead of classes, you choose 7 "skills" where each skill has a couple of abilities (active and passive), making endless combinations for developing your hero
- comedies and parodies on...everything
- crafting, smithing, melting, alchemy...
- challenges
- and other interesting things...
Great indie game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019436413', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1419834585}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068208518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 3267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1419666581}
review: This game is impeccable. It reminds me of the old school days of baldur's gate, and this game has many skill trees along with a deceptive amount of traps and potions (many poisonous, but not labeled so:D), and this leads to a fabulous immersive gameplay that your own ignorance kills you nearly as much as your characters lacking skill against the monsters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047706543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1286, 'last_played': 1614276440}
review:
Livelli su livelli, piani su piani, oggetti su oggetti, comicità su comicità.
E' veramente difficile trovare dei difetti a questa piccola perla. 
quale altro gioco da un achievement quando la schermata crasha? no, ditemelo.
se proprio vogliamo essere pignoli l'unico difetto che mi viene in mente è il fatto che il personaggio non cambia aspetto in base agli items equippati. se fosse possibile tale personalizzazione quest'esperienza videoludica raggiungerebbe quasi la perfezione, l'orgasmo informatico, che invece si limita a sfiorare con una carezzina innocente.
lo consiglio agli amanti del genere e lo consiglio a chi non conosce il genere, ovviamente non aspettatevi un Diablo o un SoTP o un qualsiasi roguelike RPG di ultima generazione dalla megasuperiper grafica ma invece aspettatevi un gioco complesso anche se apparentemente semplice, longevo AS FUCK, con una colonna sonora epica e un gameplay perfetto.
Insomma un gioco da provare e riprovare, magari insieme ad un buon boccale di Tennet's e bestemmie libere.

Voto: 8

Musiche: 8
Longevità: 8
Gameplay: 9
Grafica: 7

author: {'steamid': '76561198049312577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5367, 'last_played': 1527499742}
review:
Alright. So... how do you describe Dungeons of Dreadmore?
- - - - -
Imagine, if you will: You are in a room. There is a pair of pants on the floor, a hunk of cheese, and a door in the far wall. There are vending machines to your right and left, and you have a sword in your hand.

These are your first moments in the dungeon.

You grab the pants and cheese, walk over to the door, and push it. Its locked. So you kick it untill it finaly splinters and falls down. Inside the room, wall to wall, floor to celling, packed with monsters. 

And they all turn and stare at you.

These are your last moments in the dungeon.
- - - - - -
So, overall? This game will beat you over the head with a rusty pipe, mug you, and then call the police and tell them you called thier mothers fat.

Yet, you will grit your teeth in frusration, slam the reload button, and take another shot at the Monster Zoo that turned you into a pile of mewling organs.

Why?

'Cause loosing is fun.

10/10. If you can get it on sale, do it, but totaly worth buying at full price. DLC is totaly worth it, ands a bunch of additonal content, plus five more levels of ball-busting dificulty. The modding community is still active, and has a wiki dedicated to helping mod the game. Very fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024379228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1474994760}
review:
This game... oh, this game.

Very rarely do I find a game that I consider I might actually play -Forever- (or at least until I am no longer able to).  This is one of those games.  I will play it, revisit it, time and time again, until I can't anymore.  It's that epic.

True to it's rogue-like nature, there is very little hand-holding in this game.  There isn't -too- much to figure out for yourself, but there is definitely enough to keep things interesting.  The turn-based combat is refreshing, as is the way you can use items (clicking on an enemy while holding a bolt from your inventory will shoot them with said bolt).  

The base stats are a a refreshing new twist, with stats not seen in any other games.  Of course, you've got about a million ways to start your character depending on what type of play-style you're going through.  Base stats serve only to enhance secondary stats, which are used throughout most of the game.  Nothing big to figure out, but you could definitely be a min/maxer if you wanted to be.  I prefer the role-play / lore route.

Perma-death mode is the only mode I'll ever play.  As your characters die, your name, level, and score all get added to a giant headstone which shows all of your previous deaths as well.  Making it exceedingly interesting to see just how much farther you can push into the dreaded Dungeons of Dredmor.

Over all, I HIGHLY recommend this game.  I feel like it is one out of over 150 titles that I own that I got much, much more than I paid for.  If you pass this one up, you're missing out.  Buy it.  Buy it now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047985807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1437740106}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor

Sembra molto simile a "The Binding of Isaac", ma con una gradevole vena RPG e tanto tanto humour.
All'inizio vi ritroverete nei sotterranei di un castello, con delle abilità scelte da voi ad inizio partita, che potranno essere potenziate dopo ogni nuovo livello raggiunto, poi dovrete farvi strada tra varie stanze scassinando porte, disattivando trappole, acquistando e raccogliendo oggetti, craftando e bevendo tra le più disparate pozioni magiche, e castando numerosissime magie, il tutto con la possibilità di iniziare un nuovo livello sempre diverso, quindi con una giocabilità pressoché infinita!

Unica pecca: sembra non esserci una traduzione per questo gioco, quindi se non masticate bene l'inglese potrebbe essere un problema, più che altro per identificare e capire i vari oggetti sparsi nel gioco.

Consigliato per gli appassionati di RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021818985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1473, 'last_played': 1500140977}
review: Пошаговая Roguelike RPG, отличный убийца времени, про то как главный герой бродит по подземелью и убивает орды монстров. Масса различных предметов, скиллов и всего остального прилагаеться. Подземелье каждый раз генерируеться заного, также в начале игры вы должны выбрать 7 направлений для развития персонажа, в которых по ходу игры необходимо прокачивать скиллы. В игре присутствует хороший юмор, посмеяться можно над кучей штампов не только этого жанра игр, но и другого популярного медиаконтента. Знание английского языка крайне желательно, других языков в игре нет. Веселей всего играть на сложном со включенным режимом Permadeath, который предполагает что персонаж умирает раз и навсегда без возможности загрузиться.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046224629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 14899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11022, 'last_played': 1695163526}
review:
Не знаю, куда подевалась моя рекомендация DoD, так что напишу еще раз. Абсолютно волшебная игра, наполненная отличным юмором, десятками отсылок и пародий ко всему, чему только можно. Также здесь полно способностей, кучи различных предметов и совершенно безумного вида монстры. В общем, маст хэв, если с английским все хорошо и не жалко 30-40 часов только на то, чтобы разобраться.
Also, diggles.
11/10
