author: {'steamid': '76561198051163768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3024, 'last_played': 1666539115}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is a rogue-like dungeon crawler. On first glance, it seems pretty basic and generic as there are so many games with the same genre. However, Dungeons of Dredmor manages to stand out from the rest with it's wide array of skills, items, floors and monsters, it's humor, and how much fun you have playing it. 

Dungeons of Dredmor has you as a hero to defeat Dark Lord Dredmor. On you quest to defeat Dredmor, you will need weapons, armor and a brain to slaughter monsters across the 10 dungeon floors.

 DoD has you start off with you picking from about 30 skills (Excluding Deadshot which was removed) and you have the freedom to choose whatever you like. It's a great sense of replayability that is added this way. You can mix and match different skills to see what you like as a player and various skills change your playstyle.. If you happen to mix to certain skills together, you may come up with an amazing combination to destroy some enemies. When you've picked your skills, you get spawned on the first floor. It's good to note that every floor is randomly generated and that the game is turn-based, allowing you to strategize your next move.

Now as you progress through the game, different items will be there to enhance your character through different stats, I won't go into detail though. While the same items do pop up on occasion, they feel different because the stats and it's name is always different. Killing enemies will give you XP and will eventually get you to LVL up, therefore giving you one skill point to give you a passive or active skill. As I've said before, the game's large variety increases how much you play. DoD also has a surprising in-depth crafting system that will let you make better weapons, armor and various items like food and potions. 

DoD also has DLC, which is a must buy. It only enhances the game that's already worth your money.The DLC's add more skills, items, floors and balances the game in general. There is also a decent sized workshop community, constantly added mods to make the game better. 

Overall, Dungeons of Dredmor is an amazing buy. It's challenging with the option of Permadeath and it really makes you think in a lot of situations. For anyone who loves rouge-likes, you must check this game out. 

PROS:
+Fun and Addicting
+Charming
+Humorous
+Wide Array of Skills
+Hundreds of Items
+Challenging
+Excellent Soundtrack
+Permadeath Option
+Deep Crafting System
+DLC enhances and balances the Base Game
+100+ Achievements
+Steam Workshop
+Bang for Your Buck

CONS:
-Graphical Style may not be your taste (Grew on me) 
-Other players have been known to lose their progress
-Items don't change character appearance.

DUNGEONS OF DREDMOR: 9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970805014', 'num_games_owned': 6583, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1625605769}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053376582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 15997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6159, 'last_played': 1706131713}
review:
La perfección dentro del género Roguelike.

Sus expansiones lo hacen muy extenso y completo, siendo capaz de rozar una casi infinita rejugabilidad con tantas ramas de habilidades y contenido, lleno de mecánicas distintas y variedad al extremo. Su humor es toda una pasada, además aliñado con referencias a juegos por doquier.

Después de tantos años sigue siendo un imprescindible de mi biblioteca y jamás lo he borrado del PC, tarde o temprano acabo echando una partida como un adicto busca su chute. Una pena que Gaslamp Games muriera, este título tiene una estructura demasiado sólida como para dejarlo olvidado. Siempre que pienso en el género, Dungeons of Dredmor me viene a la cabeza como una referencia clara de lo que uno busca con este tipo de juegos.

No te dejes engañar por su apariencia, al principio no entra por los ojos pero luego te enamora. Esa es su magia, acabarás hipnotizado intentando profundizar más y más en la mazmorra hasta darte cuenta de que estás quitándote horas de sueño o procrastinando...

author: {'steamid': '76561198039763191', 'num_games_owned': 480, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1527321569}
review:
Very nice and addictive dungeon crawler with pretty comic-like graphics and oldschool gameplay mechanics. In short - it's like a little big game. 
Tons of items, skills and vast (randomly generated) dungeon to explore with loads of easter eggs and humor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042378349', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4526, 'last_played': 1476394670}
review: A rather funny take on the dungeon crawling genre of games. With its own Steam Workshop, you can always find new content to add to the game. It even comes with perma-death for those looking for an added challenge. And you can save and quit at virtually any time. I recomend this to those looking for good dungeon crawlers.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975520974', 'num_games_owned': 1105, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1375443164}
review: Dredmor is a cool little retro RPG. You comb a dungeon by levels, clearing the monsters, doing randomly generated quests, and leveling up your skills and gear. It's a high-quality example of the genre and combines humor, dungeon grinding, and RPG elements in a fun package. For the low price, I'd recommend picking it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966948377', 'num_games_owned': 1216, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 2198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1387254056}
review: This is a Roguelike, and it is a great one. Never taking itself too seriously, this game will make you laugh, smirk, and hulk smash when you open a chest of evil and get slaughtered by the rampaging golem that comes out of it. In the end, the humor and skills in this game just make it very appealing. I enjoy this much more than something like FTL because there is much more diversity with things like full blown crafting systems, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048104702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2936, 'last_played': 1489291100}

review:

review: Arguably the best roguelike where you're able to play as a steampunk-themed killer vegan wielding the power of emomancy, Dialectical Materialism, and also you're a tourist

author: {'steamid': '76561198055312560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1373559592}
review:
A fantastic entry level roguelike - if you've ever been interested in the genre, but games like Stone Soup are too intimidating then this is for you.

The humor may be quite hit or miss - but anyone who has played a lot of tabletop or board games may get a few chuckles here and there. As will those of us who are members of the Big Eyebrow Master Race.

Full disclosure though - like many roguelikes there is a LOT of luck involved, and the starting skills aren't particularly balanced... as a result it's more of a casual roguelike, so all 2 of you hardcore rogulike fans can probably pass on this one - for everyone else however, it's a great way to try out the genre.

review: I really really like this. It's kind of simple and shallow by roguelike standards but the writing and gameplay are very entertaining. The humor definitely 'clicks' with me; I have laughed out loud several times. I've played for several hours but I figure I have only accessed about 4% of the skills. The random nature of the game combined with the vast number of possible character builds will keep this fresh for a long time. If you like roguelikes then I highly recommend this.

review: プロパティから「一般」タブ内の「起動設定」ボタンを押して「-opengl」とパラメータを入力することによってSteamのオーバーレイが使えるようになります。webで調べながらプレイできますね。

author: {'steamid': '76561198042604808', 'num_games_owned': 878, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2242, 'last_played': 1431622090}
review: This game manages to take the roguelike genre and make it not only approachable but also insanely charming, what with the unique and altogether wonderful artwork, the complementary music, and the constant high-brow humor, all while leaving plenty of room for the experts to sink their lives into the mechanics. Especially at its price, you owe it to yourself to play Dungeons of Dredmor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026308622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1349161200}
review:
What irritated me at first was that I couldn't check the monster's strength before I actually fought it in close combat. For example the shop guard killed me with it's first strike. If I knew I wouldn't have stolen and fought against it. It's a lesson I had to learn. The whole game works this way: Play, die, learn, play again, die again, learn again, and so on.
What motivates me to play again is not to finish the game by killing the final monster, but to get a higher score than in the last game.
I like that it's turn based. Even during a fight I have enough time to think about what weapon to use, whether to heal or to flee.

[my ranking: 8/10]

author: {'steamid': '76561197993282815', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 8233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7967, 'last_played': 1510509004}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor brings nontrivial graphics and an odd sense of humor to the classic roguelike formula. The character creation system is very flexible, allowing kleptomaniacal grenade-wielding tinkers, implacable armored warrior-monks, long-range glass cannon wizards, and everything in between. Gameplay is surprisingly deep for how young the game is compared to classic roguelikes like Nethack or Angband. The difficulty is adjustable to suit your taste, and perma-death is optional but encouraged.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025548392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1590506460}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043783908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5354, 'last_played': 1627534070}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is a turned-based dungeon exploring game full of loot, fun, and challenge. The sheer amount of variety in this game is astounding. There are seemingly infinite combinations of skills, unique monsters, hundreds of items, and just the right amount of comedy. Expect to spend hours on each play-through (depending on your settings!). The combat is always different. There are so many different ways to fight all the different monsters. Not to mention the 3 packs of DLC (one is even free!). I have personally spent +80 hours and have not beaten it once! Dungeons of Dredmor is by far one of my favorite games, and I would recommend it to anyone that wants a challenging dungeon crawler that will last them a lifetime.

review:
a great game,why is it great you ask? because it has these things,a shield with a picture of a cake on it,and when you pick it up it says THIS IS CAKETOWN!
Canada Items =P
a random naming system for epic lulz like Ferrari Logo studded Axes supposedly used by Samurai's
it's silly but when you look more into it it becomes very difficult,i recommend playing with Permadeath on because it's the most challenging and fun way imo to play the game,it's only  5 bucks and it is a hell of alot fun,has alot of replay ability because of the randomization of most things,like dungeons,magic items and the like,all with all,it's a great game with a sense of humor which made me giggle more than once ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198056726063', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1652, 'last_played': 1649022082}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor. This game is a Take-Turn RPG Roguelike (on or off) and it mocks many RPG games like it, with funny item descriptions, ridiculously strange enemies, randomized dungeon generation, tithing lutefisk to the lutefisk god, attacking genie-things, giant living mushrooms OF DEATH, mummies,  and diggles! ( i have no clue what diggles are either :p ) you can pick 7 out of many traits for your character to have, the awesome DLC is cheap for it (up to 3.00) as well as the game being cheap (5.00) i highly suggest this game if you're into randomness and RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013892999', 'num_games_owned': 1562, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4167, 'last_played': 1506623667}
review:
Tough as nails, but hugely entertaining for multiple playthroughs. So many things to find and discover, you'll almost definitely enjoy this if you like simple dungeon-crawler games.

Definitely worth it if you've not picked this up before. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198036795107', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1562774688}
review: Hands down one of the best new-age Rogue-likes.  You can't handle perma-death, then you don't have ta play that way.  You like zany skills and humorous events, then this here game is the one for you.  Makes Diablo 3 look like a failed attempt at a computer RPG!!!  Beg, steal, buy or borrow this game... no matter what, get it in your pants jack!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974634695', 'num_games_owned': 2196, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 35982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17499, 'last_played': 1700240549}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997036304', 'num_games_owned': 3184, 'num_reviews': 455, 'playtime_forever': 1872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1847, 'last_played': 1428754338}
review: A very fun little rouge-like game where you have a lot of synergy with many off the abilities, some of which are just made for humour like vampire and the ability to sparkle or communism and a ability to drop a bomb. It's one hell of a time waster, but at the same time you can actually cut down the size of the dungeon with NO repercussions. None. No achievements are affected either. Really, it's a lot of fun, especially as you can wear some light armour with magic which paths the way to making something like a Magus from Pathfinder's Ultimate Magic or Arcane duelist from D&D 3.5 or, again, Pathfinder.

review: Every time that I think I'm done with this game, finally bored with it, it finds a new way to amuse me.  It has a rare combination of silliness and complexity that just keeps bringing me back.  If you like a challenge and you miss the humor that was a hallmark of so many PC games in the 80s, give this a chance.  It's cheap, it's funny, it's great for min-maxing or fucking around; it's hours of good times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047611162', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 11066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4623, 'last_played': 1690252408}
review: This game is a flat-out, old-fashioned dungeon crawler. You travel through a dungeon killing monsters trying to reach a goal boss and along the way gain the skills as you get deeper. Of course magic included. if you are a fan of games with sarcastic humor, this game is full of funny jokes that make you laugh, but of couse you must pay attention to the details of the room to catch them. An awesome game with MANY skill trees. Love every minute I play of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046680021', 'num_games_owned': 1903, 'num_reviews': 947, 'playtime_forever': 10538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3532, 'last_played': 1515926389}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is a great singleplayer rpg, basic old school dungeon crawler with killing monster, leveling up, getting epic loot and crafting, and quests, this game alone will keep you entertained for many hous to come, Even has 121 achievments to keep you going. Then there are addons from the steam workshop you can check out for enhanced gamplay.The sound track is some of the best in a while, and the gameplay is fast and slow in parts, and the AI really gives you a fight if you are not ready for it so watch out. There are a few diffrent gameplay modes for challenge basicly a easy, medum, and hard, with permadeath, or smaller floors with same exp gain. If you have not tried this game yet, this is a must to have for any rpg fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004346403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1600536505}
review:
A basic single-player RPG game that sees you going on a play-by-the-numbers run through an evil warlock's dungeon to kill your way through all his minions, dodge and disarm the fiendish traps before then killing the warlock himself. Sounds generic, but the game's humour and plethora of funny achievements (even one for when the game crashes!), massive character skill customization, and most, of all the utterly unforgiving difficulty when played on "permadeath" (one life is all your character has, so use it well) instead of unlimited lives is the saving grace of this game. Played in small doses of an hour or two at a time it is a great timewaster and borderline addictive on the hardest difficulty to boot.

I received this game as a gift, but its been on and off my wishlist for sometime due to its interesting quirks. Buy it when it's cheap and grab all of the DLC in one hit for the best experience. Mods also exist for this game, but there are none of note at this time (2013/04/29).

author: {'steamid': '76561198072255649', 'num_games_owned': 2259, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1381719669}
review: Steam平台难得的Roguelike RPG。剧情精简为闯地牢杀魔王，但所有其它经典元素都悉数保留下来，回合制的战斗，丰富的角色属性，随机的地牢、怪物和装备，开门惊喜，以及独创的自定义职业组合系统，使你的每一次冒险都充满未知和挑战。包括对Steam Workshop的支持都使这款游戏始终保持着独特的魅力。

author: {'steamid': '76561197989063499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7350, 'last_played': 1437403475}
review: Very fun and addicting rogue-like.  If you've played the card game Munchkin, you will really appreciate the humor-- lots of cute witticisms.  You create a character choosing from a few dozen different skill sets.  Depending on which skill sets you choose your character will be more skewed towards being a Warrior, Wizard, or Rogue, and as you choose your skills and your gear, the class "meters" will be affected.  No function in this feature itself, but it can kind of skew how stabby or sneaky or magicky you may want to be in your approach to monsters.  Regarding the skills themselves, they range from weapon specialities (Sword, Axe, Throwing, Dual-Wielding, to name a few), to magic specialties (Pyromancy, Viking Wizardry, Blood Magic, etc.), to rogue specialities (Burglary, Lock Picking, Assassination, etc.).  Lots of variety and ways you can build your character.  There are 3 DLC packs out, one of them being free, which add more skills and more levels I think.  I still haven't beat the game, but I love playing and dying and making new characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041408471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2545, 'last_played': 1647058485}
review:
Like most roguelikes, the game features permanent death and stat transparency. You can look at your character sheet at any time and see what your current stat line looks like. It has multiple difficulty modes and a deep dungeon to explore. It randomizes floors and even has side quests and everything. The game is chock full of references and silly humor that will lighten your day. The story is your typical roguelike story setup, but let's be honest; who cares about the story in a roguelike except for the opening and the ending? That's not why you play these games! You play these games because LOSING IS FUN!!!!

What makes this game unique in my opinion is the classless setup. Rather than pick a class and go with it, you create a class by combining 7 skills and then leveling those up as your character levels up. These skills fall into one of the three major categories. Warrior, Wizard, or Rogue. Your base stats are affected differently by each point invested in these skills depending on the category it falls under.

Where it fails in my opinion for being a 'real' roguelike is the fact that permanent death can be turned off. The other issue I have with it, and more egregious n my honest opinion, is the fact that your hero automatically knows what everything is. There is no need to identify anything, at all, ever. What kind of roguelike lacks the need to test things and figure out what thay are? There is also no curse system to make equipment unable to be removed, at least not that I have encountered.

(Overall 8/10, Story 3*/10, Gameplay 9/10, Graphics 6/10, Sound 8/10, Replayability 10/10)
*not factored into overall score

author: {'steamid': '76561197970515094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 4960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4871, 'last_played': 1438046954}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971592042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1531920689}
review:
Good time waster. Turn-based combat makes it a good "second monitor" game that you can tab in and out of and play at your own pace. Good interface with inventory and crafting windows that can be moved anywhere on the screen and resizable dungeon map. Lots of variety in playstyle depending on the starting skills you choose for your character.

There is also a perma-death option and some very powerful monsters so it's not necessarily an easy game. Attacking the wrong monster early on can mean certain death. Good strategy/roguelike game for a low price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011058013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1689821457}
review: Dungeons of Dreadmor is a challenging roguelike that delivers an addictive dungeon-crawling experience. With its charming pixel art, deep character customization, and procedurally generated dungeons, it offers endless replayability. The turn-based combat system strikes a perfect balance between strategy and action, keeping you on your toes throughout the journey. While the learning curve can be steep for newcomers, the rewarding sense of progression makes it worthwhile. The witty humor and quirky encounters add a delightful touch to the overall experience. If you're a fan of roguelikes and enjoy a good challenge, Dungeons of Dreadmor is a must-play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011699593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1436549713}
review: A rogue-like for newbies of the genre! Dungeons of Dredmor is a fantastic starting point for people who wish to play an often unforgiving and visually lacking genre. So let's start at price, Dredmor is dirt cheap. At £3.49 for the base game, it's a steal that will offer countless hours of adventuring fun, and this is helped by the fact that no dungeon is ever the same, thanks to procedurally generated dungeons! The story is the Evil Lord Dredmor is here to do bad things and you are a hero who has to kill monsters, pretty generic... However, the game is packed with humour, which is super pleasant and the game doesn't take it's self serious! Gameplay revolves around stat-checking, crafting, combat and cleverely disguised turn-based mechanics. The game is surprisingly tactical and you can often mess up if you don't think about your character's positioning! And that leads me to my final point: Permadeath and replayability! You can pick 7 base 'Perks' in character creation (which can be randomised). As you level up you can evolve these Perks. However, should your character get killed (and they will), you stay dead and start fresh! This is optional for the less hardcore rogue-like players. In conclusion I say if you like role-playing games you should give Dungeons of Dredmor a shot. It's fun, simple and hilarious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003698409', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 4306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2573, 'last_played': 1382594469}
review:
First of all, although Dungeons of Dredmor is a very fun roguelike, it's also incredibly unforgiving - which is what I feel some players may be put off by, when starting the game. But don't stop there! Once you've died a horrible death or five, (heh, don't worry, it'll likely be a quick demise!) you'll start to get the hang of it, and be able to delve deeper into Dredmor's residence; killing off his foul minions and living vegetables with ease.

There is also a lot of humour and references to be had in this game too, which is certainly one of its strong suits; whether it's finding a Holy Hand Grenade from Quest for the Holy Grail, or having the option to purchase incredibly expensive (and pointless!) horse armour from Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion. Another one of the pros of DoD is that it's a completely new experience every time you play it, as the floor layouts differ between playthroughs, as do the items you find.

So yeah, at the price it's at, I'd definitely recommend buying it if you're interested in a very challenging and rewarding experience, provided you're prepared to potentially suffer for an hour or two, before you get the hang of it.


Skål!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994567313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 2751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1401, 'last_played': 1639544798}
review: This is seriously the best Rogue-like I've ever played. The amount of items, monsters, and skills is astounding, so there's always new stuff to find. I love the game's sense of humor, too - it doesn't take itself seriously at all, and is filled with silly pop culture references. I've seen nods to everything from Monkey Island to Lord of the Rings, from Lady Gaga to Han Solo. The graphics are great, and I loved the soundtrack so much I bought it from the website. The gameplay has a lot of depth to it, and since you can pick whatever skills you want, you can truly play it the way you want to. I see myself spending hundreds of hours on this over the next few years... or even decades. Recommended if you want a quirky RPG with a sense of humor, AND if you want a light tactical strategy dungeon crawler.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007148760', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2430, 'last_played': 1391637544}

review: It's got crazy depth, an amazing mod community, Bowiemancy, loads of skills, caters to both casual and hardcore types without sacrificing anything, and it's a roguelike that can be bought for a few bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007006417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5194, 'last_played': 1390757130}
review:
Un gioco cattivo che vi punirà per ogni vostro singolo errore, bevi una strana pozione: sei morto. Ti fai colpire da delle api: sei morto. Trovi il Monster Zoo: sei morto. 
Quando pensi di aver capito come funziona il gioco, riuscendo a raggiungere il 2-3°piano, sei al 5-6 livello, hai dei buoni item, e sei sicuro che il peggio sia ormai passato, apri quindi la porta di una stanza, spavaldo, ma la stanza si rivela piena di Muscle Diggle (o altro): sei morto (di nuovo).
Allora perchè giocare ad un gioco del genere? Non saprei, masochismo forse? 
NO, il gioco è incredibilmente divertente, ogni volta che muori (opzioni abilitate: Going Rogue e Permadeath) vuoi ricominciare con nuovo personaggio con delle skill diverse, nel tentativo, di scendere di un'altro piano o sopravvivere ad un altro Monster Zoo oppure riuscire ad aprire un'altra maledetta porta.
Ma alla fine, dopo circa 60 ore di tentativi, quando vedi gli achievements: 
>Left For Dread 
>I Can't Believe That Worked
Un WOW lo urli al cielo. Un po' mi manca come gioco.

Voto: 8/10.

review:
This game here is amazing, you see how much it costs?

author: {'steamid': '76561198026871347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 54126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 559, 'playtime_at_review': 15888, 'last_played': 1710620641}
review: Gorąco polecam gierkę, gdzie grafa i muza są na drugim planie a pierwsze skrzypce gra miodność i świetny humor. Giera z typu roguelike  (RPG+tury) początkowo wydaje się być dość trudna ze względu specyficzny pisany angielski humor i brak tłumaczenia - ale już kilka rozegranych partii powoduje, że stale chce się do niej wracać, przygotowywać nowe, lepszy buildy w celu skutecznego dopadnięcia i złojenia zakopanego na głębokim 15 poziomie Lorda Dredmora :) Chętnym służę skoromną wiedzą która pomoże się ciutkę odnaleźć w nowej ciekawszej rzeczywistości...

review: Why I recommend this game, well it started off watching a video on a first impression of the game during a steam sale, so for a couple bucks i thought alright what kind of rogue like am I getting myself into. Well it so turns out this thing is the most comical impetuating, and cartoon rogue like I've ever played. This thing has the most hilarious things I have ever seen, the monster all have insults that are more funny than painful, the game itself does not take itself too seriously and with the community hub, this game is a killer definately worth the $5 they're asking for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025965972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1510540785}
review: Fun game. Rogue-like, because dying is half the fun! It has a very good sense of humor and pokes fun at the tropes of normal dungeon crawling hack'n'slash games. Also, turn-based.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041511347', 'num_games_owned': 2623, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1565557358}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is a more laid back RPG and gives a typical 'dungeon crawler' feel when playing. Personally, I love the fact that there are endless combinations to beating this game, some requiring more skill than others, that really make this game unique. And if your looking for some nostalgia you'll find it here too, there's references and puns as far as... uh, the screen can stretch! (Sorry couldn't think of anything cool.) But you get the idea, it's a game that can consume many hours of your time and it's something that will make you come back for 'more'. I also highly recommend the DLC as well, it's worth every penny. If you still need something new to change things up a bit, there's plenty of player created content as well! (Items, abilities, etc.) So in short, there's tons to do and many ways to beat it giving it a unique feel each and every time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005662588', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4737, 'last_played': 1577166030}

review: The best roguelike for people who don't know they like roguelikes.  A great way to lose 6 hours of your life at a time, and a pretty balanced game mode UNTIL THE FINAL BOSS WHO CANNOT BE DENTED BY SIX TENTHS OF THE SKILLS COME ON.  Otherwise fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968658621', 'num_games_owned': 993, 'num_reviews': 446, 'playtime_forever': 9884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9784, 'last_played': 1584616895}
review:
A much needed blast from the past, finally a both accessable & enjoyable roguelike.  I haven't found one since the Castle of the Winds series.  Some of the graphical style isn't my cup of tea, and I feel there are too many "active" skills in relation to passive ones.  Despite the randomly-generated nature of things, I find my motivation to try all the different skillsets not what it should be.  A game that should provide fun, for a while.

***-

author: {'steamid': '76561198064457911', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1375552605}
review: Roguelike神作！Rogue类作品常见的大量文字阅读、复杂的ui、繁琐的操作都被最大程度的简化了，并且精细的打磨了动作和音乐，把Rogue的游戏核心通俗而完美的呈现了出来！

review: One of the best roguelikes on Steam at the moment. Mechanical depth, great humour, fitting soundtrack and despite the constant fear of permadeath, the turn-based combat can make for a nice Sunday afternoon game.

review: One of the best dungeon crawlers I have ever played, if you like a humor, dying, and murding tons of enemies this game is perfect. Did I mention loot?

author: {'steamid': '76561198007677832', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 4971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4012, 'last_played': 1423884565}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is an excellent roguelike that takes place within a large, vibrant dungeon filled to the brim with smartass creatures, quirky equipment and massive eyebrows completed by very memorable music. Customization is found in the character creation menu and then in improving your selected abilities while hunting down the right gear for the role you have selected.  Replayability is high in this game thanks to the random dungeon format, multitude of character skills to mix and match and downloadable content. Kick the game into overdrive with options that limit the amount of floors in the dungeon (thereby reducing the experience you gain and decreasing your chances of finding rare equipment), increase enemy levels and HP and store purchase prices while also reducing sell prices and health/sp regeneration among other things, and permadeath. The game is well worth its full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988995835', 'num_games_owned': 2439, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 2495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1373, 'last_played': 1653700756}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004499559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4473, 'last_played': 1534107914}
review: This game is $5 why havent you bought it yet? Its got random everything, random skill selection (if you want), random dungeon layout, random loot, random ... ugh random. As you level you can place skill points in one of your 7 skills. Each point brings a new ability or stats/buff to your character. Luck plays a big roll in this game, but preparedness and wits can give you the edge over chance. It may be something you never beat, but can have fun trying too. If you like FTL, this is like the fantasy dungeon dive version of that kind of. You can spend as long as you like on floors, and return to old ones but you cant leave the dungeon till you get that big ol mean nasty lich Dredmor. Will you bait your enemies into 1 on 1 fights with a quick thief, will you slog into melee with a heavy armored fighter, will you destroy your enemies with the arts of the arcane? Lots of different ways to play... which one will you choose? The battles are effectively turn-based, each tile you move represents one turn, each attack/ability represents a turn, so methodical approach to dungeon diving is often rewarded. This game is $5 why havent you bought it yet!?

author: {'steamid': '76561198002824429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 14490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11915, 'last_played': 1590853816}
review: For those who like roguelikes: this game is excellent, versatile, with high replay value and lots of humor (though it's more like oooh I get it humour rather than laughing my ass off humour). Just for comparison: I've spent about 20-30 hours playing Diablo 3 and got bored, and on this game I've spent more than 170 hours already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008530728', 'num_games_owned': 757, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1540695690}
review: This game is a true RPG all about the grind with quarky little tidbits to keep you laughing as you turn base yourself into a seemingly endless dungeon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049654813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1641845839}
review:
As a fan of the old Rouge-alike games years ago, I find Dungeons of Dredmore to have a familiar 'feel' about it. 

The sheer amount of items, and crafting ability you have makes the game entertaining on its own. Add to that the random skill generation (you can choose these specifically too) and what you have is a thoroughly addictive game that almost anyone would enjoy! 

It takes a couple hours to get used too, but its so worth it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198049006077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 6944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5732, 'last_played': 1385684040}
review:
A very fun and humorous dungeon-crawler. Very-much worth the $5-10.

Beyond the brutal dfificulty, this game is very much about trying different skill combinations. I strongly urge all new players to choose rogue difficulty with permadeath on. This isn't just sadism on my part but that it will allow (force) the player to try new builds every 10 minutes or so until he finds effective ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972426666', 'num_games_owned': 1190, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1392957194}
review: Cheesy tounge-in-cheek rpg. Good for the occasional randomly-generated-dungeon silliness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000305114', 'num_games_owned': 696, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 12446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8717, 'last_played': 1549003666}
review:
This game is hard. Good, but hard. You probably shouldn't even expect to win. The nature of the game itself means that you'll probably make new character after new character, each embarking on their journey into the dungeon's depths in a different way. Tons of different skills and endless amounts of humor and references as well.

This game is fantastically built and you need to fucking buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993204681', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2150, 'last_played': 1391651585}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is amazing! It's among the games I've logged the most hours in on Steam, as a roguelike it's very difficult and endlessly replayable. You just have to prepare yourself for the heartbreak of finally (finally!) getting a good character rolling, and starting to make plans for what skill you'll upgrade or gathering materials to craft certain weapons, and then watching all your plans crumble because you forgot to check your health before moving to the next room and a couple weak monsters finished you off and now it's gone, it's all gone and you know it's all your fault you'll never play this stupid game again god dammit why did you get your hopes up you knew you would just fail and die like always

author: {'steamid': '76561197991591636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1555613761}
review:
Fun fun Indie rogue-like game here.  Pick it up on sale if you can its definatly worth the money.  This game pokes fun at all of the typical Steryotypes of your basic RPG's while relying upon those to create a fun whimsical RPG game.

For example you can be a Mathmatician and use your Arthiomantic skills to blast your enemies from afar.  (its a type of magic)

The game can be brutally tough at times though, but not enough to keep you from coming back for more punishment.  A definate must get for fans of Rogue-like games.

4 out of 5

(RPG / Indie)

author: {'steamid': '76561198041734018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 18584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7635, 'last_played': 1682464860}
review: this game is... well, it's amazing. it has a great sense of humour, amazing music, and more replayability than should be possible in the vanilla game ALONE, and the gameplay is amazing. there really just isnt anything you can really compare it to, because nothing currently in the turn-based roguelike genre is even 1/10th as good as this currently. there's this and then...well nothing, really. which is fine with me, because this game has everything you could really WANT from this sub-genre. the world needs more companies like gaslamp games, ones that put real effort, and charm, and character into their games, ones that CARE. it's sad that this is really the only good turn-based roguelike available at the time, but hey: you can still beat a mole-bird creature over the head and steal it's eggs, make an omelet with them, then immediately be murdered by a giant invisible scarecrow and his 50 friends

author: {'steamid': '76561198044630046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1662696290}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmore is a rouge-like dungeon crawler.
You play as an adventurer going down into the Dungeons of Dredmore. You pick you gender and then choose a set of 7 skills before you are plunged into the randomly generated levels.
The skill customisation is fantastic as you pick whatever you want and there is plenty of variety from the normal swords, assassination and magic training to moe obscure skills like fleshsmithing, tinkering, necromincomics. As you level up, you can improve these skills to higher levels. The skills can interact and synergise, making the system incredible deep and complex if you really think about it.
Levels contain enemies, traps, loot, interactive objects with lore, shops, side quests and so on. There are lots of different items that you can collect and use, but you have a limited inventory and you DEFINITELY cannot pick up and use everything. Battles with enemies is turn based and there are many different types to encounter.
You can choose how you want to play the game from the start: you can change the difficulty level, whether you want to respawn or not on defeat, whether you can even respawn on death or completely lose that character forever, start off with a completely randomised skill set or choose your own skills, etc.
Replayability is definitely high and with 3 DLCs and plenty of user mods, you won't run out of things to do or play with Dungeons of Dredmore.
Perhaps one of the best aspects to it is its humour. The game is hilarious and takes every opportunity to make jokes, poke fun at itself as an RPG and the archetypal features of RPGs (an example would be the character stats and the description for each stat), even making jokes about you as a player. It keeps the game fresh and entertaining all the time.
It's worth picking up if you like rogue-like games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970971411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 14063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13650, 'last_played': 1707654600}
review:
A precious jewel lovingly crafted pixel by pixel, line of code after line of code.

Dungeons of Dredmor is a randomly generated masterpiece of a roguelike with a shocking number of character combinations that anyone even remotely interested in the genre should try and love.

With a dedicated community of modders filling the Steam Workshop with goodies, you're not going anywhere for the next 1000 hours.

review:
This game offers perma-death - and mark my words - THAT'S HOW IT'S INTENDED TO BE PLAYED. It will make you so mad, yet every accomplishment will be x10 times its normal worth. And to accomplish that (or vice-versa), the game bathes you in humor, which is good, nostalgy and an actually great RPG mechanic.
Just take a look: a funny pixely dungeon crawler with perma-death, What else could you wish for?

author: {'steamid': '76561198013565588', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1400361393}
review: The hardest game ever. You will die. You will have fun. Or not, I'm not going to assume things about you. Eat lutefisk to heal one hitpoint. Eat an omelet and heal 64. Put the omelet in a box and turn it into lutefisk. Make a sword. Make  an axe. Make a sword axe. Make brass ingots. Make copper ingots. Make plastic ingots. Make another omelet. N/10, where N is your enjoyment of dying in new creative ways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036600583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1848, 'last_played': 1676929172}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995913881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6993, 'last_played': 1666999894}
review:
Do you take RPGs seriously? Yes? Go away then! This is an addictive turn based dungeon trawling game where every manner of spoof appears while you're smacking creatures who squeak while they thrust in your general direction. No, really, there's a monster called 'Thrusty'. A wide variety of skills to learn, so many weapons and a bucketload of throwable projectiles, groovy music, and when you die you'll curse, you'll freak out...and then start it again right away to get even at all the evil gits!

And I heartily endorse this product to receive the "Test of Time" award for the Steam Awards 2016!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005403195', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 3802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3482, 'last_played': 1482620792}
review:
If you're looking for a challenge in a RPG setting and aren't too fussed on graphics and enjoy a bit of humor sprinkled into the mix as well, then this is for you.

Seriously, I have yet to beat this game playing "Dwarfish Moderation" on Hardcore. I can honestly say, that the majority of my deaths were due to me being greedy saying things like "I can kill this room full of monsters! There's only 150 left!"

If you play this, and you should, you will die. Repeatedly. You will rage so hard at how you had just found some epic loot or had just managed to find that crafting recipe you needed and you will swear to the heavens at how absolutely unfair the fates are... Then you'll create a new character and do it all over again. Because it is THAT fun to lose.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999975592', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1281, 'last_played': 1576809984}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971756502', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 9793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10014, 'last_played': 1527483351}
review: Best old school dungeon-crawling-fun I've ever had.  I recommend playing with perma-death as the game was intended.  A strong modding community stretch this game well beyond it's lifespan.  I have yet to find a game I have invested more hours into!!  If you like deep crafting systems then you will like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990011179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1566654337}
review: I am pretty picky when it comes to roguelikes (though I love them), from all the roguelikes I've ever played, Dungeons of Dredmor is most likely the most content rich. Deep character ability system, an interesting crafting system and some fine comedy to boot. The game has leaderboards so you can compare with your friends how far you've gone through the dungeons. If there's a game worth your cash that runs on nearly any computer you can throw it at, I would highly recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014666590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 2122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1537, 'last_played': 1376138342}

author: {'steamid': '76561198071810127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1450924376}
review: "Late in the night, the game calls to you. The lights on your computer blink, intermittently, in a repeating pattern. You hear a tapping from within your monitor casing. The Dungeons of Dredmor want you back."

author: {'steamid': '76561198004589179', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 53869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50995, 'last_played': 1700434762}
review:
This is one of the best dungeon crawlers I've ever played. The amount of content you get for just a few dollars is incredible, and 800 hours later I still find myself learning new things. The humor is goofy and fresh, there's tons and tons of skill combinations, and for once, it's an RPG with a crafting system which is actually pretty interesting. Dredmor is simple enough so that people of any background can easily jump into it and have fun, but there are also difficulty levels for all sorts of players, and enough depth to challenge you as you progress.

I've been playing this game for several years now, and it is by far the best purchase I've made on Steam. The community surrounding Dredmor has also been incredibly friendly and helpful, and a wide range of mods doesn't hurt, either.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993293926', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 4214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2189, 'last_played': 1510799215}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971993032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1333177200}
review:
Good and fun on the surface, severely skewed endgame mechanics.

New to roguelikes? You'll probably like it.

Vetran gamer? This might start to piss you off.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995781736', 'num_games_owned': 1042, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1396397833}
review: A strange but potent combination of humor and dying, both of them in immense quantities. DoD is a whimsical, sometimes downright sadistic game, throwing you into startling deathtraps at a moment's notice, while perpetually referencing and parodying roguelike genre conventions in most wacky, even disturbing ways. DoD does all this while being remarkably fun and addictive. It's superfluous mentioning replay value in here as it is staple of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036078718', 'num_games_owned': 922, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 6006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4051, 'last_played': 1431135075}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985858889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2614, 'last_played': 1357545600}
review: Didn't expect this game to be as good as it is. It has exploration, loot, skills and builds which are actually fun to figure out, challenge (from time to time), humour in spades, turn-based combat and it is random so very replayable. It was a steal at 2.50 for all DLCs + game; I would have paid 30-40 euros for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972299640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 1685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1596, 'last_played': 1558726548}

review:
I got this game buying a pack of indie canadian games.

Normally I dislike turnbased stratagy games cause it gets boring after a while. But this one has humor, extra quirks & your char is open to a lot of different skill types. Thief(Dodge) & Warrior(Dmg) Was my best combo so far.

<-- Will be buying expantions once they are on special :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198036957838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5372, 'last_played': 1696451139}
review: I'm normally not one for Roguelikes. In fact, I am atrocious at them and have come to sort of detest the genre as a result. I've attempted Nethack once or twice and end up failing a couple floors in. Dwarf Fortress, let's not get started on that please. Dredmor on the other hand, I've sunk a good 60 hours into and have loved every soul-crushing second of failure in. It may be called an "easy" RL by the hardcore who've done vegan pacifist ascensions, but it's a great introduction into the genre and overall one of the best PC games I've played in the last few years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025000656', 'num_games_owned': 1109, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1615, 'last_played': 1495653426}

review: This is a good old school dungeon crawler that might bring you back to the days of DOS. The dungeons are randomly generated, so is the loot, its easy and nice on the eyes. author: {'steamid': '76561197993226705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 8748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8425, 'last_played': 1374333305}
review:
スーファミ時代の8bitドット絵インディーゲームと侮るなかれ、ゲームの面白さの本質はグラフィックだけではないということを教えてくれる貴重なローグ系RPG。不思議のダンジョン系にハマった人なら十分楽しめる内容。むしろそれ以上に面白い。
ダンジョン内に落ちているものすごい種類のアイテムを拾い、装備品やアイテムを合成や金床を使い強化、さらにレベルアップによるスキルの強化などでダンジョンにもぐり、最下層にいるDredmorを倒すのが目的。
装備品にはDiablo的Hack & Slashな要素もある。スキルの数もデフォルトで数十種類。さらにDLCで要素が大量に追加。DLCはどれも質が良いのですべて購入すると世界が広がってやりがいが増える。

author: {'steamid': '76561197989017606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3979, 'last_played': 1526361315}
review: A roguelike for people who don't want to hate themselves! It has a really fun sense of humor about it while you trudge through randomly generated dungeon floors. Great time-killer if you just need something to do while at a particularly boring work shift or while listening to an online lecture.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026151166', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1481152451}
review: A really entertaining game if you enjoy rogue-like games. Humour in stock.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059844883', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 2225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 959, 'last_played': 1697354632}
review: An excellent game that's truly one of a kind. Many cool features and good artwork. A lot of hilarious references and the like. The rpg element to it allows a variety of ways to play and the turn based combat most encounters unique, for the first while. While very light hearted in some respects I feel it lacks a driving story line. The game can start to feel like a grind for more loot and levels with the sole objective of killing some enigmatic final boss you've faintly heard of. Despite it's short comings I would definitely recommend this game especially if it's on sale. It does what it does well, 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042057084', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2359, 'last_played': 1364367600}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980283507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 6040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3663, 'last_played': 1633462994}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is a fantastic rogue-like. It is just the right amount of tricky and irritating to keep you enticed. Just when you feel you have mastered the perfect build formula (out of the insane amount of combinations possible). The game throws in a curve ball that ruins the whole game for you, it could be your super warrior tank has been slashing their way through floor after floor only to suddenly open up to a Monster Zoo that has a load of magic attacking legendary mobs in it and all you can do is get slaughtered by the holy sound of magic raining on you. Or perhaps there just was not enough cheese on the floor you were on to keep your health up against a particular tricky set of enemies. Even on permadeath mode the game will have you happily start back on floor 1 of this random generated pleasant hell of a game. Time to re-roll and try again after all those diggles gotta dig and thrust you must.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980073777', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 2247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1567, 'last_played': 1536512290}
review:
I don't even know where to start with DoD.  

That it's a top-down roguelike, RPG, monster murderfest?

That it's filled with hilarious writing in everything from the skill descriptions, monster taunts, and every single item in the game?

Or that it's actually pretty fucking hard, and to this date I still have yet to complete it? Even before they added a bunch of free content that made the game even longer and more fun than it already was?  

I guess I'll start with the premise, you play a lad/lass with enormous eyebrows and no common sense, venturing into the titular explorer-rending dungeon on a quest to obtain renown and slay an immortal lich.

On your way you will kill diggles, bats, genies, furious cephalapods and god knows what else.  

The game has crafting, random quests and events, and more enemies and loot than you can shake a wand at.

So dive in, pick your skills, and dig as deep as you can!  I can almost promise you'll only regret it a little bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017022052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4741, 'last_played': 1352534400}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028916889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 96268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61952, 'last_played': 1706655966}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is a modernized Rogue-like game with a great sense of humor.  It's the kind of game I've been literally waiting for since I first discovered Rogue on a mainframe computer back in the late 1970s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002056298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1416054133}
review: okay apparantly I played this for almost 15 hours yet the only part I remember about it is trying to stick an interdimensional cube inside itself blowing down a wall in the process

author: {'steamid': '76561198029328728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 33323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1692204666}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is a truely amazing game. It may not have the high specs like more popular mainstream games do, and it might not have an incredibly developed, emotionally, provocative storyline, like other games, but there's no denying that it has every element nessesary to make it fantastic, fun, and adrinillen pumping Adventure RPG. A perfect mix of catchy music, eye-pleasing graphics (even if they are slightly neanderthal), and corny humor, make this game a MUST BUY in my book.

review: This is a ridiculously fun graphical rogue-like with a great sense of humor. I've put a metric ton of hours into this, with more on the horizon; it doesn't get old. The expansions are great, there's an active mod community, and tons of skill choices to make every playthrough a new experience. You will die a lot, but you'll have a blast (sometimes literally) doing it. (= The Vancouver-based developers are also awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969913402', 'num_games_owned': 3553, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 2150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2076, 'last_played': 1379481489}
review:
I decided to rewrite my recommendation: I have had way more than $5 worth of fun with this game.  It has an offbeat style that's apparent the minute you see the main character.  Then you see some of the monsters, and the skills, and if that isn't WTF enough for you, wait till you see the monster zoo....If you survive! 

My only complaint is with how they pronounce "mana".  Fix that and this game would be pure gold Jerry, PURE GOLD!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009432831', 'num_games_owned': 2097, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4762, 'last_played': 1623065625}
review:
This game is utterly brilliant and extremely charming, but at the same time exceptionally challenging and (virtually) infinitely replayable. It is a modern roguelike, both inviting to newcomers like me, and challenging like the classics. (Going Rogue, Permadeath. Nuff said.)
I wholeheartedly recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967658060', 'num_games_owned': 1732, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 1848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1639430126}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997218296', 'num_games_owned': 1408, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2694, 'last_played': 1699897615}
review:
Неожиданно годный рогалик. 

Очень хороший геймплей, к тому же полон стёба на около-РПГшные темы - как откровенного и тупого, так и неявного.

Не обращайте внимания на графику, она здесь вообще не важна.

4.5 из 5

author: {'steamid': '76561197989522084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1468, 'last_played': 1383975293}
review:
I'll start off by saying Dungeons of Dredmor is not for everyone.  DoD is a Rogue-like; meaning that it is modeled after the classic game, Rogue.  This means that death is permanent and you must re-roll a new character after each loss.  This would be a slog if not for the fact that you are able to pick from a huge amount of skills to bring with you each time.  This makes each playthrough a new experience as you combine different skills to see what works for you.  The difficulty is countered by a lighthearted and downright silly tine that will surprise and delight.

I really do encourage you to try this game.  It is super cheap and Steam seems to put it on sale fairly frequently.  Plus, one of the DLCs is actually free.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985907272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2493, 'last_played': 1411198091}
review: A very funny old school turn based exploration game in the vein of Thief. Its super cheap and super good why don't you own it already?

author: {'steamid': '76561198002358405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2304, 'last_played': 1397986414}
review: Best rogue-like I've played in a long time. Lots of comedy involved :3

author: {'steamid': '76561197980336628', 'num_games_owned': 809, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 15485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7221, 'last_played': 1678288869}
review:
If you like old school RPGs and/or Roguelikes, and the humor they used to carry with pride before things started getting all serious and brown, you'll probably love this game.

It's a pretty standard roguelike, but with some really nice animation and a great sense of humor.  Almost every item in the game has a description that's at least made me chuckle, not to mention the skills. It will kick your ass (with a cheerful "Congratulations, You have died!" every time) unrelentingly, but the randomized dungeons ensure that you can always make a new character and plunge on in without knowing quite what you've gotten yourself into.  It also offers standard roguelike permadeath, and a save/reload system for all you pansy whipper-snappers.

Also, mods, tons of them!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977153856', 'num_games_owned': 4887, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2355, 'last_played': 1401560986}
review: A surprisingly deep and varied graphical roguelike, driven by player chosen skill sets rather than predesigned classes. It has a very silly and referential sense of humor, but despite its comedic tones it's also distinctly challenging. Sure, you can adjust the difficulty levels and turn off permadeath, but if you run with the latter on, you can expect the usual cavalcade of unfortunate demises (brilliantly greeted with the words "Congratulations, you've died!") and restarts. The expansions open things up even more, adding new skill sets that bring brilliant new mechanics to the game, additional gear and crafting options, more dungeon room types, traps, enemies, additional floors, Wizardlands, a pocket dimension for loot storage and time-stopped crafting...and all for a very reasonable price. My main complaint is that the silly veneer tends to obscure the actual game mechanics, but with regular reference to a wiki or the Dredmorpedia, that can be alleviated.

review: Think NetHack (or similar Rogue-like) with fun coartoony graphis with enahnced RPG character development.  It also has the ability to be modded with its own Steam Workshop.  If you want a quick, easy, random dungeon delve to fill up some free time, this is perfect for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021102653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 8354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7415, 'last_played': 1453911155}
review:
Ok, so you want an opinion on Dungeons of Dredmor?
It's an rogue-like done to near perfection. The combat is great, the UI is great, the way you manage skills and stats is great, the HUMOR is absolutely perfect. The game itself is highly moddable and there are tons of them on the workshops.
To add some icing on the cake, the developers (Gaslamp Games) are one of the coolest dudes ever, and I suggest you closely monitor their next game (Clockwork Empires, they first turned a rogue-like into a good-looking understandable game, now they're doing the same to dwarf fortress)

author: {'steamid': '76561198038195820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1608926957}

Two Fat Thumbs up for Dredmor!

review: This game is a roguelike that is approachable for anyone to play. There isn't really a story aside from "You are Hero. Go kill Bad Guy.", but the game is extremely fun and humorous. The Item/Skill names and descriptions are some of the most enjoyable bits of text I've ever experienced in video games; one such noteworthy item is the Shield of Agnosticism, which "shields you with doubt." The game is so cheap, there really is no excuse for you not to get it. Buy it. Buy the DLC. Save the world. Have fun doing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969487697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3721, 'last_played': 1554245737}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor is a lot like jamming a bent fork into your thigh, repeatedly... and I mean that in the best way possible.  You simply can't play this game without being at least a little masochistic.  Despite the fact that you are guaranteed to lose character after character, gameplay continues to be very rewarding and infinitely replayable.  This was easily one of the most refreshingly great games I've played in years.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991620903', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 956, 'last_played': 1546286131}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993300050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 5234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4685, 'last_played': 1504905097}
review: Finally a roguelike with a graphical quality beyond the realm of ASCII. If you like dungeon crawlers, roguelikes or tactical based gameplay. This game is for you. With 3 expansions out this game has more content than you can shake an omnipotent pork sword at. Including 15 floors of a randomly generated dungeon. Your very own tardis and multidimensional realms. Indepth crafting and enchanting systems and a massive variety of flavourful skills to learn. 3 difficulties, a perma death option and optional grindless mode with smaller dungeons for the same amount of exp.

review: This one surprised me. I expected a silly cash-in crammed with video game and meme references, lacking in any sort of strategy or gameplay, but gave it a shot anyway. What I got was a silly cash-in crammed with video game and meme references, and a whole bunch of neat gameplay mechanics, and a deep, but not TOO deep strategic element. A great buy for a long weekend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034126069', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5258, 'last_played': 1601079148}
review:
I've been in love witht his game since 2011, and I still adore it. It's been a little bit forgotten at this point, but god its still a gem. Everytime I come back to it I fall in love all over again. 

Its silly, its fun, and it can be pretty hard! It's a beautiful dungeon crawler. It's got built in steam workshop support, and every player thats stuck around with it for 6 years has their preferred mod loadout, because with all the workshop content it's basically a build your own dungeon crawler. 

Like I said, this game has had my heart for 6 years, and it's going to have it for many more to come. Some of us have forgotten about it, but I'd still call it one of my favorite games.

review: this game is addicting, I love being able to find new items, and keep trying to beat your own score in the game, this is a fantastic RPG/Indie game, I bought it when it was $1.50 a while back ago, and I'm not regretting that, although, I wish I could have bought the DLC avaliable for it, but I will in the future, so anyway, for people that love Dungeon Crawling/RPG/Indie games, pick this game up, you'll love it!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984018080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 6417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6206, 'last_played': 1665804025}
review:
A turn based rogue-like dungeon crawler with great humour and is very unforgiving. This game is best played on the hardest difficulty and permadeath enabled. I would recommend that you buy the expansions to unlock more skills to play around with. This game also has a modding community with the Steam Workshop so you could spend countless hours messing around with different builds. However your goal in this game is to murder Lord Dredmor, who's in either room 10 or 15, depending on your settings. 

If you're not a fan of grinding I would definitely recommend you enable "No time to grind" which makes each floor smaller but you still get the same amount of experience from clearing them. The only weakness for that option is you won't get as much item drops so your equipment could be poor and you won't get as much crafting items for crafting skills.

You may reach the stage where nothing can stand in your way but don't let that fool you. Room 15 will kick your ass if you aren't prepared.

review:
Very specific  RPG. I finished it and therefore I think, I like it. First 5-6 dungeon levels (about half of the game) was challenging. I constantly found new stuff (item, spells, etc.). However second half of the game was boring. It was the same over and over again. Maybe I was too powerful (promethean magic seems unbalanced to me). I rushed through just to kill final boss. By the way the fight was way too easy. So overall I am little bit disapointed. I rate it avarage. 

It is possible, that I don't understand this game. It should be something like rouge like, or whatever. So if you know what that mean go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967630636', 'num_games_owned': 1933, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 21188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11453, 'last_played': 1562078358}
review:
Over 185 hours...I've played over 185 hours in Dungeons of Dredmor, and I'm still not tired of this game.  It's kind of hard to be, because the key idea to the game as a whole is "randomness"  Every level, every enemy and item placement, even every skill if you choose to go that route is random, and it's awesome.  

The randomness of it all creates a unique experience, even to the niche genre of roguelikes, that let's the player be cool with the experimentation of new character builds, new gameplay strategies, and new ways to die.  Dying happens a lot, by the way.  The game is so addictive though, you won't mind starting a new character, getting closer and closer to Lord Dredmor.  The humor of the game definitely helps that.  What also helps is the Steam Workshop feature, adding more depth to a game that already has it in spades.

Over 185 hours in, and I'm still not tired of the game yet.  Still haven't beaten it either.  Maybe next round.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980565224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3335, 'last_played': 1561520603}
review:
This game is all the detail and complexity you would expect from a rougelike without the awful interface, lack of visuals, or unfair obfuscated mechanics typically associated with rouglikes.

It is "not like" Nethack in all the ways worth sacrificing or improving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007899249', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 20598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16924, 'last_played': 1683940500}
review:
A fun and light top-down, turn-based dungeon crawler.

The storyline is pretty straight-forward: an evil dude with a whole load of evil minions are in those dungeons; go nuts.

I recommend playing on the standard settings the first few times, I.e. normal difficulty with perma-death turned on. Due to the large amount of skills you can choose to start with (7 out of a total of 33, 43 with both DLC's), there's an almost infinite choice of characters to play, so experimentation is a must.

There isn't a whole lot of information in the game itself, a lot of potions have vague descriptions, and even most skill tooltips don't give full explanations. But I'd say that's hardly a flaw, there's lots of room for experimentation and exploration. And there's definitely no shame in checking the wiki pages for additional information, especially on mechanics such as crafting, brewing and quest-related things.

The array of different weapons, skills, character modifiers and monsters is impressive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009528477', 'num_games_owned': 1979, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 11756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5345, 'last_played': 1659798434}
review:
The perfect game for any e-emo and otherwise suicidal and/or masochistic person out there :O
Nothing screams "FUN" in your face like dying over and over to random nonsense and that's what this game is all about. Less complicated than the usual Rogue-likes (which I can't name any of, because I don't play such things..I only heard the term before and wanted to use it myself to appear knowledgeable enough to actually recommend this game), this game has a great sense of humor and lots of replay value. Also one of the dlcs is actually for free, so...The whole thing is cheap as heck, but I digress...So you wander around a random dungeon and try to stay alive long enough, to be able to unleash a lot of rage once you die after lots of wasted hours. If all that hasn't sold you yet, you are a sane person. I do recommend :O

author: {'steamid': '76561197993619932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 12658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9790, 'last_played': 1394505002}
review: In the magical land known as "Fun," the nations of "Good-For-A-Laugh Silliness" and "Tough-As-Nails Roguelikes" were ever at war. And then Gaslamp set up a trading post on the border, and called it DoD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012690441', 'num_games_owned': 1804, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 18915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3273, 'last_played': 1644593964}
review:
Inexpensive, quirky, amusing, and fun take on the classic dungeon crawl. It's surprisingly roguelike (the classic ASCII dungeon crawler) in many ways, or at least it takes me back to the same sort of brutal aesthetic—i.e. you'll probably die a lot at first, until you get the hang of things.

One of the really great things about the game, though, is that there's a very large amount of character customization available since you can pick several different skill branches (which in may ways feel more like job-classes than skill branches) that alter the gameplay SIGNIFICANTLY, especially in their interplay with each other. And some of the skill branches are rather unique, such as: Fleshsmithing, Fungal Arts; Emomancy, and Killer Vegan from a DLC.

I can't think of another game where the main character can be a Ley Walking, Vampiric, Killer Vegan, Berserker who is studying the ways of Viking Wizardry, striving to become a Mathemagician and Clockwork Knight.

It's lots of fun, and only $5.

review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is a game where you can take Unarmed Mastery to kick enemies to death while dual-wielding shields, then later switch to dual-wielding BEEKEEPING MANUALS so you can attack with DOUBLE BEES.  

Be sure to download "You Have to Name the Expansion Pack" it's free but doesn't come with Dredmor Complete.

The + key controls animation speed if you want to play faster.

review: This is a pretty decent roguelike, but be warned: it overestimates itself pretty hard. The dungeon is 15 floors deep (with Realm of the Diggle Gods active), and that's about twice as long as the game is built to last.  It makes a wonderful introduction to an ancient and storied genre of computer game, but once you're acquainted, move on to Brogue, Stone Soup, ADOM, or even granddaddy NetHack.
