author: {'steamid': '76561198020225902', 'num_games_owned': 1277, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2639, 'last_played': 1443989615}
review: This game is a real treat.  It's not only a well drawn dungeon crawl done in the old school style of Rogue and Nethack, but it's bursting at the seams with geek humor and benefits from modern advances in design and game philosophy without sacrificing any of the rushlessness and lack of mercy that is the hardcore pedigree of this genre.  Standard skill packages like Swords, Dual Wielding, and Alchemy find use alongside more unconventional schools like Veganism, Emomancy, and Viking Magic.  As a difficult yet slickly humorous adventure, this is a definate fit for anyone with a penchant for heroic vandilism looking for some randomly generated fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993231943', 'num_games_owned': 2377, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2318, 'last_played': 1325923200}
review: Blasted roguelikes, they keep sucking me in. Dredmor is a worthy representative of the genre with a good UI, interesting class mechanics, and a heavy dose of the sort of humor that made Hack funny back in the day. Whether I am farming lutefisk for the lutefisk god or earning achievements for dying in creative ways... the time just disappears. One of these days I might even try to win ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197960375849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1186, 'last_played': 1620994490}
review: If you like exploring vast dungeons to brave dangers of monsters and traps for tons of loot, then Dungeons of Dredmor is for you. Traverse the dark (actually rather well lit) floors of a huge dungeon, fighting monsters along the way as you find gold to buy items from shopkeeps... or vending machines. Pick up weapons, find items along the way which you can craft, to aid you on your journey into the dungeon's depths to find better treasures and to eventually defeat Lord Dredmor... if you can find him... somewhere... down there. This game is a must for fans of rogue-likes and humor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044326084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1701496696}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988977031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 19949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6889, 'last_played': 1708542224}
review:
Despite the screenshots showing little to nothing, it's actually a rather engaging and amusing game. Lots of costumization, randomly generated dungeons and a rather heavy inspiration from Dwarf Fortress adds humour, replayability and challenge to what on the surface seems like a rather dull game. Let it be said, however, that the interface is really messy, and figuring out stats for weapons and items is extremely difficult if you're not 100% focussed on it. Experimentation is also vital, as nothing is explained, and half the items you find are as liable to kill you as they are to be helpful. Skills without explanation (what does Arithmancer, Archaeologist or Pirate do?) also requires a lot of experimenting outside your comfort zone, and a lot of restarts. Lastly, the crafting system is downright insidious; no guides, no tutorials, and bugs that mess things up.

As a casual yet devilishly difficult pseudo-turn-based RPG/Dungeon Crawler, Dungeons of Dredmor is bang for your buck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040789987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1324540800}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is potentially the greatest game since Elevator Action.  Wait was that a game, or did I dream that?

Dredmor's basically what happens when you throw your SNES, Doom and rock n' roll into a beaten-up blender and hope the results don't lead to food poisoning.  This time, you got lucky, but next time, don't expect to see daylight for 48 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993160592', 'num_games_owned': 635, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2880, 'last_played': 1374053381}
review:
It's the next generation of 'Rogue' or 'Angband' or 'Nethack' - still turn-based, but beautiful graphics, and with the bonus of unique and quirky skill trees that can customize your play experience, as well as several forms of crafting to fill up your pack with all manner of junk since "I might find a recipe that uses that!"

The best part, however, is the tongue-in-cheek sense of humour pervading the game, from the descriptions of the skills and attributes, to the random conversation 'barks' of the mobs.  

This is a game that remembers that it's supposed to be FUN.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035293052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1422038242}
review: A solid roguelike experience for both fresh dungeon-divers and scarred savescummers! It's got a lot of depth but won't scare away newcomers with in-your-face complexity... And what's a roguelike without tons of replayability? The humour tops it off nicely, as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998935093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2463, 'last_played': 1574843257}
review: If you want to get into rougelikes, this is a great introduction with it's humor and approachability. There is no need to start on rouglikes in ASCII and this game will give you a taste of what makes roguelikes great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050124574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1607590025}
review:
Don't let the minimalistic design fool you, this game is no push over. Once you put in some time getting use to it you will find a solid roguelike experience. Under it's light-hearted story and almost childish graphics you will find an addictive gameplay and a game that is not above poking fun at it's roots.

This game is able to take away all your hard work with one careless mistake and you will be more than happy to do it all over again. Great game for losing track of the time, I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977506187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1469945238}
review: Awesome, addictive roguelike. Tons of classes to play and items to find. Sense of humor is a plus, and music is quite good! You'll want to keep exploring and going further down the dungeon until your face turns blue!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012276748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 9974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9807, 'last_played': 1703135884}
review: This is, hands down, the greatest graphical roguelike that contains allusions to Sun-Ra. It's also fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991058250', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1839, 'last_played': 1703512611}
review: awesome game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039311704', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 7102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3840, 'last_played': 1658138350}
review:
If you've never heard of Roguelike games, then first of all, slap yourself.
Second, pick up Dungeons of Dredmor.
It's a great game for if you're new to Roguelikes or if you have a Black Belt in Dungeon Diving.
Recommended so hard I broke my keyboard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027016039', 'num_games_owned': 1404, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3589, 'last_played': 1593632548}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963557791', 'num_games_owned': 1581, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5263, 'last_played': 1558280212}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035361808', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1613, 'last_played': 1653612092}
review: Does this need any greater recommendation than the fact that I can't stop playing it?  I'm a sucker for roguelikes, and this one is delightful.  It tempers the fact that you're going to re-roll A LOT (assuming you play on permadeath) with fantastic wit and humor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999410730', 'num_games_owned': 718, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5302, 'last_played': 1673239778}
review: It has random dungeons, items, skills, levels. weapons, armor, magic, crafting, and other stuff. What more would you want?

author: {'steamid': '76561197993623452', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1687301390}
review: This is a great Indie over the top RPG that has a style of DnD and Pop culture humour mixed in between, I could easily play this game for hours and buy all of the DLC and be happy with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025092004', 'num_games_owned': 1719, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1552446980}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995647765', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1591048455}
review: Surprisingly fun little game, especially considering how cheap it is with the current sale. I've only got to the second level and it took me a while (and many gruesome and silly deaths) but it's quite fun and something to play in the background with different mechanics to try out and different easter eggs to find.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960557837', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 7469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6380, 'last_played': 1557984693}
review:
Ahhh. Good ol' Turn Based Dungeon Crawling. Always fun! Even more fun with the addition of Crafting, as well as the multitudes of upgradable skills in Warrior/Thief/Wizard categories (you can select 7 in any combination for each new character). Many unique items await your discovery (and can be sent for XPs and storage by the government if you happen to have Archeologist skill).
The veddy British Humour and pop culture references continue to amuse.
The game has proven to be much deeper than the purchase price suggested.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974103321', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 9029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2836, 'last_played': 1577140823}
review: Dying is fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990622574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1616, 'last_played': 1630082534}
review: Excellent game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000673917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 35843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14399, 'last_played': 1701996851}
review: This is a brilliant game that is reminiscent of the pleasant difficulty that gamers experienced in the 90s. It's a game that has great humor, an addicting play style, and a creative art style. Anybody who likes Roguelike RPGs or just RPGs in general is bound to get a kick out of this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030538843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1335682800}
review: Play this game! Seriously though, Dungeons of Dredmor is addicting as heck. And with the many creatures, items, and hilarious descriptions for everything, it never gets old :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198033264318', 'num_games_owned': 1955, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 4772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3358, 'last_played': 1440347142}
review: Чёткий и сложный рогалик

author: {'steamid': '76561197971719407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 10866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11048, 'last_played': 1445137450}
review:
Pros
- Great art style with tons of personality
- Tons of possible builds, which further ehances the inherent replayability.
- Crafting system to help mitigate bad RNG so you're not stuck stabbing dreadmor with a pointy stick
- Mods!

Cons
- Inventory management is tedious, and almost everything is useful in some way so hoarding is almost necessary to a degree. Wizardlands mitigates this a bit with infinite storage, but it's still kind of a pain

This is probably the best actual roguelike I've played. It has a few flaws, but overall it's a great experience, and a great modern take on the genre without sacrificing what made it unique in the first place.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964181244', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1404899987}
review: I love roguelike games.  This is a little buggy, but it's indie and they are actively fixing them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010094590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2316, 'last_played': 1444784444}
review: Get your dungeon crawling fix!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008100392', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2466, 'last_played': 1451541825}
review:
Hello,
This game is by far my favorite dungeon crawler/rogue-like in a long time. This game makes sure that you do not have the same dungeon by allowing you a wide selection in classes and the random generation. Also, the DLC doesn't dissappoint by adding even more wonderful content. I am fully content with this game. So if you like rogue-likes, dungeon crawlers, or both, I highly recommend this one for your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005056979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 19945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2325, 'last_played': 1593797058}
review:
A light and comic introduction to the world of roguelike games with a dark and wide-spanning sense of humour. Sometimes unforgiving, but always challenging and fun. The graphics are perfect for the genre, beautifully cartoonish. I've never raged at this game, even when I died from trying to kick down a door. The DLC was a steal at £0.99 as well. 

PS - You'll learn to hate the term Monster Zoo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986510429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1370346904}

review: Another randomized dungeon crawl - silly writing, nice character leveling, and a bit of a haphazard crafting system, but it's great fun. Basically fun in all the ways Binding of Isaac is, but turn-based. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197993823494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1489, 'last_played': 1326096000}
review: A roguelike for the modern era. Dredmor brings old tile-based gameplay into a neat graphical package.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026389812', 'num_games_owned': 1696, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1711, 'last_played': 1538869235}
review:
Great rogue-like (hard, but interesting turn-based role playing game).
It has very unique skill trees (veganism, emomancy, archaeology, ...) and a great humor (items, item names, quests, ...).
Complete with crafting system, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010301153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3379, 'last_played': 1401391415}
review: Surprisingly fun game, with a lot of depth to the various systems and many skills. One of the best indie games out there :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197997123523', 'num_games_owned': 1400, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1765, 'last_played': 1637424596}
review: If you like Rogue-likes, you'll like this game. Besides a quirky sense of humor (particularly call-outs to other games), the skill system makes this much more like modern RPGs than most other Rogue-likes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030753037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1590592469}
review: I've always been drawn to roguelike games, and this is one of the best.  It has the brutality of standard roguelikes, but not to the extreme of some.  The humor is spot on, so if you've always wanted to try a roguelike game, give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000566937', 'num_games_owned': 730, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 9877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9660, 'last_played': 1605458097}
review:
Absolutely one of the best roguelikes of our time, Dungeons of Dredmor is a turn based dungeon crawler with enough humor and videogame/internet references to make the most jaded gamer crack a smile and enough difficulty to bring back the long missed feelings of gnashing teeth and yanked hair after your 12th permadeath gameover. Permadeath is optional though if you are not as iron willed  ; )

An absolute must for anyone and its pocketchange price is a steal even when it isnt on sale.

I also fully reccomend grabbing the DLC pack (which is also insanely good for its tiny price) for even more dungeon diving, diggle slashing goodness.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995689843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 42202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20178, 'last_played': 1653975968}

review: Like NetHack, but funnier. Very high replayability thanks to the randomly-generated levels. High timesink potential. I thought it used too much battery last time I played it, but they might have fixed it in later updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040959560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2694, 'last_played': 1654321469}
review: A deeply brilliant roguelike, and way ahead of its time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002510306', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 4149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3574, 'last_played': 1527281663}
review: I first saw this game...and didn't think it would be good. Atempting to recapture allot of the charm of such games like Nethack isn't easy, and even more so when you are a new devloper. But somehow these guys pulled it off in such a way that just makes me aplaud them. If anything else this game makes for the perfect 'time waster', and it's diffaculty and charm will chances are ensure you'll be coming back time after time again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013704207', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1492, 'last_played': 1404440877}
review: If you like dungeon crawlers, picking up every single item you see, and old-school RPGs, this is a great game to add to your list.  Lots of fun and it's hilarious (you can summon a mustache golem for goodness sake!).  And there are shoutouts to other games as well! You just have to play it to find them!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011331681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3100, 'last_played': 1571453759}
review: What's great about this game isn't that gameplay. It's a pretty standard rougelike with a few mechanical quirks meking it a bit more interesting. What's really fun about it is the comedy, it's so constant and zany. You can't help but laugh as your vegan pirate psychic warrior fights ridiculous monsters and perishes at the hands of wee diggles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985109343', 'num_games_owned': 2681, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1389, 'last_played': 1388753132}
review:
Темный Лорд пробудился! Подземелья кишат монстрами и ловушками! Но наш бровастый герой, наследник викингов,  всё преодолеет и изметелит врагов в кровавую массу, bless his little heart.
Классическая rogue-like игра с отличным пародийным юмором и симпатичной (пусть и 16-битной) графикой.
Осторожно - в игре присутствуют акты героического вандализма и самодельные крепкие спиртные напитки. Секса нет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017198694', 'num_games_owned': 1996, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4145, 'last_played': 1374419542}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987159750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3344, 'last_played': 1455350662}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014747679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2454, 'last_played': 1405855525}
review:
Best Roguelike I've played since EVER!

Awesome graphics and music, tons of stats and crafting options, and INSANE replayability. What's not to love!?

author: {'steamid': '76561198028188028', 'num_games_owned': 1523, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6671, 'last_played': 1591812306}
review: So much fun for a small timekiller.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961243477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3025, 'last_played': 1552285574}
review:
A little repetitive and a little buggy, but it's nevertheless a very accessible roguelike for anyone new to the genre. It's the first game I played in which I didn't really mind getting permanently killed, just gleefully starting a new character every time.

So not the greatest game of all times, but for its low price it can definitely entertain you for hours, and who knows, maybe you'll get seriously hooked.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997088519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1373629875}
review:
pretty good as an introduction to roguelikes and for veterans the sense of humour will keep you entertained at least

author: {'steamid': '76561197982786177', 'num_games_owned': 2306, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4751, 'last_played': 1438242968}
review:
It's a roguelike game....OK let's be more specific: Dungeons of Dredmor, I believe, is a perfect gateway into the roguelike genre, which is normally populated by games that are massively complex and nearly impenetratable to normal gamers, since those mainly used minimal graphics, user interface mostly designed for machines that are 20 years old or more and massive complexity which several games don't bother supplying adequate tutorials (and lots of newer roguelikes still opt to follow that tradition, though recent trends are going against that). Dredmor, though, evades all the above shortcomings pretty well, with good graphics, humor and good introduction to the game combined with complexity that is not too deep but is still deep enough.

And after this maybe you want to try more roguelike games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025438083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 12258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9374, 'last_played': 1576122367}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029053625', 'num_games_owned': 1714, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1457349216}
review:
A game that's pretty much Build-Your-Own-Adventure, the worlds are radnomly generated and you get to pick your skills for survival, how well you survive depends on how you use the skills you chosen.
Three levels of difficulty determine how easy it will be to live in the Dungeon, but dying is only part of the fun, as you can re-use the setup you used previously and change it to better or worsen your chances of survival.
Give the game a try, anyone that likes click to move games will enjoy the top-down Dungeon Explorer

author: {'steamid': '76561197997809014', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 1555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1061, 'last_played': 1456719871}
review:
If you ever wanted to get into rouge style games, I start with this one. Those who already enjoy rouge games will like this one. It keeps many of the elements that made it fun back in the 80's while introducing many fun elements that make games today fun. Personally I like the skills as they all give you a reward for leveling them up. Also, this game is hard (you will die alot). So it's definitly worth getting.

Perhaps the most refreshing feature of this game is the visuals. You really can't beat having good animation and action. While other Rouge style games can get boring pretty quickly due to the ASCII graphics they commonly have. There is plenty of visual eye candy to make you want to stay and finish the game.

Pretty much anyone can pick up and play this game. It's a fun adventure game, and I play it when ever I get the chance or feeling down.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971301516', 'num_games_owned': 2042, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 4396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3927, 'last_played': 1640562313}
review:
Okay.  Can you accept that sometimes you can not win a game because of the maps/items it has generated?  Can you accept painful defeat with a smirk and roll a new character and dungeon?

If you can't, move on.  You'll just go online and complain about the game design.  If however you can enjoy rampant dying and item collecting, buy it now.  Or next sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999328988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2098, 'last_played': 1689905626}
review: This is a neat little game, though little is probably the wrong word.  There's a lot to do.  As you go through the dungeons, you'll beat up tons of monsters, collect tons of loot, and perform acts of HEROIC VANDALISM!  And, if you'd like, you can pray to the Goddess of Sidequests and maybe get something cool for completing whatever insane job she gives you.  If you like RPGs or rogue-likes, give this one a go!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993363806', 'num_games_owned': 1054, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1373948461}
review:
Do you see that logo picture over there? Compare it to the box art for Doom. That is the extent to which these people go to cram jokes into their game. Also, death. So many stupid deaths. But maybe THIS time your Viking spell won't backfire as you battle a mustache warrior. Maybe THIS time you'll be able to max out your Vegan skill bar. 

Extremely fantastic. Play it with permadeath on, like a real man/woman.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030732973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3910, 'last_played': 1373593979}
review: Stupidest game I ever loved.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997002523', 'num_games_owned': 1847, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 8524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4341, 'last_played': 1699805319}
review:
If you long for the old days of pixel graphics and dungeoneering or just like turnbased, really entertaining RPGs in general, you should definitely check this one out. It's intended to play like a classic Roguelike, but you can also turn off permadeath and just have fun with it as a normal RPG. 

The selfaware humour, the different character builds and the random dungeons will keep you entertained for quite a while! As of this writing, the game still has a couple of bugs that can be quite a nuisance, but the developers are very active and responsive about issues, so that's also a plus. The game also has very good mod support and a healthy community providing new content. 

For what little money this costs, you get quite a lot of value. Worth a look for sure!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997051230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5441, 'last_played': 1417497078}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993263478', 'num_games_owned': 934, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2125, 'last_played': 1527219476}
review:
A wacky and accessible roguelike, Dungeons of Dredmor can keep you laughing, even through the more desperate and irritating times. If you've wanted to enjoy NetHack or similar roguelike games, but the difficulty and one-trip permadeaths spooked you away, this is definitely a good start.

Lutefisk for the Lutefisk God!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038652782', 'num_games_owned': 1380, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2195, 'last_played': 1373752366}
review: An awesome dungeon crawler all nicely wrapped up in humor, numerous pop-culure references and a great replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008117830', 'num_games_owned': 1135, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 2175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2039, 'last_played': 1373828936}
review: I think this game is great. It has been widely called a rougelike or a lite-rougelite and I have read in forums many people who have experience with roguelikes not liking this for various reasons. But I think this game was intended for people who have never played a roguelike or never heard of the genre. It is a gateway game with charming graphics, item crafting, an open character creation. It encourages experimenting, and most of all it encourages failure and trying again to do better with what you have learned. It does what it set out to do very well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972850794', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1388120608}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966597554', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 2949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2827, 'last_played': 1547694615}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053959008', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1337, 'last_played': 1419999560}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994239917', 'num_games_owned': 3172, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2318, 'last_played': 1374527209}
review:
"Curse you diggles! I hate this stupid game, I'm so fed up of dieing! Although, one more try wouldn't hurt ..."

Another roguelike with the one-more-life addiction working for it. Dungeons of Dredmor ticks a lot of boxes for me. I love the art and the sound and think it works fantastically together. I haven't even scratched the surface of the Steam Workshop for this game, which will potentially add hundreds more hours of fun to it. What DoD does best, is it makes me engage with my characters journey. I'm likely to stay alive in DoD for a few hours, and this makes me attached to what I've achieved so far and makes me want that character to be victorious. Alas, they rarely are. They often meet their end in some embarrassing way, to an enraged Diggle or something (sidenote - I really want a Diggle plushie. That would rock). Just writing about DoD makes me want to play more!

This game is superb for it's price. 

Play it on Permadeath for the best experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978411201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1653, 'last_played': 1566774229}
review: If you like in-depth RPG's and ding a shit ton, this is the game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001715087', 'num_games_owned': 964, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1344322800}
review: This game is surprisingly addicting. It takes a bit of time getting in as you'll probably have to run through the tutorial once, but once you know what you're doing, you're set for fun! I probably wouldn't buy this game at full price, but it's nice to have when you've got nothing to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978251941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1350889200}
review: A decent take on the roguelike genre, well worth the low price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996272522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1382, 'last_played': 1635886218}
review:
Surprisingly simple yet effective, Dungeons of Dredmore combines a form of turn based combat with some of the depth in character customization that exceeds most 2D RPGs. 

How you build a character is just as, if not moreso, important to how you play (with a healthy dose of luck thrown into the fray). Does your character employ magics or ranged weaponry such as bows and wands to deal with enemies from afar? Do they create their own gear, potions, accessories and traps or do they err on the side of lady luck? What defenses can they rely upon when backed into a corner?

With a hearty dose of humor, Dungeons of Dredmore delivers all this and more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000262690', 'num_games_owned': 4003, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1475716343}
review:
A steal at $5, even at $7.50 to get the expansion with it it's a good deal. It has everything you'd want form a roguelike. A highly replayable game with plenty of items, skills, and monsters. Better still, multiple difficulty levels (with permadeath optional) and a mouse interface means you can jump right in without needing to memorize hundreds of commands or spend countless hours learning ot survive past the first floor. 

It's a great game for those new to or curious about the genre, but also still offers something for roguelike vets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049654855', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 17959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17545, 'last_played': 1651687149}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003999386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1379880320}
review: Do you like beating things up? Do you like metahumour? Do you just like rougelikes that don't look like ass? Good! Dredmor is for you. Get it. Now. (It's awesome. :3)

author: {'steamid': '76561197979324980', 'num_games_owned': 1025, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5925, 'last_played': 1566290266}
review:
This is a great tittle for those that have always wanted to try the roguelike genre, but were scared away by other roguelke'a complexity.

It offers a lot of the same depth as other roguelikes games, while adding its own twist, with a beautiful graphics set to keep everything looking nice, to a large amount of customization, right down to if you want permadeath or not. 

Lots of great items and skills to discover, as well as amusing enemies that you'll figure several ways to beat. Also, the game is constantly supported and they are messing with stuff all the time, so if you don't like something, who knows, it might get changed next patch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998829673', 'num_games_owned': 876, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1106, 'last_played': 1499624179}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986220481', 'num_games_owned': 886, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 9799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4428, 'last_played': 1697845813}
review: First - this game is not for everyone. Its complicated, difficult and involves way too much trial and error. Second - this game is fun, but hard. The game even tells you in the tutorial not to expect to win anytime soon. The game is really fun with all the skills and combinations and potions and magics to use but it can get really repetative if your doing too good. (Thats easily fixed by progressing further in the dungeon though) Third - I think all my friends might already have this game but if you don't, talk to someone who does and try it out. Its worth a try for a dungeon crawler.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004825044', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1451185983}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001969728', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1695, 'last_played': 1422697544}
review:
Probably the most user friendly Rogue-like game. Hardcore Rogue players might be disappointed but if you like old-style dungeon adventure games and funny comments (my current favourite is the description of a pair of short jeans "It is a real medical condition!" which refers to Tobias Funke of Arrested Development and his Never-Nude condition ... you have to watch the show to get that one, but the show itself is worth watching anyway ;) ).

Also - as far as I could tell from the indie developer's website - the small team is really committed and very responsive to the community.

In short: If I had to, I would buy it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995758706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4900, 'last_played': 1467153688}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023732687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 9117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8951, 'last_played': 1511389373}
review:
A great example of what the Roguelike genre can become, not just niche super hard rpgs that are for the most part text games but slightly less niche super hard rpgs with pleasant graphics, multiple difficulty settings for those who can't handle the very hardest, and fun game play that's bolstered by the ability to have different skill load outs after every death(oh so many deaths) and having a food system that backs up the health system and not just a hunger system that kills you nearly as fast as the enemies do(seriously, i should only have to worry about things killing me considering how often they do). 

If you want a bigger challenge out of your RPG's without self imposed challenges like a nozlocke run, this is the place to start.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984147675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3978, 'last_played': 1479927287}

review:
If you understand the following, and you like what you read, then you should get this game: This is a classic dungeon crawling roguelike with a sense of humor.

Multiple skills (all humorous and some oddly difficult to figure out), odd enemies, strange weapons, multiple crafting systems (smithing, alchemy, fungimancy?), and many other attributes all make this throwback to the past a worthwhile buy.

Overall: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971948490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 1272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1179, 'last_played': 1385523397}
review:
It's stupid and fun. And stupid fun is always good fun.

It's a roguelike (completely randomized dungeons) with graphics. And silly pictures. And if you're a vampire, you get an attack where you sparkle at enemies menacingly.

Also, Golemancy gives you the ability to win the "Honey Badger Don't Care" achievement, and you can be a Killer Vegan or Werediggle (Werediggles gonna weredig) if you download the DLC, and lay your own diggle eggs for the high cholesterol achievement.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998330429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2262, 'last_played': 1667758742}
review: Great game to play, especially if you like randomized dungeons, tons of options, and turn-based strategy fighting. Quirky humor abounds!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972581643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 32831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30379, 'last_played': 1397606299}
review: Okay I'm not going to be obtuse with this one; Dungeons of Dredmor is just a really good game. The humor is sharp, the devs are a good shop, and if you're not into roguelikes already this is a good way to round out your collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009392597', 'num_games_owned': 1389, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1679849265}
review: A deceptively simple game, Dungeons of Dreadmore is a deep and entertaining roguelike RPG. The turn based combat flows smoothly enough to seem real time, with dozens of ways to attack your enemies and defend yourself. The skill system is very deep, with multiple skills to choose from and level up. The story and graphics are minimalistic, though this adds to the charm of the game. The most entertaining aspect, however, is the countless references and spoofs to popular culture, from the archeologist skill tree to the amusing phrases spoken by enemies as they’re attacking you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963561291', 'num_games_owned': 935, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 8148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2489, 'last_played': 1534683749}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026218175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1453279132}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993263732', 'num_games_owned': 1044, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1682942495}
review: I never thought I would truly like a roguelike. The random factor makes learning the game hard, and the deaths make the game frustrating. DoD handles it beautifully. Making starting a new character as much fun as leveling and progressing really makes it a lot less stressful to die continually. The silliness of the game also makes it hard to be mad at the game for things like a lutefisk parodox, or drinking a chalice full of acid when you just wanted enough mana to heal yourself. The lampshading of tropes really does bring to light how great the roguelike genre is, and this game is a great intro to the genre in how well it handles new players. I would say this is the most noob friendly roguelike I've ever seen. Yet, it still has the depth of many major roguelikes.

review: A rougelike game that is fun and accessible to new players of the genre. Has plenty of variety in items, weapons, armor, monsters, locations, quests and events. The 20+ skills you can choose from also add a lot of replayability. It is a very challenging game in which progressing keeps getting harder and harder the more you advance. author: {'steamid': '76561197972969142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1606330434}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971907582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2383, 'last_played': 1488651346}
review: At first glance, Dungeons of Dredmor seems to have little to offer to the modern gamer besides poor animations and a main character with inexplicably prominent eyebrows.  But, if you can get past the old-fashioned visuals, there is hidden here an excellently designed dungeon-crawler with varied skill-sets, a great deal of replayability, and a good sense of humour.  It is difficult and a little confusing at first, but experimentation is as much part of the experience as confronting the dungeon itself.  Also, it's cheap, so you really can't go wrong.

review: It's my new drug. If you enjoy roguelikes, then you have to play this. It's a big game, with lots of different ways to play, lots of ways to customize your stuff, and lots of ways to die.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019820523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 16022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15724, 'last_played': 1449101180}
review: I found this to be one of the best casual-play games ever.  It is always new, rewards patience and greed, and tends to let you die of your own carelessness.  That means I always know when to put the game down and go away.  Yet, what I learn on each play makes me all the more certain that I can beat it next time.  Long lasting fun; I've played over an 100 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982897178', 'num_games_owned': 1000, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4095, 'last_played': 1683475733}
review: Never has a game taken over my life so completely as Dungeons of Dredmor, I had to uninstall it or risk losing myself.  You can't get a better deal for your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982445800', 'num_games_owned': 1159, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1910, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review:
I lied to myself.

I wanted to be that guy who wasn't afraid to pay money on a chance he'd like something that seemed amazing.

So I tried.  I tossed money at this game, knowing full well that there were numerous other free alternatives.  Every one of those alternatives would actually turn out to be much better than this game ever could dream of being.  No matter how many times Dungeons of Dredmor releases ordinary updates and makes people pay for them, it'll never be as good as those other indie rougelikes who are making games to provide entertainment to as many people as possible, not to fill their pockets as much as possible.

I lied to myself.

Perhaps the worst part of all of this though, is that I besmirched the glorious art of the game recommendation.  Not only did I lie about the game, but I wrote a straight faced serious recommendation.  So to all of you who read my reccomendation, and to all those people who might have purchased this game based on that,

I'm sorry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044732658', 'num_games_owned': 3123, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1324454400}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197984328001', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 2326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2000, 'last_played': 1690310208}
review:
The first game I ever bought on Steam.  I downloaded Steam for this game, as I am a huge roguelike fan and this game was released right around the time they started making a huge comeback.  Now lots of games take aspects of roguelike games and make them their own.

Game has a great sense of humor and is easy to learn and play.  Lots of different class to customize your character.  One negative is they try to be funny in the naming convention of your character's stats, but it is more confusing than anything.  I have to constantly remind myself what floopishness is and what it does.  Just call it dexterity.

Other than that a good game.  It may be a little dated by today's standards, but still a good buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970927261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6246, 'last_played': 1386475304}
review:
I got this as part of the Humble Indie Bundle #4... I had no idea what a "roguelike" was, but I thought the art looked pretty silly and decided to give it a try.  Within 10 minutes, I knew I was in for a long haul of booze-fueled spell casting and Diggle whipping.  

On the surface, the game seems rather unappealing: Stricly turn-based; very minimal animations; dry, flat, squared-off environment; absolutely simple controls and mechanics.  And it is hard -- very hard.  I died, and continue to die, a lot.  And death is permanent for your character and his progress to that point

But beneath the surface, the game is a refreshing and compelling peice of work.  The instrinsic randomness of nearly every game element means that each replay is its own truly unique run filled with delightful surprises and totally unfair que-sera-sera situations.   I'm out of room.  This game is a bargain - buy it, love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006085410', 'num_games_owned': 971, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 6431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6065, 'last_played': 1693223065}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor, come ogni dungeon crawler che si rispetti, è un gioco che punisce gli sbagli. È un gioco molto semplice da comprendere, le meccaniche di base sono intuitive e l’interfaccia è tutto sommato accessibile. Tanto è facile da comprendere quanto difficile da padroneggiare.

Dungeons of Dredmor è un esperimento perfettamente riuscito di ridare lustro ad un genere per troppo tempo abbandonato. Dimenticate la complessità spesso frustrante dei vecchi classici degli anni ’80 e ’90, Dungeons of Dredmor combina la profondità dei vecchi roguelike con l’immediatezza delle produzioni attuali miscelando il tutto con un’ironia citazionistica raffinata ma mai  banale.

La recensione completa: http://checkpointcafe.wordpress.com/2012/10/21/the-weakly-hobbyt-81/

author: {'steamid': '76561198002616216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1450974450}
review:
The humour is bad, but so are your chances of survival.
Probably the most accessible roguelike ever is silly on more levels than just a few, but being beaten by an arguably retarded run of the litter game is as taunting to ones ego as it gets.
Dwarf Fortress has built a cult following with its iconic lemming-like dwarfs who all run on booze and unsatisfiable fetish for shiny trinkets. And claimed that LOSING IS FUN!
Dungeons of Dredmor takes this one step further but this time endless complexity of deadly hidden game mechanisms is replaced by brute brawn and genuine lack of giving a fuck.

"If you want a picture of the future, imagine a boot stamping on a human face—forever."
George Orwell, when asked about Dungeons of Dredmor

author: {'steamid': '76561197994476740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 13403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13403, 'last_played': 1397337703}
review:
An oldie but a goodie. 

One of my favorite Roguelikes of all time. And yes. I mean Roguelike and not RogueLITE. This is an actual game that mimics the mechanics of the old-school game Rogue. The thing that sets Dredmor apart though is its humor. Dredmor is exceedingly funny. Whether it's sacrificing massive stacks of lutefisk to a hedonistic fish god for forbidden magic tomes or playing a run as a super saiyan vegan, there's always something to get a chuckle out of.

When you start a game, you pick a number of skill trees to level up. Every time you level, you gain a new passive or active skill plus some stats from one of your trees. The number of skill trees is enough that over a hundred hours of play, you will likely not have seen all the fun combos the game can offer. Add in the workshop content and you have yourself one of the greatest bargains on steam at 5 dollars. 

If you can tolerate the game's clunky interface and dated graphics, the price is a real no brainer. You won't find any game that gives you more time for 7 bucks out there. I have a joking metric for determining game cost and worth. "How many Celestes and Hollow Knights is this game worth?" Like I said. It's a joke. You can't expect every game to have as good of a value as Hollow Knight.

Is this game worth half a Hollow Knight though? Absolutely. 

If you've bothered to look this game up, odds are someone recommended it to you or you were looking through the relevant tags. That said. If you're LOOKING for a game like this, this is one of the best examples out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027227463', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3732, 'last_played': 1527094256}
review:
Excellent game for anyone who is a fan of roguelikes.  Every new game is a completely unique experience, and with 20-some-odd skills, hundreds of items, and witty humor and hilarious references, you'll never get bored!

TL;DR - Hilariously fun with insane replay value!

review:
Очень и очень затягивающая игра. Правда, меня вот лично первые десять минут усердно отпугивала - но как только я разобрался в механике, играть стало нереально интересно. Напоминает карточных "манчкинов" - стеби ролеплей, создавая ветку ЭМОЛОГИИ и НЕКРОЭКОНОМИКИ! Хапай сокровища, среди которых найдётся место даже ШЛЕМУ ДОВАКИНА! Убивай монстров с помощью ПОСОХОВ ТЕСЛЫ и ТОПОРОВ-КЛАВИШНОЭЛЕКТРОГИТАР! 
Вин, Вин, Вин.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993323701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 17840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7415, 'last_played': 1690317792}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961034816', 'num_games_owned': 923, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 3223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1704, 'last_played': 1462126664}
review: A rogue-like, it's silly and challenging: revelling in pop culture and its own ridiculous story and creatures while doing its best to erase all your hard fought progress. For the faint of heart, permadeath is optional and there are three difficulty settings for greater margins of error, but even on normal a few missteps will result in your great eyebrowed hero being reduced to nothing more than a name, title and score on a headstone that is your high score list.

review: An old-school Roguelike RPG with a streak of Pratchett-esque humour, Dungeons of Dredmor is a blast no matter your experience level. Far friendlier than your traditional Roguelikes, it's highly recommended for anyone who fancies a bit of traditional dungeon-crawling.

Edit on 11/22/18- well maybe I have started a yearly thing here thanks to steam wanting me to complete 4 tasks for black friday sale...will see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018758125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1749, 'last_played': 1682219939}
review:
Have you played Nethack? How about Crawl, or SLASH'em? Have you made fun of them behind their backs, and then smiled politely when you saw them walk by on the street?

This will be the Roguelike for you. It contains tons of classic elements -- the randomly designed levels, the urge to kill you approximately constantly, and difficult layouts -- and then lampoons as much as it can along the way. You'll get monsters yelling at you, incredibly useless-seeming items, abilities that may or may not help you at any point, and a hearty congratulations upon your eventual death.

Luckily, for those of you not as adept with the concept of 'Permadeath' (think hardcore mode in ol' Diablo 2 -- die, and your character is gone permanently) the game does offer a mode on each difficulty level that removes the permadeath in lieu of saving when you need it. But, then again, I'm a purist.

For the genre faithful, this game offers plenty of challenge. For the new, it can be a fun, if wildly difficult, romp.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027875638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3350, 'last_played': 1682856654}

review: A fantastic little game. It's well worth your fiver. It's as hard as any rougelike ever was and it's very pretty, as well. Plus it's got a sense of humor that shows a lot of love. Really, it's just an endearing little game you should spend an afternoon on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034678941', 'num_games_owned': 933, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4871, 'last_played': 1420682562}
review: I'm a fan of the Dungeons of Dredmor. It combines many game elements I like, including this unnecessary list: Challenging gameplay, humor, delightful 2D graphics, RPGness, and nonsense. I recommend playing it, just don't buy it more than once.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994574201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 11644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4927, 'last_played': 1396498682}
review:
Simple to get into, yet surprisingly deep, Dredmor is a good test to see if you like Roguelike games.  It lacks the complexity of a true Roguelike - though this isn't necessarily a bad thing!  It's great to waste 30min or a few hours on without having to think too hard about your next step.

Get it, because Losing Is Fun.

review:
This silly little game is retro D&Dish fun at it's best.

A monster yelled "FUS DOH RA" at me. I found a pair of cut offs jean-shorts, the desciption reads "Its a real medical condition". When I finally died, it said "Congratulations! You'r dead! [and your game is over]"

References FTW.

Best $2 I ever spent on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985380680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2104, 'last_played': 1590472217}
review: This game is fantastically hard. It's one of the few games that I play just because it's so damn challenging and I die constantly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010974276', 'num_games_owned': 2195, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1373613265}
review:
Too hard. Too unfriendly to new players. But also it is very interesting.
Something like that you can see if you mix Fallout (Strong Humor and step-by-step gameplay), The Binding of Isaac (Randomly-generated rooms and adventure style) and Gothic (Middle-Ages, hard quests and tough enemies)... Awesome mix!

So why are you still reading this? Go and play "Dungeons of Dredmor"!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960550225', 'num_games_owned': 1881, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1328342400}
review: You know, I picked this game up when it was on sale the first time for very cheap.  I figured I might play it at some point but probably not but for the price I paid I might as well buy it anyways.  Than this steam xmas thing came around and I played the game.  I have to admit, this is a pretty damn good game.  It reminds me alot of the old arcade games like Gauntlet and it's ilk.  Well worth the price for the game and I have already spent a considerable amount more time than I anticipated.  Pick this up for a great little treat!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026182756', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3557, 'last_played': 1566862415}
review: A simplistic and watered down roguelike with a bizarrely robust crafting system. Worth the 5 dollar price tag, however.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007431670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1426042002}
review: Okay. So lets get one thing out of the way before i start. t'his game is made by a indie developer and its so ridiculosly cheap, itd be an insult to condsider buying in, then decide not to. Okay, on to my thoughts. This game is fantastic! the humor is superb and always so fresh (just yesterday, a diggle yelled FUS ROH DAH at me). The gameplay is smooth and no repetitive, and the skills and leveling keep you engaged at all times. this is a grade A turnbased rogue clone that almost everyone should own. Its cheap, simple, funny, addicting, replayable, really fun, and has a great range of difficulties. It suggest it to all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016090414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1597, 'last_played': 1421767395}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989211154', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5209, 'last_played': 1559042974}
review: This is an enhanced version of Desktop Dungeons. It has so much to it in those 200 megs that it will keep you busy for ... uhm... hours will turn into days pretty quickly, the best discription would be. You won't notice the time whilst playing this thing. It's really addictive and worth trying out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004541366', 'num_games_owned': 1102, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 5110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4249, 'last_played': 1704406396}
review:
Fantastic Roguelike, with a great sense of humour.

Nethack, the next generation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970284755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2325, 'last_played': 1654754984}
review: If you like roguelikes, you'll love Dredmor.  (For those who don't know, roguelikes are single-player turn-based RPGs in randomly-generated dungeons with permanent death -- i.e. you can't reload a save if you die.)  It's not as ludicrously difficult as many in the roguelike genre, but it's still hard -- I've never gotten past level 7 (of 10) and I still die on level 1 on occasion.  The graphics are cute, and the game is hilarious -- it's a parody of the whole RPG genre that simultaneously manages to be a good, challenging game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991516445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1301, 'last_played': 1485500074}
review:
What's that? A rogue-like RPG that is full of satire but still manages to be a great game? And it's cheap?

Welcome to Dungeons of Dredmor. How may we kill you today.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983269703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 4118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4017, 'last_played': 1445461512}
review: When the bug fix log starts with the update, 'FIXED: n-dimensional lathe was, in fact, a giant game-crashing exploding bomb,' you know you've got something special.  The rather unassuming looking Dungeons of Dredmor is an astounding game, although it might take a few minutes to click.  If you go in expecting some sort of retro themed action-RPG, you will probably hate this game.  If, however, you start with the tutorial and look at the game as a sort of Disgaea-flavored randomized Demons Souls playing by old school, turn-based calculations and rules, it should be hard not to fall in love.  Easily more enjoyable than half the full priced retail games I've bought in recent years, you would be remiss not to give this game the time of day.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965829752', 'num_games_owned': 1681, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1357891200}
review: Awesome, very addicting, hilarious, hard, different every time. Worth far more than 5 dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010140979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5104, 'last_played': 1375079148}
review: Bought on sale, probably the best $1.87 I've ever spent in my life.  Even at regular price, this game is well worth it.  Just the right amount of brutal, unforgiving death for a rougelike.  Lots of fun skills to play around with.  Lots of silly randomness.  Definitely one of the most fun dungeon crawlers I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963330680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1745, 'last_played': 1698355499}

review: It is now almost 2am and I have not stopped playing for... what is it now? 4 hours? This game is ridiculously addictive! author: {'steamid': '76561198025864772', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3369, 'last_played': 1363762800}
review: Truely a unique rogue like, though can be grind heavy. You'll be smiling and laughing the entire way thanks to the tons of referencial humor and geeky injokes. It laughs and looks like a Lucas Arts point n' click, but it plays like the addictive and random rogue like.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197999487140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1324540800}
review:
Charmed me briefly with its silliness. But I soon learned that it was using its silly theme to disguise a lack of substance to game. For a dollar this isn't a total waste, you will get some amusement out of this, especially if you're into roguelikes.

But if you've never played a roguelike, I'd warn you to steer clear of this game. There are much better titles in the genre - that are free. For a dollar, this game contains an endless dungeon with silly monsters that really never gets as deep, complex, thrilling or as fun as some other roguelikes.

There are also some purely AWFUL design choices that I just can't understand. For instance, the dodge mastery? When you dodge, it makes you teleport. This was scripted so horribly, if you get a high enough dodge chance, you can practically never attack anybody. Often times, you'll teleport across walls and through doors, quickly swarming yourself with monsters you can never hope to handle. It's like the last dodge skill point is a troll!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997203810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 952, 'last_played': 1373569167}
review:
Schnell und unkompliziert, nur sollte man sich ans Sterben gewöhnen. Finde aber die Ansicht etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig.

Wer noch weniger Zeit hat, sollte sich nach Desktop Dungeons umsehen, da dauern Spiele in der Regel weniger als 10 Minuten.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982757199', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1494535231}
review: Pretty damn awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973713843', 'num_games_owned': 628, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1388396734}
review:
This is game that'll eat a lot of time, at very little cost. Yes it is a large numbers game, where you'll want to have higher numbers than the enemies your facing - but it also depends on the skills that you build your character with as well. Selecting from a large base, it's fun to let it randomly pick your build then try to make it work. Being turn based doesn't mean that it's any less frantic or too easy as you can easily find yourself outnumbered, cornered and killed. The dungeons being randomly generated can be somewhat unoriginal afterawhile and random loot makes the complex crafting system useful only after acquiring a bunch of random crap. 

Overall it is a neat game, great value for it's price and quite a lot of replayability - well from dying a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998142701', 'num_games_owned': 3870, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 7510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3504, 'last_played': 1459802187}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018682097', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3121, 'last_played': 1669872001}

review: A solid rogue-like with a huge range of character types to mess around with. It can take more than a few tries to find a build that works, and to learn the tricks to each level of the dungeon but there's some real satisfaction in getting past your last death.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025939304', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2784, 'last_played': 1375576177}
review: Really good "roguelike" dungeon crawler RPG. If you like dying over and over again to figure a lot of stuff out this game is really good for that. Of course you could just keep the wiki on hand and the game is still really good and will stil take up a lot of your time. You're not supposed to beat it till you've failed a good number of times so expect a lot of experimenting and dying of course.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960341703', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1332831600}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025030716', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2625, 'last_played': 1576610596}
review:
Ever wanted to delve into a dungeon and loot everything without the hassle of spending stat points, and coming up with a class? Then Dungeons of Dredmor is for you. You start the game by picking seven skills, all plainly described, and then you enter the dungeon to kill the boss. Sounds easy, right? Wrong. The game is forgiving, to a point. On the first level of the dungeon, you can make mistakes. Go down one floor though, and you will be eaten alive, spit out, and then have your brain sucked out with a straw.

Combat is simple. Click on the enemy, and you attack. None of that "Attack: Spin Dash: Slime A" bullcrap. You can cast spells with a right click, and here's where it gets trippy. You cast them, and you don't miss. 

It's rare, if ever, for a death to be the fault of the game. You missed with your crossbow because you aren't that great at using them. You got blocked because you're not that strong. You died, because you stepped into your own AOE spell.

Get this game. It's good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985132215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1063, 'last_played': 1412104379}
review: This is easily the best roguelike I've ever played. Easy to pick up and play, full of all the things the genre's known for (tons of loot, brutal difficulty, random dungeons), TONS of replay value via a large array of skills and craftables, and above all: it's absolutely hilarious. Definitely  grab this one if you're a fan of roguelikes or are looking to get into them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048254478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1417442025}
review: Addicting little RPG roguelike with lots of humor. Don't take the game seriously, DO play just a few more turns... just open one more room. Note: Game isn't as hard as it seems at first, but it does allow you to build a character that's nearly helpless. Pick a build with a melee weapon and some defensive skills or you'll die. Also it's hard to find the materials for crafting early but it gets to be very useful. Dying is a learning experience in this game, try not to take it too hard. ;3 Also if there's only 1 block between you and enemy, don't move. Hit space to wait 1 turn. They'll move into range and you get the 1st melee hit for free. Don't be afraid to run away and close doors on them. Highly recommand taking a skill with a "teleport type move". Oh just get the game when it's on sale and jump in. Die a few times, then read the wiki. ;3

author: {'steamid': '76561198025820005', 'num_games_owned': 1706, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 6737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6628, 'last_played': 1373835536}
review: This game is addictive as hell. It's extremely difficult and at times unfair, but these are some of the attributes that give it a distinctive charm and keep me coming back for more. The DLC makes it even more fun, adding hilarious new talents and enemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023411416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3730, 'last_played': 1630915398}
review:
This game is fantastic, with loads of replay value, even if you don't like roguelikes (I never played one before this) you'll get hooked. 2cat lmao!!!

Not recommended for scrubs!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993725466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1542919565}

review: If you like dying and dungeons, you should try dying in a dungeon, repeatedly, to less-than-threatening things such as diggles or blobbies or locked doors.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004484756', 'num_games_owned': 2208, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 4626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4536, 'last_played': 1374027139}

review: Artwork is flatly par for the course, animations leave a bit to be desired, but I just hacked at a weird, pelvic-thrusting goblin-thing in the face with the axe from Quake. What's not to like?

author: {'steamid': '76561197998779819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5721, 'last_played': 1461867350}
review: Dungeons of Dredmor (n.): 1. A game that is silly and addictive.  2. A must have for anyone and everyone.  3. If you got this far before going to the page and purchasing it then you're doing it wrong.  4. If you're still here then buy it already and if you have it play it so I don't have to make a fifth definition and/or threat!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984631203', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 7383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6886, 'last_played': 1534094010}
review:
All the depth, tactics, gameplay, and insane fun of your favorite roguelike games, but it's actually possible to play! It has a beautiful graphical style that harkens back to the 16-bit era of gaming, so no more looking at ASCII characters and trying to figure out if you're looking at a dog, fountain, amulet, yourself, or a typo. Plus it is genuinely funny, and they're adding new stuff to it all the time.

Seriously, for $5? You can't go wrong!

Edit: I made my review for this game back in 2011 and had to point out that I've spent more of the past 7 years with this game installed than not. I play other games of course but this one just keeps calling me back and never disappoints. Even though the developer seems to have closed down, the community support and mods are great. Even the vanilla experience is wonderful and pretty much endlessly entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970567244', 'num_games_owned': 813, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 22782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20394, 'last_played': 1550365126}
review:
Good Rogue-like game, different than most because of its disturbing lack of ASCII. Oh, and that it isn't freeware.  Still, fun turn based dungeon crawler oozing with dry wit and charm.

Unfortunately not without a plethora of bugs, especially now right after the 1.0.8 patch release, but Gaslamp is hard at work fixing things. Well worth a look

author: {'steamid': '76561197972126747', 'num_games_owned': 1056, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1133, 'last_played': 1359619200}
review: First roguelike I've ever tried. Did not really like the part of them not having graphics so this was a good game to start playing them. Got to love the scoreboard after each death showing how you scored this time. You will see it a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970836309', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4552, 'last_played': 1344322800}
review: Truly excellent roguelike that embodies the best of inde gaming.  It gives the player a great degree of flexibility as to how they play, with multiple difficulty modes and the ability to turn off perma-death if you so choose.  It plays better with perma-death, but having the option for those who truly hate perma-death is nice.  It has an excellent class/character building system, a great sense of humor, and it is mod friendly meaning there is a lot of content for you.  Buy the complete edition, this game is highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991204613', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3597, 'last_played': 1477476769}
review: It takes the traditional Roguelike, giving it a polishied graphical interface and slapping in a heaping dash of self aware parodies and humor that will leave you enjoying it for the moment to moment absurdities as well as the challenge of killing them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000707331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 7431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7170, 'last_played': 1373538428}
