author: {'steamid': '76561197972392543', 'num_games_owned': 1097, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 13072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 554, 'playtime_at_review': 11254, 'last_played': 1710381194}
review: Be prepared to die. A lot. Horrendously. It's fun as fuck really thought and a lot more interesting then I first gave it for. Give it a few whirls and enjoy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045101741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1564220760}
review: Brutal Roguelike gameplay with hilarious powers equals a fun, relaxing game to play after a long day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010333017', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 2905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2416, 'last_played': 1701744700}
review:
I originally didn't have this on Steam, but Gaslamp has such a masterpiece with this Rogue-like that I just couldn't help myself.
This is one of those games that makes dying the ultimate penalty, and it's sure to piss you off. Yet somehow you end up rolling just one more character and get just a little bit further.... 
Maddeningly addicting and challenging. And the humor is top notch and anyone with a bit of wit will get a good chuckle out of nearly every description. 
A great time waster and surprisingly in depth game. It's well worth your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989034898', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4584, 'last_played': 1643279740}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022256753', 'num_games_owned': 889, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1385117530}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961167439', 'num_games_owned': 1579, 'num_reviews': 720, 'playtime_forever': 15565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11842, 'last_played': 1580536919}
review:
Nostalgic 2D turn-based D&D game. It has all the right elements to keep it entertaining plus a large variety of skill sets makes for a wide variety of character combinations. Swords, bows, shields, spells, wands, bombs, food, drink, mushrooms, potions, raw elements, character leveling, skill trees, inventory system, hot keys--everything that makes an RPG good.

Seriously, it feels like they took all the good things from the Ultima series, Wizardry series, and Atari's Gauntlet, threw out all the bad things, and kept the game and interface as simple as possible. This is an instant classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988363045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1540007251}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967546141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 40252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40209, 'last_played': 1475188077}
review: I started at this game on Sep. 12, 2011, playing with max. difficulty and perma-death. During the next two months, I played -nothing- else; I was interested in only in sending one char after another to their inevitable doom in Dredmor's dungeons. Finally, on Nov. 15, after logging in over SIX HUNDRED HOURS of play time, I killed the final boss for the first time. If you value your family and friends, I beg of you, DO NOT buy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005732248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1462828658}
review: My first experience with a "roguelike" game and I can't stop thinking about it.  So many different skill combinations, coupled with a hardcore mode and randomized levels makes this a hard game to put down.  Plus, it's damn funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028166817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2437, 'last_played': 1545281360}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001810786', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 6935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5510, 'last_played': 1633657764}
review: Dungeons of dredmor is a really fun dungeon crawler.  A sense of humor is a must!  The game is quirky, challenging, and quite fun.  You get to create a character with 7 skills (sound familiar ultima online fans?) then proceed down a dungeon at your own pace.  There's no town or anything, just vending machines.  It's a lot like the old pc game Mordor.  If you have a sense of humor and like oldschool dungeon crawlers, check this one out.

review: An all time favorite. Play this game on the highest difficulty and permadeath and you will have endless fun trying out the different skill combinations. Don't worry about winning! Nominated for "Best use of a farm animal" because: Who doesn't love Diggles!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993336898', 'num_games_owned': 1407, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 2125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2125, 'last_played': 1373548087}
review:
Don't be an moron like me and judge this from the screenshots alone, thinking "what a piece of indie crap". 

This game is a real gem and a must buy if you have any interest in rogue-like games, lootwhoring and ehmm lutefisk.

review: With this self-ironic game "Gaslamp Games Inc." has created a magic potion that smells like oldschool century eggs. This is a ridiculously awesome game, that will bind your "must-win-self" to the device that computes this drugging abomination.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994480308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1427621634}
review:
If you're a newbie to the Roguelike genre, this is a friendly enough (and fairly funny) game to dip your toes into - no ASCII, and optional permadeath make it an ideal game for casual gamers.

However, pros may find it a little slow and simple. If you've played a roguelike before, I'd recommend Dungeon Crawl - Stone Soup instead, which is more interesting, more difficult, and free to boot!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997038498', 'num_games_owned': 1101, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 2990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1331, 'last_played': 1404127412}
review: nethack準拠。nethack的な判りにくさ(アイテムの効果とか)がある。床1箇所に複数のアイテムをスタックしておいておける。インベントリ狭すぎ。重量制限はない。基本的にどのskillも強くて他のしい。ただ糞skillは糞skillなので、糞skillでクリアできる気はしない。だからこそやりがいがあるのかもしれない。値段相応には楽しめる。

author: {'steamid': '76561197978997874', 'num_games_owned': 3466, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 7775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4778, 'last_played': 1627266322}
review:
You see this game?

This is what you get if Nethack had pretty graphics and a good writing team. This is what the Diablo series should've been. AND IT'S ONLY FIVE BUCKS. FIVE BUCKS FOR A GAME THAT CREATES ENTIRELY NEW LEVELS EVERY TIME YOU START OVER.

And start over you will. A lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981939207', 'num_games_owned': 1952, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2235, 'last_played': 1659297755}
review:
Esse jogo foi o meu segundo contato com o gênero roguelike (o primeiro foi Binding of Isaac, outro game fantástico que recomendo a todos), e no início confesso que fiquei meio inseguro de comprá-lo especialmente pq as screenshots da loja são bem feinhas.

Mas como todos sabem, gráficos não são tudo, o que importa mesmo é a jogabilidade e após ler reviews positivos resolvi comprar. Ainda bem, pq o jogo é sensacional!

Para quem é fã do gênero roguelike não preciso nem falar mais nada além de COMPREM AGORA!

Mas para aqueles que querem se informar mais:

Nesse gênero de jogo vc só tem uma vida, se morrer perde todo o equipamento, toda a experiencia, todos os itens, todo o progresso, TUDO! E deve recomeçar o jogo do zero da primeira fase.

A movimentação e combate ocorre em turnos e é baseada grids (a fase é dividida em quadradinhos) e cada quadrado que vc andar conta como 1 turno. Os monstros só se movem quando vc se move, basicamente o tempo só anda quando vc anda. 

O mapa é gerado aleatoriamente bem como a localização de itens, escadas, monstros, etc. portanto cada sessão vai ser diferente e por isso que morrer infinitas vezes não torna o jogo cansativo nem chato, pq à cada sessão será uma experiência completamente nova.

No inicio de cada jogo vc pode escolher seu gênero e 7 skills (dentre 37 disponíveis no jogo base http://www.dredmorwiki.com/wiki/Skills) o que permite a criação de personagens que sejam bons com mágica, armas, escudos, crafting, ou um pouco de tudo. 

Após isso vc começa no topo da masmorra que é dividida em andares. O objetivo é descer e atingir o andar mais inferior da masmorra e enfrentar o chefão. Quanto mais vc descer maior será a dificuldade e por isso é importante explorar bem cada andar para encontrar itens úteis e ganhar o máximo de xp possível. 

O jogo conta também o um sistema de progressão onde vc pode ir atualizando suas skills conforme vai ganhando levels. 

Outro fator interessante presente no jogo é o crafting. Com o auxilio de engenhocas que vc leva com vc ou encontra no mapa vc pode fazer poções, itens, criar melhoramentos para armas, etc..

O jogo base conta com uma tonelada de conteúdo, diversas armas, itens mágicos, receitas (para criação de itens, magias ou arma), boa variedade de monstros e mapas. Com certeza esse jogo irá te render dezenas, senão centenas de horas de diversão.

Muito bom recomendo pra quem gosta de RPG e combate em turnos!

ps.: Compra definitiva pra quem gostou de Binding of Isaac.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990022916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 6876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6152, 'last_played': 1420615140}
review:
Roguelikes too daunting for you? Can't remember if you drink potions by hitting "P" for potion or "Q" for quaff potion? Introducing Dungeons of Dredmor with its revolutionary gameplay system: Having actual graphics!

Jokes aside, Dredmor is addictively clever and humorous. Half the fun is blazing your way through the dungeons to see how far you can get; the other half is learning intricasies such as: "just because you have the option to drink something does not mean you should" or "A bolt of mass destruction does exactly what you would hope it would do".

author: {'steamid': '76561198009068740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 2097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2097, 'last_played': 1344754800}
review:
It's a straight up rogue-like, turn-based and everything. It's got graphics though, these are laggy in places. It has an eccentric sense of humour which is generally funny, I like to think of it like what would happen if the creators of the Munchkin CCG made a PC rogue-like game.

Pretty fun though and has plenty of replay value. Also, updates somewhat regularly and has some DLC coming out soon - new classes and skills. Hopefully more bug fixes...

Anyways, with this price, it's worth of it .

review:
Hands down one of my favourite indie games of this year.

I invested in this game on release as a gamble, but I was completely blown away by it. It's a game that the devs are passionate about and are constantly tweaking and updating and adding content. Every dungeon is randomly generated, so you're sure to never play the same layout twice. 

9.6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197980875494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1540582658}
review:

А ещё игра учит нас тому, что помирать - это весело!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014140180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 2204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1254, 'last_played': 1573540812}
review:
Рогалики отличаются, от остальных представителей другого жанра, своей ужасной графикой, но компенсируется это - широкими возможностями в игре.
В случае с Dungeons of Dredmor один аспект вылетает, а это - ужасная графика. Остальное - остаётся! Милая графика, приятное на слух звуковое сопровождение, система раскачки и случайная генерация мира. Единственное, что очень обидело - это разнообразие врагов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035309659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1452730420}
review:
This game is really addicting... HOLY CRAP IT'S 3AM!!!!!

It's humorous, fun, and chalk-full of references to other games and tropes. Everything you'd want in a graphical rogue-like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024925713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 9468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7108, 'last_played': 1401428879}
review:
This game should be in everyone's library.  It's funny without being pushy about it, it's got a nice balance of variety and depth, the gameplay feels pretty intuitive, and you'll be amazed as hours fly by without you even realizing it.  Even if roguelikes aren't your thing, this game is worth having for those times when you need to kill an hour; just fire up a new game, hit random and find a fun new way to die.

Seriously, just get this game already.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982681995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 1177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1569357840}
review: I have played this game almost 20 times and never gotten past the first level. It's excrutiating difficulty only serves to make you better each time you play. I have never before played a roguelike, but feel like this is a great introduction. Not since Super Meat Boy have I loved a game that hated me so much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034340520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1597693236}
review: Don't bother wasting your time with this "Dated" piece of trash. The graphics suck (think basic ninento maybe a tad better, but not by much). The interface is so tiny you can hardly see anything. I practically went blind just moving items and trying to read their microscopic decription. The combat system they pulled out of an old Lord British game called Ultima. To decribe this game as "BOBO" would be giving it WAY too much credit. I feel like I just took 5 bucks,and tossed it out the window into a windstorm. Save your money. "You get what you pay for aptly decribes this game. "

author: {'steamid': '76561198027547845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1499490658}
review: Want to initiate yourself in Roguelikes, but, for some reason, can't stand some of their gimmicks? Maybe it is the permadeath? Maybe it is the fact that most of them rely on the Random Number God having mercy on you (Hahahaha! Mercy, what a funny joke!)? Maybe it is the fact that the ASCII graphics do not help you get immersed? Give this a try, then. It has three difficulty levels to lessen RNG impact, the option to turn permadeath off so you are not pressed by the need to constantly play it safe, and the graphics are just awesome! You like Roguelikes? Then WHAT THE HECKLES ARE YOU DOING, STILL READING THIS RECCOMENDATION? Go get it, go, go, go!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006679102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1357718400}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034232714', 'num_games_owned': 3297, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 8333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7693, 'last_played': 1511004955}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981047937', 'num_games_owned': 7422, 'num_reviews': 437, 'playtime_forever': 2649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2649, 'last_played': 1373505564}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is a game that gives you all your value in its flavor text and enemy insults (yes the enemies will insult you) alone, but then adds a fun skill system, variety of settings (this is the best first-roguelike I could recommend with enough challenge for veterans if you like), and a surprisingly excellent soundtrack to boot, something I don't expect out of the genre.

It may also have achieved sentience on my hard drive and decided to fuck with me in the ultimate example of meta-humor when I beat the game and it crashed in the ending.

For that alone I'm going to recommend DoD and point out that if you can't find the hilarity in that last sentence, you may want to worry about if roguelikes are for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994383424', 'num_games_owned': 1345, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1427021296}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009383387', 'num_games_owned': 642, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 3129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3043, 'last_played': 1423796818}
review: This is a really fun angband or rogue style of game.  It is well worth the rediculously low price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034663705', 'num_games_owned': 8151, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 1599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1511, 'last_played': 1373546248}
review:
A fun modern roguelike with a great sense of humor. Besides being turn-based with traps and randomization this isn't your typical roguelike; archaic design is thrown out the window and gameplay is intuitive and can be mouse or keyboard driven. There is no hunger or limited turns and permanent death is completely optional across the three difficulty settings. 

There are tons of skill builds to choose from and most of them are fun and useful in some way or another. Graphics are nothing special but it does look good for a roguelike and there is enough variation between floors to keep things fresh. The soundtrack is surprisingly good and this game is worth about twice what it costs, so buy it if you like the genre. Exceptional replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030872769', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 39613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15721, 'last_played': 1696064355}
review: I like it. makes me chuckle and strangely satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008487741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 16589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9577, 'last_played': 1454293495}
review:
A rogue-like for the modern era, and despite the age of the genre with some quirky graphics and easier UI to work with it plays quite nicely even in the current environment of gaming. 

Perhaps the only flaw with the games it comes off as a bit -too- quirky at times - you'll know what I'm talking about when you see the names of randomly generated magical items or special 'elite' monsters. That aside though, the tongue-in-cheek nature of it takes some of the edge off the inevitable messy splatter death(s) you will experience time and again in your quest to reach the bottom. 

Make no mistake, this is a faithful recreation of the true difficulty of the Rogue-like genre, even when played on 'elvishly easy'! You want a challenge like that? Get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995286437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2357, 'last_played': 1392358379}

review: An excellent game for anyone with a sense of humor and anyone looking for hours of dungeon crawling goodness. Plus, they'll be releasing a mod kit sometime, which is a major plus for the lifespan of the game. It's well worth the money and I look forward to future updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002203340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1324627200}
review: While it does suffer some minor issues, and some major ones (perhaps I have been spoilt by dungeon crawl, but that's a free game and lets you go places by clicking on the minimap, rest until healed and autoexplore, all of which Dungeons of Dredmor could do with) it's overall a decent rougelike with humour, customisable skillsets and with the level of graphics and animations rougelikes mostly lack. If you aren't familiar with rougelikes, this one is more appoachable than most, but maybe try some of the more accessible free ones first to see if you like the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986196908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1314082800}
review:
Great roguelike game, really is an amusing, creative throwback to classic dungeoneering games from decades past, with some fun and clever modern twists thrown in. It's a really addictive gem of a game, with a lot of good humor to it; it doesn't take itself seriously at all. There's definitely a lot of obscure nerdy references, some of which I got, and a lot that I probably didn't :P .

Dungeons of Dredmor features randomly generated dungeons, a variety of monsters, tons of loot,  a couple dozen perks to choose from each time you start a game, and an in-game skill upgrade system tied to those perks. Putting all that together, you can really lose a good amount of hours playing the game, like I have, and all for a very small pricetag.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967650601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2515, 'last_played': 1360828800}

review: Este entretenido juego de rol por turnos tiene algo por lo que destaca enormemente: es divertidisimo. La historia del juego es divertida, los comentarios de los monstruos graciosos, las habilidades son desternillantes, y sus descripciones aún más. Incluso los logros están llenos de referencias graciosas. El tutorial es muy importante hacerlo, aunque siempre puedes aprender las cosas por tu cuenta y morir un buen puñado de veces... aunque hasta tu muerte resulta hilarante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035435584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1361606400}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990982388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1572110126}
review:
Thought I better reccommend this game properly as I really really want people to experience it. Ignore the 'derp 2d' impression, the graphical style is actually really nice :)

Right so basically this is a stunning introduction to roguelikes and an incredibly easy to get into game, there are a ton of awesome abilitiies such as summoning a moustache to fight for you and kicking things to death jackie chan style.

Basically you work your way through the floors of a randomly generated dungeon, with the aim of getting to the bottom to kill Dredmor, a very hard task indeed.
By default the game has permadeath enabled which means if you die you start all over again which adds massive replay value, only being able to save upon exit. Although this can be disabled but is less fun and takes away the tension.

There is a HUGE variety of awesome weapons and equipment that you can find a lot of which are also randomly generated, others being hilarious references to other games!   No room left - GET!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960409779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1532655835}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996859673', 'num_games_owned': 2099, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 3068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1596, 'last_played': 1467525195}
review: Devo ammettere che non mi aspettavo granchè da questo gioco, ma avevo voglia di un rogue-like e 4 euro non sono poi così tanti considerando il punteggio che si è preso. La verità è che credo che questi  4 euro siano stati i meglio spesi della mia vita, è divertente, con difficoltà personalizzabile sia per i masochisti che per coloro che vogliono rilassarsi, abilità interessanti e combinabili per qualunque tipo di giocatore, fin troppe XD non inutili, ma che offrono un gameplay alternativo come il Ley Walker o il Blood mage che permettono di recuperare mana in modo diverso. Tutto questo con un simpatico umorismo del gioco che sà prendersi in giro in modo molto divertente. Il gioco è abbastanza fedele al genere dei rogue-like old school, anche se devo dire che alcune cose mi mancano, ad esempio le pozioni random (qui sono scoperte e si sà quello che fanno), in generale è una versione semplificata, ma divertente e innovativa!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000422381', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 17514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16004, 'last_played': 1682918815}
review:
This game is pretty good, as far as rogue-likes go!  My two previus experiences with rogue-likes are ADOM and Dungeon Crawl SS.

The game gives you a good range of skills to pick from, enemies to fight, and gear to collect or craft.  At the same time it mixes in nerd culture humor ranging from Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri, Indiana Jones, Hellsing (anime), or just making fun of Canadians.  The thing that makes this work for this game a lot more than Magicka is that if you took the humor away from Magicka the base campaign of the game loses almost all of its charm, while as DoD is still a much better base game when you're not laughing at the humor.  That is at least MY feeling, being a person who enjoys playing RPGs.

Difficulty feels nicely balanced on Normal and isn't as punishing toward the new player as it could be.  Permadeath can be toggled, bringing much needed sanity to the roguelike genre and letting less dedicated (or insane?) players enjoy the game too.  For just $5, a great buy.

EDIT: In retrospect, this game has a serious flaw that needs mentioning.  The game does not give clarity of its mechanics, namely in how skills may or may not scale off of certain statistics or the values of their outputs.  This obfuscation is not new to RPGs but it is more relevant here in how you combine many different skills from many different skill trees to create your character.  It doesn't change my positive reccomendation, but it is very much worth noting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4492, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1373544923}
review:
Excellent game. The screenshots and trailer didn't make me want to play this, because the whole game looked so overly simple. How wrong was I? The animations are cute and detailed at the same time and the gameplay itself is quite complex, and can be extremely hard even. Even though the game presents itself as a humorous turn-based dungeon crawler.
I just love exploring every part of the dungeon. Until I get myself in trouble that is, which usually doesn't take all that long. You'll die a lot in this game so it's advised to safe often. But somehow dying never frustrates. You'll just load your savegame or start an entire new game. Both choices can be fun. So... Like I said; excellent game. Highly recommended !

[Rating: 77/100]

review: Though it may not be for all players, it is still a very fun and addictive RPG action game. The turn based system in this is one of the few turn based systems I can stand, with games like Final Fantasy being those of which I can not stand. Despite being turn based, it still manages to keep a great pace, with the ability to stop and think about your next move carefully. This is a great game at a great price, and is good to kill time with.

review:
Fantastic game!!

Very enjoyable. Manages to hit that balance were dying is fun (especially when you only have yourself to blame).

It's a little buggy and after extensive play, you might find some novelties wear-off, but it is well worth the price.


Have fun with the Monster Zoos. Tell them I said hi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012500313', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 5253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5034, 'last_played': 1703692261}
review:
A fun, entertaining, addicting, yet brutal "Rogue"-esque RPG and when I say brutal I do mean brutal, you will lose charecters alot even on easy mode but ironically that's part of this games charm as there is a wonderful charecter creation system so even when your charecter dies to acidently drinking  a bottle of posion or wandering into a "Monster Zoo" which is a room crammed with a swarm of monsters and so on. 

Now unlike other rouge style  rpgs there is a option to turn off perminate death but honestly the game is more fun with it turned on then off as it forces you to really think your moves and turns carefully and adds some depth to the game. But as I said just don't expect it to be a balanced affair like Rouge style rpgs this game is very, very unfair but that's part of it's charm and what makes it addicting as it's satisfying to finally survive and make it down to the next level and each level after that till the final level and then finally take down the big boss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030740279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2892, 'last_played': 1392211261}

review:
This game is simply awesome, very addictive. It looks silly, and doesnt take itself very seriously. The game has a great sense of humor. Despite this, it has depth too. It is very challenging as well, dont expect to plow through this game, it will kick your ass. Hard. And make you laugh in the process.

This is another one of those games like Terraria and Plants Vs. Zombies. Its cheap, and will give you several hours of great gameplay, moreso than most blockbuster titles.

review: A mouse-driven GUI and pleasing aesthetics make this game a roguelike for the masses. Dungeons of Dredmor provides opportunities to die in a myriad of interesting ways - not all of them at the hands of monsters. author: {'steamid': '76561197982330819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4141, 'last_played': 1377782108}
review: If you are a fan of the old school game rogue, or you enjoy playing turn-based rpgs with a fairly high challenge, then this is definitely worth a try!  At $5 dollars, I've already played this more than 10 hours, so that's like paying 50 cents an hour...  And i'm not anywhere near the end of the game.  If you have some patience, and can tolerate death (possibly repeated deaths), then you really should get Dredmor!

review:
This game is a bad-ass rogue-like that is great if you like A. Dungeon Crawlers (Diablo) B. Hardcore Mode C. Lot's of Dying

Crank this baby up on Hard mode and perma-death and have yourself a blast as you test yourself at getting further and further into the game. The jokes are hilarious, white items like Zoich, the Birth of Canada and Shuggoth, the Root of Vegetable as well as hilarious descriptions for items, stats, and skills it'll keep you laughting too!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992233285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1943, 'last_played': 1703874246}
review: Because losing is FUN!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031276974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 6448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5315, 'last_played': 1676504281}
review:
With the basic engine of "Rogue-style" games of the 90's, the graphics of the SNES, and with a sense of wacky humour of it's own this game is shockingly addictive.

Everytime you do something,everything in the dungeon does one thing (instantly - no loading!) and you, the trusty adventurer must use your wits, your abilities and the items you find to try and reach the bottom and defeat Lord Dredmor.

Characters are incredibly custimiseable - will you choose Burgalary, Vampirism and Wand Lube or Mathemagic, Fungalmancy and Crossbows?

author: {'steamid': '76561198014839778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 6421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3430, 'last_played': 1709006608}
review:
It's no secret that I'm a fan of Roguelikes. This here is a roguelike. It's got all the random dungeons, turn-based combat and movement, and items which you have to learn, And none of the ascii graphics.

Plus, it constantly references Dwarf Fortress, which earns it points. A steal at the $5.62 I paid for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004053899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 13975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9741, 'last_played': 1506981136}
review: A highly accessible Roguelike. If you're new to the genre it's a great way to get into it. If you're an old hand at Roguelikes, don't be fooled; it's not easy, dumbed-down, or simplified. Just because you don't have to remember 200 different keyboard commands doesn't mean it's any less of a Roguelike, and the traditional ASCII graphics have been replaced by animated, stylish graphics that fit well. Its grim and parodying sense of humour will amuse anyone, and the challenge of higher difficulties and the variety of skill sets will keep anyone coming back for more. The $5 price tag is ridiculously low - easily worth five times that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997042137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 11021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5983, 'last_played': 1473302117}
review: Munchkin: The Roguelike. Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970967770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1468350411}
review: This game is WIN, saying less would be an insult.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004483954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1386290219}
review: Yes I know the graphics for this game are not high quality,  I got it to play on my laptop.  I didn't expect much, but I have to say for a 5 dollar game it is fun!! The Dungeon is randomized everytime you start a new game which makes it a lot of fun to play.  If you want a game to sit back and enjoy, I say this is the game for you!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019695579', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 25608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12986, 'last_played': 1653756223}
review: I am a fan of NetHack, so when I found a more modern game in the roguelike genre that doesnt stray too far from traditional, i had to play it. If you have never played a roguelike before, keep in mind that you WILL die.. over and over. The goal is just to keep trying to get a bit further each time, and if that fails, hope you die in an interesting way. Instead of being tied to a class, you pick from a selection of physical, magical, and crafting skills. The dungeons are randomly generated each time, so you never know what you are going to find. I highly reccomend this one as an introduction into roguelikes, for anyone who doesnt know about them, and to those who love the genre, Why dont you have this already? Its pretty cheap too, which is always a plus

author: {'steamid': '76561197997368354', 'num_games_owned': 722, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 4805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3738, 'last_played': 1655880298}
review: This game is to Rogue what Monkey Island was to Zork. Sure, it has its flaws, but it's fun, and it's cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964026234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 15377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8166, 'last_played': 1614646301}
review:
I could describe to you how much fun I'm having with this game. I could tell you that it's the fun bits from a roguelike mixed in with the best of a dungeon hack like Diablo or Torchlight. Also there is a Lutefisk god and you must bring it Lutefisk. And an omnipotent pork sword. Not making this up. It has a very Dwarf Fortress feel to it, sort of a "experiment and see what happens."

I'll just say this. Buy the game. If you liked Angband or Nethack or Dungeon Crawl you'll get a hell of a kick out of this. But it's fun, fast playing, and has permadeath (which apparently you can disable, but why?). Just buy it. For $5, even if you only play it for a few hours and never touch it again you'll have gotten your monies worth. Seriously, you'll be skipping out on like one starbucks coffee or fast food cheeseburger and you'll having that you can enjoy for many, many hours (I expect to rack up at least 100 before I even find the end boss, dying is fun, yay!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967227522', 'num_games_owned': 1284, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1458, 'last_played': 1373624780}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022246538', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2551, 'last_played': 1373754379}
review: If your interested in Rougelike games, but haven't had the currage to try one, this would be it. Probably no as relentless as others, but i found it great fun. On the otherhand if loosing isn't your thing, you might want to skip this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968995967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3382, 'last_played': 1491243640}
review:
An excellent rogue-like with a quirky interface and humour. Can eat away all your time if not careful.
If you like nethack but is just a bit too casual for the interface and the complexity, this is a decent "dumbed down" rogue-like. And when I say dumbed down, I don't mean it is simple - only that it is way easier than nethack and many other rogue-likes! (Going Rogue + permadeath is masochistic by normal standards, but pussyplay compared to nethack conduct playthroughs)

author: {'steamid': '76561198035785754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1523923236}
review: For the low low price of 5 dollars, this game is difficult (as a roguelike should be), but is packed with hilarious enemies, amusing item descriptions, and exudes a sense of self-parody that is well integrated without becoming grating. There are too many instances that I have laughed out loud while playing, but the funniest is probably the screen in which you die. "CONGRATULATIONS! YOU DIED!" it says triumphantly. This game is well worth the 5 dollars you shell out for it, and then some. I can't wait to see what the subsequent updates will add to this already excellent gem of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006845714', 'num_games_owned': 981, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1373595129}
review:
A turn-based rogue-like game where death is part of the game.

Create your 7-skilled character and explore the depths of a randomly generated dungeon until you die in one of various ways, rage at death, reload game, then try again.
Or you can reach the end and slay the boss; whatever works.

Also contains an interesting crafting system for making potions, weapons, traps, and more.

This is addictive. You must buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998336636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1459702579}
review: A light, humorous roguelike. Definitely as challenging as other examples of the it's kind, but it's simple interface and colourful looks make it a great introduction to the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967992446', 'num_games_owned': 1178, 'num_reviews': 543, 'playtime_forever': 11914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7001, 'last_played': 1407775648}
review: Shamelessly nerdy and in-jokey. The ability to kill monsters with moustache golems (complete with John K.-esque butts). A game mechanic that lets you turn crap items you would have sold at one of the three stores on a dungeon level into lutefisk, an otherwise useless food item you can sacrifice to the Lutefisk god for random prizes. An old-style Roguelike made for casual gamers, yet still retains some of the rage-inducing difficulty and overwhelming complexity that you'd find in old Roguelikes you'd play in DOS terminals. And it's only $5. AAA-game developers, you'd better be taking fucking notes, because this is what I want to see instead of Call of Jerking Off 7: Realistically Rendered Sound of Fury.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969951436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1779, 'last_played': 1460870504}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983436465', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1325664000}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967396885', 'num_games_owned': 1049, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3100, 'last_played': 1502093404}
review:
This is a fun, slightly goofy, somewhat addictive Hack-esque romp of a game.

The only down side, and it's a big one, is that sometimes it crashes out when going up or down stairs, and it - in true Hack style - only saves your game if you are still alive and exit of your own volition.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970688619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2884, 'last_played': 1396421343}
review: Fantastic roguelike with charm and personality. While not as punishing as older entries in the genre (such as NetHack), Dungeons of Dredmor still maintains a healthy difficulty. Complete with randomly generated bosses, levels, loot, traps, over 30 skills to choose from and amazing post-release support Dungeons of Dredmor offers near infinite replay value at a very affordable price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971079985', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 3292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3000, 'last_played': 1379463910}
review:
This game is a great introduction to roguelikes. Turn based dungeon crawling with a simplfied interface that is easy to come to terms with. Still, the difficulty level is traditionally high (I've yet to beat it on the medium setting; Dwarven Moderation) and the learning curve will still be quite steep for those who approach the game as "just another Diablo clone". The humour stops the game form ever getting too full of itself, but if you play and really enjoy this unique style of game then I'd recommend hitting up the godfathers Nethack, ADoM and Dwarf Fortress too.

All praise be to Krong! May he impart mighty powers to your flip-flops and traffic cones always!

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197963450498', 'num_games_owned': 817, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3056, 'last_played': 1422135579}
review: I was playing BFBC2 today and I spawn in at the start of the round. I'm running towards an ATV and a teammate hops on it. I keep running so I can get on the back and hitch a ride but no, the guy just goes on his merry way. There were two other ATVs driving off each with one person. Way to go, that's not annoying. There totally aren't people on your team that want to get to the M-Com station faster. You're great. You're awesome, a credit to the team. No really, I'd rather hold the shift key and run for 5 minutes. Dungeons of Dredmor is pretty fun, you should get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967981251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 3789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3773, 'last_played': 1618463512}
review: Decent - however there are better, and equally graphic, Roguelikes available out there entirely free which are longer, have more races/classes/skills/etc. - For what Dredmor is it isn't bad, but there's better for free (te4.org for example!) At some points it seemed hard just to be hard/jerkish, and some skillsets fall painfully shotr of being able to handle the game. Area affects make the game much more manageable, even just the Protean fire rune thingy.  Some more items would have been nice, saw lots of the same couple items, artifacts are just random extra stats on already existing items, not truly unique. Items all look the same when equipped, generic sword/etc., so for being graphical a little more variation would have been nice. Was a save-game breaking crash bug, but it seems they pleasantly resolved that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961262780', 'num_games_owned': 1166, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1567, 'last_played': 1654625533}
review:
Fun little rogue like that stays were true to its ancestors. Playing on the Medium difficulty, the first random mini-boss encounter was with a mindflayer that was the master of coffee, running away to a fountain I decided to drink it, getting my self poisoned and suddenly die. Those who have always wondered what nethack would be like but couldnt get past its countless interfaces, remakes and graphics; and those who by default like rogue-likes should definetly try this game out. The game feels like a modern version of nethack. 

Unfortunately, It does not have the major element of identification, and I have yet to discover traps that would spell instant death to my character: However there appears to be random encounters with fairly difficult mobs. It also apparently does not feature the gender or character customization as in nethack as well as pets (or well, I havent discovered any yet after a dozen of attempts to keep my character alive after level 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982121255', 'num_games_owned': 942, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1446152293}
review:
Dungeons of Dredmor is an excellent coffeebreak roguelike with some charming pixel-art graphics and an excellent sense of humour. It's a great deal more accessible than traditional roguelikes, but doesn't skimp on the brutality -- often being unafraid to kill you off within a matter of minutes if you're not careful, or just unlucky.

That doesn't matter, though, because starting a new character and exploring the many varied combinations of skillsets makes every game of Dredmor a joy. Besides, in what other game can you play a vampiric mathematician archaeologist who likes to grow mushrooms on the corpses of his enemies?

The best thing about Dredmor, though, is developer Gaslamp Games' engagement with the community and response to player feedback. Already we've seen two patches that fix the most major issues with the game, and it's much better as a result. There's still a few little bugs and things that need tweaking, but the team seems dedicated to collaborating with the community.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960320038', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1344150000}
review:
Das perfekte Einsteiger Roguelike. Humor, Graphik und Maussteuerung. Eigentlich in dem Genre undenkbar, aber die Umsetzung ist gelungen. Einziges Manko die relativ kleine Sichtweite, dadurch scheinen die Sprites teilweise etwas überdimensioniert.

Dennoch, wem ein echtes Roguelike zu stressig ist, findet hier ein schönes Coffeebreak Spiel - und zu den großen Brüdern kann man immer noch wechseln (Angand, Crawl Stonesoup, TOME, etc)

review: Fantastic roguelike dungeon crawler with a graphical template. Loads of fun, permadeath can be toggled on and off, 3 difficulty levels and 10 floors of monsters and loot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961601781', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 7921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3974, 'last_played': 1661014163}
review:
A must if you've played any traditional roguelikes, though it's arguably not as difficult (still comes with multiple difficulties and a togglable permadeath, at least). With a unique stats system and starting skills that can be combined in creative ways, Dungeons of Dredmor delivers a humorous, addictive, and highly replayable dungeon crawler. There are also plenty of items to discover, including potions and mushrooms that each bear different effects upon the user, as well as an array of weapons and armor with silly damage types and resistances (e.g. a ring that provides existential damage resistance to its user, or a dagger that deals asphyxiating and aethereal damage to its target).

Sometimes the best way to get into a roguelike is to dive in without any prior research, and at its price, Dungeons of Dredmor is a steal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013493458', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3405, 'last_played': 1527193050}
review: Roguelike! Already wins in my book for being a good roguelike, add in the great humor and this is a masterpiece at the extremely low price it's being sold for. Also, it's HARD, but that's mostly the point of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993434587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1416272450}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003825293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3558, 'last_played': 1651892310}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975402534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3730, 'last_played': 1447630659}
review: A very fun dungeon crawler holding true to the old Rouge-Like experience. With slight nods to some center-pieces in gaming and a humorous art style, Dungeons of Dredmor is a must play for people who want to get into dungeon crawlers or for people who want their Rouge-Like fix.

dungeons of dreadmore. ... only thing im dreadin' more of now is starting it up again hehe

author: {'steamid': '76561197999861542', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 8513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7064, 'last_played': 1616549064}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988827286', 'num_games_owned': 2857, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 8419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8296, 'last_played': 1596641296}
review:
It's a roguelike, minus the mystery items, but making a lot better use of skills and magic. Also, a helluva lot easier to play!

Seriously, this game is amazingly fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042034205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1164, 'last_played': 1608141239}
review:
A awesome rogue like with more intuitive UI and graphics.

A must buy for anyone who is a fan of classic turn based RogueLikes or a good starting point for those that have never played them before.

Also has a good sense of humour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002027124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 16957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4805, 'last_played': 1656996002}
review:
If you are a fan of Roguelike games such as Nethack, or if you just enjoy silly humor, and dieing a lot at the flippers of cute little digging penguins, then this is the game for you.
You can pick 7 varying skills to build the hero you want, and can craft a variety of useful items out of the junk the dungeon provides you, or you can steal the traps from the very ground and place them somewhere more useful.
I strongly suggest this great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001002853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1237, 'last_played': 1537982146}
review: A wonderfully challenging game. It's only 5 bucks and can provide hundreds of hours of entertainment. An awesome roguelike, where permadeath means that you must think your actions through, but by doing so you maximize your potential

author: {'steamid': '76561197968114974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3642, 'last_played': 1329724800}
review:
Classic Nethack/Roguelike with 8-bit style graphics.  Imagine a turn based Diablo with a sese of humour.  As the tutorial says, the aim is not to beat the game - but to survive a bit longer than last time - to which I'd add "and die in an interesting way!"

Plenty of skills make this eminently replayable, even after the permanent death of your Diggle-fodder hero number 12 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197984733917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1668424094}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003320135', 'num_games_owned': 3632, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review: A definite throwback to the days of old roguelikes with a new and, wonder of wonders, functional UI for a change. Humor and other references are everywhere, groundwork is solid and developers are apparently eager to deliver new content with patches/DLCs. Needless to say, game is somewhat lacking in content but it's hardly fair to compare it to most other roguelikes which have had YEARS of development.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970286203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1374377879}
review: Nethack without the charm, thoughtful design, polish, or point. Just big eyebrows. Seriously this game is uninspired as shit and I guess the entire team failed Game Design 101 because it's just full of inexcusable failures. OH BUT IT'S INDIE AND RETRO, AND ONLY FIVE DOLLARS, BE NICE. Yeah, uh, no. Save your money for a five dollar game that isn't shit, and just go get Nethack for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971256111', 'num_games_owned': 1106, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1594, 'last_played': 1417269546}
review: If you receive even the slightest amount of enjoyment from playing roguelikes, you must own this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966248112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1333263600}
review:
Congratulations! You have died (again)!

A fun rogue-like where the main goal is to defeat the big bad lich and be forever immortalised as "That Dude Who Killed Dreadmor". Kill enemies with psionics, necromancy, astrology and even, MATH. Die! Craft weapons, complete pointless side-quests. Die! Be like Indiana Jones and change artifacts, or play as an unarmed character to increase the challenge. Die! Play the game for as long as you can and then show off your e-peen to your friends via Steam Community leaderboards. And did I mention, die?

TL;DR - Fun game. If unsure, wait for demo. If want, buy now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987041919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1374257790}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993406860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
If you were ever a fan of Roguelike RPGs, give this little bad boy a try. And just like the other rogue RPGs you end up spending hours playing before you realize that time has even passed!

Decent amount of skills, interesting crafting system. And obviously, unfair amounts of monsters may apear to kill you. <3

If you do play, be a man and leave permadeath on. It's the whole of the game! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993729628', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 20559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12599, 'last_played': 1538360004}
review: Challenging and fun with a sense of humor. Plenty of replayability, well supported by the developers, and easy to pick up and play when you don't have time to sit down for a long uninterrupted gaming session.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004842665', 'num_games_owned': 3569, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 4106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1670190205}
review: This game is packed with witty nonsense, awesome silliness and outstanding replay value and it is sold outrageously dirt cheap. Just don't go in expecting to finish the game quickly... possibly ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022087448', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 4668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4588, 'last_played': 1426409092}
review:
It's a roguelike (spiritual predecessor of Diablo 1)
The sense of humour is just great =) 

If you like minmaxing, you'll thoroughly enjoy this game, as you have to try out a lot of things to find out what works best.

It's amazingly addictive, I clocked 24 hours in the first 2 days >.<
Dear god......

edit:
4 years later I'm playing the game again.
They added SO MUCH CONTENT.
Definitely get the complete edition with all DLC!
It adds new skills, new monsters, new levels, new items etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008996041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3903, 'last_played': 1498361583}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988057446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1285, 'last_played': 1671922347}
review: Awesome Rogue game that makes you always want to play it yet another time, beware though, not for the faint of heart with its permadeath :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027374663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 2909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2684, 'last_played': 1469071387}
review: I had this game marked on my calender for months after I first heard about it a long time ago. It's been in development forever, and it shows. It makes Roguelikes fun, and is hilarious, with every item and description poking fun at the genre. Most importantly, it is loads of fun, and incredibly addictive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025481904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 9669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6186, 'last_played': 1581959989}
review: FANTASTIC ROGUE ADVENTURE!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961699104', 'num_games_owned': 1634, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1874, 'last_played': 1426001587}
review: Very light hearted, humorous dungeon crawl. Of course, you'll die a lot, but that's really the point anyway. Worth the $5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040841481', 'num_games_owned': 1854, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1434273731}
review:
This Rogue-like game, that is a turn-based gameplay, with an interesting Perma-death mechanic.

While there are more games since this one has come out, the game has done things ell enough things right, that it still worth playing and even the new games haven't been able to take away from this game.

Steam Workshop support that allows for a whole host of customizations with community driven changes/additions is welcomed and likely has given this game the live it has seen.

KB&M work wonders, graphics are solid, stable game & just interesting overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991929668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 7196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7196, 'last_played': 1341817200}
review: For those of you who have never played a Rogue-like before, this is the perfect start. It's a turn based action RPG, where every action you do is a "turn." As far as rogue-likes go, this one is actually easy to get into and is rather fair in terms of difficulty. I would pay more than 5 dollers for this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994343420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 13930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11040, 'last_played': 1649476031}
review: Pretty much everything you could want out of a roguelike, and a great introduction to the genre.  Amusing writing!  Shiny graphics!  Diverse skill choices!  Difficulty levels that include ones that won't immediately kill you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972294656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1345273200}
review: It's a decent mainstream rogue-like with an accessible interface, so in other words: entirely unique. Buy it if only to ensure there's more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961064480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5463, 'last_played': 1374707136}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019156213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1219, 'last_played': 86400}
review: Great game that makes me spend way too much time on hunting down better gear, just finishing this corner and just levelling up once more. And an awesome amount of replayability due to lots and lots of different talents and skills.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993698440', 'num_games_owned': 2393, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 4229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2848, 'last_played': 1539386944}
review: Questo gioco è una droga! Da giocare rigorosamente con permadeath abilitato. Morirete spesso ma ogni volta andrete a premere quel maledetto New Game per cercare di arrivare più avanti di prima. Come tutti i bravi indie hanno promesso una tonnellata di nuovi contenuti non appena sistemeranno tutti i bachi (finora ho avuto un solo crash). Per questa cifra è da prendere subito, se vi interessa il genere. Voto al momento: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197987669462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1390090697}
review: Anyone who likes rogue-like games is required by law to purchase this thing. Heck, anyone who enjoys fun is going to love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962445032', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1313823600}
review:
Hah! Retro nethack style roguelike RPG parody! But this time with actual graphics and controls that don't resemble a unix text editor.
Gotta love a game that lets you craft a cheese sandwich in a gold smelter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004072261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1612, 'last_played': 1376501239}
review: Excellent ! Bourré d'humour, ce jeu garde toute la profondeur des roguelikes (Angband,Zangband, etc.) en leur ajoutant des graphismes sympas et une interface pratique. Attention, c'est un jeu difficile et chronophage, mais l'investissement en temps vaut le coup.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974985005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1553145302}
review: Fun and hard to beat at the same time!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967998533', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1531823801}
review: A really fun roguelike game with some minor bugs at launch. Always play on hardcore, and you'll enjoy the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975088488', 'num_games_owned': 722, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1369608630}
review: It's Nethack with a humorous and modern twist. I keep permadeath on for a little nostalgia. Be careful though, Dungeons of Dredmor is very addicting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963688296', 'num_games_owned': 1534, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 2164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2060, 'last_played': 1682290734}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998367711', 'num_games_owned': 2125, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 3114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3114, 'last_played': 1373902798}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969196040', 'num_games_owned': 1193, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review: This isn't exactly a recommendation as a petulant whine: "This game is *hard*."

author: {'steamid': '76561198006437466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 2560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2192, 'last_played': 1400324944}
review:
A wonderful indie dungeon crawler with a quirky sense of humour and a well crafted "Easy to pick up but tricky to master" skill system. Highly recommended for both newbies and veterans alike! The game is best summarised by one of the tutorial messages which reads:

"You are encouraged to learn by experimenting, dying and then starting a new game"

My only gripe is that changing your gear has no effect on your character model.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964018315', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1409462151}
review: While I like Roguelikes initially, I tend to gather animosity towards them and end up hating them. THIS THOUGH, is a different story. The humor, easy yet deep gameplay, the leveling and skills, the insane amout of loot plus crafting and the HUMOR. Moustaches are out, huge eyebrows are in. $5... Get this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977857726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1649277218}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999689924', 'num_games_owned': 1686, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1313305200}
review: This game is funny, violent, tactical and cruel. Never have I had so much fun dying again, and again, and again. One day I'll get revenge for every enemy that has called my father a chunk of manbeef. Until then I will plumb the depths of Dredmors dungeons, heroically vandalising his statues and killing his followers with math.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992701279', 'num_games_owned': 703, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5421, 'last_played': 1380165720}
review: You can be a mathemagician.  Arithmancers of the world, unite.  Roguelike game with a great sense of humor.  A few bugs at the moment, but I think they'll get worked out.  Also, mathemagician.  Why are you still reading?  Mathemagics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028157131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 7231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7084, 'last_played': 1404446651}
review:
Do you like roguelikes? If so, then it's time to buy Dungeons of Dredmor. Don't know what a roguelike is? If that's the case, then the time to buy Dungeons of Dredmor was yesterday. No worries though, I hear there's still a copy waiting just for you.

With a fantastic art style, excellent roguelike dungeon-exploring, and humorous bits and bobs no matter where you look, the game is easily worth more than the asking price. Skip lunch for a day and pick this up, it'll be worth the suffering you experience before dinner.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980901776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 9255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7817, 'last_played': 1612263084}
review:
This game is actually rather fun, dispite the fact they expect you to die...alot...in humiliating ways while being swarmed by monsters.

I know that if your smart, you can keep alive and keep fighting.

Also "...what about...eyebrows?" (FLCL)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993846384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1915, 'last_played': 1452692330}
review:
Remember the game Legends of Zork? or Zork simply? It was one of the most acclaimed Text Based Adventure games in times of "old", well now we pixel lovers have a chance to enjoy such a great and humorous style of game as zork was with... (dreadful music of awe!) Dungeons of Dredmor! 
A long time ago sealed Lich has awakened and is in the hand of hour intrepid hero to go down there into his dungeon and KICK HIS ASS!

With a big set of skills that vary from "swords" or "axes" to "Mathemagic" or "Archaeology" (wich actually grants a fedora hat for starters) you have to wage your way into the bottom of a dangerous dungeon, with pixels and animations that would make all classic gaming nerds (like myself) enjoy it more than much.

Just played a few minutes to it and already had some laughs, so veeery veeery recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561197999039343', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1619, 'last_played': 1595859494}
review:
Si vous êtes amateur de roguelike, ou du mode Porte Monstre Trésor, ce jeu est pour vous. Le système de craft et d'inventaire est assez mal pensé, cependant : les icones trop petits et pas de manière rapide pour transvaser les objets.

Mais tant qu'on peut taper du monstre, je ne vois pas où est le problème.

review: This is a really well-done Roguelike with a good sense of humor and lots of side things to do such as various crafting skills. It may be missing a few things you might expect from a Roguelike such as numpad movement, but it is still a really fun (and funny) game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973639669', 'num_games_owned': 954, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17409, 'last_played': 1428965557}
review: Let's see...awesome roguelike with a somewhat more modern UI and setup. Check.  The level of detail and complexity that I love about roguelikes.  Check.  Multiple types of crafting. Check.  Under $5? Sold.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034054926', 'num_games_owned': 2486, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2870, 'last_played': 1707557432}
review: So awesome. If you enjoy random dungeon crawling and comedy or have a NetHack fetish but long for something beyond ASCII symbols, this is the game for you. Infinitely replayable too!

review: It's a roguelike game with a good UI, crafting, character customization, and a sense of humor.  For the price it is absolutely awesome if you like killing random things for random loot and seeing how long it takes for you to die.  What more could one ask?

author: {'steamid': '76561197964267969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 3783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3753, 'last_played': 1397080172}
review: (At launch:) It reminds me of the Magicka launch in that the game itself is brilliant and chock full of witty references and homages of all kinds + fun to play... and yet it randomly CTD's, has usability issues and other flaws that need to be patched ASAP. It's a true roguelike though, so just forget about the Magicka comparison. A mouse-driven RL is a nice idea but it needs to be polished. When the game's working correctly it's a real treat for all who like to dabble with permadeath and turn-based action RPGs. Dwarf Fortress, Nethack, oldschool PC gaming and silly geek humour represent.
